Reviews.Title: “awesome long weekend”
Reviews.Author: karen B
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time at this ritz left from jfk on a 6am flight was on the beach drinking by 10 am. Check in was great greeted with champagne, got our room right away room was small but efficient did not hear the airplanes 1 time.The breakfast buffet was awesome The only downside of the whole trip lunch at obg was awful so we went out for lunch evryday. Dinners were awesome BLT, il mulino, and la piccolo at the EL SAN juan costly but you get what you pay for awesome. casino friendly and nice, There were alot of kids there pool packed with them beach not so much. At the beach Jean louis was awesome had our chairs ready for us everyday with umbrella. The weather was great, staff first class cant compar the beach to aruba or stmarteen or turks but no customs and great for a long weekend getaway to be treated like royalty, Will definently return

Reviews.Title: “not a full blown ritz... but everything was nice”
Reviews.Author: scfitzg
Reviews.Content: The pool and beach are both great. It was april vacation - so crowded - but we always managed to get a beach chair when we needed it - the people on the grounds were all very helpful. Food and drink is expensive - but good. Both il Mulino and BLT Steak are great dinner spots - but pricey. Other than that you need to grab a cab or brave the walk near the airport. we went with our 4, 6 and 7 year old. they loved the pool and the beach. the ritz kids has nice people but didn't do much but color and watch tv. not worth the price you pay - more like daycare. overall - great place, especially if you are looking for an easy place to get to. less than 5 mins from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than they have to be”
Reviews.Author: PC-FtLauderdale
Reviews.Content: Given the eclat of the brand, this chain could easily get by with 'very good' at every turn. Instead this lovely hotel makes certain everything possible is done to make your stay memorable. The reception desk is warm and welcoming, the concierge knowledgeable and most helpful. The rooms are immaculate and exceedingly well-appointed; the staff unfailingly pleasant. The lobby bar is happily bustling, the breakfast buffet ample and delicious and BLTSteak as terrific as you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: Susan P
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week with my husband and 18 yr. old son the week of April 16. We had requested 2 beds but got 1 king bed. My son (200 lb 18 yr. old) had to sleep on a roll away bed with a thin foam pad on it all week. Room was small and with roll away bed we had no room to move about the room. The windows don't open so you can't get an ocean breeze! The beach and pool service was very nice. We never had a meal at the hotel since it was so overpriced. ($72 for fish at one of the hotel restaurants) We walked to nearby places to eat. If you stay here you really should rent a car and drive to explore other parts of the island, other beaches and places away from the city. Lots of car exhaust pollution was encountered on our walks to find places to eat. The hotel is in a shabby area of town and staff recommended that we take a cab after dark because it wasn't "safe". If I returned to San Jaun I would stay at the Marriott or other more reasonable hotel. If you stay here you really are paying for the name of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....Not perfect”
Reviews.Author: toybuscookies
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 days at the Ritz and it is a beautiful hotel, but needs help. The rooms are very nice and well appointed. The 2 restaurants Il Molino and BLTSteak are outstanding but very expensive. Too many kids running around the place. The staff was excellent. I did notice that the place lacked a bit of tidiness. Tables were left with dirty dishes for a long time. Cups and plates were not picked up at the pool in a timely manner. Ashtrays were left full. Overall a great place, they just need to step it up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beatriz M
Reviews.Content: Although is not cheap it is a great place to stay. Beautiful pool, grounds and beach.!!! For casino lovers the are a variety of machines that were good to me. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jadspringma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a beautiful stay at the Ritz in San Juan. This is a beautiful hotel and the service is excellent. Yes it is expensive but what 5 star hotel isn't. You get what you pay for. The pool and beach were very nice. There were always chairs available, any time of day. They provide cold water and fresh fruit at the pool and beach, and cold bottled water and punch in the hotel lobby all day. There were alot of kids but since we had 5 kids in our party it was not an issue for us. We had booked an excursion on our own, and as we sat in the lobby waiting for pickup a staff member came and brought us a small cooler with bottled water, sunsceen and hand sanitizer for everyone in our party. The poolside/beach lunch service was excellent and not too pricey,,the kids meals were big enough the kids could easily split one. There are several good restaurants within walking distance for bfast, lunch or dinner. We had an excellent dinner at Il Mulino on our last night, not cheap but very good. Rooms were nice and beds very comfortable. All in all an excellent experience and wonderful service. Did not fine truth to anything in any of the negative reviews I read.

Reviews.Title: “Casino that pays and good food”
Reviews.Author: UncleG55711
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the pleasure of a cruise with a stop off in San Juan. Being an avid casino player and ever searching for that casinos that pay when you play, the Ritz Carlton was a pleasant surprise. After leaving the ship we took a taxi to the Ritz Carlton. Cab fare was not cheap, but it was a pleasant ride. The Ritz wasnt crowded and there was a nice variety of machines to play. We both won a jackpot, and enjoyed the free sandwiches and good coffee. Choice of burger or grilled chicken sandwich. Cant beat FREE and it was very tasty. I would highly recommend a stop in if your are a casino lover.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort. Wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: Kenyonl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 3 nighs and were impressed. This is definitely on par with other Ritz-Carlton resorts. The grounds are beautiful and the service was fantastic. We were a little concerned because there were some negative reviews but don't believe them. This is the best place to stay on the island. Highly reccomend upgrading to the Club Level. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Frankspicks
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Puerto Rico has several things going for it. It's close to the airport, has a nice (not great) beach, plenty of fine dining (two of the best restaurants on the island, BLT and Il Mulino) and a nice Casino. It is packed with families so if that is your thing and you are looking to eat well on property and hang with the kids on the beach or at the pool: great. If you are looking for a romantic high-end Ritz property, this is not the place for you. Its casual, its all about families with kids and its not a particularly up-scale experience. The prices however (for rooms, drinks, food) are very upscale indeed. So bring the kids, pee in the pool, pay through the nose.

Reviews.Title: “Too Family Friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerri d
Reviews.Content: If you go spring break - be prepared to see baby carriages and infants at the bar, both the Pool Bar and the Lobby Bar. The pool, while lovely, is insufferable due to the sheer number of little kids running around. The hot tub, never had less than 6 kids under 10years old in it at any given time. The beach is a better option if you don't enjoy kids running all over and screaming at the top of their lungs. This is NO upscale experience despite the prices. Even their restaurants like Il Mulino and BLT will have you skirting around little kids to get to your table, while their parents dine in shorts and tee shirts.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay overall.”
Reviews.Author: Globetrker
Reviews.Content: First, this IS NOT a place to stay and eat if you are a budget traveller, or a family that's "pinching pennies". I read a few reviews of pricey food especially, YES, this is a resort, and priced accordingly. All resorts typically do not have bargains when it comes to food-service, not even breakfast! Do not expect low-priced fast-food walking distance either, although there was one food-cart vendor on the edge of the property with "modest" priced American type foods. The ocean-view room is furnished in modern style. Ours was a king bed and approx 400s.f. We stayed on the 8th floor with a balcony. BALCONIES ARE VERY LIMITED on this property. DO NOT EXPECT one! I had to insist on the phone to make sure I got a balcony. I booked directly with the hotel, and rec'd this way only. Look @ website, then call!!! I had none of the hassles a few reviewers wrote on getting a room type. The beach is great, the pool area can fill fast, but it's best to really experience the ocean setting, and sit on a lounge on the sand, and all still very close to the pool and bar/towel services areas. NICE staff all-over, and consistent. No big "gripes" and best for singles, couples, and older-families with kids 12+ years. Room-service was always quick, and good. Be aware hotel is VERY CLOSE to airport, which is good and bad. If any type of jet-noise bothers you, you might want to go elsewhere. If your room faces away from ocean, you might just look @ the end of a runway of SJU. Typically while INSIDE THE HOTEL you won't hear anything, but during the day while on the beach, you will hear and see the jets on takeoff. Not a deal-breaker, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bcsystems
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best service hotels I've ever stayed. You are always greeted at the door coming or going. Checkin/checkout was very smooth. Calling for any room service was fast. The only issue may be with calling the concierge. They seem rather busy all the time and it's probably best to go down there personally to talk with them. There is also a separate tours staff that was very helpful. The facilities and grounds are in great shape. The lobby lounge seems to be a popular evening gathering spot for dinner or night cap. The food is very good but as expected on the pricey side. I'd recommend walking a block or two to Platos or Metropol for some authentic Carribean cuisine. The beach is not overly crowded though the surf is rougher than other beaches. In fact just down a few hotels, folks are surfing. The hotel is almost located next to the airport. While you can hear jets periodically, I did not find it bothersome. It is $15 taxi ride to the airport and $20 to Old San Juan. There is Enterprise Rental Car on site. Tip, reserve the car on the internet and pick it up. If you walk up and reserve, it cost alot more. In fact, this may seem to be a hassle, if you have to reserve multiple days, it might make sense to reserve by the day. It might end up being cheaper as Ritz will charge you to park or valet your car.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Million”
Reviews.Author: JunieBee
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton prides themselves on service, and service it is. Upon arrival you are welcomed with friendly faces and attentive attention. The hotel in impeccable, inside and out. A wonderful aroma is walfting though the lobbly which must be filtered through because you sense it as soon as you walk in. Fresh flowers, shinning marble floors, and a personable hello from every available employee. Unlike other Ritz locations this is a family hotel so be prepared. Food is very expensive so you may want to stop at the Pueblo just a few blocks away to stock up on some goodies, possibly even some alcohol. You can rent a car at the hotel and it is pretty resonable but just two blocks down ( near Denny's and Walgreens) there is a rental car company that probably has better prices. Book an excursion at least a week before you go as they fill up quickly. If you head to the rain forest, rent a car and go on your own but as for the snorkling which you MUST do, book through the hotel. Try visting Culebra Island. Dont forget to ask for an upgrade infact if there is a woman receptionist, send your husband.*There is a magnifyed make-up mirror in the bathroom but the lighting isn't great.*

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: esthichick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 days prior to a family cruise. The hotel grounds are lovely, the beach was perfect. We went off property for dinner finding some excellent food and the most wonderful Coquito gelato!! We were really surpised to see how many families stayed here. If you are looking for a family friendly place, then you've found it. Our kids (13 and 17) had an absolute ball swimming in the pool late at night. Go to the beach during the day as the pool if full of very rude people. The pina coladas are sooo yummy especially while sipping on the beach while watching the kids surf!

Reviews.Title: “Grown- up get away”
Reviews.Author: Jo102597
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Ritz in San Juan. The hotel was pretty and the staff was very helpful, friendly and polite. The location of the hotel was not ideal. It is, basically, next door to the airport. There is a lot of back ground noise of planes taking off and landing. We were lucky enough to have a ocean view room, but the other couples had airport view. The beach often appeared "messy". People left trash n the beach and the staff piled dirty towels on a chair. There were a lot of families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway Using Marriott Reward Points”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoregolfer
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Ritz Carlton, using Marriott Reward Points. Never left the property. We specifically took the trip to relax and unwind and that's what we did. We are from New Jersey and immediately realized that the clientele were from NYC, Phila. and NJ. The 2 restaurants are NYC based - Il Mulino and BLT Steak (both outstanding). Weather for half our stay was cloudy, so we went to the casino on the property. The other half of our stay was sunny and we spent all day at the pool and/or beach. Our trip was Thurs.-Monday. Saturday at the pool was packed---not a single lounge chair unoccupied. Clientele was made up of young families with babies and small children and young couples travelling in a group. The remainder were older couples in their 50's-60's, like us. If you want to see the sights, it requires either a cab or car rental. The only drawback to the location---you are very close to the end of the airport runway. You do hear jet engine noise at the pool throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: TajMarwah
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with very good facilities, the beach is outstanding. The only negative is that the hotel is excluded from the main city so you need a taxi to get everywhere. Visited January 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Service With a Smile”
Reviews.Author: mjgboston
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton San Juan has the "Ritz" way down! Every staff member smiles and says hello. The property is lovely. Great pool area but never sat there. The beach is not one of the most gorgeous, but its fine. Comfy lounges and great drink and lunch service by the ocean can make a person's day! The guys working the beach are great. Always enough lounges...and you don't have to get up at the crack of dawn to get one. Breakfast room is a bit harried and disorganized but if you are in a vacation frame of mind, you can deal with it. I kept telling myself to chill. Food is good. French fries are killer. Prices are "Ritz" steep. We had an ocean front room with a balcony which had been redone since our last visit. It was lovely. Beds are great with loads of pillows and sparkling white sheets and thick towels. Great little single serve coffee maker in the room. Better than the coffee in the restaurants. Had dinner at BLT - it was good. Il Mulino is a shadow of the one in NYC - the only thing it shares is the name. This is a city resort - so you have the benefit of great dining in Old San Juan and Condado being nearby.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable getaway, even for family”
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Ritz and had a great experience. The facilities are clean, comfortable and pleasant. The staff were, like Ritz staff everywhere, unfailingly friendly and always willing to help. Whether it be by the pool, in the lobby, on the beach, or on the floors. The beach itself is lovely, with lots of chairs and towels. Not crowded. BUT, if you really want isolated quiet beach experience, you can walk 1/4 mile down the beach and there is noone. Empty white sand beach for a mile. The waves are mellow, but good for little kids. Some folks out there surfing, but just beginners on baby waves. The pool is nice. Good temperature. Bars and poolside food/drink service were good. The hot tub is nice. We called ahead to see if there were kids activities by the beach and pool and were told there were kayak rentals and things like that. Not so much. If you are looking for lots of "activities" for the kids, this is not the place. Of course, the pool and beach are great. There is a Walgreens next door for boogie boards and beach/sand toys. We found the pricing on site to be pricey, but that was expected. The hotel restaurants (Il Molino, BLT and general food service) were costly. The drinks, too, were pricey. Just know that going in. If you can get on the Club Lounge floor (9th floor), that's the real key. There is breakfast/lunch/snack/dinner/dessert service nonstop from 7 am through 10 pm. Excellent options and free! That was the "steal" of the trip, and worth over $100 per day, easy. Finally, of course the beach views are awesome. But, if you get a non-beach view -- overlooking the airport -- the noise is NOT a factor. We worried, but the triple-layered windows are, indeed, soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best hotel on the island.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago411
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Ritz for four nights. I was a little worried based on some of the negative reviews so hopefully this will clear up some of the confusion. The property is beautiful, the service is very good and the rooms are very nice and very very clean. It does look just like the hotel pictures. It was spring break but the pool was never too crowded and the pool staff was very nice and was always ready to help you find a chair. Yes they expected a tip for this but it's a resort. The beach was very nice and again never too crowded. We had a cabana one day and the service from Gustavo was awesome. We saw several of the other hotels including snuba at the Caribe Hilton with Cade from AquaAdventures. He was great and I would highly recommend it. Friends have stayed at the Caribe and liked it. It is larger and not as nice as the Ritz but still looks like a great choice if you want to go a little less expensive. The 2 restaurants for dinner on the property are great but expensive and not geared for kids. Breakfast was $80 for three though you can pick up coffee and muffins for around $20 all in. There is not much walkable. Even with the $25 cab ride each way with tip to Old San Juan dining there was cheaper and more kid friendly and you got to see the city. We had a fantastic stay at the Ritz and I would definitely come back. It does look to me to be the nicest hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “First class accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Tharkone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful resort in March 2012. The pool is one of the nicest resort pools I have ever seen. Poolside gets crowded when the hotel is full, but very few guests actually got in the water. There was great restaurant next to the pool where kids could get lunch entrees for under $10. Adult choices were a little pricey as evidenced by the $16 hamburger. The resort staff varied greatly in their helpfulness. One of the bellmen brought a mini refrigerator to our room at no charge when we asked about keeping juice for our daughter in the room. Pool staff was great. They came by frequently with ice water and snacks. Depending on who was at the concierge desk, you might get a quick answer or have someone leave to find help and not return. The housekeeping staff was the same. You might not get shampoo in the room after it was cleaned; but when you asked for it, they came with 5 bottles. I would definitely stay there again if I was in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: Burm
Reviews.Content: I have had the priviledge of staying at a number of beautiful resorts and this topped them all. Not only the beauty of the facility but the way all of the staff made us feel. There is nothing so decadent as being given a glass a champagne when you return from sight seeing. Out in the pool area, the staff not only found our chairs but took towels and made pillows out of them for our heads. Beautiful view from our rooms. Received a lovely free necklace from their jewelry store on premises. The two restaurants were fabulous but will write more about them separately. Yes it was expensive, but worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “THIS is why you pay more!”
Reviews.Author: ladyjai1024
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel about 2.5 years ago in September (despite me marking April 2011). We were scheduled to stay in a hotel about 30 minutes away (Wyndham Rio Mar) and it SUCKED. We checked in and checked OUT immediately. We called around and the Ritz-Carlton had rooms available. It was the BEST choice. We stayed for about 6 days. The customer service was wonderful. Each time we arrived in the front we were greeted by staff (front desk, maids, managers, whoever). They had in-house activities office so we could arrange tours and hikes without having to leave the property. At the time BLT and Il Mulino we tried both and the food was to die for! The pool was great and the pool service was on point! They always kept the food and drinks coming. The food is indeed pricey and you might be better off going to a local place for food. We went to the spa close to the end of our trip and it wasn't memorable but once you've had 3 massages, you've had them all. The facilities were very nice. I can't recall the rooms we stayed in but we had a front view for the first 4 days then a beach/pool (on the corner) view for the last 2...so worth waking up to! I loved the Bvlgari products provided in the rooms. I honestly can't think of anything bad to say about this place. I even saw a very cute Yoana Baraschi dress in the boutique window. I called once I got back home and ordered it by phone even that transaction was smooth! OH and it's literally 5 minutes from the airport, can't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not the Relaxation We Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: DSA519
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in March, clearly a very busy time for them. The hotel was so crowded that they couldn't even honor our king bed request, so we had to spend our 4 nights in a room with two double beds. If you want to sit by the pool, you need to "claim" your chairs by about 9am, otherwise you are out of luck for the day. People typically stake their claim to chairs by leaving towels, a book or some lotion, and then they go back inside and have breakfast. This is not how we like to relax - the pressure of running out the door just so that we have a seat by the pool or beach. The beach is sort of unfortunate - it is rather small, and while we were there, it was covered with seaweed. I had hoped for better. The casino is fine - small but adequate. We ate at Il Mulino, which was very good, but it is true that the hotel has no food offerings that even remotely reflect the cuisine of the area. Metropol across the street isn't bad if you are looking for more traditional Puerto Rican fare. The hotel itself is clean, rooms are fine - no real problems there. The service is average, but in no way exceptional. We also found the breakfast at Mares to be really greasy. It's a nice hotel. Nothing wrong with it, per se, it's just that we were expecting something a little more relaxing, and with better service than we received.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful property, WAAAAAY too many kids EVERYWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay in one of the nicer rooms and enjoy the Club Level amenities. The Club Level was great. Our room was nicely appointed, the pool looked beautiful from our balcony.....however, sitting by the pool was like sitting next to a play ground. I love kids, I have a 2 and 4 year old....which we left at home for some "couples time away". Not so much. First off, I was amazed at taking infants through middle school age to a property that costs this much. I guess I live in a different world! Had the RC had 1 small area for adults only, it would have been so much more enjoyable. Even at the beach, we were at the corner of the property just to try and get away, and still were surrounded by kids. It is spring break season, but thought there would have been an adult hide away??? I would honestly not go back for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Small & pricey for families”
Reviews.Author: LoveBeach515
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Ritz. The rooms are small for the price, the pool is crowded and the food at the pool is overpriced. We paid $28 for a simple salad at the pool. Better food choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner exisit within walking distance to the hotel. Pool staff were great. Front desk staff understaffed and guests frequently waiting. Nice that it is so close to the airport. We tried to pay for an upgrade so we would have more room and was told that a larger room was available. While we were waiting to move to a larger room, manager told us that someone offered them more $$ for the room so we could not move as promised. We would not stay again based on overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Ritz but ...”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDenver_CO_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz in San Juan in December 2010 for 5 nights. The hotel was very nice but was way more formal than what we were looking for. Most nights other guests were pretty dressed up in formal wear and I'm not sure if this is typical for the Ritz or if there was a special event going on, but we felt a bit out of place. We have stayed at very nice places in the past and are used to getting dressed up now and again but were really looking for something more informal than the Ritz. I did, however, enjoy shopping at Tiffany's, and we liked the pool area as well and the resort was very clean. The beach was okay. We took a few day trips to see the bioluminescent bay which was amazing and also went zip lining through the rainforest, which was also a lot of fun. We also went out to Vieques on a catamaran trip and were much more impressed with the beaches there. If we ever go back to the area we would stay in Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars???”
Reviews.Author: Paulagreen
Reviews.Content: 1. We booked our trip with Expedia...never again.When we checked in we were told that we did not have the Expedia package which includes 2 Breakfast daily and $100. resort credit daily.Not that the people at the front desk cared.It would have been nice because drinks were $14. each and buffet breakfast was $27. 2. We were awoken at 6:45 am our first morning by someone power washing our window and the floors above us for about 10 minutes.Reported to the front desk. Don't think they really cared. 3. Our pool view...you would need to have a machete to see the pool.The tropical plants were so high you would need a ladder to look over them. 4.More kids than Disney..Couldn't believe how many young families were here.I inquired about this and a young mother told me it's because the Ritz caters to young kids.Which is great for them but we were looking for a relaxing getaway with our 20 year old daughter.Couldn't get into the pool side jacuzzi. The sign states no kids under 12. It was filled with much younger kids paying Marco Polo! Or parents with their toddlers complaining the jacuzzi was too hot.Also, It's one of those places where people stake their pool chairs first thing in the morning and you see chairs unused for hours. 5.If you went into the lobby lounge at night to get a lite bite or a drink(the only place in the hotel to do so) The place is filled with familys eating chicken fingers and pizza. 6. The room we had was small with 2 double beds. The bathroom was 3 star. A tub/ shower combo with a plastic shower curtain?? 5 star? 7. The area was also not 5star. A cockfighting arena across the road. A lot of abandonned properties in the immediate area. I would close by saying if you are travelling with young kids..this is a great hotel for you.But for anyone older looking to relax this is not the place. We kept saying imagine if you were newlyweds and picked this hotel??What a disaster that would be.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: AndyWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This a classy, well-appointed hotel like Ritz-Carltons everywhere, but that's the problem: It's like a Ritz-Carlton anywhere--with no flavor of Puerto Rico whatsoever. You might as well be in Philadelphia. The restaurants--transplants from the U.S.--offer no local cuisine. While other San Juan hotels feature a large bar in the lobby to emphasize the conviviality of the place, the Ritz' is an eight-seater tucked in a corner. Even rooms in most downscale hotels have balconies so you can enjoy the weather. In the large majoirty of the Ritz' rooms you can't even open the windows to sense what the weather is, to hear the ocean or to perceive that you're not in Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It (But . . . $$$)!”
Reviews.Author: Duberto
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that as excited as we were to be going on a promising holiday to San Juan, we were a bit concerned about this Ritz Carlton given some of the reviews on here . . . . . . but after spending seven days and six nights here I can wholeheartedly say that this is a fantastic place to stay: the staff are very friendly, accommodating, and efficient; the property is in excellent condition and immaculately maintained; the beach and pool area are great for couples and families with small children; there are several different restaurants and bars to choose among; taxis are plentiful and Old San Juan (which is lovely) is only 15 minutes away; and there are some additional helpful amenities (e.g., Walgreens, Starbucks) nearby. We loved it! The only thing that gave us pause was the extra cost of just about everything. We were lucky to be staying here on a good conference rate, but the advertised prices are clearly quite high (even for hotels of this high standard). On top of that: (1) there are a number of extra charges (e.g, $32/day resort fee, a one-time $16 bell service fee, $2/day room tidying fee, etc.); and (2) the restaurants and bars - although excellent - are very expensive (e.g., $16-$18 for mojitos at the bar, $27 for breakfest buffet, etc.). That said, if this hotel is within your budget to begin with you won't leave fussing about those costs - but rather will remember the extremely warm and helpful staff, the excellent accommodations and offerings, and a tremendous overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let other reviews scare you away!”
Reviews.Author: barbaraUsa
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Ritz Carlton Isla Verde this week. I must admit I was a little tentative about booking here after reading some of the reviews stating this property is not up to Ritz Carlton standards. Don't listen to them! We have stayed at many outstanding properties including other Ritz Carlton hotels and this is a lovely property. The hotel is small and very well appointed. We were attending a conference, and clearly were given a standard, "rack" room on the eighth floor facing the entrance and fountain. The rooms were recently renovated and done in very good taste. I must agree, the shower curtain was a little disappointing, but the soaking tub is extra long and the bathroom is large and very comfortable. The room was spotless every day. We requested an "in room" refrigerator which was brought up immediately at no charge. The beds are comfy, though I did not care for "unfitted" sheets--woke up in a jumble of comforter and sheets every morning. Large television and free internet access. DO NOT let the proximity to the airport scare you. The windows are double glazed and we only heard the airplane traffic in the quiet hours of the morning faintly. We also never heard the casino once. The grounds are some of the loveliest we have ever seen. Very well maintained. The pool area is crowded, but the attendants will quickly find you chairs if asked. The beach is great, plenty of towels, ice water and attention. The restaurants are limited and the service was spotty. Only poolside service and a breakfast/lunch dining room open to 4pm. For dinner, two upscale restaurants Il Mulino and BLT--both delicious but expensive. There are many other local places within safe walking distance such as Metropol, Mi Casita and Don Jose--cheap, tasty, local food. The public beach also has a kiosk with delicious empanadas for $1.00! There is a great spa/gym with plenty of equipment and free classes with a tough, but effective trainer named Josue--loved the spinning, total body fitness and ab workouts. Two tennis courts-free. Lighten up people, get out of the hotel and embrace the local color and culture. Isn't that what we all travel for? We would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good experience”
Reviews.Author: Fontaine
Reviews.Content: I had been here before the renovations and was prepared for a mediocre experience. I was thus happily surprised to have a wonderful stay. We had three rooms for five nights, they were all good, the service was good, the facilities were fine. I called housekeeping and mentioned a brand of soap that I like, and that I thought are provided in their suites, and within hours I had a delivery! Food was good for the most part. Lunch at the beach was a weakness and the menu needs to be expanded and improved. Dinner at the Italian restaurant was great, at the steakhouse a disaster the first night, greatly improved on a return visit. I could do without rushing down to the beach to get a good spot on the weekend, but that happens everywhere. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Haven”
Reviews.Author: BeachEpicurean
Reviews.Content: While not in the same class as many other Ritz Carltons it is a beautiful hotel, a more refined haven amidst the touristy options in San Juan. It's 5 minutes from the airport, great for a quick beach getaway. Had a 7th floor corner oceanview with balcony -an elegant newly renovated room, lovely spacious bathroom and terrific view of Isla Verde Beach. The beach is public, so you don't have the sense of serenity and privacy found at a Ritz Amelia Island or Grand Cayman, especially on the weekend. And the pool IS crowded, as others have noted; I think the hotel exterior footprint is just too small. Even so, the pool is stunning, a typical Ritz layout in a courtyard with fountains and palms. The pool food was a negative - I can't recall ever having a bad meal at a Ritz until I ate here. The mojitos are excellent & prosecco is probably the best value if you are drinking wine on the beach ($18 for a glass of sauvignon blanc?). However, room service and the lobby bar had excellent food. The Lobby Bar is a gorgeous space with terrific sushi and some decent wines by the glass, and a safe place for a single woman. Can't speak to the casino, which I avoided. It seems at odds with the Ritz glam to have a casino off the lobby. But I can recommend the handrolled cigars sold by a gentleman at the casino entrance! The massage I had at the spa was fine, but again, service wasn't on par with other locations. The spa is only accessible by walking outside, so arriving during a rainstorm was not a relaxing start to my spa time. No one greeted me and took me for a tour of spa facilities, showed me to my locker or any of the other courtesies you would expect. The room where you wait for your treatment is separated from the gym workout facility by a curtain - not quiet or private. Overall, the other hotel services and amenities (front desk, room upkeep, etc) were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated motel with terrible guests”
Reviews.Author: fakeis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back and wish I had forgotten I had. Gives Ritz a bad name. Casino is small and feels like a run-down middle of nowhere city casino. Hotel is a renamed motel in need of a complete renovation. Guests have terrible manners. Beach is small and is easily overcrowded. For example, you secure a spot with your towel, book, sunglasses etc and while you call your spouse where you're at, all your belongings are thrown out somewhere and others just take your place. Had to spend the rest of the vacation without a couple of key personal items for a vacation. Staff is laid back but courteous. However, I will never come back to this place. Stay at the better hotels along the beach and more closer to the city if you can. Don't expect anything of the Ritz standards. There are reasons why it is so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Our Go To Spot When in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: umich3
Reviews.Content: Literally a five minute taxi ride from the airport. Check in was perfect. Staff very friendly. Upgraded to a junior suite city view. The room is very large and has two large windows. The problem is the view is pretty sad. One window overlooks a run down condo with rusted a/c units and its parking lot. The other window is literally of the airport runway. The 50 inch flat screen is sweet. The bathroom is gorgeous and huge with a separate WC, huge bathtub, separate shower and two sinks. The bed was just OK for me. Turn down service nightly. Friendly housekeeping staff. We were given a coupon for a free gift at the jewelery store ( a necklace of a Coqui). The breakfast buffet got very tired after a couple of days, although it does have an omelette station.There are no caribbean fresh fruit offerings (only watermelon, honeydew and cantaloupe) which is odd. The servers are all wonderful and friendly. $30 per person. The hotel was overrun with small children and strollers. Wondering if they had a special offer for young families. Every single lounge was taken at the pool early in the morning (7-7:30)and they are literally on top of each other. We opt to stay on the beach for the solitude. The beach staff was excellent on the weekend and horrible on Monday. Their loss, since we are generous for their setting up our chairs. Two food servers to cover the entire beach area but over the top friendly. The lunch was good. The cuban sandwich was excellent, the fish tacos good, not great. The pina coladas are $16. Lunch runs around $50-$65. The beach is beautiful but public. As the late afternoon comes around the locals pretty much overtake the area with their radios and dogs. The staff seems to disappear. There is no security on the beach. Overall a perfect getaway for a long weekend to get out ot the cold. Tack on about $100-$150 to the nightly rate which takes into account taxes and a huge resort fee. Internet included plus use of the business center, gym and tennis courts. Pool cabanas run $350 per day. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Jawdoc524
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, a happy and engaged staff make for a perfect combination to relax in. We spent 5 days here with our travel buddies who had been here before. We stayed on the Club level. It is a great deal and we totally enjoyed it . The beverages and snacks were high quality and abundant . We were a little bored with the variety by the 3 rd day. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. We would all return here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is, after all, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Pamela1354
Reviews.Content: When you travel to Puerto Rico, you will not receive the service that you get in, say, Laguna Niguel. Given that foundation, this hotel is OK..and I would probably stay here rather than anywhere else on the island, if I wanted to be fairly close to San Juan. Don't make my mistake of driving past it when you leave the airport. It is literally five minutes from the airport, but the intersection leading into the hotel has about six different ways to go; it can be confusing. The hotel is directly opposite your car when you come to the first red light. The grounds and pool are pretty. The dining options, as always, are limited. There is a Denny's around the corner which helps. BLT is ok....but I was disappointed in the limited offerings. I can't eat steak every night. We had an ocean view double room. Nothing spectacular, but rumor is that they are remodeling/redecorating. Right now, it is very sunny yellow caribbean decor. They are very proud of their casino. If you have traveled to Vegas, it feels like a small vegas strip hotel. Don't waste too much time in the hotel. Get out and see the island. I rented a car and had the standard Ritz valet parking fee. But, if you have a car, then you are free to get out and explore the island. Driving to San Juan is easy and only crowded during rush hour...so don't let that worry you. It is worth getting into San Juan. Do Not miss the two castles/forts. They are a kid's dream. Lots of turrets, and tunnels, and hiding places. Back to the hotel. Decent beach for Puerto Rico. This is NOT the white sands of the bahamas. If you have limited funds, stay at the Courtyard just further east and you'll be on the same beach. It has a rapid slope, so more for sunning than swimming. I was disappointed at the service at the beach. The young staff was more interested in chatting among themselves rather than checking on us. The entire staff needs to be trained better....but again, this is Puerto Rico. This is funny: the concierge will give you printed out directions to locations/sites around the island. The directions are written poorly, are confusing, assume too much and are pretty much worthless. Although the concierge staff tried, they just don't get it! Nevertheless, go to Arecibo, the observatory, and visit the caves, and check out Luquillo beach, and the restaurants in San Juan, and drive around. One gets the sense that quality of life increases the further away you get from San Juan. Yes...balconys would be nice...but the hotel is too close to the airport for that. The longer I stayed, the less the hotel bugged me. Lots of groups come down here for conventions, so there is a rowdy set in the lobby during cocktail hour. They aren't paying much, so they are happy to be here. The hotel would benefit from hiring a few staff to do nothing but clean up glasses around the pool, pick up room service trays outside doors, move wet towels. And, it rains in Puerto Rico....a lot. Be prepared. You will use the umbrellas provided by the hotel and the wind will destroy them. Have a rain poncho with you at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: eeChi
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel and grounds were very nice and most of the service was great. The rooms were nice and comfortable. I stayed at La Concha the year before and would go back there before coming back to the Ritz. I thought the pools, the location and lack of kids gives La Concha the nod for me. Pros: - Very nice grounds/facilities - front desk service was great - good casino Cons - Lots of kids - Service at the pool for drinks/food was slow - Not many restaurants/things to walk to compared to other areas

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at 10 different Ritz and this one is no different. Solid!”
Reviews.Author: steveb6666
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews are concerning and i guess they didn't have a good experience but I will tell you differently. We have stayed at 10 different Ritz around the US and this one is just like the others...solid!. We had an ocean front room on 7th floor (good idea to get 6-9 floor. Well appointed and in good shape. Help is typicial Ritz...outstanding. Yes the prices are high but that is true for every Ritz or any fine hotel. Yes the Pina Coladas are $16-18 and the breakfast $30 (ours included in our package). Last weekend was very busy (Feb 25-26) and at 100% capacity but just a little crowded at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Ritzy about this Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Paolosmom
Reviews.Content: Our stay was under 2 Reservations and I had emailed the hotel x2 to remind them of this, Sure as the sky was blue they acted clueless. Our room was not ready, even though I had emailed that we would be arriving at 3. The front desk attempted to "sell" us an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite for the low price of 2k per night. The room was ok, and the bathroom lighting is poor. The hotel reminds me of a middle of the road cruise ship with everyone grabbing a chair early in the am, then never returning. The breakfast buffet is overpriced ( the line for eggs is lenghty, the cut fruits are a few melon choices,and the pancakes hard as a rock). The worst by far was our meal at Il Mulino which appreared to me to be thrown out of a trough and tasted as bad. Stay elsewhere and have a better stay...

Reviews.Title: “Just didn't do it ...”
Reviews.Content: The history of comments really say it all in this case, some good and some not. Parts of the place were wonderful and other things just were not up to high end standards. Good things include the staff, we thought everyone was very friendly and polite, the food overall was outstanding in our opinion. We had group dinners, private meals and snacks at the pool. The work out area while a little small was very nice when you included the streching room. The just ok issues are more plentiful, the overall size of the property is small so be prepared not to walk much and be be on top of your neighbors at the pool and beach. The room was ok, but when you check into a room you expect bathroom mirror lamps to work, TV remote controls to operate... and during your stay to have your coffee maker items re-stocked without having to ask for it. One person who absolutely stood out was Jerome, the omelette king extraordinaire, his friendly personality brought out a smile in me every morning. I also must mention Jose, a pool attendant, man this guy takes his job seriously and is extremely helpful to ALL the guests, which is needed as busy as this pool is. Overall nice but something just seems to be missing.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: DandLPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that my stay was a business reward trip so I didn't have to pay the high rates that many other reviewers have complained about (so my opinion may be biased since I didn't have to pay all the high fees...which we did notice while dining at several places and can say I'm glad I didn't have to pay the prices). That said, I can say that this hotel is definitely top notch on many ends and just good on several others. The top thing about this hotel is that the staff/service you get is top notch. From the minute you walk in you are treated by friendly smiles and people willing to help. Anytime you need anything there is someone there to help. They service your room twice a day so it is always clean. The servers in the restaurant were all great. Shout out to the omelet chef Jeremy (at Mares breakfast buffet). He loves his job and made awesome omelets as well. The beach guys set-up a chair wherever you want one and will get you an umbrella as well. I honestly have no complaints at all about the staff. As for the rooms. I would give them just an average rating. For the price you pay to stay here you would expect a soaking tub and a larger room overall (I have stayed at many resorts for half the cost of what I was hearing people paid that are twice as big as the rooms here). The beds are extremely comfortable. Our view was just of the parking lot so nothing fancy there. For as nice as everything else is at this resort I would have expected more space. The rest of the amenities at this hotel are definitely very good. Cleanliness -- Awesome. Landscaping -- Great (they were pulling weeds every day and everything is in top shape). Work out center -- nothing fancy but sufficient. Spa -- Wonderful. Pool area -- while busy it still is kept clean and is very nice. Casino -- good (even though I didn't do very well). I would say this hotel is Excellent, but the room size and just the overall value make it only a very good hotel. I would probably not spend the money they charge here if I had to shell out my own money. However if service is your key and you have the extra dough then you will get the best here at the Ritz. One final thing...the key card on the elevator needs to be fixed. My wife had several times she couldn't get it to select our floor. Also, if you forget your room key or your spouse goes up to your room ahead of you then you have to hope someone else getting on the elevator is on your floor. Understand the security purposes, but it is kind of annoying. Anyways, just a small annoyance to an overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Ritz Carlton Standards”
Reviews.Author: TravelDivaBoston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Ritz in San Juan. This hotel is definitely not up to the Ritz standards. First, our room was not ready upon check-in even though we arrived at the hotel after 3:30pm. Second, the pool area was extremely crowded and service was poor -if you didn't reserve your chairs with towels prior to 7am, you were out of luck; and the servers rarely came by to ask for our drink or food orders. Third, the concierge messed up our dinner reservations twice - booked the wrong time at BLK, and never made us a reservation at Il Mulino (even though we had the confirmation in writing). They tried to make up for it by seating us outside the restaurant by a very noisy casino - though they did comp us with a free bottle of wine, coffee, and desserts. Fourth, the bathrooms by the pool and lobby were a disgrace - unclean and not properly stocked. Fifth, service in the lobby lounge for dinner was extremely slow and the servers mixed up our orders. Sixth, this was not a kid friendly hotel - aside from some pretty sad inflatable water-slides outside the pool, one ping pong table, and a volleyball net in the pool, there were no other programs or activities for kids. The hotel was definitely not worth the price we paid.The only pros of the trip were - the beautiful weather, close proximity to the airport, snorkel trip aboard the Spread Eagle II, and the homemade chocolate chip cookies in the lounge..Save your money, and stay at another spot. We will definitely not be returning back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jafo777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan probably 30 times over the past two years both for business and vacation. There is no better place to stay in San Juan if you are looking for quiet, upscale luxury and great service. I've also stayed at several other properties in San Juan (La Concha, El San Juan, Stellaris, Doubletree, El Caribe), and each has its strengths and weaknesses. But overall, the RC is the best. If you are looking for a "party" atmosphere, this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for something geared towards young kids, this will work, but may not be your best choice. But if you want luxury, class, service, and a great beach and pool, plus great personalized service, go with the RC and pony up for the Club level amenities. Giovanni, Yanira, Wanda, Jose, Norma, and the rest of the team in the Club will pamper you and take care of your needs. The dining in the hotel is a bit limited and pricey (you are at the RC after all), but there are great options within walking distance or a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive! Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: My third stay with the property but 1st time after the new renovations. Balconies were added & new furniture. The room furniture is more contemporary but lacks luxury. The worst is the bathroom concerning the lighting! The bathroom had only one light fixture over the single sink which had a fluorescent bulb. The only other lighting came from the dim light over the tub. Also a four star EXPENSIVE resort should not have shower curtains!!! Beware-a new system was installed into the elevators and room locks. The room locks were not the problem but everyone we ran into on the elevator had issues getting to their floor. You have to hold your room key over a circular black sensor then press your floor button. You CANNOT get onto any other floor besides your own. Only one person at a time can wave/hold their room key over the sensor so people were constantly missing their floors or just didn't know how to use the system,ANNOYING system! Restaurants: Il Mulino-$$$$$ horrible,didn't even eat the entree BLT steak-$$$ excellent Mares for lunch-$$ good but not great Poolside lunch-$$ good but needs improvement Pool Area: Service & staff-very friendly very crowded,loungers are in close proximity the water temperature is not maintain and neither is the cleanliness a lot of servers walking around to serve you/mix alcoholic drinks average $15 Beach-seems like your best bet For a resort that charges $$$$$ for everything and 16% of your rm rate per day in resort fees,it just was not worth it. There was nothing luxurious about the rooms,pool area or the restaurants. The resort is literally 5 mins by taxi ride $13-$17 you can see the resort when landing on the strip If you are planning to go to Puerto Rico,one restaurant stood out-PIKAYO $$$$ but EXCELLENT(located within the Conrad) Would I ever go back to this particular resort-NO

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, beautiful property, and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: loveparadise4
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th time in San Juan. We did not stay at the Ritz before because of the proximity to the airport. However, we have indeed been proven wrong. This property was top notch, customer service at it's best and the distance to the airport isn't a concern whatsoever. To go on about customer service once more, the hotel was booked at 90% of it's capacity, but we always felt like we were the only clients! We split our time with another hotel, but we will give the Ritz more time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not for me.”
Reviews.Author: Geedubb W
Reviews.Content: I've been to this resort twice, both company awarded trips. It's got a nice pool, casino, beach and restuarants. However, it is EXPENSIVE! Drinks are $14 bucks a pop, breakfast for two $60.00 plus tip. Then there's the fact that it's close to nothing and a round trip taxi ride to Old San Juan is $40. If you're weathly or want to appear to be then it's for you. Otherwise stay at the Hampton Inn across the street or at the El San Juan resort down the street. Better yet, stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and conveniently located close to airport and old San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Kap117
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz San Juan for 6 nights with some doubts after reading some negative trip advisor reviews. We were not disappointed at all-the hotel was spotless and although the room was not overly special- pool and some ocean view, it was clean and appeared to be recently renovated. The beach and pool areas were nice and poolside/beach staff were attentive. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous and both BLT and Il Mulino were very good. Compared with our stay last year at the ritz st Thomas, I do have to say that property gave more of a resort feel and enjoyed that stay even more. All in all, I feel you cannot go wrong if you choose this property for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible- do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: traveler5512
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon before departing on a cruise. It is in no way like any other Ritz property I have ever stayed at. The customer service was terrible. We had a similar experience to other reviewers who experienced long check-in lines only to be told their room wasn't ready. We didn't get into our room until 6 pm- very disappointing. The room itself was also sub-par and did not have a good view at all despite being over $400 a night. Add that to the bar tender at the pool who could not be bothered to give us the time of day..... Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: RonKVA
Reviews.Content: Unaccustomed as I am to self-described "resorts," I have no idea whether my stealthily inflated room bill was typical or an aberration. But if, like me, you naively believe the quoted room rate and fail to request an all-in quote in advance, be prepared for sticker shock at checkout time. I have no problem with the room tax, which added around 13% to the room charge. But then there was a compulsory daily â€œresort fee,â€� whatever that covered, which added another 16% -- even though I was attending a conference and had no time to use any resort facilities outside the meeting rooms. I always tip the bellhop and housekeeping staff personally, so imagine my surprise when I saw that the hotel had also added very generous â€œbellmen gratuitiesâ€� and smaller daily â€œhousekeeping gratuitiesâ€� to the final bill. I suspect that the chances of that money going to the service staff who actually helped me (and whom I already tipped directly) are slim to none. Unlike most good hotels I have stayed at and even many bad ones, the Ritz-Carlton San Juan offered no daily newspaper to its guests. But when I inquired, the helpful reception staff directed me to the gift shop, where I could buy a Wall Street Journal for $4.82 (including tax) on weekdays and $$8.56 on Saturday for a slim edition strangely stripped of the usual weekend WSJ magazine section. The printed price tag on the newspapers was $2.00, carefully covered up by a gift shop mark-up sticker. Not much money involved, but still an egregious rip-off. The room was large but nothing special, with no balcony and a view consisting mainly of a nearby building across the street. The thermostat apparently controlled only the air-conditioning, so there was no heat on a cold February night. On the plus side, maid service was excellent, the reception staff was friendly, the wi-fi worked well, and the three-drawer dresser was adequate. But overall, the facilities were unimpressive despite the hotelâ€™s beach location and beautiful ocean setting. The Ritz-Carlton San Juan is not a great place to hold a conference. The hotel did not provide paper, pen, or pencils for attendees at the conference sessions, and many of us were especially annoyed by the poor acoustics and chilly temperatures in the meeting rooms, which we were told were unadjustable. The conference meals were served by an untrained or poorly supervised serving staff, who failed to bring me one or more of the standard items (dessert, salad, beverage) at three different meals -- despite my requests after others at the table had been served but not everyone. All three times the serving staff disappeared when the after-meal programs began, so those who had been overlooked initially never got served. My best experience at the Ritz-Carlton was late at night in the small Casino, which has some unusually player-friendly blackjack rules.

Reviews.Title: “First Class service all the way!”
Reviews.Author: KAS490
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in Puerto Rico for the first time for his sisterâ€™s destination wedding and we originally checked into another hotel down the street, but had a less than pleasant experience with the lack of cleanliness and service and were checking into the Ritz after our first night stay. The Ritz itself and the grounds are impeccable and clean. The extremely cordial and polite staff always greet you at the door, consistently offering to help with your bags, assist you out of a cab, or help you find your way around. We noticed when we paused to look around when we first entered, someone immediately came over, asked if they could be of any assistance. I was sold even before we checked in! At one point during our stay, we came back from an outside excursion and decided to sit for a minute on the main lobby couches, and a staff member came over asking if they could get us a drink or a menu. We could not believe how attentive they were! The rooms were clean, well kept, the dÃ©cor was neutral and calming, the bedding was down pillows and comforter â€“ very comfortable sleep! The rooms are cleaned twice a day; once in the morning, and once in the early evening. In between housekeeping rounds, we would get a knock on our door asking if we would like additional towels or water. At one point, I had left my diamond earrings on the sink in the bathroom, forgetting to lock them in the safe. I was a little worried about the second rounds of housekeeping that day knowing we wouldnâ€™t be back until late, but when we got back to our room, everything was straightened up, including our bathroom and my earrings were placed on the glass shelf, above the sink â€“ we could not believe the honesty of the staff member! The staff is unbelievably considerate when knocking on your door too â€“ at one point, we could not find our TV remote, when we called downstairs to see if we left it on our food cart, they offered to send a new one immediately (at no additional cost). When the staff member arrived with our new remote, the main desk called the room and said we had our â€œPrivacyâ€� note on the door (staff members will not knock if that sign is up) and let us know the staff member was outside the door. When you walk onto the beach, the staff greets and asks how many beach chairs you will be requiring, and they set them up for you with fresh towels and umbrellas. There is chair side wait service; a wait staff member will come to you at the beach chair and take a drink or food order. I did not know this when I first went to the bar to order some drinks, and the waiter seeing me place my order and pick up 3 drinks, rushed over with a tray and insisted on carrying them to our chairs. We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner; the presentation of the food itself is amazing! When you place your order by phone, they give you an approximate delivery window time frame and the food is always on time. For breakfast orders, you can fill out a menu the night before, hang it on your door before 1am with a time frame you wish to eat in the morning and the food is delivered as requested! We literally woke up and the food was delivered a few minutes later. Each time the staff brought the food in, they would personally lift each top off of the trays, stating the item underneath, always saying if we need anything to let them know and every â€œthank youâ€� on our end was always responded with â€œmy pleasureâ€�. If I could give this place 10 stars, I would! I cannot emphasize enough how warm, accommodating and friendly everyone is. They provide first class service all the way! The upscale environment and amazing staff truly allow you to have a vacation! As a guest, you feel as though you are their priority and give you their undivided attention and service. This is THE place to stay in Puerto Rico, have your wedding and welcome your guests. The Ritz staff really saved our trip, provided a beautiful place for a destination wedding and gave us a great welcoming experience to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Robert J
Reviews.Content: Love going here as it is a quick trip from New York, close to the airport, and has great service and access to the beach. The hotel pool is one of the better features. Run into a lot of folks from New York and East Coast. Il Mulino in the building. The casino is so so but that is not the reason to go anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place-great little beach”
Reviews.Author: s199056003
Reviews.Content: Great service. Room view was mediocre -we overlooked the airport. Beach was nice. We had our 3 kids with us and at times felt a little awkward as it seemed as quiet as a library (and our kids do not like to go to the library on vacation). We were able to walk to the Metropol across the street for dinner for a reasonably priced dinner that was pretty good. There was a Walgreens as well within walking distance for whatever you may need - we needed a little air matress and beer). Casino was small but had the table games. Seemed like the slot machines were mostly penny version. Hard to get a drink at times. I played video poker twice and never got a drink. There was not a bartender there. I actually went to my room to get a drink (from Walgreen's) and came back down. You could bring your drinks in. Beach was nice. Small waves that the kids could play in and enjoy. Overall, we had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the negatives...”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: We took a recent trip without the kids for 5 days. We booked everything and then started reading some of the negative reviews on trip advisor and started getting a bit worried. First if you are traveling with kids, some guy complained about $20 kids pasta meal. We looked at all but one of the menues in the hotel. None of the kids items was over $10 most were $8, so dont let that worry you. Next is the sound from the airport. Yes you are next to the airport, yes you can hear some of the jets taking off. They are not that loud, few and far between and sometimes you go hours before you even notice one. The food at the pool is good not great, but it is poolside food so what do you expect. We ate at BLT twice, BLT is always great. We ate at the lobby bar once for light dinner. The food was great, but had to be sent back because it was cold. When we got it back it was great, it is just that the kitchen is on the other side of the hotel from the lobby so it has to travel, add that to any delay in the waitress picking it up and you get luke warm food. The drinks in the lobby are great and the atmosphere is comfortable. Rooms are great and clean, no worries about that. The one thing i didnt understand was the beach and pool lounge chair covers. Everything in the resort is clean, spotless and well taken care off. The covers were alomost all ripped and falling apart and some of the chairs were actually broken. No idea why anyone would have a complaint about this hotel except that the just need to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Excllent Stay, Impecable service”
Reviews.Author: kosx4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2012 on the club level. Form the moment we checked in to the moment we check out, we were treated as treasured guest. Each request was met with "My Pleasure." The grounds of the hotel are spotless, well manicured and continously cleaned. We played tennis and took tennis lessons - our pro Kamil was very thorough and our group clinic for 1.5 hours in the mid days sun was exhausting - and left us all sweating and smiling.. I had a deep tissue massage in the spa - simply wonderful. The spa is a bit small, with just a ladies and gents locker room and a shared whirlpool and finnish sauna. Not a lot of relaxation space. Exercise space was adequate with tredmill, elliptical, bike and universal. I did not take any of the classes - it appeared there were two per day. We sat at the pool, and sat at the beach, no problem having the pool staff find and set up loungers and umbrellas. We ordered drinks and light snacks from the pool waiters as well as ordered ourselves from the bar. The pool waiters were a little slow, and we had to hunt them down (after waiting quite a long time) to close our tab. The service in the bar from Robert and Elmer was exceptional. We frequented the club lounge for a light breakfast, mid day snack and pre-dinner drinks. The staff was incredibly accomodating, mixing any cocktail, including tasty mojitos. Wine, champagne, cappucino, tea, soda and water were available through out the day. Well worth the upgrade. We had a cooked to order breakfast each day in the cafe. Service was good, but the room is all tile and glass, and quite noisy. For some reason - there was always lots of breakage each day, dishes and glasses breaking and smashing on the tile floor. The casino was quite fun - much lower minimums at tables than I have seen at other upscale resorts. Saturday table minimum bet was $2. Not too crowded, the usual slot hogs in place. We had a memorable meal at Il Mulino. Expert waitstaff and an Outstanding captain (Steven). WE enjoyed the welcome treats as well as the strawberry grapa that concluded our evening. My only complaint was the incredible markup on the wine - 5x retail?? I think we were one of the only tables with a bottle. They'd sell more if the markup were more reasonable, and the list expanded more than just the "well know" wines. Time to add some QPR gems to the list. The location is close to the airport, but there is no overwhelming noise. A cab ride from the airport was about $15, which included some charge for luggage. It is a $21 cab ride into Old El San Juan. THe taxi's are almost all very large vans than can easily accomodate 6. One small complaint was the timing of the room cleaning. Service was provided twice a day - in the "morning" and then again around 5 PM. Everyday - our room was not serviced until 2 PM or LATER. So we would come back to the room - still dirty. No clean towels. I Don't understand why the rooms, particularly on the club level couln't be serviced by 12:30. But honestly, it was a small inconvenience for an outstanding visit. Excellent visit - I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet get away!”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler68
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was recommended to us by our neighbor, who has been there several times in the past. It is very clean. Its is very quiet, especially at the pool. Its close to the airport but not so close that you smell jet fumes like some places. The service is what you would expect from a Ritz. My only complaints were slightly slow room service and bad wifi coverage. You'd be surprised how many people complained about that while we were there. The room was great and the bed very comfortable. I would definately go back. Incidentally the restaurant, Metropol, across the street was not fancy but outstanding (stuffed mashed plantains with grilled chicken and garlic sauce!!!) and the gellato place(Pio Bella?) down the street to the left even had sugar free flavors for the health conscious and cheap breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “What's no to like?”
Reviews.Author: CousinsClan4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, San Juan in September 2011. The hotel is just what you expect from a Caribbean hotel. Open spaces, extremely friendly employees, and of course delicious mojitos. The hotel is geared more towards adults I think. The pool was perfect and I recommend that you rent a cabana since the sun is pretty intense in the Caribbean. I agree with the other reviewer in that it is centrally located and just a cab ride away to Old San Juan. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mssrfoie
Reviews.Content: After spending time on the water and some little Islands, getting back to the Ritz was a welcomed event. The hotel is modern, well kept and has a fabulous pool/ocean play area. For the gamblers, the Casino is very nice....not cheesy like many hotel operations. This Ritz mirrors the many other Ritz hotels we've had the pleasure of staying at for both business and pleasure. Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Ritz Carlton San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: GottisEgo
Reviews.Content: I've learned to take some reviews and understand not everyone is easy to please. I came to the Ritz on a Business/Pleasure trip and I was pleasantly surprised. I come to PR every year and stay at other resorts but this was the best in terms of in San Juan. Pros: -Excellent Location - $20 cab ride to Old San Juan, nearby restaurants, etc. Right next to the airport yet you rarely hear a plane. -Newly Renovated Rooms - More modern/Art Deco..I stayed in a Ocean Front Balcony and I highly recommend it. Some of my co-workers stayed in regular rooms with no views at all. I'd recommend Pool or Ocean View/Front rooms -Food - The restaurant on the beach has the best fish taco's I've ever had. BLT is always a great time. We ate twice at the hotel but mostly went to Old San Juan for dinners -Overall service was Okay- Certainly not a true Ritz Carlton experience -Beach is great - Excellent service and waiters certainly worked for their money. Tipping helps! Cons: -As any high end resort, prices are sky high but you know what your signing up for when booking the Ritz Carlton. -As mentioned in Pros, Service was okay. What would make this property that much better is reorganizing the service aspect of their business. Waiters to be more attentive, front desk to be more willing to help rather than look like they are going out of their way to help. When your paying $600+ a night, this is unacceptable. Now don't get me wrong, everyone was very nice but again, with brands like St. Regis and Ritz Carlton you expect a certain level of service that nears over the tops. I'd pay a $1,000 a night if the bellman called me by my last name every time they saw me (Yes, this actually happens at places like Four Seasons, St.Regis etc.) Overall I had such a great time I am headed back there in May with my wife. We love San Juan and have a new hotel on our list to continue to stay in. Just hope they implement more training to their staff to recognize their guest. Otherwise, stay at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton and "average" shouldn't go together”
Reviews.Author: hazzy724
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan and have to say that visiting over 10 Ritz-Carltons, this one does not live up to its name. Their service is terrible. I pulled up and there were no bellman to help with my luggage or the door, the maid walked in on me without knocking, the poolboys were nowhere to be found and the waitstaff was too busy chatting with each other rather than attending to me. This property needs some serious help service-wise and does not live up to Ritz-Carlton standards.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel and vacation experiences we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth H
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews about this hotel on Trip Advisor, I have to admit that my wife and I were concerned about our upcoming stay. We recently returned from a 5 day stay here and have nothing but amazing things to say about our experience! The room was beautiful, clean, comfortable, spacious and quiet. We called in advance to request a feather free room, an extra fridge and early check-in. All of our requests were graciously met. I felt that throughout our stay, the staff went the extra mile to make sure we were always comfortable and taken care of. Our two daughters, ages 4 and 6, were thrilled with the Ritz kids program and all of the restaurants offered a very reasonably priced kids menu. The beach was clean and beautiful. There was absolutely no seaweed on the beach (as someone previously commented) and the pool area staff were very friendly and accommodating. In addition, the location of the hotel is fantastic. 5 minutes away from the airport and not noisy at all, 15 minutes from beautiful Old San Juan (20.00 cab ride) and short walking distance from a Walgreens and 24-Hour large grocery store. My wife and I highly recommend this hotel and are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: davidojs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property at this point almost ten times. I have not once had a negative experience. One of the things I enjoy most about this Ritz is the staff. They always take the time to say hello and make the experience as enjoyable as possible for you. Additionally I have always enjoyed the patio breakfasts, and of course, sitting by the beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Better than fajardo!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2aprince
Reviews.Content: On our vacation to puerto rico we were caught in hurricane Irene! So going from a powerless, humid, and unorganized hotel that apparently did not know how to address guest after a storm we were so happy to walk into the Ritz! They greeted us at the door, walked us up to the counter to check- in, and brought us more water and coffee as soon as we asked! The hotel was also hit just not as bad as ours in fajardo so we couldn't go to the beach or swim in the pool for a day or so. The restaurants were nice and food was good everyone was so nice! I know I would come back here if we ever decide to go back! You never know when a vacation will go bad, but I am glad we came to the Ritz to try an salvage what was left of our crazy vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and impressive in every way”
Reviews.Author: Nell S
Reviews.Content: I cannot express what a wonderful time my husband, my 16 mos son, and my mother and I all had at this hotel. It was our second time coming. They absolutely go above and beyond in every way... accomodating us to allow for my mom to stay next door to us... to ensure my son had whole milk for his bottle every night... to leaving a rubber duckie in the room... to offering champagne upon our departure... to making sure that my son's dinner came before all of ours (at the beautiful and delicious Il Mulino restaurant)... to, if you can believe, having someone from the hotel get our bottles to us on the plane, after we had mistakenly left them in our room, along with my son's medicine. I have never written a review about a hotel but felt the need to open an account with trip advisor and share the experience. I realized as we were about to board that I had forgotten my son's bottles and sippy cups at the resort. We were beside ourselves, looking for cups and straws and milk to buy for the 4 hour flight home to NYC, and just as the plane was about to take off, the flight attendant called our name holding the bag of bottles that the Ritz had taxied over to us (without our knowing). They have customers in us for life. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. Beautiful pool, gorgeous beach, lovely staff, always going above and beyond. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Some elements were far from 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here recently and had a mixed experience. The breakfast was very poor, I've had better in any hotel I've stayed in europe regardless of the stars. The service was hit and miss, some of the staff were excellent however others left a lot to be desired. Went out for the day and came back at 4pm and the room still wasn't cleaned which is unacceptable. However, massage in the spa was excellent and the beach was well serviced. Though we had a balcony alot of the rooms are without one and the windows don't open. On the whole I don't think it deserves a 5 star rating. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “A nice escape”
Reviews.Author: cathleenmarie
