Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our visit to the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. It is across the street from the airport which had me worried about sound and perhaps view/ ambiance. Not to worry--our room faced the airport and the sound proofing was excellent. There were nice views of the mountains beyond. The room is comfortable--not large, but recently renovated and handsome.We had a room with a king size bed. There was a small-ish loveseat which we later realized was a fold out couch--great for families with one child. The dresser just inside the drawer wins the award for shallowest dresser in the world! The drawers are maybe 11" deep. There is only one sink in the bathroom, there is a bathtub but not a separate shower. The water pressure was excellent. There is one small-ish closet. The TV is a flat screen but none of the channels are high definition (a big deal to my husband). (None of the TVs in the entire hotel are high def--not in bars, restaurants, casinos.) We stayed on the club level so had access to the four presentations/ day. We used it at breakfast and occasionally at lunch--on a nice day it was more relaxing to have lunch on the beach than trudge up to the club level. Some reviews comment on the high prices for food and drink--makes me wonder if these people have ever stayed in a hotel before. In my experience, the prices are what you would expect. We enjoyed BLT Steak and Il Mulino. The latter is pricey--but all Il Mulino's are pricey. The beach service was quick and friendly. The staff working the beach was very helpful and would set up a chair in the shade or the sun. There were shady palm trees and umbrellas for the sun averse. There was also plenty of sun for sun worshipers. The exercise facility had two rooms--one with cardio and weight lifting equipment. The second room was for yoga and spinning classes--also great for working out on your own with exercise balls, mats, weighted bars, steps, etc. The cardio room needs more ellipticals--there are only four and there was always a line in the morning. There were five treadmills and one recumbent bike. I had a massage--really nice. It was an easy and relaxing trip. We were fortunate to have lovely weather which was a plus. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: joberg44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Ritz for 3 nights and it was all that we could have hoped. 5 minutes from the airport. Great service. Great rooms and great food. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “very, convienent, good restaurants, close to airport... good for a few days!”
Reviews.Author: pipsey1
Reviews.Content: went between Christmas and New Years...Crowed but manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel for a relaxing family vacay”
Reviews.Author: jaylaw333
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be in a first class hotel that is buzzing with excitement and a party atmosphere, this is not ideal. It is better for the distinguished traveler or a family. Hotel is first class and the rooms are nice with a beautiful beach and pool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: Resort is only about 5 minutes from the San Juan Airport. Greeted by name and we were taken to our room. We were celebrating an occasion & told them when we made the reservation. A lovely silver photo frame was in the room upon arrival with a bottle of wine. How nice. Room was very nice size and felt oh, so clean. Bathroom was very large and had 2 sinks, large soaking tub, sep. shower, mostly marble, etc. No view...but it was a QUIET room. And, THAT MATTERS. Bed was very comfy. Internet office with printers on a sep. floor that has no charge. Lobby bar that had entertainment...but is had a cold feel even though it was quite full. High drink prices. 2 very good restaurants on site. Casino was hopping every night and had a GREAT feel to it. It was very busy there, with mostly locals. We really enjoyed it. Pool was large and had a large area for lounges. Outdoor patio rest. was just okay and so was the food. Alot of waterfalls at the pool that made it noisy. Lovely beach to take a long walk on. Hotel was not in an area that many bars/restaurants/shops were within walking distant to. We prefer the Condado area...especially the Marriott Resort. We would rather stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “ahhhh, nice”
Reviews.Author: jazzlo
Reviews.Content: Ritz-C does it right in San Juan! Around 9:30 PM i sat quietly on a bench in the backyard of the resort leading out to the crashing waves just enjoying the sounds of the safe jungle oasis created around the meandering walkways. Sipping a savory rum recommended by my bartender gave me the excuse to enjoy perfect weather and soothing sounds for the most 45 relaxing minutes of my trip. Those paths mentioned above lead out to pools, and a perfectly maintained beach. Everything about the hotel was great too! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “I think I came back with bed bug bites!”
Reviews.Author: Drcc_14
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty, mold in the toilet and shower. We were moved to a different room only to find mold again, but just in the shower the second time. The last night before leaving I asked housekeeping to change the sheets. I woke up with several bites that were not there the night before. Upon arriving home I discovered more bites, my body itches like crazy. I just hope I didn't bring any back. The restaurants were very expensive and the food was ok. For the price you pay, I dont recommend this Ritz property.

Reviews.Title: “Weary of upcoming trip”
Reviews.Author: Wendypal
Reviews.Content: I will be staying at this hotel in 2 days and can't even say I am looking forward to it. I had a question about our reservation and just waited 10 minutes on hold to talk to someone and finally hung up. I sent an email 2 days ago to the property to ask my questions and have yet to receive a response. To update people, the resort fee we are being charged is $44 per day. Already I would give the service minus points! I am going for a business conference and once again the people booking hotel are going for name rather than value. Clearly Ritz Carlton does not read or care about these reviews because they are consistently inconsistent. My guess is that the people who rate the hotel high are not accustomed to what a LUXURY hotel should be. Wake up Ritz!! I will update when I return. I realize I've not been, but felt I had to share my experience thus far. This is the first review that I have felt compelled to take the time to write!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Space, too many kids”
Reviews.Author: ABologna86
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are lovely (very comfortable beds!) and the pool and beach are beautiful. Rather small beach space, but large pool and floats available. The only downside was that the place was over run with families with small kids, which made relaxing difficult. Not the best place for families as there isn't that much space for the kids to run around without bothering all the other guests. Breakfast was good, enjoyed a mango mimosa, and the grouper sliders we had for lunch were very tasty! I would stay here again, but not if I want peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: foodiejsg
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. Our room was average size, balcony with ocean views. Very clean, excellent service and very friendly staff. Was very sad to leave and come back to cold NYC :(

Reviews.Title: “If ur looking for a very average place..here you are”
Reviews.Author: yuls21
Reviews.Content: Terrible food, with service below average..dirty rooms ..very tired hotel..so far not a fan ..the only good thing is the casino....we went to the steak house they advertised blt- shockingly terrible....Italian place Milano a lot better..pool good very average..feels like ritz is going down

Reviews.Title: “Easy Acess Ritz Vacation”
Reviews.Author: polo10
Reviews.Content: This was a quick family birthday celebration. The Ritz is literally 5-10 minutes from the Puerto Rico airport. We were all arriving/departing at different times so this was extremely convenient. Rooms were typical Ritz quality,we all had ocean views. We were all the club floor. Many families with small children and babies in the club room at all times of the day.Pool and beach were great. Service was fantastic, remembering names and occassions. A few snafu's with concierge requests...i.e. champagne delivery poolside for b-day celebration, but was remedied with sincere apologies. Liked BLT,also poolside restaurant. Zip line was worth it, orgainzed by hotel. Fun, easy, relaxing family vacation, nothing exotic, but fairly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Service Never Fails”
Reviews.Author: babettetravels
Reviews.Content: The service for which the Ritz Carlton is famous was apparent every minute of our stay at this property. When we arrived, the receptionist/greeter not only assured that we had a table at the popular BLT Steak Restaurant, but walked us to the restaurant to do a personal handoff to the maitre d'. Though the room was a little tired (and small) and the beach even more so, there are not enough superlatives to describe the staff who fall over themselves to assure the most pleasant of stays. From the front desk to the restaurant to the bar to the workout room, every Ritz Carlton personnel was solicitous, courteous, helpful, charming and warm. Unfortunately, the property itself feels a little like the poor cousin of it's Miami Beach counterpart, and we were not impressed with Carolina overall. We booked many months in advance and got one of the best rates on the beach for the Christmas season ($210 per night). And in our experience (we also stayed at the Mariott Isla Verde and frequented the San Juan Hotel) this hotel was the best of the lot. In short, if you would prefer service over amenities, and need to be in Carolina, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, big bill”
Reviews.Author: durhamjw
Reviews.Content: We had a beach from room on a high floor but the size of the room was a disappointment. We had no place to put out clothes except the hanging space in the closet. There was no dresser and only two small drawers in a night stand by the bed. For the price of the room we should have had somewhere to put our things. The housekeeping staff was not very efficient or consistent. As the week went along, more and more things were missed - towels, glasses, etc. The staff was always friendly, but not always very efficient. Must make sure to get up early to save a chair at the pool or the beach. In summary,wWe have expected better from a Ritz. Stay away from the casino. The staff there is 180 degrees off the expectation of the Ritz. We heard similar reactions form other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: pwpezzella
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week. My husband and I are middle age and traveled for pleasure with no children. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The beach is steps out from the gorgeous pool. The service is amazing. There is not anything that they will not do for you and make you feel like it is there pleasure doing it. It is a little quiet but you can walk to El San Juan hotel for some hot salsa dancing at night. Both hotels have casinos. The Italian restaurant and the Steak restaurant in the Ritz are expensive but well worth the price. Great time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: SheilaKentucky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the RC San Juan for 2 nights before we started a cruise. The location is just 20 mins to OSJ and the cruise ship terminal. The aesthetics of the hotel was wonderful.It was not too spread out though. Pretty compact. The front desk and bellboys were great and greeted us by name. Room was beautiful.It was ocean view ( from the side ) We had breakfast at Mares- try the guava pancakes! Awesome.Lunch at Ocean Grille ( Lots of black birds there !).Dinner at IL MULINO- a lot of pomp and grandeur but food was not that great in my opinion. The lobby lounge was beautiful with stately columns and soaring ceilings. Just 3 shops. Spa was great according to my husband. Nightly turndown service.Pool was beautiful and lined by the signature stately lions. Lush landscaping. They had a glass door opening onto the beach from the pool, which is locked at night.I have never seen this anywhere.Looked really nice indeed. We used Debbie Molina from Legends of Puerto Rico for a Night Tour of OSJ and a day tour of the city.It was awesome to walk the cobblestone streets and glimpse into the past. She is an awesome guide! Look her up on Tripadvisor. She recommended for lunch- Manolin on Calle San Justo. A bustling cafeteria like atmosphere , where we sat at the counter and pointed at the menu ordering - Mofongo w/ shrimp. Mashed plantain stuffed with shrimp. Try it for an authentic Puerto Rican experience. Right opposite to the RC is Metropol- a local favourite. Try the fried red snapper.You can easily walk to it - just 5 minutes. We used Castillo Tours at the hotel for a 4 hr EL Yunque tour. We were unable to do the Bio-Bay but heard from everyone it was awesome! Maybe next time... One Con- the beach was strewn w/ sea weed. They did not clean it up.It looked very unkempt indeed.I hope the management takes notice of this. All in all- we loved it and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: janep p
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Ritz Carlton properties and this is the worst of the lot. The service was indifferent and careless. We stayed on the club floor. The food presentations were the same every day - mediocre as well. The club lounge staff was more interested in talking with each other in Spanish than attending to the hotel guests. Additionally, the pool was dirty (there were small children bringing buckets of sand and dumping them in the pool with the pool attendants standing by and watching), and the beach was covered with trash and black seaweed. The lounge chair covers were left out overnight so that they were wet and covered with bird droppings. The restaurants offered good food, but it was ridiculously expensive. I would not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: rslukas
Reviews.Content: A great place for the price. Room was clean, beds comfortable. Bathroom was large, well supplied, good water pressure, and classic. Close to airport. Friendly staff. Clean throughout. Great restaurants. Can't wait to go back to RELAX!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: loneranger007
Reviews.Content: There's something to be said for stellar service...and that's exactly what you're paying for (among other things) when you stay at a Ritz property. The facility is solid (not overly extravagant) - but well worth the cost of admission. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We took advantage of the morning session Kids Club (a 3 hr break so the adults could enjoy a spa treatment). Our children felt safe and secure - and we felt good about bringing them there (two visits during our week stay). I'd quickly recommend this hotel to families looking for a home base during their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 2 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: ekejdono
Reviews.Content: We spent our 25th anniversary at the Ritz. We booked an ocean front balcony room and did the Cosco package that included airport transfers, breakfast, $100 daily resort credit & a tour credit for $100. We arrived well before the 4pm check-in time (12pm) & they gave us a beautiful room immediately - pool & ocean view, balcony, king size bed and a huge bathroom that seemed more like 4 more rooms. We ate at their seaside open air restaurant for lunch both days & the food was excellent. The restaurants are pricey; the drinks very expensive; but you're going to the Ritz. You can't expect anything else. We ate dinner across the street at Metropol - an excellent Puerto Rican/Cuban restaurant that was moderate in price. The service at the Ritz was impeccable. The bad reviews all mentioned the renovations, but they were complete when we were there. We definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for a Ritz, poor service, some nice points - overall erratic”
Reviews.Author: jncd2000
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would say that a Ritz had poor service, but this Ritz sadly convinced me of that. As a platinum Marriott member I rarely have had an experience where I felt the staff simply didn't care, but this Ritz seemed to be populated by clueless staff with less than cheerful attitudes. Additionally, the setting was somewhat odd as it is about 1 mile from the airport as the crow flies and in a sketchy area. The shame of it all is that with good management and a dedicated staff, this hotel could easily get up to standards and meet, if not surpass, other Ritz properties. It has a casino, which many people might like. The spa has great potential as well and the physical plant was built to good standards. Ocean is within 300 feet of the rooms if you get a coveted ocean view, but many of these views also encompass a view of the rooftop of a part of the facility and if you have lower than 3rd floor you won't see ocean. Our room had hair in the bathtub from a poorly draining bath and when we moved to the next room we had two wet rags over the shower bar from the last maid service. The spa was tired and unappealing with no whirlpool and a bizarre steam room with a sink in it, but the masseuses were fantastic. The pool was unheated, which made it challenging to consider during the winter. On the positive side, the workout rooms were top-notch. There were some surprising restaurants around, including a BLT Steak, which we didn't get to eat at and a slew of other choices within walking distance (Chilis, Wendys, Baskin Robbins, McDonalds). The hotel shops were outstanding, including a Tiffany's and other boutiques. Good things about it included the beds, which were fantastic and the appointments in the rooms, which were recently redone. Certain of the staff were fine, but overall it isn't representative of the brand and is definitely the weakest Ritz I have ever stayed at of the 10 or so I have visited. I can't speak for the rest of the hotels on the island, which is relatively poverty stricken, so this may be the best there is, but I wouldn't encourage coming to Puerto Rico for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you may think it lacks â€“ it offers far more important things”
Reviews.Author: Margie O
Reviews.Content: I can agree with some of these reviews in regards to the lack of a pool heater which would be beneficial during the cooler time of year; to the need of paying more attention to the cleanliness of the beach during times when the hotel occupancy is at 100%; the fact the cost to dine on property is on the expensive side; or the lack of rooms having a balcony. But for what it may lack, I believe it makes-up in the overall ambiance, its great service philosophy, and its attention to offering the highest quality found on the island. My time at Ritz-Carlton San Juan was a pleasant experience. My trip was mostly for business. But during my post-business stay, the resort was my solace from a most intense week. I counted on Ritz-Carltonâ€™s brand of high-end amenities, high quality service to try to decompress and enjoy all that San Juan/Old San Juan had to offer, and Iâ€™m happy to report it did not disappoint. From my time spent in the lobby lounge, sipping a signature mojito while the sun sets over the island, to my interaction with the spa attendant as she generously hands me a plate of iced hand towels while in the eucalyptus scented steam room, to even the energy reflective from the resorts guests â€“ I notice while waiting for the elevator or walking into one that guests seem to be relatively happy. They acknowledge perfect strangers with a hello and a smile, having a calm demeanor about them. From this interaction I assume they are enjoying their stay â€“ and their enjoyment is the energy that fills this building with the solace that I seek. Will I return to Ritz-Carlton San Juan? Absolutely. Period.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Valerie K
Reviews.Content: I too agree that the area is kind of shady. We stayed on the coceirge floor. Do not stay in a room near the lounge as I could hear them using the service entrance all day/night. The walls are thin as I could hear the person in the next room coughing for two days. I did not think the service or rooms were on par with other RC properties. The most disappointing part is there are very few rooms with balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BullHusky88
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. The service was great and the restaurants were excellent. The pool/beach area was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service .....”
Reviews.Author: Karen1997
Reviews.Content: The hotel in Puerto Rico is not the highest class of the Ritz Carlton's. First I will have to say. The SERVICE is EXCELLENT on all levels!! Â The rooms we had with an ocean Â view were very nice and comfortable. But Ocean view DOES NOT mean balcony. It just means you can sort of see the ocean. If you are below 8th floor the view will be trough the palm trees. The pool area and sunbeds on the beach are a bit worn. The stretch of beach in front of hotel has whitish sand that seems to have been manually put there, which is nice as the public beach right next to the hotel has coarse yellow sand.Â  The food in the restaurants is way to expensive for what is on your plate. This goes for the $16 nachos w a small PLASTIC container guacamole and the same container size salsa in pool bar. $18 for ONE glass of red wine in the bar etc. We stayed 6 adults for Thanksgiving . We were recommended to go for the buffet in Restaurant Mares. The buffet was only OK. Nothing incredible. 6 adults and 2 glasses each sangria set us back $700. Compared to an incredible four course wine tasting menu at Restaurant Marmelade in Old San Juan, Â The Buffet at the Ritz almost seemed like a "sham" for The money. Anyway. We had breakfast and light lunches at the hotel and had our remaining dinners in Old San Juan.Â  We have stayed here before and will be back. But I recommend eating dinner in Old San Juan .The rooms have everything you need but at the end of the day it is the service from all the staff members who makes it worth while coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: LexZNyc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night trip. Since we were traveling with children we didn't venture far from the hotel, but I agree with those who found the area kind of shady. We stayed on the 10th floor which was clean and up to date. Our room was nice and meticulously cleaned daily. The restaurants were expensve. My husband asked for side of linguini w/ his entre at Il Mulino and it was $15. My 2yr old and 4 yr old had chocolate milk at BLT and we were charged $10. $14 for a mojito on the beach/poolside. You can grab a 1/2 price drink at the lobby bar at happy hour. The property was very crowded for the holiday but there was room for everyone in the pool and the staff would find a seat for anyone who needed one. I was really pleased with the hotel, and the staff was extremely accomodating. My only real complaint was that the beach felt dirty. There were orange peels everywhere (since they are available for free at the towel hut). I also tried to find shells with my daughter a few steps away from the hotel and found more cigarette butts and beer bottle caps than shells. Lastly, on my last morning there I was eaten alive by some kind of small flea on the beach. Its two days later and I'm still covered in over 30 (no exaggeration) itchy welts. I would return for the hotel, but I think the bug bites and beach condition were a big turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it. Some negatives, but overall great.”
Reviews.Author: DrRhythm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in November, 2011. We took a chance with the tail end of hurricane season, and we are glad we did...the weather was PERFECT. The hotel is at the very end of the strip of hotels, which actually is a very good thing---the strip leaves a little to be desired. There are some homeless and shady types roaming around the area at times, at night, but overall we didn't have any bad experiences. There are police up and down the strip constantly. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff were very welcoming and accommodating as soon as we arrived. Everything was in order regarding our reservations, and we were offered an upgrade to an ocean view room, for a small fee; the hotel was not at capacity because it was still not peak season yet. This turned out to be a great thing, because there were no crowds, and there were tons of free poolside lounges & chairs, and there was always a chair and umbrella available on the beach. There are guys working for the hotel who will set you up with a couple of chairs, a table, and an umbrella for no extra fee (just a tip). This was great, considering many upscale hotels will charge you extra for reserving a chair. We assumed it was this way because it was off season. As far as the poolside and beach drink and food service, this was one of the negatives. The service was quite slow. Although the drinks were expensive (really expensive), we would have bought more if the servers came around more frequently (hotel management take note; you could have made a lot more $$ on drinks!). The hotel has some restaurants within, which we took advantage of only once because we like to get out and explore. The restaurants on site are very expensive, as well, but the food was good. We had a breakfast package included in our booking, so we had daily breakfast at their buffet, and this was very nice- fresh fruits, juices, omelette station, cheeses, pastries, etc. As far as the room, we felt it was fine. It wasn't quite as "wow" as I would have expected from a Ritz-Carlton; we had never stayed at a Ritz-Carlton before, so maybe our expectations were too high, but it was a nice room; the bathroon was particularly nice, though the door didn't close properly. One negative was that we had this huge picture window that offered a beautiful ocean view- except the window was quite dirty, which made the view not so hot. This was unfortunate, given it took away from what would have been a beautiful view. The A/C unit in the room also would make a loud "bang" every time it would kick off. So, all in all a nice hotel, but some things should have been better considering the reputation of a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking that this is a Ritz Carlton property”
Reviews.Author: BBoopL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls out long weekend getaway. From the moment we stepped into the lobby of the hotel, we were quite underwhelmed. The decor was decent, but it felt more like a 4 start Marriott and not up to the usual Ritz Carlton pizzaz. Service wad decent, but not stellar. The hallways and rooms looked old and weathered. The paint job very drab and rather depressing at times with paint chipping off on the ceiling in public areas. Everything about the property seemed very forced - like it was not naturally meant to be there or to look that way. The section of the beach was clearly not "prime" beach real estate for that area and the hotel is surrounded by other less expensive hotels (and at times nicer looking properties) that seemed to have better beaches. The view of the ocean here is quite subpar compare to other beaches throughout Puerto Rico. Food and drink service on the beach and in the pool area was awful. We couldn't get anyone to come take our order, and several times we flagged down a staff member and were snapped at because they did not cover "this section" of the beach/pool. As expected though, everything from food to sundries in the hotel was super expensive, but we would want the service and quality of the goods to warrant those prices. no way we are coming back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “I have found Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveladdict
Reviews.Content: So a quick flight from the East Coast, no passport, no customs, and a tropical paradise make Puerto Rico a wonderful vacation destination. A 5 minute taxi ride from the airport, a stellar staff, and amazing accomodations make the Ritz the best choice for San Juan relaxation. From the moment we arrived at the Ritz, it was pure heaven. The grounds are lush and tropical, the pool area is gorgeous and the beach is great as well. From the moment you arrive, the staff treats you like family and this is the hotels greatest advantage. Their service is phenomenal and they are all one of a kind. I promise that you will be happy you chose this hotel for the staff alone. The casino is moderatly sized and provides entertainment, the restaurants are amazing. You have to try the chicken parm at Il Mulino and the cocunut grouper sliders at Mares. The bar by the beach has the most amazing frozen mojitos and champagne cocktails. See Michael and he will make you a pretty pink drink with champgne and the local passoua liquor. He was so helpful and kind while we picked his brain about local things to do. The rooms are very clean and very modern, we loved the beds as well. They were very comfortable! The bathrooms were spacious, with a seperate water closet and a shower/tub combo. Housekeeping kept our room clean and neat the entire trip. It was worth the money to upgrade to a pool/ocean view room. We were on the 8th floor and our view was amazing. 24 hour room service as well. We had one issue with our A/C on the 3rd day of our trip and within 5 minutes there was a repair tech who fixed the problem and we were so impressed. The spa was wonderful also, I had a facial and enjoyed the products they used so much that I had to bring them home with me. The facilities (shower, sauna, lockers etc) were clean and nice as well. We were able to use these after a long day at the pool as we hurried to catch our flight. The location of the hotel is great, $20 taxi to Old San Juan, $15 to Condado and $15 to the airport. Very safe as well. We walked to Platos and Metropol for lunch/dinner and it was lovely to be out and about. There was some evenign entertainment in the lobby lounge but it ended pretty early. Seems to be an older crowd at this hotel, but this makes for a quiet and relaxing getaway. We did not want to leave. I have to mention, Gabriel Albaladejo (the Guest relatons coordinator), he was amazing! Always a smiling face, alaways remembered our names, taught me to salsa dance in the lobby and reccomended amazing places to visit in Old San Juan and Condado. Carlos, the bellman, was also such a pleasure. He told us to get yucca mofongo at Cafe Puerto Rico and we loved it! He was so kind and accomodating each day as he helped us get taxis and decide where to go. Also, I can't remember his name (but they called him the Latin George Clooney) and he helped us with our bags when we checked in. He was so kind as well. You can't go wrong at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Totally Chic”
Reviews.Author: IvyFromPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Very Expensive ($22 for a PiÃ±a Colada wRum) :-( but very Elegant. Is in a great place felt very safe at night walking around the area, lots of places to eat. Service was excellent and the place was amazing very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Although a Notch Below a "Regular" Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: RNG1008
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for a surprise weekend getaway after we got engaged. I chose this hotel because its' a Ritz-Carlton (similar to other feedback already posted) and I regularly stay at Ritz-Carltons throughout the world so I had some level of expectation of what I would get. Overall, the hotel was nice, a very solid Ritz-Carlton, no unlike those in the Carribbean or Mexico. The room was pleasant, properly well maintained, the casino was not too rowdy, the pool was excellent and beach front location was also great. The fitness center, as well as the tennis court, were also fantastic, exceeded my expectation for a small hotel. No complaints here at all (and I'm generally someone who's quite particular and picky). My issue though (recurring throughout my stay) was the service. It's not what one would expect from a Ritz-Carlton. I think it's more comparable to a Westin or a Marriott - something that is meant to be a large-hotel style service and is generally 1 to 1.5 notches below a Ritz-Carlton. Not sure if it's just different culture and expectation / definition of "service", but just reduce your expectation. At the pool, it was impossible to flag down anyone to serve us drinks. Not that they had a shortage of staff, but they were just busy socializing with each other and walking around without actually helping guests. Front desk was also not overly warm or helpful. Did their job, fine, but again, not what one would expect from a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All What You'd Expect.......From a Ritz......”
Reviews.Author: Docktj
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the name--Ritz Carlton--and because it was listed with the American Express "Fine Hotels in the World" program for platinum card holders. (We've used this AMEX program previously and have been VERY happy with the hotels included--truly great hotel venues). I'm sorry to report that THIS Ritz, in many ways, does NOT live up to the Ritz-Carlton reputation. The first issue was upon arrival: after checking in, our luggage wasn't delivered to the room for 30 minutes. Upon trying to call the Front Desk to inquire, NO ONE answered the phone upon 3 successive calls. I eventually had to go down to the lobby only to find my luggage STILL sitting on a baggage cart directly in front of the check-in desk. I had to ask that it be delivered immediately. The accommodations: the rooms are average sized: NOT the spacious, welcoming, and comfortable rooms associated with the Ritz. The junior suite level of accommodation is certainly NOT a suite and failed to meet any pre-conception of the accommodation level.The prices of the rooms are based solely on the views......and they are certainly NOT spectacular. My "junior suite - city view" was a small room with the view of a local apartment complex immediately next door. Now, understand that I'd called the hotel DIRECTLY to inquire about the accommodation and was given a description that in no way was equal to the level provided. While I was supposed to be upgraded to the next level of service because of my affiliation with AMEX, the next level wasn't available for all three days--but the level of service above that one was....but , no upgrade. I subsequently learned that there were executive suites and full suites available--but the registration staff didn't offer or alert me of the options. The cleanliness of the room was average: a decent sized stain was present on the carpeting as one entered the room: plain as day. Obviously, the housekeeping staff didn't give a hoot about it let alone correcting it. Dining: The breakfast was just as another reviewer of this hotel stated: limited options and certainly not the variety you'd, again, expect from the Ritz. Lots of rolls/bread/cereals----not much else. While that would be fine if the breakfast was a continental one: but, it's spun as a "full breakfast" buffet. The restaurant "BLT" has good food: but, like a fellow reviewer, it was VERY expensive and the taste, quality and portions were average. I too felt cheated. I ordered a fruit plate from room service after inquiring about the types of fruit included: of course, the plate that arrived was nothing as described. The staff: many of the staff (particularly in the restaurants) seemed pre-occupied and seem to be "put upon" by having to deal with us. This seemed anathema to me given that we were guests at a Ritz-Carlton!! The SPA: to our surprise, the staffer that greeted us, after inquiring as to whether we'd been to other R-C spas (to which we replied in the affirmative), offered spontaneously that this one was not quite up to the standard(s) of the others we'd visited. Unbelievable !!! This hotel was Okay: but definitely NOT in the tradition of service synonymous of the Ritz-Carlton and definitely NOT a "five-star" property. And, it certainly was not tantamount to one of the "finest hotels of the world." Just so ya know.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Truly wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Dave4377
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beautiful Ritz-Carlton in San Juan as guests at a wedding and could not have been happier. The room was nicely appointed (with a bed so comfortable it made going to sleep a real treat), the bathroom was spacious, and the view of the pool and ocean was lovely. We stayed on the concierge floor and were impressed by the service of the staff in the concierge lounge. The drinks and food there were a great treat, as well. I can't remember the last time I felt so pampered at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply special”
Reviews.Author: dryoung1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in June and could not of been better. The staff was very helpful and courteous.had a problem with the room safe and within 10 minutes the staff repaired it and we were on our way. 3 of the nights we ate at the ritz for dinner and it was exceptional from appetizer to dessert. If we were walking around the area the concierge was very helpful in pointing us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “More than I could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: manndoe
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from spending 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton/SanJuan. I was overwhelmed by the courteous staff from the minute we walked into the resort. Every single person asked if I needed anything, if I was enjoying myself and if there was anything that they could do! The room was beautiful...pool, garden and an ocean view all in one! Wonderful appointments in the room, wonderful bed! The spa and pool areas were also wonderful. The breakfast was very expensive (would have liked to have had another option) but loved having Il Molino and BLT Steak at the property. It was a bit pricey to go back and forth to Old San Juan ($42 round trip) but so be it. I would take advantage of the tour options...great way to spend a half or whole day. I could go on and on but you should experience it for yourself! PS-Spray insect repellent...trust me. I unfortuantely did not, and was eaten alive by these crazy invisible bugs on the beach :(

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MartinDe
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here Nov 2011. It's an expensive hotel (in-room breakfast >$100!) but worth it if you just want to be pampered. Staff are very attentive - in particular 'Antonio', manager who assisted us. Restaurant Il Murino is superb and, if you can fight your way past an army of elderly PR women, the casino's fun as well - and the slots are noticeably looser than Vegas & New Orl;eans!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect!”
Reviews.Author: haddy0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in early November 2011.The Ritz-Carlton is everything most people want in a top end hotel. It's big, elegant and well maintained. Staff, from the valet parking, front desk, housekeeping, restaurants were all pleasant, welcoming and hardworking. The concierge was especially courteous and eager to help with any request. My room was large and well appointed with a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was large and well lit with plenty of towels and other amenities. Everything was in working order and the room was quiet. The only meal i ate in the hotel was breakfast and it was the expected buffet with a cook doing eggs to order. Everything was fresh and appetizing and there was a large choice. My deal which I got on-line included breakfast for two and valet parking and was $299. There is a glitzy, but fun casino in house that is enjoyable if you want to indulge. the pool is large and attractive with plenty of towels and lounge chairs. The negative here is the distance from Old San Juan and Condado. Taxis really are a must if you want to go to either place especially if you plan to drink. It's about a twenty minute drive to old San Juan. All taxi drivers whether we got in at the hotel or at the taxi stands in Old Twon charged a uniform $21. Condado and other spots in between were always less. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but missing in the details”
Reviews.Author: KingCountyTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to summarize the Ritz-Carlton, San Juan. Firstly, it is a beautiful hotel as one would expect of a hotel in the Ritz Carlton chain. The garden is well designed and quiet (when planes are not taking off) and the little patch of beach in front of the hotel is picturesque. My wife and I love eating well and we have eaten at some very good restaurants around the world. Our eating experience in the hotel was not up to par with what we would expect of a hotel of this caliber. Firstly, the breakfast was certainly not up to the standards of a good hotel, lacking variety, and I would even say quality (such as pancakes that tasted like they came from a packet). The one time we ate at a restaurant in the hotel, we felt a little cheated. While the food was OK, it was not great but we paid a price that is higher than some very good restaurants we know. For example, we ate at a wonderful restaurant in San Juan called Marmalade where the food was sourced from ecologically friendly sources, each plate was truly a work of art and the chef came out personally to greet the customers. At this restaurant, one of the finest in San Juan, we still paid less than the restaurant at the Ritz Carlton. Pros: Well designed hotel, nice room, friendly and attentive staff. Cons: Too close to the airport, don't get the "San Juan" feel, a little stiff, unpleasant casino, and unnecessarily expensive - I don't mind paying for quality but I felt that the quality didn't match the price in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and facilities on the Island for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: OCRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I have business in Puerto Rico and have stayed at other hotels over the years, but the Ritz Carlton is in my opinion the best facility and the best service staff on the Island. The staff is attentive, and anxious to make you feel at home. They also respect when you are conducting business and know how to give attentive service while remaining at an appropriate distance. When work is done, this facility is amazing, a terrific beach and pool, great fitness center, and tennis. The business center has a xerox, scanner, and three computers and is available 24/7. In-room internet is included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and fun casino”
Reviews.Author: annalisajb
Reviews.Content: The area near the hotel is busy. I particularly enjoyed its proximity to the airport, local restaurants, and other hotels (which contain the popular bars/clubs). The hotel is very nice, has a great pool is located right on the beach. My favorite mojitos were made at this hotel's bar! The hotel casino was great as the patrons were not serious gamblers, but rather there to have fun. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Crez4jc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz pre-cruise from September 23-25, 2011. This trip was to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and staying here was the perfect kick-off to our vacation. They had rose petals scattered everywhere around the room when we arrived in our room. They had a card and a special chocolate dessert waiting for us too! We had dinner at the steak house and they brought us free champange and appetizers. The service was perfect, every where we went, from the pool to the beach, and our room. We also stayed one night here after our vacation, and they held all our extra cruise luggage for a week, while we traveled to St. Barts. The hotel manager was great, and very helpful with every request we had, I'm sorry, I can't remember his name. I can't wait to go back and just stay there for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: AJPost820
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel just minutes from the airport! Stayed here twice and would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Heidi V
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in San Juan after a cruise and spent the night at The Ritz. The rooms are spectacular! From the bedding to the bath it is typical Ritz. The pool and the beach are where you want to spend your time. You can rent stand up paddle boards or learn to surf. The pool bar food was very good and the chicken wings are worth the sticky fingers. The cabana staff is right on top of the cool drinks and the happy hour bartender was also a magician! Really fun! Sad that we were only stranded for one night. I could of spent a week at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected !”
Reviews.Author: dbenamy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2010 from 12/20-12/25 and loved it. the reviews I read prior to booking were so so, however we found hotel to be a great Island getaway . It is easy to get to and essentially in the "states" from an Americans point of view. the rooms were bright and airy and clean.The service was first class and what you would expect at a Ritz. Enjoyed the super friendly casino as well as the great meals at BLT and Il Mulino. San Juan was nice as compared to other island destinations, enjoyed local restaurants as old San Juan. I especially enjoyed the fact that Puerto Rico is part of the states, friendly people, US dollars and a Ritz .Give it a try I don't think you will be disappointed unless you are expecting more of a resort destination...

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: CGW52
Reviews.Content: We decided at last minute to steal a weekend away to just relax. The weather was great, the pool and beach wonderful and the hotel and staff was terrific. We stayed on club floor and while we had "city view" room in fact we had view of Carolina beach and the ocean (room was at end of the hall next to Presidential suite). The service was top notch. Only complaint was that club only opened officially at 7am, way too late for an early riser. They did accommodate and let me sit in their early to read, so as not to disturb my wife, and sip my coffee. We ate in the lobby lounge, mostly sushi, which was delicious and reasonably priced for an expensive hotel. I will be back when I return to San Juan. My only complain was the bathroom was a bit dated and the shower lacked water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Anniversary Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Luxtravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for our anniversary. The beach and pool were great. The service was great. Our ocean view room was great. The only thing that wasn't great was the food at Il Mullino. Everyone raves about this restaurant in New York and Las Vegas but we know several people that visited the one in the Ritz in San Juan that said it was just average. We agree. The food was overcooked. My guess is that they just need a new chef in San Juan. Get the package with the free breakfast as it was excellent and it was nice not having to pay7 for it.

Reviews.Title: “Low-end property..”
Reviews.Author: dba80
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton, San Juan is a rather low-end property and unfortunately not worth a second visit. Service is a bit lax, restaurant choices are too casual and disappointing, while formality is non-existent Public areas and rooms are nice, but average. Locations is designated out of the main tourist area, which is positive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pat1293
Reviews.Content: I gave this an Average rating based on all the other Ritz hotels I frequent. The service level is comparable to the other Ritz hotels, but once you leave the lobby, shops and the restaurants the hallways and the rooms start to feel very worn out. First the good: 1. The staff is very attentive, the grounds are well maintained, great restaurants and hotel shops. The lobby is beautiful. Now the bad: 1. Noticeable stains on the carpet in my room 2. First morning i woke up to the sounds of workers in the room directly above me. This was at 730 am mind you. I waited 30 minutes and then called down to complain at which it point it stopped. Not sure who thinks its a good idea to do work starting at 730am. 3. The Maid service cart was planted outside my room for hours on end and i had to keep telling them to move it somewhere else. 4. The televisions in the exercise equipment in the health club did not work and those that did got poor reception. 5. Depending on where you sat at the pool side restaurant you would get hit with an overwhelming smell of dirty dishes/garbage from the kitchen that was nauseating. 6. Very difficult to get a drink in the casino. The servers are very difficult to track down and dont come around often if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Club level downgraded”
Reviews.Author: Epicurean40
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The casino is great, the restaurant selections are great but the Club Level has been downgraded. What was once a sprawling selection of food through out the day is now reduced to a few offerings that frequently ran out. While it was very tasty, they repeated the offerings and now it is no longer worth the price of admission.

Reviews.Title: “Most luxurious hotel in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Fish11_11_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. Probably not worth the money however. We also stayed at a hotel just next door to this - very high end as well for 1/2 the price. The staff here is amazing and very attentive. They always greet you and hold doors, etc. The casino was a kit of fun and very clean. Rooms were average and maybe a little on the small side. The pools and beach front are what really make this place worth your money. The sandy beach is wonderful and connected right to the pool area. Also, the whole hotel felt very safe, in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Rubes1011
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico about 10 times and this is by far the best hotel/resort/casino on the island! The service is 2nd to none and the accommodations are wonderful. The hotel has an amazing spa and gym and the restaurants are top notch. The staff will make you feel at home the moment you arrive. I will always return to the Ritz Carlton in PR. The rooms are beautiful, the pool is relaxing and there is a great beach area. Don't waste your time or $ in any other hotel. The Ritz has it all!

Reviews.Title: “My 5 day Visit 10/6/11”
Reviews.Author: Sm j
Reviews.Content: My first review, and I feel compelled to share my experience at the Ritz in San Juan due to the mixed bag here on trip advisor. The good: -Clean, newly renovated floors 7-10. They are working their way down, so if you go, request to be on the higher floors. - Houskeeping, lobby, pool/beach, and dinner service was excellent. All friendly and helpful. The Average: -The pool water looked like ocean water. Didnt have that crystal clear sparkle. -The breakfast buffet was rediculously overpiced at $55 a plate for eggs, bacon, sausage, mango juice and an omlett chef. If this is not included in your package, Denny's is a 2 in walk away. Also the service in this restraunt was lacking. I went through a whole sitting without being greeted or served, had to ask for coffee, and the bill was never presented as if I didnt exist, so I left. -There are descent water activities right off the beach. Surf/SUP boards for rental, a little rock reef to snorkle, nothin fancy. Around the corner we rented a Hobiecat sailboat for $60 and had a ton of fun. Jetski's are available as well. The Bad: - Hot water. In my 5 night stay, I had an engineer in the room 4 days to check for hot water. by the end of my stay, I just called guest services to turn on the boilers so that I could take a luke warm shower every time. They insisted that there wasnt a widespread problem, however without fail, the shower was cold within a min or two. - To add to the hot water issue, the 'hot' tub was a mildly warm tub at best most likely carrying the heat of the sun into the evening. There was nothing Hot about it. No steam, no bubbles, just bath water. -Drink prices. $14 for a pina colada. $9 for a corona, $12 for a captain/coke all served in a tiny plastic dickie cup at the beach. If buying for 2, to achieve a slight buzz will cost you dearly. On the otherhand, they do not prohibit coolers or externally bought alcohol, wink wink. -Airport noise. I didnt think I would notice it, but when a Jet leaves, you can almost feel the rumble. From our window, you could see airplanes taxi. On the beach you could hear the jets being turned on etc. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning. Recommended activities: Ingrid and captain Dan on the Erin Go Brah sailboat was amazing. (www.egbc.net) $100/each and you get to enjoy a full day of sailing with multiple snorkle stops an excellent grilled rib/chicken, rice, salad lunch, and they provide an open bar for the day. Dollar for Dollar this is the best day trip I could have booked. Highly recommended. (Rented a car and drove 1 hr to the marina) La Perla Restraunt in the El Concha hotel. $17 cab ride from the ritz towards old sj. We exhausted the dining around the Ritz and headed to La Perla at the ritz doormans reccommendation (Carlos). it was awesome. Right on the beach in a unique shell type structure, waves crashing, great menu (displayed on an ipad). Very nice upscale restraunt. El Morro fort in Old San Juan. Its a $20 cab ride to and from, but totaly worth it. Take a morning and go check it out. Cab fares: $11 from airport. $20 to old san juan Overall, we had a great trip, but were kind of annoyed with a few things concerning the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day...a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: liz5757
Reviews.Content: This Labor Day weekend I stayed at the Ritz Carlton and was disappointed because the standards were less than I expected from this brand and other Ritz properties before. The areas that I thought disappointed were; 1) Service at the beach - it was slow both days, managers put more resources to assist but not until guests raised the issue 2) In the morning and evening glasses were left around the pool area, walkways and on elevator area tables 3) The concierge on the first two days was less than helpful, they provided little information and they seemed generally unhappy to be in the role. On the plus side I went to the spa two days and both massages were exceptional! I would go to the resort again just for that.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: kkinhouston
Reviews.Content: Last weekend we stayed at the RC in San Juan and it did not disappoint. The location in Carolina was a 5 minute ride from the airport and right on a beautiful stretch of beach. The pool area had more than ample lounge seating complete with towel service, bar and food service. We got the $209 bed and breakfast package that also included valet parking. The staff was courteous as would be expected at the RC. We were on the 10th floor where rooms had just been remodeled, the new scheme is beautiful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way”
Reviews.Author: CHRISANDDEB
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the ritz. Very center of everything and very helpful staff. Absolutely breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: ancPR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, with breathtaking views and top notch facilities. The service is truly outstanding. Get one of the newly renovated rooms in the 9th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Enrique M
Reviews.Content: It is a great property, with a perfect service and very friendly staff. I will highly recommended to any one traveling to Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to spot!”
Reviews.Author: NoBagsChecked
Reviews.Content: As a family and a couple we go here every July 4th weekend. My wife and I also went here for our "mini-moon" right after our wedding. Every time we go we are not disappointed, the staff is first class and they really do care about your comfort. From frozen strawberries and cold water by the pool to remembering your drink at the bar and bringing it to you with being asked to! The restaurants are not the best on the island but honestly why would you want to eat in the hotel when Old San Juan is only a $18.00 cab ride away! Although, the Yuca fries are addicting! I hope it stays somewhat under the radar as we have never had a problem getting a room. The hotel deserves a great deal of credit, they really do a great job.

Reviews.Title: “puerto rico-riffic”
Reviews.Author: TimboTexan
Reviews.Content: at this hotel for work function and stayed extra two days. wonderful. they welcomed me like royalty and marriot rewards member got me upgrade. all staff members look at you and greet you. the pool is amazing and they even import some white sand for their beach. although can't overly recommend the larger city of san juan, this little slice of paradise was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, ok beach”
Reviews.Author: tribecadoc
Reviews.Content: I flew down to San Juan with my boyfriend for a weekend trip to get a bit of sun and rejuvenate my tan. Unfortunately tropical storm Maria got a bit in the way, but that's just the risk you take when you head to the Caribbean in September. I've stayed at the Ritz before, so I knew what to expect. The hotel is very nice, if just a touch dated. It is located on a strip of decent beach, but the surrounding buildings are not very attractive to look at. The benefit of the hotel is that it is a hop/skip/jump from the airport, and a relatively quick taxi ride into Old San Juan. It also has a nice casino (The Bellagio it ain't, but for a Caribbean casino its one of the best). In addition, the service could not be better. All of the staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating. We are a gay couple, which wasn't an issue at all. We didn't quite stay the weekend (flew in Friday, and bolted on Sat. morning before the storm came through) but it was a fun 20+ hours! We ate at Marmalade in Old San Juan on Friday night, which I highly recommend, and we did get a few hours of sun/swimming in on Friday afternoon. If you're headed to San Juan, I doubt there is a nicer property on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “I feel safe when traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: I like staying at the Ritz in San Juan. The service is amazing, the food great, beach good and price - well high as expected. I was in a taxi one time and needed to get cash from my room and the bellman paid the taxi from his own pocket for me!! That was service that I have never before exerienced. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Hoped For...”
Reviews.Author: FoMoCo1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at numerous Ritz-Carlton properties. This one is not stellar, although it is not bad either. First off the bad points: -Carpet in room with stains and numerous cigarette burns -Mattress was terrible and completely worn out -Construction or "Enhancements" as the staff called them were going on around us for many hours each day, although we were never told about these at check-in -Overall the property had a somewhat "worn" look to it compared to the other Ritz-Carltons we have stayed at Now the Good Points: -Wondeful and friendly staff -Excellent food and drinks, even though nothing there is a bargain -Clean casino with ample slots and tables -Convenient location There is a new super duper Ritz being built down the road and our conclusion was that the property we stayed in will be sold as soon as the new one is ready. This could explain the disappointing aspects we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene could not even tkae the rita out of the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: nora1fenton2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz the day after Hurricane Irene hit Puerto rico. The island was hit hard and many locations were out of power for the whole week we were there. The Ritz was very well prepared for this type of natural disaster and as guests of this resort is was business as usaual. The staff was absolutely professional and overly concerned for our enjoyment and safety. There was nothing in the hotel that was not hooked up to there generator system and all the restaurants and amenities were open and available for normal hours. They went over board to make sure we were taken care of and had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: territraveler
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for the first 2 night of a 4 night vacation trip. We have stayed here on 4 -5 different occasions and we have never been disappointed. From the moment we checked in Jarisa made us feel at home. Carlos took our bags to our room as was a gem to talk to all the way up. The breakfast buffet was run by a sweet gentleman named Jeremy. Thanks for the great omelets Jeremy! Jarisa gave us a great room on the 10th floor that had been newly renovated and the room was immaculate! I can't complain about anything. We both had facials and they were Phenomenal. My husband will continue to go back to the Ritz in San Juan. Thanks for your hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated (for a Rtiz)”
Reviews.Author: RIYatri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for a quick getaway. We loved the property - courteous and responsive staff, great beach, good food, wonderful spa services. We visited a number of the other top properties in the area (including La Concha and El San Juan) and thought the Ritz was the classiest. Slight issues - not as lively as the other properties, but that makes it a more comfy place to relax; some noise from planes taking off at the nearby airport, but not overly intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-standard Ritz”
Reviews.Author: rogerthat
Reviews.Content: This hotel had many minor shortcomings and does not approach the quality level one expects from the Ritz chain -- no one to meet our cab at the curb to assist with luggage, a confused desk clerk who kept us waiting 10 minutes to verify the rate, room AC that didn't cool the room, very poor air quality in the room itself, a shower/bath with water that wasn't warm enough. You can do better for less money elsewhere in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: drbench400
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and room was clean and well set up. Asked for a small refridgerator which was brought up fairly quickly. Front desk staff was extremely slow and service in lobby bar was horribly slow. Doormen were friendly but often stood around and didn't get the door. Not what one expects from a Ritz Carlton. Pool staff were very attentive but of course they are working for tips. Parking was expensive ($24/day). I would try one of the other luxury hotels if I were to return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “It was Nice”
Reviews.Author: mary j
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz last year and I did not encounter any problems like I recently read. The staff was professional, the room was nice and the beach just behind the hotel was nice. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom/ tub was magnificent. I did not eat at the hotel because I was too busy venturing out and I could not afford those prices anyway. Instead I dined at the local spots nearby and in downtown Old San Juan. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel so getting around is not a problem but just be aware that the last bus back stops running around 9 pm. (Check on that time with the locals) There are cabs just outside waiting to take you wherever you want to go and the rates are reasonable. The planes from the airport did not bother me. If you want total seclusion book a remote resort. Puerto Rico is a busy place. There is a Drug Store just down the block so if needed you can get just about anything in there. There is a local bar just down the block so you can get your drink on if you don't want to drink at the hotel. There are other hotels nearby so check them out, sometimes they have activities going on including nightlife. Try to book the Ritz when rates are reasonable or far in advance so you get the best price - that way you get a better bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “A complete pleasure ~ an amazing and magical place”
Reviews.Author: DCflyboy
Reviews.Content: A two week stay in the Ritz San Juan was purely an A+ experience. Despite it being a work trip, when I was back in the hotel each night I slipped immediately into a "vacation mode" and had an amazing time. Different experiences await all around -- a couple of nights, you could go from a garden outside watching a big iguana eating flowers, to the hotel lobby area with has a beautifully spaced bar and lounge area -- on several nights there was live entertainment, and couples would be doing a salsa or other dancing and it was 100% alive and happy. Both I and others in my party remarked that when at that bar we felt more like we were at someone's home for a party, rather than a public venue. This is very rare for a hotel to accomplish. It also had the very pleasant effect that many strangers freely introduced themselves and engaged -- people from all over the world visiting for work or tourism, and many people living in Puerto Rico. A very interesting group of people every time we stopped for drink or quick bite of food at the bar. The pool is incredibly beautiful and there is excellent food available outside with water all around -- the ocean is simply on the other side of the beautiful palm trees and plants -- a matter of a few feet. A perfect setting. The room was very good, but I stayed in it so little as it was so comfortable to relax outside the room in many different hotel spaces and settings. And there is a great little casino which had new machines, table games and a well spaced format. And several other high-end hotels and casinos a very short walking distance. I cannot compliment the hotel service and staff enough. In 12 days I had over 50 interactions with staff regarding some item of need or information. Every time the staff was consistently friendly, attentive, effective and engaged. I plan to return whenever possible -- even if for a weekend to relax. This hotel should make the Ritz proud and as a customer you cannot make a better choice. PS: When I told local persons where I was staying they consistently stated that the Ritz is the best hotel on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Slow and unorganized.”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorld4
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have a Ritz Carlton sign out front but it sure does not feel like a Ritz. The service is slow and the staff are very disorganized. They first sent me to a room that was still being cleaned. No one at front desk to answer phone to fix situation. Took 20 mins of lots of talking among housekeeping to straighten out. The lobby bar has good drnk service but when ordering food it took 45 mins. No apology. The main restaurant staff generally took 15 to 20 minutes to even approach table when I was first seated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Cloud52102
Reviews.Content: We were here for a wedding in June so had many activities around the hotel and got a discount on the room. I was worried going down having read all the reviews here but we didn't have the same impression as others. I've never stayed at a Ritz before, though, so take it with a grain of salt. I thought it was very well-kept, the pool was beautiful and the layout perfect to not feel crowded by everyone. It did get busy, of course, but I was happily surprised to see it stay open 24 hours, perfect for a late night quiet dip. Service, front desk, check-in and even the on-site doctor (for a minor hiking injury) were all attentive, efficient and friendly. The rehearsal dinner and wedding night dinner were superb - but probably moreso because they were free for us. Being a member of the wedding party, our hotel was free for two nights and discounted the others - a huge cost savings. Otherwise, as expected at a Ritz, hotel and restaurant and especially drink prices were off the charts. My one tip: if you'd like to drink, head down the street to the WalGreens and load up - that's what we did and saved a bundle! Overall: Beautiful hotel, relaxing vacation, but very expensive destination that is not close to Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky Mold and Empty Promises aka Ritz on the Fritz”
Reviews.Author: salsadama
Reviews.Content: This stay at the Ritz was my last. Not only did I have to switch rooms 3 times due to mold, but I also had billing issues. This is unacceptable for any hotel. The Ritz does not live up to its reputation. First, I have to say that I am not a "high maintenance" woman. The frills are nice, but comfort, cleanliness, service, and safety come #1 for me. I have stayed in hotels ranging from $15/night to $400/night depending on my purpuse for the trip. This time, I was attending a conference at the Ritz. I arrived a couple of days before the conference started. My room had odor from day #1 that just worsened with time. It was constantly humid. By the 3rd night (the first night of the conference) my room had a horrible (and increasingly nauseous) moldy smell. I asked the other attendees about their rooms. I entered another attendee's room across the hall that had *no* odor and was not humid. I complained on a Thursday night, the gentleman took my cell phone number, and he told me that I would be contacted the next day once the manager arrived around 730/8AM. Nobody contacted me, so the next day during a break I checked again, and nothing had been done. I went to the front desk again at lunch, and I was told that they could do a "blind move". If I packed my bags, they would move them to another room for me. I packed, and the front desk immediately called. I took my bags downstairs, got a new key, dragged my bags up to the 8th floor, and walked right into (you guessed it) another stinky room. The odor was overwhelming. I called the front desk from the room 2 times, and nobody answered. I packed my bags again, and went back downstairs. When I asserted that the stench was just as bad, I was told that the hotel was booked, so "Why don't you just put your bags in the room for now." Excuse me? I told them that under no circumstances would I return to that room, not only because I'd been up and down the floors several times with my bags, but also because there was no way I'd stay in another stinky and possibly dangerously moldy room. (By now I had spoken to 4 different employees about the problem.) The front desk stored my bags for me and told me they'd call when another room was ready. No calls. After the conference let out for the day, I went to the front desk and asked again. I was told that a room was available, and I was given a key. The lady took my bag ticket and said that they would send my bags up. I went to the room and there was significantly less stench when I opened the door to room 441. The air was noteably fresher and less humid. Then I waited for 45 minutes for my bags!! I went back to the front desk and said that **I** would take my bags. Yes, you know it-- She asked me for my ticket!! I told her that SHE had taken it, I claimed my bags, and once again **I** carried all of my bags to the new room. I have to add that during the room-moving process I had several people tell me, "But this is the Caribbean. Things are damp here." I replied that I am well aware of that, which is why I tolerated the dampness of the room at first. It worsened with time, and once I found out that other rooms were fresher I had no reason to subject myself to mold. I stayed at this same hotel 2 years ago with no mold issues. I have LIVED in the Caribbean and in Central America. However, I stayed in a different hotel for an annual trip to PR in March 2011, and my room there had no moldy odor. (Needless to say, I will be returning to that hotel in March of 2012, not the Ritz!) The minor, but nevertheless annoying billing issues... During the process of this, I noted that the first room had 2 Snickers bars when I left. I had stored my own food in the mini-bar since gluten makes me very ill, and I have learned over the years that P.Rico is not a gluten-free-friendly island. The front desk should have been very aware that I was storing food in the mini-bar, because during the process of switching rooms they had to store a large bag of my food in their refrigerator. After I left the first room I told the front desk that the room had 2 candy bars. I assumed that they "replaced" a candy bar because the first candy bar was hidden behind my food. (There were several other food items I'd removed from the mini-bar to make room for my food. I'd eaten nothing; it would make me literally ill.) I was told that they would make sure that I wasn't billed. Of course, in keeping with the empty promises, I found the charge on my bill as I left at the end of my stay. I talked to someone downstairs as I checked out, and I was told again (more empty promises) that they would make sure that I wasn't billed. Today I received my final copy of the bill via email and- BINGO!- a charge for that candy bar that was NEVER EATEN appeared on my bill. Other conference attendees at the Ritz found that after a day or two their rooms also began to stink of mold. Another colleague requested a featherless room in advance and had issues with the hotel. There were other less significant issues like inconsistent water pressure/temperature in the first room, a *maid walking straight into the room WITHOUT KNOCKING... but the mold and billing were the 2 biggies for me. I spent so much time dealing with ridiculous issues at the Ritz. No guest at ANY hotel should have to spend so much time during a business trip or a vacation dealing with stinky (and likely unhealthy) rooms or being billing for services or products you don't use. I would give the service for the front desk 2/5. They were very polite, but didn't follow through on their promises. And I spoke with probably 8-10 different people at the front desk over the course of my stay... I would give the pool staff 5/5. I give this hotel 1 star because the staff members at the POOL were polite, they DID follow through, and they were very helpful. Kudos to them for saving my filtered water bottle when I left it at the pool one day, and for bringing ice for my swollen leg. Room staff were also polite but.... (See *) An additional star for the property. Even if the next conference is held at this hotel, this Ritz is permanently crossed off of my list of possible hotels for future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Stay! Great Food! A few minor issues. "”
Reviews.Author: Deven T
Reviews.Content: Loved our room & view.!!! Â We reserved an upgraded balcony Â oceanfront room. Â Large room topnotch view of ocean & pool. There are some other concerns that bothered me.Â  After reading other trip advisor reviews. I had to agree with some important points. Â I have stayed at Ritz Carlton properties in the past & feel this particular property was not completely up to par. Room was clean on the surface but details are important to me.Â  1. The furniture & carpet in lobby & our room were a little worn & dirty.Â  2. Carpets in hallways were in desperate need of vacuuming. Â  Hallways & our room looked as if it was not vaccumed in weeks Â Our room was not vacuumed the entire 4 day stay Â Room was very dusty in corners & on all lampsÂ  3.Â The signature Bvlgari bath products that Ritz Carlton usesÂ Â were saved for select guests. I discovered the products on the cleaning cart. I asked room attendant why our upgraded balcony room did not have slippers & Bvlgari products Â I was told that these were reserved for guests on specialty floors. Â We paid $450 per night for our room & was put off by this 4. Â Pool was beautiful but water was cloudy & dirty.Â  5. Entry is very Elegant but Location is not the best. The beach location in back is beautiful.Â  Good pointsÂ  The grounds are very well maintained. Landscaping & flowers are beautiful.Â  The Â Â Food & Service was Excellent! Â We ate at BLT. You have to try the popovers Â Â  IL MULINO was top-notch, romantic, Â the food was incredible and service was exceptional.Â  The Lobby bar was great, & breakfast/lunch restaurant Mare was yummy.Â

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, but "city view" rooms just ok”
Reviews.Author: TripsFromNC
Reviews.Content: Was here on a trip with a group. Overall liked the property and beach. The chairs are extremely comfortable The service staff is excellent - very attentive to requests and friendly. Was not thrilled with our room - a city view room on 8th floor at the end of the hallway. To the right from our window we looked out directly at the stairwell of the parking garage - which apparently is the smoking lounge for employees. We had to keep our curtains closed during most of our stay. They should put up a full screen there if that is were they want their employees to smoke (they did have a large ash collection container there). Had to ask the restaurant "where's my change" when I gave them a $100 bill for $60 check (in the Italian restaurant). They seemed offended that I was't leaving them a $40 tip! Drinks are expensive - but this is the Ritz. Can buy your own a few doors down the street (they even sell liquor at Walgreens). My wife loved the Spa! However, If we return to Puerto Rico and San Jaun - we will likely stay elsewhere for better value and location (close to airport - but fairly long cab ride to Old San Jaun)

Reviews.Title: “Needs refreshing”
Reviews.Author: GaCare
Reviews.Content: Was a bit disappointed with this Ritz. Not a huge fan of the ritz Carlton chain - but this one definitely needs to have some money put into it to refresh everything. The carpet in the rooms are very old and stained. The entire hotel has a musty smell to it and in places, such as the entrance, they have tried to cover the smell with a very strong odor that just makes it worse. The food that i had was horrible in all of the restaurants. But on a positive note the staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraDNorthport_NY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation at the Ritz. We requested connected rooms, which we received. We stayed in the basic rooms, without much of a view, but since we needed two rooms, we decided to save money in that area. The rooms were nicely maintained, and we were provided with water, shampoos, etc. daily. There was evening turndown service, and housekeeping was available for extra towels if you chose not to have the evening service. We arrived very early in the morning, and although our rooms were not ready yet, the front desk made arrangements for my family of six to have a room for a few hours to rest until our room was ready. They even brought in a rollaway bed so that we could take a nap. We appreciated that level of service, and feel that that is why the Ritz is worth it. One of our rooms was not available on-time and management offered us a credit on our account for our inconvenience.
