Although we were pleased with the service that we received, there seemed to be a lot of people complaining about their rooms not being ready, or not receiving the room that they requested. That did not seem like what we have observed in other Ritz hotels. Management definitely tried to provide excellent service, but it seemed that there were some unhappy folks at the check-in area. The food was good, but yes, costly. We enjoyed the food and the service at BLT, more than at Mulino. The poolside services were very efficient and friendly. Breakfast was good at Mares restaurant. There is a daily resort fee that was different in both of our rooms. It is supposed to cover pool fees and bell captains, I believe, but I am not sure. I would prefer to just pay one price for a hotel room, without odd additional fees. We would stay at the Ritz again if we were to visit San Juan. The management definitely tried to provide that extra bit of customer service. I appreciate the friendly staff at the resort, which would bring us back. I neglected to mention that somewhere along the way I must have mentioned that we were celebrating our 26th wedding anniversary, and one evening we received a picture frame and a lovely card. That was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great...”
Reviews.Author: njbchluvr3
Reviews.Content: This is an older Ritz property and it's beginning to show it's age. The rooms (i.e. carpets) are in definate need of refurbishment. However, the staff were friendly and the concierge helpful. We stayed with our kids during the busy school break and the hotel was packed! You need to get to the pool very early for a good spot. The food at the poolside restaurant was not very good at all! Dinner at BLT Steak was much better. The concierge has some excellent restaurant recommendations and it's worth venturing off property. I did like the fact that there was a security on duty at the back gate by the beach at all times. We felt very safe letting our teens "hang out" with friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Nazila1219
Reviews.Content: The hotel was super clean and staffs were nice and friendly! The only issue we had was when we checked in around 3 pm, the room was not ready and we had to wait for about 2 hrs to get our room. However, the hotel offered $100 hotel credit which was nice. We loved the breakfast buffet at Mares. Breakfast was good with many options and our server, Jose, was super friendly and very attentive. Other restaurants in the hotels were expensive but it's Ritz, that should be expected... Overall we had a awesome experience and we will go back again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Service unmatched!”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: From checkin to checkout, I was quite impressed with the staff. Carlos the doorman provided exceptional service by paying our taxi driver out of his own pocket while my friend went upstairs to get money. I was shocked! The other notable memory is that the casino was not smoky in the least bit and appeared clean. The beach is nice and beach attendants are super attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but in need of a few facelifts”
Reviews.Author: Carlincool
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days. The staff was exceptional. Very friendly and outgoing. The only problem I had was getting drinks in the casino. They staff they had in there was great but nowhere near enough. On Friday and Saturday nights they would only come around about every 45 minutes to one hour. Then it would take another 15 minutes to get your drink. Overall they pamper you with great service. The pool needs some repairs in certain areas. It was one of the few places in PR that was tourist friendly and had good service. The staff on the beach was fabulous. They set up your chairs and wrapped them with towels. All of the staff always greeted us with a hello and a smile. Housekeeping was exceptional. We had 4 people in a suite and many days it was left a mess. When we came back in the afternoon it was spotless. Hats off to the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MBDude
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to San Juan on Cheapcarribean.com and arrived at this magnificent hotel with high expectations. We were not disappointed. Upon check in we were upgraded to a junior suite with an amazing veiw of the pool area. We forgot to pack a few items and the staff provided us with everything we needed. Really impressive customer service. Two gripes...Slight odor in room...Could be because it is such a humid climate. Another was the price of food and drinks, but to be expected at such a high end resort.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't lift a finger!”
Reviews.Author: fpfarric
Reviews.Content: There were a few hiccups when I arrived at the hotel, which is the main reason I did not rate the hotel 5 stars. I called the morning of my arrival and told the front desk that I would be arriving a little early and I would like early check-in. I arrived at 1pm. The check-in lady was quite unaccommodating and told me that my room was not ready and would not be ready for several hours. She handed me a plastic bag and told me to step aside next to the check-in counter, open my bag on the floor, and gather what I would need for the next few hours until they called me on my phone to tell me my room was ready. The man in line in front of me was given a room right away and acted surprised since he was there early and hadn't arranged anything. I walked away and sat in the lobby for a few minutes before calling for the manager. I had been traveling 30+ hours from around the world and the main reason I chose to stay at The Ritz for this trip was because of their impeccable level of service. $400/nt in my mind does not equate to being told to unpack my belongings on the floor and wait for several hours doing nothing... After I got the manager involved, the situation was immediately resolved and the rest of our stay was flawless. The pool is beautiful, the beach is clean and has nice chairs and umbrellas they set up wherever you desire, and the hotel property was well-appointed. All of the food we ordered at the hotel (beach restaurant, room service, breakfast buffet) was delicious (although quite expensive--$25 for a salad with grilled shrimp). The spa was nice and relaxing. My sister and I each had prenatal massages and they were wonderful. The spa staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice, although I honestly expected it to be more luxurious. I have stayed at 5 star hotels all over the world and the rooms here were small and simple compared to other hotel brands. The hotel was located about a 5 minute drive from the airport and costs $12.50 in a taxi to get to ($10 base rate to go anywhere, $1.50 tax, and $1 bag fee). Old town San Juan, the cute walking/shopping area where the cruise ships pull in, is a $20 cab ride away. There were a few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, but the neighborhood is not nice at all. Overall, I would recommend this hotel mainly for the very high level of service they provide their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice.”
Reviews.Author: DellaW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding, the staff was exceptionally helpful and engaging. The pool is lovely (open round the clock), the food is lovely (wonderful big Sunday brunch) and the housekeeping staff were top notch (we went on a muddy hike in the jungle and left out shoes in a bag in the bathroom and the housekeepers cleaned them up without asking). The fitness center and spa were great as well. Complimentary yoga classes (and other classes) for guests! However, what they don't tell you is that they "hold" a large portion of money from your credit card every day you stay there. This is assuming you rack up a huge bill buying drinks. This was not mentioned to us in the bill or when we made our reservations (it would have been very nice to know that an additional large chunk of cash would be held on our card or we couldn't check in). Not the end of the world, but it definitely made the check in process much more stressful than we wanted (had they told us before it wouldn't have been an issue). Also, the beds are absolutely not Ritz material. The mattresses were as stiff as a board. Which is sad because the Ritz normally has lovely beds. But besides the beds, the bill and the jacked up prices (it's the Ritz we knew a $16 pinacolda was going to be on the menu, thank goodness it packed a punch) everything else was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tabinin
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal of four nights for the price of three and took it. The quality of the hotel was great, similar to other Ritz Carlton where I have stayed before, so no surprises here. The pool was really nice for the kids, the service was quick and polite. The concierge provided interesting options for dining, and ideas for recreation. Overall very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “wow! fabulous beach and service.”
Reviews.Author: pudge2028
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz a few days before taking a cruise and should have stayed at the Ritz instead of going on the cruise! The beach is small but beautiful and perfect for relaxing. The service was perfect and the entire property is just lovely. The food is great but pricy so be prepared. A lovely resort to relax and reconnect. We will be going back to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princessinbk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ritz carlton for an extended weekend. The hotel is very nice but it is not what you would expect from the ritz carlton. The hotel would be in the bucket as a "Westin Hotel" which are also nice. Room The rooms are a perfect size for 2 people. They are well kept and modern. The rooms are cleaned every day with turn down service nightly. The hotel is very close to the airport so you can see the planes coming in however you can't hear them from your room. Hotel The pool and beach is very nice and well kept. The staff was nice but not friendly. I found that they had the attitude of I'm being nice because you asked a question so I'm answering you. I suggest that you try the neighboring restaurants as the food at the hotel is average but very pricey. The mini bar snacks were also pricey. If you walk out of the hotel main entrance and make a right there is a strip of other hotels and restaurants. There isn't much going on at the hotel. We rented a car and found it fairly easy to get around using navigation. We went to old san juan which has a lot of restaurants and shopping. Driving to old san juan was fairly easy but once you arrive there is a bit of traffic. The fort in old san juan has a beautiful view. We went to the rain forrest and hike up the mountain. It was definitely an experience. if you are in good shape you should try it. We met a lot of people hiking. We also went to the bacardi factory which had a good tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service at hotel in need of sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: 1goirish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in mid-July and found the customer service to be excellent and actually above what one expects even at a Ritz Carlton. Check-in was efficient and friendly. I stayed on the club level and the staff for the lounge was great. The offerings in the lounge were ok, but seemed below average for this class of hotel. I couldn't figure out how to set my clock alarm so i called for assistance. The gentlemen sent to help me could not figure it out either. I actually found that amusing. They replaced the clock. The elevator cabs are in rough shape, but it is a beach hotel. Also, the matresses seemed in need of replacement. Still, I cannot say enough about the people working at this place. Their professionalism and hospitality allowed me to forget the minor issues I had with the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the most comfortable choice unless going to St.Regis.”
Reviews.Author: Buttaman
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews that not up to typical Ritz but I believe another hotel that was redesigned to be a Ritz Carlton property. Same nice finishes but clearly not built as a Ritz. Food sky high and drinks $12-$14.00 you expect resort prices but geez! I will say food is very good but not good value. There are lots of excellent restaurants in San Juan and this place charges because they can, not because it's that good. Service is okay but better than typical Carribean. I find that most reviewers here are unfamiliar with the pace of the Carribean and ones expectations shouldn't be compared to service in the US or Great Britain. Have to say I didn't want to take a chance on other chains and ultimately very comfortable. I believe that the prices charged to other guests varied widely. Didn't look like your typical Ritz clientele. Lobby lounge entertainment sucks! Airport Holiday Inn your last gig? Not one but two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible wait time for checking-in”
Reviews.Author: ramguna
Reviews.Content: Check-in was supposed to be at 4PM but it took forever. I had a 6month old infant and the wait was unacceptable. By now they should be able to figure out the daily demand and accomodate to it. Make sure that rooms are turned around at a decent rate. There is no reason why we should have been waiting around with a crying baby in hand. This is a clear sign of bad management. The hotel was great except for the experience at check-in

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT FROM A HOTEL SNOB”
Reviews.Author: Pattyj12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 6 nights from July 12 - 18. I consider myself a hotel snob so I analyze everything. CONS: Could be on a better beach considering all of the beautiful beaches throughout the island. Very expensive restaraunts. DO NOT EAT AT THE ITALIAN RESTARAUNT INSIDE THE HOTEL. fOOD TERRIBLE AND WAIT STAFF VERY INTIMIDATING AND RUDE. Hotel could be updated. New paint, repairs. etc. Thats really it on the cons and belive me all the bad reviews are totally false. PROS: Excellent service 5 stars. Very close to city and many restaraunts within walking distance. (Metropol) across street.WOW!!! very safe area. 2 blocks down is Best Tour Connection for any kind of rental you need at great prices. Tell Sheila the guys from the Ritz sent you."inside joke". Anyways rent a scooter and head to Pinones for an amazing experience only 10 minutes from hotel Rooms fine with very cold A.C. and beds were great! I must agree that rooms are a tad musky but after you turn on the air it goes away. I read just about every review in here and cant belive the negativity. I think people do this to keep it a hidden treasure. fine with me. Make sure to go over to The old San Juan Hotel to check out the lobby on the weekend. Everyone is dancing even the elderly with walking sticks. Cant wait to go back and Thank You Ritz for your service and to Sheila at the scooter rental place for your friendliness and passion for your beautiful country. Please do not believe other reviews. Mine will sum it up for you. Also I am a real person from Florida and not writing a fake review as I thought I was reading before I went. The negative ones are fake , They have to be!!!!!!!!! T hanks P.S Yes many locals do use this beach as it has public access but what would Puerto Rico be without seeing the locals. If you want to see a bunch of sunburnt people with dark socks and sandals on just go to Disney World..LOL

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and have to go back w/the kids to let them enjoy it too”
Reviews.Author: jedijolo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort. A friend hooked us up with it and it was great. They were very accomodating, pleasant/polite and treated us great. Room was wonderful. Staff serviced it well. The resort grounds were beautiful w/a huge, huge pool, hot tub, access to the beach w/full service out there. There's also a nice spa, great workout rooms and 2 very high end restaurants. We ate at both and were really happy w/each. Breakfast buffet was nice but high priced and the pool/beach bar food was good. We will def be back!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Time!”
Reviews.Author: chasu
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was worried but once we got there all was well. I kept in mind that it was on a island so I was very pleased with the rooms and the service, the casino was fun and the food was great. You must go to see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay here made the trip worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Toni085
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had an issue with a tour that we signed up for through the hotel but they were quick to solve the problem. The food at all the restaurants was great, especially at the Blt Steakhouse. We looked forward to breakfast every morning. The pool was great and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Jbardy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a really good stay. Other than that I had to wait about 2 hours for my rooms. But it was good overall.

Reviews.Title: “Out of all hotels I've stayed in, this one has to be the best!”
Reviews.Author: danielacast
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my family vacation in Puerto Rico. The Ritz Carlton is amazing! It has entertainment for the kids and it has a casino for the adults.This hotel is suitable for all ages and every occasion. Whether its a business trip, family vacation or romantic getaway; you will leave satisfied. The service is outstanding, everything you ask for is delivered quickly and it's exactly what you asked for. They are constantly making sure you're okay and go above and beyond. The hotel is beautiful and is located on the beach. I would highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMEAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 day trip and loved the hotel. Despite bad reviews on this site, we found service to be top notch, our room to be excellent with all that you would expect from the Ritz, the beach and pool were great. Food in restaurants was excellent and timely delieved. Worth a visit. Ignore negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Royal experience”
Reviews.Author: Malva12
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Ritz Carlton ,SanJuan Puerto Rico. The food was good, the beach was excellent nice and clean. The service was espectacular. It was like been in heaven. Everything is close by (restaurtants, bars, malls, El Condado and El viejo SanJuan). If you never been in Puerto Rico you have to plan a trip there you will fall in love with the Island and their habitants. Gorgeous place!

Reviews.Title: “Received more than expected! Awesome 4 nights stay prior to cruise.”
Reviews.Author: MYTBAD
Reviews.Content: My online research showed this to be the only 5 STAR (capitals on purpose!) in Puerto Rico, I began my quest for the best rate possible and after almost giving up luckily found a reasonable deal on website VacationstoGo.com. I am so happy to have not been swayed by the "not so great" reviews. Since Jet Blue had bumped my neice to a flight 4 hrs. later (their review comes next!), I took a taxi for $12 from airport and was greeted warmly by all. Check-in was quick around 3 pm with everything prepaid as promised by agent. Room #242 ( I think) was beautiful, clean, well stocked with towels, coffee & maker, tea, hair dryer, ironing board, iron, in room safe, honor bar (even had Gummy Bears!) soft robes and toiletries. Bed felt worn out, awakened with backache, politely called guest services, went to pool, upon return noticed bed had been replaced! Received call day later to inquire if bed was satisfactory! That's what sets the Ritz apart from the rest! At poolside, as I went to dust sand off the chair cushion, attendent appeared immediately and said "let me do that"! The spa was wonderful too. The Italian Dining next to Casino was excellent! Off site, Denny's is in walking distance to the right about 2 blocks, busy busy, but great food and service too. I took better pictures than I have seen posted of Ritz and will try to add at later date. After cruise, stayed at resort in Rio Grande, however if I return to Puerto Rico, I will only stay at the Ritz in Carolina! And a special note to the Ritz "thanks for making our stay so comfortable".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DrChipset
Reviews.Content: This hotel was spectacular with the rooms, location, and amenities that it has. The view out from the beach onto the ocean is breathtaking, and the staff there can help you out with anything you need. The restaurants at the hotel were pricey, but the food was really good and not overpriced. We even stopped in the spa and had a couples massage, which my wife still raves about. The oceanfront room was great and the beds were real comfortable. Overall you will truly enjoy your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: jvelis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the service is excellent. Great attention to details and very well decorated. Staff is well trained and have a process for everything that they have to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beds smell musty!”
Reviews.Author: cokesjr24
Reviews.Content: While the service around the hotel is fantastic, and the pool is gorgeous, the bedrooms smell terrible! We even switched rooms, but we couldn't avoid the musty smell! While it didn't ruin our whole trip, it was hard to sleep with the smelly beds.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, but check your bill!!! Hard to believe Ritz Carlton would scam a guest."”
Reviews.Author: Radis1711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan for two nights in May for a business meeting. Hotel was great, as was the food and amenities. However, I was charged for two minor items that were completely bogus -- a "Bellman Gratuity" and an "Honor Bar Food" expense. Neither of those happened. I'm shocked that a hotel of this quality would be so picayune as to do this to one of it's guests. I know it's trivial, but I will think of this chain differently from now on....

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service, 4 Star Hotel, But Way Too Many Families for a Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jandbj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night/4 day stay at the Ritz San Juan. It was our first Adults-Only vacation since our daughter was born 18 months ago. The resort came highly recommended, and we have stayed at many Ritz Carlton's around the world, so we had an idea as to what was in store. Let me first start out by saying that we had an amazing time. It was so great to be at a hotel, away from the madness of our every day lives, BUT it wasn't exactly the escape we were hoping it would be. OVERALL Pros: - Very close to the airport. You do hear planes (only at the pool/beach) but it was like 4-5 times a day. Not disruptive at all. - Service was amazing. As at all Ritz Carlton's the service is top notch. Everyone remembers your name, your drink orders...and waits on you hand and foot. They will set up chairs by the pool and on the beach for you too, which is a nice touch. - Food was delicious. We ate at BLT Steak one night, and ordered room service another night (ate at Pikayo at another hotel one night - highly recommend it). Every morning we ate at the breakfast buffet - great variety Cons (and these aren't terrible things!): - It is an older Ritz. There were some spots on the wall paper in our room (didn't bother me at all). Some tiles were missing in the pool. The rafts they offer in the pool are pretty old and worn. - The TVs in the room are older - The rooms are a little small, but nothing like a city hotel room usually is! You don't spend much time in the room anyhoo - Everything is VERY expensive. From $18 hamburgers, to $14 glasses of wine...the food and drink was expensive, but we knew that going in. Since the hotel isn't near anything else, you have to pay the prices at the hotel for food if you aren't willing to take a cab somewhere. POOL AREA (we spent the majority fo our time here so I wanted to review separately): - We decided to do it up and rent a cabana by the pool for two of the days. It cost $250 for the cabana, included in that are 4 bottles of Fuji water, chips and salsa, and a dedicated waiter (who was there as soon as you needed him). If you have the option to do this, and the price isn't a big deal, DO IT. It is worth every penny. While they aren't exactly private, they are away from the crowds, and you have your own nice big double chaises, and tables and then two chaises outside the tented area. - If you want a seat at the pool, you need to get there early. We are very early risers, so we were saving seats at the pool by 7 AM (on the days we didn't get a cabana), and then going to eat breakfast. I highly recommend getting there early as it fills up quickly! And it is nice to get seats away from the big sections. The pool is the most enjoyable from 7-10 AM, and then it is chaos. - There are many families that stay at this hotel (who brings their kids to the Ritz??). Be prepared to have kids screaming and jumping and splashing. I didn't realize it was so family friendly when we booked it, as we were looking for a getaway from our kid, and couldn't stop thinking about her with all the kids running around. - If you do go with kids, they offer you a pack n play to use by the pool, which is awesome My Major Gripes: - They need to do a better job of policing the entrance to the pool from the beach. On the weekend there are a lot of local kids and families that come in to use the pool, which is not allowed. It says that you need to show a room key, but they weren't asking for them, so random people were coming in to use the pool. This was driving me crazy. There was a group of teenagers (obviously local kids) who tried to sit in the cabana next to us, and were splashing around and talking so loudly in the pool in front of us. Finally security got them out, but then they were smoking by the pool (it is a non-smoking resort) - I was not happy. - The cabanas need to be more private. The people next to us one day got a iPod dock and were blasting their Jersey Shore club music and I wanted to throw something at them. It had been such a lovely quiet day until they started playing their music so that everyone could hear. Not cool. Or just don't offer iPod docks!! Overall it was a great experience, but I wouldn't recommend it if you are trying to do a romantic weekend away. Next time we would definitely bring our daughter, but I don't know that we would want to spend a larger small fortune than we just did!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this moldy dump”
Reviews.Author: cjmumms
Reviews.Content: although they include "spa" in their name, they charge, in addition to $240 plus tax for the room, a "spa" fee of $25/night. i resent the duplicity of this. if it were included in the room rate, i wouldn't complain, but where's the logic? the hotel is near nothing but the airport and the planes can be heard in the rooms, and are LOUD when one is outside. our room was infested with mold. the phone system is antiquated and periodically didn't work. the door lock stopped operating, and i was kept waiting 1 1/2 hours to get into our room. for a relatively new hotel, the rooms are small. the toilet was in a separate "room" although it didn't provide privacy or access when the bath area were in use. but that's not the weirdest. it was impossible to close the door of the toilet [it gives a new meaning to water closet] space, without squeezing between the bowl and the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 3 nights for a quick getaway. I have been to Puerto Rico many times but this was my boyfriends first visit to island. Room: We arrived around 2:00 pm or so and our room wasn't quit ready and they asked us to come back. They held our bags and told us that they would have them in our room when we came back. After eating a late lunch at the Metropol Restaurant, which is across they street (awesome place), we came back and went to our room. Now they did put our luggage in another room but it was no problem bringing them down to the room. The poolside room was great. Now there are rooms at this hotel that have balconies but that wasn't a big deal to us but something to consider if you like the fresh air and hearing the ocean. The bed in room was very comfortable. There was a radio/alarm with an iPod dock in the room which I really enjoyed. I also really enjoyed the shower! It had a ton of water pressure with the massage type shower heads with several settings. Very nice. I also really liked the fact that they had a really nice iron. Sometimes in hotels they have very cheap irons that ruin your clothes. Overall, I would give the poolside view room on the 5th floor two thumbs up. Food & Drink: We did have the breakfast package included in our stay at the Ritz. The breakfast buffet was great for a standard buffet. There was an omelet station, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, a variety of breads/bagels, cereal, fruit and orange and guava juice. Now if you don't have the breakfast package included, this buffet is $27 and totally overpriced. You would be better off eating breakfast down the street at Mi Casita's... We did get a chance to eat the grill by the pool/beach. It was your standard burger and fries. The drinks at this hotel are ridiculously priced. Two bloody mary's are $34 and change... You would be better off going to Walgreen's next door and buying bloody mary mix and vodka and making them yourself and taking them to the beach! We spent a small fortune on the alcoholic beverages! Tip: Metropol is an authentic Puerto Rican restuarant. Awesome food. We also ate at Mi Casita's and this by far was the best meal I had during my entire stay! The chicken mufongo was unbelievable! Plato's was another great restaurant in walking distance that was fabulous. My boyfriend had the whole snapper and he really enjoyed it! In old San Juan, I would recommend a restaurant called Mojitos... it is authentic and so flavorful! Facilities: The pool was a tad bit small but I really enjoy the ocean so we spent most of our time there! There are beach chairs and towels at both places so you can enjoy either or. I will say that the ocean in this area (Ritz) doesn't seem as nice as by the ESJ Towers just west of the Ritz.. . There is an awesome tennis court at this hotel so bring your racket if you like to play. The workout room had a ton of stationary bikes but no treadmills or other cardio machines.... I guess be prepared to just jog on the beach to get your cardio workout in! We discover the hot tub the last day we were there! Take a dip in the evenings... it will warm you up and the jets will give you a nice massage. We went into the casino one night and I play at the craps table and won close to $400... so that was awesome, especially if you enjoy craps. There is only one table and the minimum bets that I saw was anywhere between $2 - $5 so it was quite affordable to play and have some fun. Service: Overall, I thought the service was fine. It is Puerto Rico though and the islands. The staff was very friendly and accommodating but sometimes it was hard to find the staff and the service is sometimes slow... but again, people from the island run on a different pace so be patient and tolerant! The only thing I found to be annoying is that the maid service knocked on the door a ton when we were in our room (checking on the minibar, asking if we need anything, etc). Put up your privacy tag if you don't want to be bothered. We just forgot to do this sometimes. Entertainment: We took the Castillo snorkeling tour. It was fantastic. It's an all day excursion to Fajardo and you take a catamaran to an island and hang out on the beach and snorkel. They also dock the boat just off shore to do some additional swimming/snorkel in deeper coral reefs. It was an awesome time. I highly recommend this tour! We also took a quick cab ride to Old San Juan. We had an awesome dinner at a salsa dinner/club called Latin Root. Then we went on the boat ride around the pier... it was the "party boat" where you could enjoy the scenery, dance and drink! It was great times. I also would recommend this as well! Overall, we were happy with out stay at the Ritz Carlton. It isn't the same as the Ritz in like a New York City or Chicago so people should not have those type of expectations. I have stayed in many hotels on Isla Verde and it is one of the nicest hotels there. I would go back again and I definitely would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Third week in February is wrong week.”
Reviews.Author: texasyaya
Reviews.Content: Hotel was dingy and dirty. Badly needs to be updated. Our room was classed as an executive suite but it was just a bed and a chair and was oversized. The cable was awful. Could not get anything even CNN. Italian restaurant in Hotel was the best of the trip. We ate there 4 nights out of seven. The pool is beautiful and large. Presidents Day week was a week of kids and more kids but we were able to find areas that were a little secluded and quite. Casino is lots of fun and sorta loose. That was a unexpected pleasure. We golfed at the St Regis about 40 minutes away and that course was one of the prettiest we have ever played. We went two days. Well worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Get the club level, and you only get what you ask for pool os so-so”
Reviews.Author: mullarkey1
Reviews.Content: Well it says its a RITZ, but I would say, not really, the casino is small, service is also ho-hum, the pool is nice, and close to the beach, but the hotel is right next to airport!

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay”
Reviews.Author: mille125
Reviews.Content: I must see that I am rather surprised at the negative reviews. This is our first time staying here but we have eaten here several times. We travelled with another couple and stayed in a king club room. The club presentations were very good as usual for the Ritz. The service was actually above average. We were transferred to the Club Lounge for a private check in. We had a tour that we had arranged that was due to get us about one hour after check in. The ritz staff (without asking) arranged several bags with water, several apples, and bug spray along with towels. These were given to us as we left the front door. We were greeted by name by many staff members. My wife was welcomed with a cold towel and water as she returned from a morning run. We were promptly set up with chair and an umbrella at the beach. The room was great as well. You do not get this level of service from any of the other hotels in the area. Perhaps my experience was different because we were in the club level. Anyway, I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the mark, though not awful”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveler429
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to a Ritz-Carlton. We usually stay at Four Seasons, Fairmonts, or Grand Hyatts. From the reviews I've read, I guess I shouldn't judge the chain by this hotel. It wasn't terrible or anything, but most definitely was disappointing. I wonder how much I should blame on the weather, which was NONSTOP RAIN almost the entire time I was there, and how much I should blame on the surrounding neighborhood. It was depressing, like a run-down strip-mall clad street near Hollywood Boulevard. Unlike the other reviewers, I wasn't put off by the airport; I didn't hear the planes at all. But the room did smell a bit "funny"...kind of like this cloying, nasty smell that wouldn't stop. The casino was a bit depressing, but then again, I'm not a gambler. Whirring and buzzing and neon lights 24/7...not relaxing and not for me. The beach was kind of dirty...not the kind of sand I'm used to seeing in the Caribbean; this was greyish/brownish, not even golden. Some employees were super friendly and great, particularly at the poolside bar, the casino, the lobby bar, and the restaurant for breakfast. Great steak at BLT as well. Others seemed irritated to deal with you. The tour desk was pretty much worthless. They didn't set up a thing for you, merely giving you numbers, unless it was one of "their" tours. When I asked to be set up on one of their tours, they never made the reservation and then when I asked to be put on the next day's tour (bioluminescent bay) they said there would be no tour. Also, the horseback ride they set us up on ended up being two hours earlier than they told us, so we had to cancel since we were asleep in our bed when they had the concierge call! They DID NOT believe us when we said we received the wrong information. The worst situation with the tour desk has to be the diving situation. They referred us to a dive boat which promised me a deep dive from Humacao (which is farther from the hotel than Fajardo, where they take the beginner divers). Imagine our surprise the next day when, after driving all the way to Humacao marina from the resort, I realized once we got on the boat that we were heading BACKWARDS towards Fajardo (where the weather was WORSE, it was sunny in Humacao). The divemaster avoided telling us where we were and how deep the dive was (the promotional material for the dive company emphasizes that Humacao is a deeper dive with better visibility). After a long boat ride and then an awful dive with fifteen feet visibility at twenty feet most of the time, I realized that they'd taken us back to Fajardo! I was right. So basically, we were lied to about the dive, driven a half an hour out of our way only to take a longer boat ride, then driven back out of our way. Also, the Humacao trip would have had us back to the harbor at around noon and (because we went to Fajardo to "dive", then all the way back to Humacao marina for a long trip back to the hotel) we didn't get back until after three pm and we had to miss our next activity. Of course, the trip desk couldn't do anything about this, as it wasn't one of "their" tours. The surf company they recommended was absolutely disrespectful in every way. I waited over a half an hour for the instructor, only to have a girl who didn't speak English come back and say they were going to be late. When I asked "how late", she didn't understand what I was saying. Turns out, she was learning to be an instructor and would be sitting in on my lesson. This meant they spoke Spanish to each other the whole time, ignoring me completely. Now, I know a bit of Spanish, although it is mostly derived from a few friends here in CA who are Mexican-American, and from what I understand, the Puerto Rican dialect is different. But I could still at least understand that they were saying some rather snotty things about tourists, and when I called them on it, they insisted that it wasn't true and said that they were talking about some party they had been to (Turistos and Gringos, sorry, but that's not about any kind of party). They were incredibly unprofessional; when the girl who was taking the lesson with me fell and hurt herself, they laughed. Again, this isn't the resort's fault, but the tour desk/concierge people merely shrugged and said "not my problem." Finally, the room, while nice, had NO lanai or porch and NO windows that opened. Coupled with the clouds, it created a depressing and airless atmosphere. The pool was very nice. It was a great temperature, and I liked the lion fountains. Too bad it was pouring rain most of the time! It was a pretty disappointing trip and while I was underwhelmed by the Ritz Carlton San Juan, I was also disappointed by other factors. Still, if you're looking for a five star hotel, this is not it. More like four, maybe? I also visited the neighboring hotels for comparisons and I found the El San Juan to look like a dark, funereal, 1980s era New Jersey mall and the Intercontinental to be charmless. So if you are staying near the airport, I would gather the Ritz would be your best bet. As for me, I am not heading back to Puerto Rico any time soon. From what I understand, the best diving is in the South and West, and yet there are no luxury hotels there, and I did not like the San Juan environs at all. It did not feel like a tropical getaway in the least. If I wanted to see high rises and strip-malls everywhere, I wouldn't have moved from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mingus123
Reviews.Content: Being frequent business and leisure traveller, we usually opt for Ritz Carlton for its attention to detail and their customer service. This was a diappointment. Front desk staff was overwhelmed and ineffective upon check in and during our stay. The concierge desk was even more disappointing in their lack of knowledge and inattenntiveness to us being there. (she was once on her cell phone for 10 minutes before ackowledging us) The room that was given had a big crack in the window and the beds were lumpy and in need of upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “how is this a 5-star hotel???????”
Reviews.Author: winey1
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here over this past weekend and I really don't have much good to say about it. I probably have a bit of a skewed view as I stayed at the St. Regis for 2 nights prior to checking in here...NIGHT AND DAY DIFFERENCE! First of all, the location???!! Directly in the flight path of the airport. I've stayed at nicer airport Sheratons. The hotel just looks tired and in desperate need of sprucing up. Also, if you want to relax, you certainly won't be able to here! It's over-crowded with families and a bit of a questionable crowd at that. I felt like I was in a cheesy all-inclusive in Jamaica or something. The food around the pool was not only below average but the prices were insane!! More than the St. Regis and it was like comparing Applebees to Le Bernardin. We had a niciose salad for $23 which consisted of brown wilted lettuce, tasteless low-grade tuna and what tasted like ranch dressing from a bottle. THEN they want to nickel and dime you by charging a $3 split fee......TACKY!! We did have dinner at BLT one night and I have nothing but great things to say about that.BLT's are ALWAYS good. This is a 3-star hotel at best and I think you could probably find a better one...would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you want great service come to Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: PandDLawton
Reviews.Content: I m in the plane returning from a great vacation at the Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico. My husband and I are celebrating our 14th anniversary . Right after I made the reservation I started to look at different sites where they have reviews and I was worried about my decision,when I made my reservations I went for the name and reputation of Ritz Carlton, I called my travel agent and he gave me different options,but after some thought I stayed with my initial decision but still worried . I called the Hotel and spoke with Carmen,she heard my concerns ...I was reading the reviews at Trip Advisor... And addressed each one with much care, I wanted this trip to be perfect,my husband and I have been working so much,we most certainly needed this vacation. Now here writing this review I have to wonder where those people went . From our arrival to the last minute we were there we had nothing but an amazing experience. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Daniella she checked us in and made sure we had a great room. Also during our stay she helped us with info on places to go,what an amazing smile she had. Next morning we got up and went to the pool to secure some chairs...the trip advisor said it was not enough chairs and the service at the pool and beach were awful ...we were wowed when we were asking for towels and Pablo went and set up our chairs tucking our towels in the chairs and Â making sure we had everything we needed. When we went to breakfast we were greeted and escorted to our table and we met Ricardo great service and personality ,Ricardo was our server for a couple of days, then we had Javier and Carolina Â they were great and always made sure even if we were not in their sectionÂ to say good morning and ask if we were having fun. The most impressive one was Jeremy WOW if we can only bottle up his positiveness , personality, customer service , attitude ...this would definitely be a better world, I work for a large company and I manage people,WOW I wish I had Â a Jeremy on Â my team.we also had many experiences Â at the Spa, what a great place,Dawn has Â hands from heaven & Â Daniel the personal trainer ,what a delightful person. I just want to say thank you for the flowers in my room,the chocolate Â strawberries, Â and for making my wedding anniversary so special, I would definitely recommend the Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico, and I learned my lesson ...sometimes you have to form your own opinion :)Â

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekeend”
Reviews.Author: FashionTravelNYC
Reviews.Content: For a quick getaway, PR and the Ritz is perfect. 5 minutes from the airport, if you carry on you can be Beach side within a hour of landing...Cannot beat that! All the NYC comforts of NYC with BLT Steak and Il Mulino in house. Though we ate at local spots within old San Juan for most dinners & Pigyo (Spelling? Food was fantastic) HOTEL/ROOMS: Its a RITZ, in the traditional sense of it. I had a Club room (club lounge asscess I think is key) that was an upgraded size, 600+ Sq. Ft. Very nice, but very traditional Furnishings. Could be updated in the near future. Comfortable beds, and separate tub.shower (which most rooms do not have) We also had 2 windows that allowed a ton of natural light in. Most rooms only have 1. Granted an early check in at 10:30 am and Late check out at 4 pm. And when we requested a Later one, We got a different room from 4-6 (since we had a late flight we wanted to stay on property and eat at BLT prior) FOOD: BLT was fabulous! the hotel manager even sent over a complimentary glass of champagne. The Pool and Mare I feel could use menu variety. Too many fried foods and no fresh seafood options. We ate Breakfast at Mare, which was very nice & included (great omelet station, with the friendliest staff) But for lunch we would opt to go to the club lounge for a simple salad and sandwich instead of eating the Pool/Beach fare. STAFF: This is what really makes this property great. Everyone is so nice and wants to help you have a fantastic vacation. Service is so important to me! So even tough the food is not the best in the world, and the hotel could use a bit of an update, the staff makes up for it in so many ways. And the convenience of its location. We would go back :) Not for a long trip, but Ideal long weekend destination for me. And Ritz are always a staple in my hotel selections :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service... so so rooms”
Reviews.Author: ndennifer
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked for a room with balcony. I agree with the reviews about the smell. Somehow I think the rooms with balcony retain mositure they feel humid and smell like mold. I first asked room service for some type of deodorizer. She sprayed teh carpet and window treatments and that worked for about a minute but the smell arose and triggered my allergies. I asked for a new room. Although I didn't get the balcony I reserved I was much happier for a room free of offensive odors. The next room smelled fine and was perfect. The service overall is great. The person cleaning our room organized everything wonderfully and even through in make up remover I guess because of all the makeup we had in the bathroom. I love that the Ritz pool is open 24/7. I was a little nervous to be in the pool in the wee hours of the morning but staff was there to give us towels and to even take a few pictures for us. The guy also showed me how to use night setting with my camera to take some cute pictures. During the day I love the beach chair and umbrella service. We were set up right in front of the ocean had lunch and drinks... PARADISE! Everyone was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An Easy Getaway for a Short Beach Trip”
Reviews.Author: diane1214
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to meet in Puerto Rico for three days of sun and we booked the Ritz San Juan. I had heard mixed reviews of the hotel so really was curious to grade it myself. As a frequent traveler to nice destinations, I was pleasantly surprised with this property after a friend had told me it was "awful" and to change to the newly opened St. Regis. The hotel is a five minute cab ride from the airport which is extremely convenient. Aside from the sound of planes when the wind dies down, you are secluded in a beach paradise and don't feel near the airport. The hotel is smaller than most of the Ritz properties I've been to and not all of the rooms had balconies. The night of our arrival I told the manager we were disappointed with the shower pressure and that it was unfortunate the windows were dirty. He comped us very generously and had the water pressure adjusted and a new shower head installed the next morning. The employees were ALL very friendly and professional though the service around the pool and beach was sub-par - we found ourselves going up to the bar and ordering drinks ourselves - meet Elmer who works at the pool bar - he's great! The beach is a pretty crescent and the surf is calm/moderate. The sand is soft but I've noticed in Puerto Rico it's not white like on many other Caribbean islands.The food at the hotel was excellent though overpriced like every other luxury hotel. The pool was smaller than it appears in pictures and I missed an adult-only pool but it was kept refreshingly cool which I appreciated. Thankfully the resort wasn't very full so it wasn't overtaken by kids but easily could have been had we gone at a different time. Overall we had a great stay but this is far away from the nicest properties I've seen though probably the second best to the St. Regis in greater San Juan area. I'm interested to see the Ritz Reserve and a second hotel that are under development on the old Dorado Beach Rockefeller property.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: zeke14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned Sunday from the Ritz in San Juan. We traveled with a group of about 24 other people. My husband was there for business, I was there for pleasure. We arrived about 2 p.m. on Wednesday. Check in was quick and uneventful. Our bellman promptly showed us to our room with our luggage. The first thing I noticed were the stains on the carpet as well as the curtains. Pretty gross! We had paid for an oceanfront balcony and what we received was a view of a palm tree with limited view of the ocean. We chose to stay in this room, until the next morning. We went to breakfast (not sure the name of the restaurant where the buffet is served), it was included in our rate. The buffet is $27, and is about the equivalant to a breakfast at the Hampton Inn. The saving grace for breakfast was the chef Jeremy at the omelette station. Every morning he had a smile on his face, and was very friendly. The rest of the staff, however, was horrible. My husband asked for coffee and water. After about 15 minutes of waiting, and asking two servers for the same, we finally received our coffee. I was poured about a 1/4 of a cup, and the waitress was disgusted when I asked for a full cup. We had breakfast here each morning. Service incredibly slow! After the horrible service, my husband decided to change rooms, and get the oceanfront we were paying for. Apparently, the only room left in the whole hotel the guests chose a late check out. ONE room left?! At any rate, we called every hour, and the room still wasn't ready. Finally, 5 hours later we were taken to our new room. Again, stains on the carpet, but new tv, and beautiful view. We were on the corner with a view of the pool and the ocean. The view made the musty smell tolerable. The weather was horrible the whole time we were there. I did lay out in the clouds and rain. The staff at the pool was incredible. Every time the rain came, Elliot would run over and put our umbrella up and make sure we had dry towels. When the rain passed, he would come back over and put the umbrella down. The guys at the towel station were very attentive and friendly. The would move chairs wherever you wanted them, and if you couldn't find a chair they would find one for you. The food/beverage service at the pool was infrequent. The Ocean Bar was great! We went there a couple of evenings and had a really good time. The bar staff was very amusing and quick! I will say that the drinks were far too expensive for what you received. One of our fellow travelers asked for a glass of house Cabernet, he received it in a plastic wine glass with a price tag of $22. Maybe I am crazy, but that was outrageous! Robert was very entertaining, and he loves to play Angry Birds on anyone's electronic device sitting at the bar. Andrew from Indiana was awesome! It was pouring rain, and he ran to the hotel to find the nearest door that was unlocked for us (8 people) to get in. Robert called the front desk and several umbrellas were run out to us. We did not eat dinner at any of the restaurants in the hotel. We did, however, order room service. We ordered 2 Kobe beef hamburgers. They tasted like just an everyday burger, but were cooked exactly as we asked, which has never happened before. Upon reviewing the bill, we realized we were not served Kobe beef, nor were we charged for it. The room service was quite speedy. We did have lunch at the main restaurant (again, I don't remember the name), and the service was horrible. There were approximately 6 other guests in the restaurant, and it took 45 minutes to get 2 meals, forget about getting a refill on your beverage. The service again horrible!!! The conceriege was also very helpful and friendly. They recommended a couple of great restaurants, made reservations, and made sure that the person waiting on our party was the best. The lobby bar menu/cocktails were great, that is IF you can get service. Also, a man passed out on a couch that was never asked to leave. Really?! They just placed his bill on the table in front of him and went about their business. That is my experience...Oh, one last thing...Bar service at the BLT bar non-existent! Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ritz-Carlton I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: pickemtowin
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at this Ritz-Carlton was just plain bad. I have stayed at many Ritz-Carltons, and a multitude of 5 Star/Diamond properties, unfortunately the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan is just not up to Ritz-Carlton standards. If you are use to staying in nice hotels, you will be disappointed! If you are use to staying in 3 star hotels, you will be fine, but you will grossly overpay for everything! My disappointment started at check-in. At the time of check-in, the front desk clerk told me that I was in a city view room. My secretary had made the reservation, but she always reserves Ocean View rooms for me. Thinking that perhaps she had made an error, I requested an upgrade. I am at the top level of the Ritz's reward program that includes a free upgrade when available. Without missing a beat the front desk clerk informed me that the hotel was sold out. Then to my amazement, less than two minutes later, without speaking to anyone, she tells me that her supervisor had informed her that a nicer room was indeed avaialable. Then the truely amazing thing happened, she actually tried to upsell the nicer room for an additional $100.00! At that point, I dug through my briefcase and retrieved my reservation, sure enough, I had already paid for an oceanview room. When I showed the reservation to the clerk, she asked if she could show it to her supervisor. She then came back and gave us the room for which I had actually paid. No apology, nothing, just an attempted SCAM! The room was very below average, small, and without even a tiny balcony or even a window that opened. We could see the ocean, but the part of the hotel we stayed in was set back a long way from the ocean. If you are going to stay in this hotel, either make sure that you get a room with a balcony, or don't bother spending the money for an ocean view! After waiting over 15 minutes for our luggage, I finally called down to the bell desk to find our luggage. After another 15 minutes our luggage finally arrived. They told me when they wrestled the luggage out of my hands, that it would be brought immediately to our room. We had spent all day on planes, it was 5pm, and we were in a hurry to get down to the beach before the sun went down. We simply did not appreciate waiting over 30 minutes for our luggage, not to mention the 15 minutes it took at check-in to simply get the correct room. The beach in front of this hotel at 5:30pm on a Sunday was disgusting! Granted it was late on a weekend, but to me it's not an execuse. The Ritz-Carlton actually charges a 14% resort fee, which covers the beach chairs, etc. However, it is obvious by the pathetic condition of the beach chairs, that they put none of that money into equipment or for cleaning the beach. I personally think that charging a resort fee sucks, but even more so when it's a percentage of the room price. That means the more you pay to stay in the hotel, the more it costs to use the facilities. It seems like it should be the opposite of that concept. If the property does charge a resort fee, shouldn't it be a flat rate? If I am in a suite, do I use more of the beach then the guest in the cheapest rooms? Sorry, just a pet peeve of mine, back to the review. We ate dinner at the beach side restaurant. The service was terrible, the food was average, but grossly overpriced as is the food at most hotels. The chairs were suppose to have cushions, but none did. And worst of all, you can't see the ocean at all, only the pool. We then tried to get coffee in the lobby bar, they only had one waitress for the entire lobby bar, so it took forever to order and longer to just get a cup of coffee! The location of this hotel is great if you are trying to stay close to the airport. The casino is okay, but nothing special. Overall, I would avoid this hotel. There are other hotels of same average quality with far better pricing! $550.00 a night is the equivalent of being robbed in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: DCInsider
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location and pool, good options for dinner and walking distance to other major hotels and restaurants. A little far from downtown old San Juan but nice for the beach and pool. For a quick 3 or 4 day trip, it's a great spot, close to the airport but not noisy. Got a little crowded on the weekend but that's not a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a relaxing beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: michelle2138
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Pool and beach areas are beautiful, and lots of fun restaurants and things to do. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Motel 6 of Ritz Carltons”
Reviews.Author: DavidWeiser
Reviews.Content: No offense to Motel 6! Ritz Carlton needs to totally overhaul this property or take their name off of it. I've watched this hotel deteriorate over ten years, and I won't go back. My deluxe corner oceanfront balcony room had filthy stained carpet, peeling wallpaper, missing light bulbs, a broken balcony door, among other problems. On the property, everywhere you look things are cracked, broken and dirty. Housekeeping service is terrible. Pool service is erratic, to say the least. Management offers insincere apologies and credits, but by then, who cares? Get it right the first time or don't bother. Who wants to spend time during a resort stay fighting to make things the way they should be automatically? This is NOT a 5 star property. Very sad. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: michwitt
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the ritz Carlton San Juan. We were disappointed in the quality of the resort. We have stayed at other Ritz Carltons before, and found this one to be sub par. The resort was average-not Ritz quality and definitely not worth the money. The service was very poor. We often waited for a couple of hours for wait service at the beach and pool. We were fine going to the bar to order for ourselves, but we were ignored there as well. Everything was overpriced at the hotel and not worth it. The breakfast buffet was $27 per person, and there were no other options for breakfast. Coffee was $3.00 per cup, when most hotels offer it for free. The lunch menu as also not worth the money. The service was very poor. We often waited for a couple of hours for wait service at the beach and pool. We were fine going to the bar to order for ourselves, but we were ignored there as well. Everything was overpriced at the hotel and not worth it. The breakfast buffet was $27 per person, and there were no other options for breakfast. Coffee was $3.00 per cup, when most hotels offer it for free. The lunch menu as also overpricedverpriced. We spent about $150 on lunch everyday, and it was very basic. Dinners and drinks were pricey, but food was very good. Beach chairs were broken and/or ripped. Beach was just okay. Lots of seaweed. Pool was just average, nothing spectacular. Pool furniture was run down and looked old and ragged. We spent a lot of time at the El San Juan (Waldorf), just down the street from the Ritz. It has many more dining options, is a much more fun and trendy hotel. If we go back we will definitely stay at the El San Juan. We have stated at hotels much cheaper than the Ritz San Juan, and they have been much nicer. Don't waste your money here. Check out the El San Juan. You will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Room service Awful and overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: ljohn
Reviews.Content: I expect to pay high prices at The Ritz Carlton, but at least serve a fresh cup of HOT coffee! Bagels and coffee were cold. Coffee was bitter! $37.00 for 2 bagels and COLD coffee. Come on Ritz, you've got to do better than that!!!! Il Molino Restaurant superb as usual!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spring Break, Fabulous Service, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: avaheh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights during the week before Easter, spring break. Service from the front desk, pool, beach, restaurants and housekeeping was all exemplary. Stayed in a pool view room with balcony, room was spacious and comfortable. We had a King bed and there was a single pull out bed/chair that our 14 yo slept on. Hotel is starting the process of updating all rooms (carpeting, paint, decorations etc) and renovation will be complete by the Fall. Our room had not been updated yet but was in excellent condition. Service at the pool was very attentive, at the beach the chair and umbrella service was good but there did not seem to be enough food/beverage servers. It was more efficient to go eat at the pool side restaurant. Qualtiy of breakfast buffet was good but pricey at $25 per person if you were going to eat there every morning. BLT Steakhouse and Il Mulino (italian) were both very good (pricey but good quality). Within walking distance we also went to dinner at Spice and LaPlayita which were very good and moderately priced. Also we had breakfast several mornings at Piu Bello which was good and moderately priced. It was nice to mix up eating at the Ritz and some local places. We booked our package through JetBlue vacations and the price was half of what it would have been had we booked directly through the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “True Excellence for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: mlrl1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before beginning our cruise. There was a line waiting to check in at noon and the general manager introduced himself and made sure we were taken to another area to immediately check in. The staff to a person went out of there way to make sure all our needs were taken care of. We had dinner in the Il Molina Italian restaurant. Though it was pricey, I felt they gave a lot for the money and it was a very good dinner. There was a Walgreen's a block away, which was convenient for last minute items for the trip. Only ten minutes by taxi to the ship or Old San Juan. Next to the airport, never heard a takeoff or landing.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at this Ritz was so disappointing; a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: cherie34
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to write a review of any hotel. My reason for doing so this time is because I was SO disappointed in the Ritz San Juan, having stayed at several Ritz Carltons in the states, each multiple times. First of all, way overpriced (for what you get). The room: smelly, dirty/stained carpet, dusty, looked like a Motel 6 as far as in class, bed as hard as a rock, shower liner dirty (had to ask for it to be replaced), and difficulty with changing rooms. Oh, let me not forget our room's view included the roof of some small attachment and all we saw was dirty roof and pipes, surrounded by trees so we were unable to see the "beauty" of the back pool/patio area. And they wondered why we wanted to try another room. I also had a spa appt booked but I canceled because I wasnt sure what to expect there. Ok, we quickly looked up surrounding hotels to rid ourselves, but they were booked as well. The 2 positives: BLT (steak) restaurant) where food and service was great. And, the posterior of the hotel does open into the carribean sea. We took a cruise and returned to stay overnight in san juan, but we stayed at the El San Juan (Waldorf Astoria collection). It was half the price, hotel in ALOT better condition, service great, and pool/beach area to die for. Imagine... paying $683 (reconnect pkg, so supposedly discount and only spending $23 over our $100 credit) with the Ritz, or $298 at El San Juan with beautiful relaxation areas, much bigger rooms, heavenly beds, overall beautiful hotel. I really can say that the Ritz owes me $383, at least. Please take this into consideration. If your expecting luxury, this isnt the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Dream”
Reviews.Author: Kspadegal
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is everything a luxury hotel should be and more. Everything is elegant, posh, comfortable, and dreamy. You even get a complimentary coqui necklace at one of the hotel's stores. We dined at the hotel's restaurants every night as we felt the food was more upscale than local cuisine. Horseback riding is a short ride away as well as shopping in Old San Juan. The staff, throughout the resort, is exceptional. Do be prepared, however, to incur an additional $100 per night for resort fee and tax. We were a bit surprised by that. Overall, this is hands down the ONLY hotel to stay at in Puerto Rico. We had checked into another hotel and it was a nightmare so we went to the Ritz instead.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: drbdl
Reviews.Content: Here is the condensed version- 1. Showing it's age. 2. Too many kids and not enough adults only areas in the restaurants and pool area. 3. Too many people with tattoos. 4. Too few restaurant choices. Went to The Palm at the El San Juan on consecutive nights for dinner (excellent, by the way). 5. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful (they know where their paychecks come from). 6. The grounds were spectacular. 7. Jets taking off across the road may bother some visitors. 8. Lacks the "exclusivity" of a high end resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stephvabeach
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property in Carolina, PR. It has easy access to everything including the airport , dining and malls. The beach seems to be the only habitable beach on Isla Verde, and although it is public it feels very safe, and it is quiet. The pool is nice as well, but the chairs are taken quickly. I had no problems checking in to the hotel, and my room was available before check in time. All of the hotel employees provided outstanding service including the ladies in the Enterprise rental station on site. The room was not so great because it was small and rather musty. The carpets needed a good cleaning, and the AC had to be put on 65 to cool it down. This hotel definitely needs something to take the moisture out of the air. It is oppressive. I ended up moving to a larger room with an ocean view because I wasn't happy with the original. The larger room had TWO air conditioning zones that operated the same way. The biggest disappointment to me was that after spending an additional 400 plus a night I didn't get a room with clean fixtures or carpets. Everything needed a good re-furbishing. Having recently returned from the Ritz Carlton in Grand Cayman, I was really surprised at the lack of attention to detail in the rooms. I paid the same for both rooms at the two properties, but the quality was completely different (yes, the SJ is older but still). If they just replaced the carpets, painted and re-finished the fixtures it would make a huge difference. It is a shame because the service is just so good. The food is good, and the location is so convenient. This could be a 5 star property with a little love.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on the Ritz Carlton for keeping this property in their portfolio!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysflyin41
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at premium hotels around the world. We do not mind paying a high price for service and amenities at a luxury property, but the Ritz is a solid 3 star trying to pretend to be a luxury hotel. Positives: Easy access from airport, lobby area with bar is very elegant and spa service was quite good. Negatives: Room unavailable at 5:00pm, waited in lobby bar for almost 2 hours with my family for a cell phone call for an update on our room which never happened. When we finally arrived in the room and saw the limited space available, we phoned down to ask to pay for an additional room. We left a message with the operator as the front desk was not answering, but no one followed up with our request. Lounge chairs are worn and stained, and at 10:30am all the umbrella's were spoken for around the pool. Service pampering around the pool is nonexistent. Food and drink service is painfully slow, in fact my family ate at Denny's next door for lunch as we were tired of waiting for a menu to arrive. Housekeeping was attempted at 8am most days, and did not occur one day and the best part of this hotel.............dead bug (looked like a cockroach but I am not an expert) in the drapes of the small, musty hotel room discovered when were we packing up. (We were so shocked that we took a picture) We pay for expensive hotels to avoid hassles and conflict. Vacation time with family is supposed to be luxurious, pampering and memorable for the right reasons. The above issues should have never happened at a premium hotel with premium rates. The hotel offered credits and apologies but we paid a premium price for a three star experience. The Ritz chain is allowing this hotel to tarnish it's image, and we will avoid the Ritz's hotels in the future........stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: bella2001
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my second stay at the Ritz in San Juan. I love this hotel. It is a very relaxing atmosphere, not for the party seeking crowd. The pool is gorgeous, but there is no music playing which could be a nice touch. The beach is nothing great, we never even sat on it. The bartender Elmer at the pool/beach bar is quite entertaining. The lobby lounge is a great way to start your evening off with an appetizer and cocktail with some musical entertainment. The fitness center is nothing great and very small. Some other reviews mentioned the rooms being dated. I didn't find this to be true. The rooms were very clean and have a large bathroom. The AC never gets cold which can be a bit uncomfortable. We ate at Il Mulino twice! It is very expensive but awesome (hey, it's the Ritz!). We also visited the El San Juan and ate at The Palm, very comparable to the NYC location. We took a 1/2 day rain forest tour and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Two hotels in one”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: While this is far from the best Ritz in the system, it is also far from the worst. In some ways it is two hotels in one; the club floor rooms appear to be in much better shape than non-club rooms, and the service in the club lounge is stellar, not so great in other areas. The location is great for business, in that it is across the street from the airport, so easy-in, easy-out, but as a liesure destination the beach is nothing impressive and it would be better to be closer to old town.

Reviews.Title: “R- ITZ a DUD . ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK”
Reviews.Author: sjs1108
Reviews.Content: WARNING THIS PROPERTY USED TO BE A HOLIDAY INN AND SHOULD HAVE STAYED A HOLIDAY INN. Letter sent to management. Their reply was a $300.00 credit per room. As discussed, I was very disappointed during my recent stay. I would like to summarize our conversation with the below points. Basically I expected a pleasurable experience but received a letdown in several are I was taking friends and business associates away for a special getaway. All rooms were booked weeks ago and were supposed to be charged to my credit card. We sent the authorization form and called several times to verify before my arrival. 1) I was told when I called concierge that BLT and IL Mulino required jackets to be worn by the men. This was not the case and caused my guests and I to bring jackets when not needed. 2) Upon check in , I advised front desk that all charges were to be invoiced to my credit card for all guests. They confirmed , however when I checked out charges were going to be billed XXXX's room. In addition , all invoices were left under my guests doors when they were supposed to be left under mine. When I called guest services to remedy the situation it took 10 minutes to find someone at front desk because they dont pick up the phones. 3) I was told upon my first night of arrival that Ocean Bar served sandwiches and hamburgers for dinner, however when I arrived they only served sushi for dinner and we could not order sandwiches and hamburgers. One of my guests does not eat fish so it was uncomfortable for them. 4) Pool- beach â€“ lounge chairs in poor dirty condition . Bathrooms near tennis courts, dirty and need better maintenance. 5) When ordering food or drinks at pool long waits because of under staffing. Thus, quality was not good. The staff even admits they are understaffed. 6) Breakfast, resturant ran out of bannanas , staff less then helpful. My guest went to Dennyâ€™s The trip cost 17000.00 and left me with embarressment and agravation. I would have been better off in an alternative property , and saved quite a bit. The Ritz name is tarnished with me. Since I am in a service business, on the plane I was thinking what I would do and have done if this happended to one of my customers. My solution would be to have a revist of the property at a minimal cost to make things right.

Reviews.Title: “Runway Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Ajsaraf
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting your typical Ritz experience this is not the place. It is dated and sits right on the runway of San Juan International airport. I am sure there our better hotels in Puerto Rico for less money. Not a winner!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable and Luxurious Base for Exploring San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: Although I'd be unlikely to stay at the RC for more than a couple of days because the "resort" experience is not quite for me, I've often stayed here before or after longer trips to other destinations within Puerto Rico or the Caribbean beyond. For my purposes, the RC is perfect. It offers a perfect transition to island time, or back to cold reality. Over the years, I've noticed that the level of service has improved and that the staff are more friendly and helpful than in past visits. The addition of champagne at reception seems to set the tone. The beds and rooms are just as plush and attractive as they have been, and it seems a re-decoration to a more modern look is in progress. The public areas are very attractive and well-appointed, but since it seemed that we were here during spring break, the pool and beach areas seemed more crowded than usual. Despite the hefty resort fee (and the resort amenities we never used), we'll continue to consider the RC-San Juan our go-to hotel when staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Prettymommy7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, luxurious hotel, wonderful service, consistently amazing . Never want to leave when I stay at a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton, great product, "ok" service.”
Reviews.Author: ko0kla
Reviews.Content: Being that it's a resort property I would think the rooms would have balconies or even windows that you can open to enjoy the fresh air, but the windows do not open. The property has a beautiful entrance, lobby, clean rooms...housekeeping service was amazing! I don't know if it's because I have high expectations or if the service was really as poor as it I think it is. A day before my Birthday my friend & I were over at the property's beach when the hotel beach concierge approached us for small talk. My friend had mentioned to him that we were there to enjoy our time as well as to celebrate my birthday the following day. It appeared that the concierge made a note of it, even asked for my name & wrote it down. The following day there wasn't even a Birthday card in my room, nothing. Later on the day both my friend & I approached the concierge desk to make dinner reservations for the evening, asking them for a suggestion & also informing them that it's to celebrate my Birthday....they recommended a beautiful Italian restaurant with the best service & cosine I've experienced during my trip but they failed to inform the restaurant of the special occasion. The following evening I approached the front desk for concierge advise (since concierge was gone for the evening & f/d played the part of front desk & concierge) but it appeared that the front desk personnel didn't have any basic concierge knowledge. The agent couldn't provide with any recommendations. Being that it's a 4 or 5 star hotel, all of the above should have been handled better. Towards the end of my stay one of the front desk agents asked me if I was enjoying my stay with them which gave me the opportunity to express how I really felt. I informed her that I particularly took this trip & chose their hotel to have a perfect Birthday, but instead, it was overlooked even after several reminders. I have to say, it's one of the worst Birthday celebrations I've had in a long time. It took less then an hour for this kind front desk agent (woman) to organize their management team to personally deliver a Birthday cake along with balloons to my room. I was impressed. The problem wasn't entirely corrected, but it did make me feel acknowledged. Having to lay out by the pool side I expected to be pampered, but the only amenity they offered was water w/ice. Any other 5 star hotels I've ever stayed at offered cold towels, complimentary fruit, etc....but no, not this one. Some of the staff were nice but not entirely, it's like they were nice because they had to be....didn't seem genuine. At check out I spoke with of the managers (male) who was very pleasant. I expressed my expectations & frustrations during my stay. He was very polite & professional.
