All in all, I think that this property is beautiful & has a great potential to be more then what it really is if the employees were more detail oriented, knowledgeable & genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service....rooms a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: QuietTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I must say first, that the service from everyone at this hotel is excellent. From the bellman to the people checking us in, and the women cleaning the rooms...excellent. I was always greeted by every employee when I passed them in the halls or lobby areas. My room was nice, however, it was a disappointment that the windows would not open, and the walls are a bit thin. There were times that I could hear the people talking in the next room. All in all, it was a pleasant experience. It would certainly be nice for all the rooms to have balconies to be able to really appreciate the paradise of the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TShip
Reviews.Content: Coming from Minnesota, I was looking foreard to a beach front experiance. I was shocked to check into a room with no doors or windows that opened. I guess I expected that every room would have doors and a balcony to enjoy the surf and sounds of the ocean, When I asked about another room they told me they would put me on a waiting list, but I never heard from the hotel. I would have traded modest luxury for the Marriott Courtyard down the beach where every room had a balcony. The pool and Beach area were nice. I spent all my free time on the beach. Service was OK, Sunday was very busy with the locals skipping into the hotel to use the bathroom all afternoon. The staff was very nice! In fact everyone in PR was nice! The hotel needs to be opened up. They are planning a renovoation, I hope they open the lobby and the rooms to the wonderful grounds! The rooms are tired and need help. Some of them are musty. Overall about a 4! If you want Luxury beach front its the new W! The St. Regis is brand new too, but I am not sure its beach front.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Ritz Carlton?”
Reviews.Author: Lounim
Reviews.Content: Although I was visiting the Ritz on a business trip, and only paid for a few extra nights, I feel like we all would have been better off somewhere else. The hotel is tired. The carpet is old and musty and since the windows donâ€™t open, you canâ€™t get any fresh air in the rooms. The air conditioning barely works, and the maintenance staff is in denial there is a problem, telling us that we didnâ€˜t know how to use the thermostat. Really? Itâ€™s a funny location for a Ritz, not in the seemingly more upscale Condado area, but instead practically on the airport runway. When youâ€™re at the pool, the ground rumbles as the planes take off. Itâ€™s crazy. And donâ€™t get me started about their â€œhigh speed internetâ€�, which is free- because nobody would pay for it. I think dial-up is faster. On the housekeeping front, it was disappointing that I had to call up, twice, because by 4:00 my room still had not been cleaned. Most of the staff, like you would expect at a Ritz, is very good. Too bad the hotel doesnâ€™t earn an equivalent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic weather,loved the beach &had a great time, but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: mgtopagent
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton Just returned from a lovely stay at the Ritz Carlton located in â€œIsla Verdeâ€� section of San Juan and almost directly across the highway from the airport. Overall, this is a very nice property and probably the nicest in San Juan. My last visit to a tropical island was to the big island of Hawaii where we stayed at the Fairmont Orchid which used to be a Ritz Carlton. I thought that in comparison, that that property was nicer and the landscaping spectacular in comparison but that is perhaps unfair. San Juan does not look like Hawaii and the nearby buildings and city appearance took me back at first. With the exception of Old San Juan, I found I needed to try and disregard this during my stay. San Juan is easy to get to from the east coast however. I liked that you could get everywhere on the Ritz property quickly â€“ the resort is large but not sprawling. We had a corner oceanfront room with a balcony which was a bit pricey, but to us, this was worth the extra. We found that by juggling the dates a few days in either direction and eliminating a Saturday we were able to save a lot of money when booking. (We booked via whatahotel.com and got breakfast and resort food credit included). Air conditioning in the hotel is erratic and may be poorly engineered. Hallways are frigid, and even though your room can get very cool, on humid days, the A/C does not seem good at getting rid of the moisture. We had a wonderful panoramic view and corner windows (although the thermal seal in one of the windows was damaged and the window was fogged), of the beach and coastline. The bathroom was probably the nicest I have ever had in any hotel â€“ very large double vanity and high enough so you do not get a backache; all marble, plenty of room and shelves to store your toiletries, separate oversized shower stall with bench, tub and separate toilet; great towels and nice Ritz toiletries; Ipod docking player included and nice assortment of teas and coffee in the room; good housekeeping service, but very poor and slow in-room wireless service Large newer flat screen was great â€“ however, we have noticed that no hotels seem to have hi def yet. All of the common areas are exceptionally nice and overall well-kept but I thought the hallways were narrow. The beach and pool areas are really quite wonderful with wonderful azure ocean but pool is not heated as others noted. There are plenty of chaises and umbrellas (part of your resort fee) even at 100% occupancy. The weather was fantastic and March is a good month to visit. Some of the chaise lounges and beach snack tables could use re-doing â€“ they take a beating. There are a few other worn areas in the hotel but this is quite minimal and they seemed to be freshening and painting. The staff is , kind and for the most part very competent. They genuinely want you to have a wonderful stay but not all of them are on the same page. A few of the waiters at breakfast went off the air, asking if you wanted more coffee and then never returning, but, then on the other hand, was someone like â€œCarolinaâ€� who was exceptionally pleasant and efficient and suggested some wonderful juices for us to try. If you can ask to be at her station for breakfast â€“ you should! As far as being pampered, I think that at Ritz prices, one expects this and I would agree with the other posters. There was not adequate service at the beach for food or drinks. Someone we flagged down said he would be right back and never came, so my husband walked up to the beach bar and got his own drink, etc. When they set up your chairs early in the day, they say they will be taking care of you all day â€“ but only a couple times during the week did anyone come around again to see if we wanted or needed anything. As far as food, breakfast was great and they had so many choices, omelette station and fantastic guava pancakes that actually look like they are baked in mini bundt pans. They stop serving at 11 so try and arrive well before that time. Sparkling Cava is available if you want to have Mimosas, beautiful outdoor setting also. We also ate at BLT steak house in the hotel which was very good if typical high end steak house as well as trying Il Mullino, the latter being extremely over-priced and even pretentious. A NYC Italian best reserved for those with expense accounts. It seems as if few hotels these days have 24 hour informal options if you just want to get some ice-cream or a light snack for example. This is limited to room service or in the lounge. I heard that the Marriott down the beach had an ice cream parlor which we missed. The other advantages of staying at the Ritz is that you are short walk to other area hotels that offer dining and shopping options and there is a convenient Walgreens about a half block away. You are close by to the El San Juan which has wonderful shops and a few restaurants - we tried Koco which was disappointing. (I am writing separate reviews of the restaurants). We also ate at Baru and Jose Jose both of which were excellent. If you wanted to visit San Juan but did not want to pay the price of the Ritz Carlton, I would suggest you take a look at the Intercontinental. We walked through the hotel and their public areas, beach and pool were quite impressive. I would probably not stay at the El San Juan although I would visit. Another great option a few doors away is the Courtyard by Marriott (written up as economical beach getaway with all rooms having great ocean and beach view) in Travel and Leisure Magazine this month.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: LWM_2010
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with the Ritz (it was comparable to a low grade Marriott)---the room smelled musty, no balconies --only a window that would not open). The pool water was extremely cold. Overall, the physical facility was a disapointment. The concierge staff was very responsive and helpful. Not certain I would return as it was not the complete experience I was expecting from the Ritz Carlton. The BLT restaurant was very good with great service.

Reviews.Title: “never again not your typical ritz.”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom511
Reviews.Content: The Ritz In San Juan has left us with no desire to ever go back to the hotel. Understanding that it was february break and the busiest season they were under staffed, the service was abominable. the wait time for pool side or beach service was close to an hour. the spa was under staffed an the conditions of the lounge chairs were in terrible shape. you book a vacation at a ritz with expectation of top notch service. the only top notch quality at this hotel was lack of service . The rooms smelled like cigarettes even though it was requested to be non smoking. the hotel needs an overhaul. never again. for $800 a night we could have gone any where else. try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The pool is no paradise”
Reviews.Author: zevin
Reviews.Content: We picked the Ritz specifically for the pool. It looks luxurious on the website. We imagined being pampered with frozen drinks and scented towels and being called by our names. Good afternoon, Mr. so and so. Our first morning there, we arrived enthusiastically at the pool at 8:30 am for some midwinter outdoor caribbean therapy, had some brunch at the hotel restaurant and then nestled into our chairs for a day of spoiling ourselves. By 3 o'clock, not one staff member/waiter had stopped by to ask us if we needed anything. Not one. No drinks. No food. No "can I reposition your umbrella". That's 6 hours with no service. At 4 o'clock, they fired up the diesel-powered ATV to move all the beach chairs up close to the poolside fence. The smell and sound of that were lovely. Evidently, that's a daily occurrence. And oh yeah, the airport runway is 1/2 a mile away. So if you're looking for no poolside service, loud 4 wheelers on the beach and 747s landing on your head, look no further. However, if it's pampering by the pool you're looking for, the El San Juan Hotel and Casino is right up the road. We also stayed there on this trip and the staff was all over our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Flyfishtom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Ritz Carlton and thought it was very nice. The hotel is in fine shape. The staff was excellent from my experience. I had nothing but great service. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We ventured to Culebra and also went flyfishing with Omar and Dave just a few minutes away. Great place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “And a miserable night was had by all.”
Reviews.Author: acmes
Reviews.Content: Although we've stayed at the Ritz in PR nearly a dozen times, it had been a couple of years. This time, we were just passing though on our way to another island. Because we were arriving after midnight, the plan was to stay at the Ritz before catching an afternoon flight. It's location near the airport made it seem ideal. We had specified through our travel agent that we needed either 2 double beds and a rollaway or a King with a sofabed and a rollaway (we have two kids and one is fairly tall and hard to share a bed with). The last time we stayed at this Ritz, we had a King bed and a Queen Sofabed and that's what I figured we were getting. WRONG. On checking in at 2am, we were informed that there were no rollaways available (I was concerned that this might happen). Oh well, go to Plan B and have the kids share the Sofabed. When we arrived in the King bed room, it was clear that it was the tiniest room, barely fitting the bed, two chairs and a bulky armoir for the TV...and no sofabed. After calling the front desk, we were told that the sofabed was "on it's way". Really?? I couldn't imagine them moving a sofabed into this room, much less in the middle of the night. Sure enough two guys arrived from housekeeping with what appeared to be a "chair and a half" on a dolly which they proceeded to wrestle into the room (after removing one of the chairs). By now it was well after 3am. They opened the bed and to no one's surprise by this point, a twin mattress unfolded. It was therefore the teen's unlucky lot to get this sleeping arrangement (did I mention that the mattress was covered with plastic that crinkled all night?). The younger child had to sleep with Mom & Dad. At $700 a night, not what any of us had in mind. There was barely room to walk around the bed and one of us had to use the bathroom to open the small carry-on bag we brought. I would have much preferred that they told us upfront that we couldn't be accommodated. We were offered a meal credit, but what I really wanted was a "sleep credit". If we travel through San Juan in the future (quite likely), I will be choosing other accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: canadiancook
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton San Juan for a few days last week while my husband had a business meeting. Was not overly impressed by the resort at all - I honestly didn't feel like I was staying at a Ritz-Carlton hotel! Our room smelled musty, the hallways were dingey and in need of new paint - it just seemed like they had let the place go. The one positive was the pool area - yummy food and amazing frozen mango mojitos - you must try one!! Luckily we weren't paying for our room because of my husband's meeting - I would have been very upset paying so much for so little!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location- but a very corporate hotel with little personality”
Reviews.Author: sunbelly
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on the way back from Nevis. Great location and I loved that it was a 7 minute cab ride. However arrived one hour after check in and were told the room was not ready. I had a hungry, cranky 4 year old and had to wait in the lobby since they couldn't really tell us how long it would be and it was already almost dinner time. Once checked in- room was plesant enough. Your basic Ritz room .. with a pretty view of the pool and water. This hotel was good for a quick stop but I am just not a fan of San Juan. There are so many more beautiful places in PR to visit that I just can't recommend it unless you have to stay in San Juan like we did so we could catch a flight out in the morning. This hotel just reminded me of every corporate function I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: RLBuckingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 12-16. The hotel really needs to be renovated. At $600 a night, you would expect really nice accommodations, however, I was disappointed. This hotel does not measure up to Ritz standards. We stayed here several years ago and it doesn't appear that anything has been done as far as upgrades. We were treated very well by the staff and I have no complaints at all with them...but the hotel is just average.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation, Excellent Service, Fantastic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Waveland723
Reviews.Content: I have NEVER written a review for any hotel or restaurant but felt obligated to do so for this hotel. Wife and I went for 5 nights and had a nearly pefect vacation for our anniversary. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Our room was spotless and better than I'd expected. This hotel made us feel like we were the most important guests there. Reading some of these reviews make me wonder where these people stayed. HUGE appreciation to the conseirge desk. They took the time to find us restaurants based on what WE wanted to eat and not what they thought all the tourists wanted. Made reservations for us and made sure everynight was an anniversary dinner. I recommend the package that includes Oceabfront Balcony with a $100 resort credit and the upscale buffet breakfast. The Club Level Package is probably better for people with kids but it seemed like a hassle to me as I didnl;t want to hav to walk back into the hotel and go to the 10th floor to get a fre drink. The breakfast buffet was excellent everyday. The drinks pool and beach side are about $6 for a beer and around $10-12 for tropical drinks and the food is $10-$20 and very good. To me, this was very reasonable for a Ritz Carlton and the service was prompt and easy. As others have stated, there is a decent liquor store and food store less then 3 minutes from the hotel that you can bye stuff at if you really want to save money...BUT then WHY go to a Ritz Carlton?? Casino was also a blast and the best in the area. Fun atmosphere. SO for those of you that need to know that I'm not paid by the hotel to write a nice review, here you go, My complaints - or rather, ways that the Ritz can improve: 1) The Birds: Too many aggresive birds at the pool. We opted not to eat breakfast outside in the morning because the birds would land right on your table and try to peck at your plate. I'm not a bird lover at all and I'd prefer to have them crated away. Good forbid someone left an empty plate of food a few seats over from you at the pool or beach, a horde of nirds will be all over you in a few minutes. STILL - We loved the place. 2) The Basketball Net: Some one had the dumb idea of putting a basketball net right under the wing of the hotel that has the most expensive rooms. It should be moved well away from the rooms near the tennis courts (come on people - think about). So, a couple of kids one morning decided to go out there at 8:00 a.m. and start shooting around. Even being on the 7th floor with our balcony door closed, we could still hear it. Really lame idea. BUT - I called down to the front desk to complain an they put a stop to it in under 3 minutes. I was impressed. 3) Hallways Too Cold: Yes, I'm reaching on this actually being a complaint. I love cranking up the AC but the hallways were absolutely frigid and I was shaking by the time I got to the elevators. 4) The Front Desk: Slightly understaffed - We had a bit of a wait and always saw a line of people waiting and they just need to be a little more attentive. To check out we were standing there and decided to slip over to the conseirge desk and they took care of us promptly. 5) Too many New Yorkers/New Jerseyians..... What are you going to do? I guess the Ritz can't offer lessons on how to teach basic courtesy. OK people - there are others trying to relax at the pool so keep the volume down. Hint: If I'm 30 feet away and can hear every word, pipe down. 6) Airport Noise: Yeah we heard the planes once in awhile but it was not load at all and never bothered us and we slept with the balcony doors open everynight. WE WILL BE BACK...but again without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Has Great Potential, But Pales to Most Ritz Carltons”
Reviews.Author: kingofsp8s
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Marriott Points; am platinum with Marriott and was hoping status would carry over, but no such luck. Reserved an oceanfront room, which I got, but the definition of oceanfront is a bit marginal as it was more like "parking lot front" or "over the entertainment patio front". If you reserve, be sure to ask for as high a floor as possible to enjoy. Also, be aware that there are heavily travelled housekeeping closets near these rooms and the doors start slamming around 9 a.m. and the half dozen housekeepers/maintenance people do not have that "seen but not heard" presence that I'm used to in other RC's. Having come in late the night before it was an irritant. Given that I was travelling on points, and still sucked into the $60/night resort fee, this became a big nuisance. All in all, if you need a hotel and can spend the money, get it including the club level. It's clean, good facilities overall, and very close to the airport so if you're just trying to get a few days away, it works. Some other tips: 1) Rent a car; the taxi rides to OSJ are $20 each way and tip balance of food costs greatly towards the hotel restaurants. 2) Reserve the Enterprise car (on hotel property) on-line and use your corporate discounts. Reserve for 30 minutes before the intended time as they don't keep cars on property. 3) Beware of BLT (at least). I was nervous because of the reviews on prices, but they were no different than NYC which I've frequented a number of times. However, the food quality was at whole level lower, which was disappointing...I think they retrned more popovers than were eaten that night. 4) Have patience; the front desk is understaffed and constantly has lines. They genuinely want to help, but again, compared to expectations and previous experience, not well trained. Again a bit disappointing. Now that I've experienced PR, I feel a lot more confidennt to try other options; the Courtyard looked decently located. Also, in looking to use points, would also be taking a stronger look at the Hilton or making the journey over to Vieques. All in all, this was an experience somewhere between a regular Marriott and a JW. Had hoped for higher.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip !”
Reviews.Author: william93
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at nicer 5 star resorts but still feel this hotel deserves 5 star status. Pros; Excellent service ,great food , very beautiful and mature, manicured grounds, wonderful, large pool area with plenty of chairs, acceptable beach ,sharp looking hotel architecture, good weather. Location is pretty decent.. $20 cab ride to quaint Old San Juan.. can go on city tour or browse on your own..felt safe at all times...very easy to get around and has some interesting, clean, historical sights. Airport noise not a problem for us..at times may hear a plane but nothing extreme. Booked a balcony room with a fantastic ocean view.. Cons; Rooms could use a little improvement...ie: beds starting to show age, no seperate shower stall..(must shower in tub). furniture a little tired looking. Balconies quite small and positioned (in our case) quite close together. Can even somtimes smell people smoking (we are non smokers) while on your balcony. Hotel in not meant for people on a strict budget as restaurants are very expensive. Poor entertainment in lounge area... live music 3 nights a week but not very good. Birds on dining patio quite bothersome but feel nothing can really be done to rectify this natural problem....( eat inside , would be the only solution) Despite few mentioned negative comments, would still recommend this hotel to anyone.. Our time spent ,was very nice and would return again. If time permits, try Pamela and Uvva restaurants. casual,.small, eclectic decor.. located right on the beach...... excellent food at both....(incredible tasting pork at Pamela's.) Enjoy your visit !

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at the Ritz-Carlton, San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: nyctravel21
Reviews.Content: What did go right with the Ritz is more the question. From the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out, our stay was just sloppy, and encountered numerous rude employees and inconsistent service. I am pretty surprised by some of the more recent reviews as we had more issues than I could even write. We have stayed at numerous Ritz properties and never experienced anything like this. Wouldnt recommend it. Plus its dated and the rooms weren't clean. For the money spent--we were not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: GunknGingy
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the people that work at the ritz. EVERY person from the hotel that we came into contact with was polite, well spoken, helpful and were genuine, it was not lip service, all employees were great. The hotel is very nice, very fancy, beds were ok. The beach was not nice, nor was the location, its kind of junky around the hotel, feels like myrtle beach or va. beach but the hotel itself is an oasis. Food was very good but extremely expensive. Resturant across the street next to the cock fight arena (yes, im serious) was suprisingly great local food. If you can, leave the hotel and find a nice deserted beach or rainforrest to feel like you are really on vactation. overall , a pleasant stay. The lobby bar.....see jose, great fellow

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rrh140
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the beaufitul Ritz Carlton San Juan Puerto Rico and can't say enought about this great resort. Located just five minutes from the San Juan airport and on a beautiful stretch of beach, this hotel is a great getaway from a terrible Northeast winter. We had our daugher, son-in-law and two year old granddaughter with us and we all had a great time. Staff is super friendly and the Italian and Steakhouse restaurants were great (if a bit pricey but well worth it). Only wish they had a more informal breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Ball in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: AuntBunny65
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first vacation together abroad, my husband & I and our 5 year old daughter and it was a HUGE success! This was our first time staying at a Ritz Carlton Property and for the most part we were NOT disappointed. The Lobby is very beautiful with all of it's marble and beautiful flowers, plants, decor and shops. Their is even a Tiffany's inside of this hotel! The hotel has a beautiful pool and their private part of the beach is kept clean with a vast supply of chairs, clean towels and umbrellas. The employees their work very hard to accomodate the guests with umbrellas and chairs. We were checked into a nice room with a comfortable bed and a city view. However, our A/C leaked and caused a wet spot on the carpet. When we notified the front desk facilities came to fix it, but it still leaked. And they did not offer to transfer us to another room, so that part of their service was not above our expectations. However, the service of others was fantastic! The doorman, was very resourceful, friendly and kind. He gave us great recommendations for restuarants and shops. Our favorite resturants were Cafe Puerto Rico @ 208 O'Donnel , Plaza ColÃ³n AND Sofia Italian Kitchen & Bar @ San Francisco St 355 both in Old San Juan. But for breakfast we LOVED a little cafe about 2 blocks from the Ritz called Pui Bello @ Rosa Street #2, Isla Verde! Their breakfast was delicious and cheaply priced. Also, they served yummy Gelato from the morning until late at night. Personally, we did not choose to eat in any of the hotel resturants but decided to go out and eat since it was more reasonable and so we could experience Puerto Rican cruisine such as Mofongo & Tostones. The other reason I gave their service an excellent rating is because of one of the ladies at the front desk. While on one of their elevators my daughter stepped in a wad of gum someone dropped on the floor. I went to the front desk to inform them, so they could get a facilities person to clean it up. Not only did she note it, but she came around from the front desk with a tissue and scissors in hand and proceeded to scrape the gum off of my daughters shoes! I was very impressed with her assistance!! FYI - English is spoken by a large majority of the wonderful people of Puerto Rico as it is taught in their schools and since they are a US Territory. So we did not experience a language barrier while visiting. Another plus for the property is the location! It was a great location and we could walk to local resturants & shops or walk a 1/2 block to the bus stop where you can take one bus directly to Old San Juan. We felt safe walking around this part of town which is funny because I have a dear friend who lives in PR, but had never been to San Juan because her mother "warned" her of the "crime" in San Juan! So she and her son came to San Juan and stayed across the street at the Hampton Inn (I think) and joined us while we visited and she couldn't believe how nice it was...that is so funny to me! So if you are wondering whether or not to stay at the Ritz Carlton I personally give it 4 out of 5 stars! Plus it didn't hurt that we got an AWESOME deal through Costco Travel!! =o)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 35805Katie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! We were a little nervous when we read some of the mixed reviews on this forum, but truly loved our stay here. First, the place is beautiful, the lobby a welcome site for these snow birds. Like most Ritz properties, the service is amazing. The staff, to a person, was over-the-top friendly and accommodating. We ate several meals at the hotel, all of which were great. Not cheap, but we expect that when dining at a hotel restaurant. The concierge desk recommended a few amazing restaurants off-site. Our rooms were extremely clean and well-stocked, the spa great. The casino was a lot of fun, too. We can't think of enough superlatives for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful gardens, Ritz quality”
Reviews.Author: akkefamily
Reviews.Content: Pricey and not the most lavish on decor for a Ritz. ESJ was nicer to look at but it was a lot bigger and busier. Ritz kept up with the friendly service, and felt more special in a smaller atmosphere. We were upgraded to a suite on the corner with the ocean front, pool side terraces. Amazing! We would run out of the water they refreshed with maid and turndown service and they would simply bring as much more as we liked! Gotta love the Blvgari soaps and stuff! Service was just amazing. LOVE IT. I would stay again and over ESJ just due to being a little out of the way but early twenties would do better at ESJ, I think--to hit Bravo. Ritz was a great place for romance or with good kids. I like that. Jason at the Spa is AWESOME. JUST AWESOME. They have an incredible spa and he was the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest place in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: YellowLightbulb
Reviews.Content: Well no doubt this is the nicest place in San Juan. The grounds are gorgeous. Nice clean rooms, and so many great restaurants on-site. The biggest draw is the nice, clean mid-sized casino in the resort. It is so much better than the dated El San Juan casino down the street. Close to the airport, but also you can hear the airplanes while hanging out at the pool. The beach is only so-so, but the Ritz's pool area is very nice. Bottom line: San Juan itself is not that beautiful of a place and all other hotels in this area called Isla Verde are super creepy. The Ritz is the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not lavish hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoRo16
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip at The Ritz on a website, Whatahotel, that offers great deals and excellent service. The Ritz is a lovely, fairly quiet, clean and pretty hotel. The rooms were nice but had no ventilation. The staff was very friendly, although they failed to follow through with their services. We gave the concierge a list of restaurants with dates and times of desired reservations but they never made plans for us. We ended up calling the restaurants ourselves. They were supposed to upgrade our room but they never followed through with that, either, despite our repeated requests. The pool is very pretty but there were a lot of kids and no separate adult area. The fitness center is small but adequate. Spa services were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: MayorMcCheese
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in plenty of Ritz Carltons and this one could be the most disappointing. The facilities and rooms need major renovation. The furniture is old and tired. The bed was worn, too soft and lumpy. The wallpaper was tired and even had brown stains on it. If I took a photograph of the room and sent it to you, you would never guess it's a Ritz Carlton. They've seriously cut back on the amentities. Instead of the usual Bulgari bath products, they had generic Ritz Carlton products that you would see in a Howard Johnson or something. The towels were worn and not as plush. The room itself smelled like feet and never got cold enough, despite the fact that we had the temperature on 68 degrees. We did previously stay on the club level and the rooms were a little nicer, but not by much. The beaches are not great, dark imported sand, although the water was pretty clean and nice. They do not offer any water sports other than surf lessons, but there's really not enough surf to surf. The pool water was very cold and the pool itself gets VERY crowded, probably because the beach is nothing to write home about. If we wanted to order something to drink on the beach, we literally had to ask someone to ask someone to send someone over. That said, it is conveniently located close to the airport and the guys on the beach that set up your chairs are very sweet and helpful. Oh, the food at the BLT restaurant was excellent but I'll write about that in a separate review. I'd probably tell a friend to look elsewhere for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler3636
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the usual comforts of a Ritz as well as a fantastic pool area, beautiful beach front, and great restaurant options. It's not in the midst of all the San Juan nightlife but it's a wonderful place to go for R&R. I would stay there again (and probably will).

Reviews.Title: “Service and responsiveness very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mobiles12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a trip planned to San Juan, Puerto Rico to take place a week before our 6-month anniversary. While I am not too particular with hotels, the service and responsiveness at the Ritz was very disappointing. Among other plans, my wife and I had some nice dinners in mind one of which was at Il Mullino inside the Ritz Carlton. Be advised they will not accept gift cards, yet they won't tell you until the meal is over. We have to pay $250 on a bill I expected to be covered in large part by the gift cards. Furthermore, the Ritz staff was extremely difficult in helping to correct the situation. They also all talk to you like you are retarded (I guess in an effort to be nice), but it comes off extremely strange. Overall I do not think it is good value. The setting is very nice and clean, but there are other options with more buzz and activity for the 20 and 30 something crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: amyinmd
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I took my daughter and her friends away for the long weekend. We chose to upgrade to the club level as my experience at other places is that breakfast can break the bank, and it's nice to have a place to go to unwind, get a snack and drink throughout the day. The girls absolutely loved it and didn't miss a presentation - lol. I don't know what on earth people are complaining about with this resort. I knew going in it was close to the airport and we chose that because we didn't want to spend a lot of time travelling. The airplanes do not fly over the hotel. I had a city view and never once heard a plane from our room. It is true, most rooms do not have balconies. Our room was always clean and comfy. Having stayed at the Ritz in St John, the layout of the room is exactly the same so we knew what to expect. It was a holiday weekend, and while it was busy, we had no problem getting chairs on the beach. We took several day trips, and the girls were always happy to get back to the resort. Our first night we ate at BLT. Two of the girls are vegetarians and had no problem finding things to eat. We've eaten at mortons', ruths chris, and imo, this ranks up there with them. The food was delicious and the service was wonderful. Another night we were tired from being out all day and chose to eat at Il Mulino. I was going to avoid it based on the reviews here, and it was delicious as well. This is no holiday inn, and the prices reflect island life. I'm not surprised by the prices, but I wonder if the people who are shocked have just not ever been to resorts in the caribbean. This is no different than any other higher end resort you'll find in the caribbean. I am generally happy to be in the sunshine and vacation and make the best of wherever I find myself. I didn't have to make the best of it, it was exactly what I was expecting. The personnel in the club lounge learned our names and always were friendly and helpful. If you are debating, don't debate, the beach is nice, the pool is nice, service great, hotel elegant, clean, comfortable. One critique... they should think about heating the pool, especially in the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Ritz- expected more”
Reviews.Author: ChesterArthur
Reviews.Content: It was nice, but not stunning. It is irritating to be nickel-and-dimed for everything- resort fee, coffee, gratuities, etc. If you want a simple coffee and piece of fruit or something for breakfast, it's around $20. Hidden fees annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, again”
Reviews.Author: shoe5214
Reviews.Content: my wife and I have stayed at this property over 10 times and recently decided to stay at another part of the island to see what it was like. we checked into the Gran Melia which was a massive property but lacked in quality of guests, the rooms and the food. we stayed for an entire 5 hrs before calling the Ritz and checking into the property for the reminder of our trip. there is nothing like being greeted by last name by everyone in the hotel from the time you arrive until the time you leave. Try the food in the hotel bar/lobby area or by the pool as it's better and cheaper than Il. Mulino and BLT. the breakfast buffet tasty but overpriced in my opinion. two adults should have to pay $60 for breakfast. also, try eating at Mi Casita (a local restaurant) about 1/2 mile down the road instead of taking a $25 cab ride to old san juan for a bad an overpriced meal. i cannot recommend the Ritz anymore as it's close to the hotel so you don't waste a lot of time travelling to get to and from your flights. thanks to all the people at the Ritz for always stepping up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Food, Great Hotel, Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryReviewer
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute thing that we decided to go to Puerto Rico. The reviews for this Ritz made me hesitate booking for a little bit. I researched and chose this hotel...and cannot complain! I have stayed at many Ritz (Chicago, Palm Beach, Key Biscayne, Jamaica, New York, etc.) and this is comparable if not better. I am the pickiest of travelers and a hotel has to go out of its way to allow me to give them 5 stars. Rooms The rooms were clean, flat screen TVs, big comfy beds. In fact, everytime I would leave the room it would be re-cleaned. We had double bed room on the club level (highly recommended). Yes the hotel is close to the airport but you will not hear them in your room and barely notice anything at the pool (the approach pattern does not take planes over the hotel). Food BLT and El Mulino are my two favorite new restaurants. El Mulino was amazing! Best italian hands down and worth every penny. BLT was the same with an amazing steak! Both had magnificent service! The only food that is mediocre is the food by the pool during lunch. They should have a more fresh selection (fresh guacamole, etc.) I notified the chef that they should call the Key Biscayne Ritz for recipe for there burgers. We ate lunch and breakfast everyday at the Club Level Lounge, again I stress to get this you get unlimited drinks. Casino This is a great mid-sized casino. Perfect for the ritz. It is very well kept and has great dealers! Carlos, Mimi, etc. are the nicest people you will ever meet and will teach you how to play any game. They have $10 tables penny slots etc. As long as you are seated at a table they will bring you free drinks and a selection of sandwiches. The casino is open 24/7. Staff Staff were very good! Always greeted you by name. After everything they gave us they would ask if it was to our satisfaction. If it was not, you would not need to pay. Got a turkey burger by the pool, did not like it, refunded immediately. The staff are willing to go the extra mile to make sure you enjoy your trip. They def. are the best ritz staff I have ever experienced. Spa I got a massage. Nothing special. Pool Great large pool area. Clean. Always staff there to help. Beach Amazing! Overall Great hotel. Great time. Disregard all the negative reviews because this hotel is worth it. I am going back next month!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to renovate the facility.”
Reviews.Author: Greeker7
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ritz Carlton in San Juan the first of week in January and the first thing we noticed while walking to our room was that the facility was quit old. The lack of meticulous maintenance shows cracks on walls, dirty hallway carpets, and dusty floor boards. We got an ocean view room with a balcony. The room was clean but there were many thing which were broken, or old. All lamps were missing switches, the in room dining pages were ripped from the book, the shower head was from the 1990s, and the curtains in the room were dusty. The bathroom could also use a new drain, grout, and some deep cleaning. On a more positive note, the staff was providing excellent customer service as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time in PR”
Reviews.Author: KCW1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick and easy getaway before the holidays and we found it in San Juan. The Ritz was perfect great location, beautiful pool and beach. Puerto Rico is completely under-rated - We loved it !! Of course the hotel is expensive its a Ritz, but Walgreens and many other restaurants are walking distance from the hotel if you are looking for something less expensive than the hotels restaurants. Lunch is great at the hotel and so was the service, they are very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach service hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malihousa
Reviews.Content: We were there from 12/22 to 12/25/2010. We reserved a double bed but did not get one. We had to sleep in the King bed + sofa bed and a roller bed. They told us next day will be double bed room available for us and asked us to check back around 10AM. We did and they said the room will be ready for us but we have to wait until the room is ready. We checked back about 5-6 times until 5:30PM then we had our new room. We had wasted one day waiting for the new room besides that everything was good. The beach staffs' service was excellent. They were always helpful for locating beach chairs and installing the umbrella for you. They served "spring rolls" which were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Quality. Ritz Prices.”
Reviews.Author: herringtown
Reviews.Content: One word about this place: Meh. While the Ritz has many great properties, their resort offerings fall woefully short of the level of quality, service & facilities you'd expect from a premium brand. Billed as a resort, the Ritz San Juan is something in-between a glorified airport hotel and a mid-level beach resort. The clientele was mostly cheesy Jersey types who seemed glad to be overpaying for a mediocre pool, beach & disappointing dining options. For $1000/night, you can do much better; we originally tried to stay at the St. Regis (Bahia) but the place was fully booked 6 months in advance -- after driving there to play golf one day, I could see why. For the same price, the difference in the 2 "comparable" resorts was staggering. If you're looking for something more in the Four-Seasons-or-better vein, I recommend looking into the St. Regis. Or, if you're looking for a more authentic vacation experience, skip the main island altogether and research some of the more charming options in the nearby islands of Vieques & Culebra. Negatives aside, the staff at the Ritz was nothing but friendly, helpful & professional. Can't ding them for that.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: athena97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip in early December 2010. I was satisfied with my stay. I arrived at the Ritz early in the day and I extremely exhausted from a few days of back to back travelling. It was earlier than check-in time but the front desk agent quickly worked to find rooms that were ready for myself and my colleague. Despite our early arrival, I entered my room to find a welcome gift on my pillow. The room was clean and modern - nothing jaw dropping, but nice enough. I had a view of the pool -would have preferred a beach view but I didn't pay for/ask for any alternate view so it was fine with me. The concierge was always willing and able to assist with my requests during my stay. The beach access was absolutely wonderful. I didn't check out any of the signature restaurants because I preferred to venture out and get local cuisine, but I did try out the breakfast buffet and it was excellent - great quality, variety, and service. All in all, I was pretty pleased with my experience. The staff was extremely helpful and service-oriented, and although I was prepared to speak Spanish, seemingly everyone in the hotel spoke English. The location for me was great because it was convenient to the airport without being next door, yet an easy drive over the bridge to the business district. Visiting Old San Juan is fun but it's tough to stay in that area with the small roads and impossible traffic. For my purposes, Carolina was a good homebase to get to everywhere I was going. If you stay here though - unless you plan spend your entire vacation hopping between the beach and the casino (nothing wrong with that!) - you may want to rent a car. Only other notable point - I got a good rate in December but when planning my next business trip, I was unable to stay here due to the crazy prices. The rate literally increased 1000%, I know we're approaching the high season for Puerto Rico but $2,000 per night is a tad over the top! Hope the rates come down so I can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: M&CMother
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for five nights the week before Christmas. We were in Puerto Rico at the same time last year and stayed at the Marriott in Condado, and decided to try a different hotel and location. The Ritz is a beautiful hotel, and the rooms are very nice. Their emphasis is on service - everyone, from the pool attendants to the spa, to the front desk, was friendly and helpful. The hotel was at capacity during our stay there - the pool area was really big, but the chairs were taken by late morning. The beach area is nice, but rather small. It was cloudy half the days we were there, but we had rented a car at the airport and spent those days visiting Ponce, El Yunque and the Rio Camuy Caverns. (We ended up waiting 2 hours at the airport to get the car and then drove 5 minutes to the hotel! If we had to do it over again, we would have looked into renting the car fewer days, and from the hotel.) The airport is really close to the hotel, but I think the rooms had sound proofed windows - we couldn't hear any plane noise inside our room. Some tips: buy your morning coffee from Starbucks at the El San Juan - I got a mocha from the downstairs restaurant and paid $9! (with tip) The fridge in the room is a mini bar so there's very little room to your own food/drinks. It's a $20 cab ride from the Isla Verde area to Old San Juan - we tried taking the bus one day but apparently the service is very slow, particularly on weekends. All in all, we had a very nice stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: edyau
Reviews.Content: Would you believe it if I tell you 90% of the rooms are with only a glass framed window. Not just no balconies, but no way to open the "window". They call it Deluxe room and tell you"you can see the pool can't you?". Offered to pay for an upgrade since one of my children is clustrophobic but they said they are full and they refused to refund us. Ammeneties are so small and poor can't even find anywhere to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: joneo
Reviews.Content: On a positive note - friendly service, but pretty much ends there. A good hotel but not quite up to Ritz standards experienced elsewhere. Needs some live music at pool and in lobby, better shops and restaurants, and shuttles to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome again!”
Reviews.Author: macleodProvidence
Reviews.Content: Our son got married here, last year, and we decided to visit again. We had a wonderful stay and can't say enough about the Ritz. The staff is fantastic and the premises is beautiful. We'll be back for a week again, next December. Loved every minute. We were feeling lazy, so we basically beached it for the week. Went to the little Puerto Rican restaurants that you can walk to and enjoyed that, as well. One little note, however, be careful if you choose to eat at Il Mulano. Very expensive and overpriced, in our opinion. I would skip that next time. Otherwise, we are happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton made our 25th Anniversary truly special and awesome!”
Reviews.Author: catvillekit
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico 8 - 13 Dec 2010 to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The employees of the Ritz Carlton made our stay perfect. Everyone was truly helpful and very nice. They all bent over backwards to make our stay perfect. Our room was very nice and clean and well appointed. The hotel lobby, restaurants and outside areas were all very nice. Everything was kept very clean. The beach was very nice also and the sand was very soft. The servers were all very attentive, especially at the restaurant, BLT. At night, at the outdoor patio area, the small tree frogs would perform a virtual symphony every night. I really enjoyed listening to them. One of the best parts of our stay was our Concierge, Luis. He was truly a very kind person and very helpful. He really bent over backwards to provide everything we needed, from making reservations, to providing us with information on all the areas we wanted to visit, to taking pictures of us. He was the best! And since it was our 25th anniversary, he surprised us with a nice card and a picture of us that he had taken. Guest Relations at the hotel also gave us a nice picture frame for our anniversary; totally unexpected and very much appreciated. I don't have really anything negative to say about our stay. The only thing is that if you stay at the Ritz, do not expect bargain prices on the food. The food and drinks are all pretty expensive, so don't stay there if you want to save money. Everything I had read on Puerto Rico had said that driving in Puerto Rico was a challenge. That's an understatement. The Ritz has a large parking garage with plenty of parking and it is very convenient.. It is fairly expensive as guests pay 17.00 a night. We had rented a car and the first day we were there, we drove to Old San Juan. The local drivers don't really follow normal traffic rules. A stop sign is basically just a suggestion. The streets in Old San Juan are very narrow and really crowded with cars all over. We had kind of a hard time finding the parking lots. But once we got parked, we walked all over the city and that was alot of walking, but we really enjoyed it. The next day, we drove to Ponce. As we found out later, it would have been better to go on the weekend since traffic was a nightmare on Friday with everyone going to and from work. The trip back to the hotel that day was very harrowing and we only arrived safely by the grace of God. We went to El Junque rain forest on Sunday with a tour. I would not have gone if we had to drive ourselves. We ended up getting on a tour from the hotel, so that was alot better than driving ourselves. All in all, our trip was wonderful and I would definitely stay at this hotel again or another Ritz Carlton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “SPA Treatments Were Very Good”
Reviews.Author: headwinds01
Reviews.Content: I was only at this hotel for a night but my impressions were that the hotel was well maintained, and that the staff was excellent. I was really impressed by the expert spa treatment which was entitled "Restorative Treatment" - I had a really knee problem prior to landing in San Juan and while I had taken measures to get it back in working order, I felt some relief after having this treatment. I also had a mini facial (25 minutes) and it was wonderful; I was introduced to the "Stone Crop" anti-aging/anti-stress products - if you know what I'm talking about, but for those who don't , it is an all natural substance akin to the aloe plant. Very soothing and I swear my skin looks better. It could also be that the 83 degree weather in San Juan felt pretty darned good (knowing that the East Coast was getting hammered with snow). All in all, the spa was the highlight.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: twinsane
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night get away. Booked through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts. Upon check in we were told that there were no upgrades available even though it is supposed to be a standard benefit of the Amex FHR program. This is the first time that a FHR hotel has not given us an upgraded room and what made it worse was that we had to wait almost 15 minutes while they checked for the upgrade. After we finally got up to the room we found that we were given a room with 2 double beds instead of 1 king. After waiting 10 minutes more, we were told by the representative that the booking was for a room with 2 double beds. I explained that they were incorrect and showed them the print out of our reservation confirmation which showed the king size bed. After 10 more minutes we were given a king size suite instead of the standard room. When I asked why we weren't given the upgraded room upon check in, I was told that the hotel does not give upgrades unless there is a problem. After check in, we had a very nice time at the hotel. It is a beautiful property with a great pool and beach area. The room was nice, but the bed was old and uncomfortable. We would expect some type of "heavenly bed" at a hotel charging such high prices. Our room included buffet breakfast each day and while it was good, it was not as good as any of the other Ritz Carltons we have stayed at. We ate at the BLT Steak restaurant 2 times and while the food was good, the service was pretty bad. Prices at the restaurant and bars were stupid. If you don't mind the high prices, lackluster service and the sound of airplanes, the hotel made a very easy get away as it is only a 5 minute taxi cab from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not really for us”
Reviews.Author: MisterDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ritz Carlton San Juan for 8 nights in dec 2010. The staff was friendly and the rooms were nice but I have to say the service was not 5 star. We are not really bothered about star ratings etc but when your paying the rates for 5 Star, the service needs to match. We repeatedly didn't get towels and wash clothes when the room was cleaned. The room was well stocked with coffee,towels etc when we checked in but each time they cleaned the room we got less replaced. Also the location is VERY close to the airport so the whole day on the beach you hear and see planes landing and taking off. The restaurants and bars on site were overpriced ie martinis were $15 and across the street the same drink was $5, didn't even try room service! Beautiful grounds,lobby and pool etc just not worth the money in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at The Riz”
Reviews.Author: travel561
Reviews.Content: I recently had the displeasure of staying at The Ritz in San Juan, Puerto Rico. I had read the reviews and evaluated, it was not like a true Ritz but more like a Westin Hotel which would have been fine. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were forced to wait in a very long extended line for over 20 minutes and instead of being checked in quietly, I felt as if I was at a cattle round up. It was far from relaxing. I then proceed to check into the room and the carpeting was not clean, the shower curtain was stained and for an added touch in the adjacent chamber where the commode was located was an extra bulb on the commode in case the l;ights went out. I must say it added a self service quality to the aura of the room. I then proceed to the overcrowded pool with the stained mats covering the chairs. After waiting awhile, it was self service for the towels and then a pool boy did put this on our chairs after we beckoned to him to assist us. However it was so crowded and so dirty that everytime, I got up from the lounge chair the dirtly glasses someone left on the next table would spill all over me. I figured order a Margarita. It was like an imposition and I did recieve my margarita with no cocktail napkins. After waiting 15 minutes, I was given napkins. I figured maybe the beach would work - it should be called more of a mud puddle and instead of a relaxing atomoshpere I thought I must have jumped into a muddy beach.. That everning, I figured relax - have a martini and I had to wait 15 minutes to ask someone to wait on us. After that we had what I thought would be a very pleasant evening at Il Molino. Wrong again, there were screaming children and I do not blame the children but parents who show no consideration for others The level of the restaurant was not the quality of it's New York counterpart.. Ok - the evening passed and the next day, I took a shower and reached for a towel - it was makeup stained, tried another also, makeup stained and as previously mentioned the shower curtain had stains on it too inside and out at least consuistent.. We all checked out and the best value was the La Concha Hotel that I will describe. with a hip cool vibe and excellent service. This Ritz should not be classified as a true Ritz because I would not put it on the level of a Holiday Inn - At least Holiday Inns are very clean and the staff always, attentive. If you are looking for relaxtion, clean accomondations, attentive service, great rooms, this is not the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would go again”
Reviews.Author: MrsfromNYC
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 stayed on the Club level and it was a wonderful experience. The food and drinks in the Club level lounge are included in the cost of the rooms. The service was amazing. The staff were warm, competent and bent over backwards to make our stay enjoyable. The buffet in the Club level lounge is perfect for breakfast and lunch, and drinks and hor deurves before dinner. Not enough food to consider it a meal at dinnertime, so book a reservation for dinner (I didn't love Il Mulino). The weather was consistently around 80 degrees and dropped to about 70 at night so you needed a light sweater (the a/c in the casino is quite chilly). The sun was a little iffy at this time of year and best to get your sunbathing in before 3pm when the sun starts to go behind the palm trees. A bit overcast at times and dark by 6pm. The people of Puerto Rico were warm and friendly, from the taxi drivers to the hotel staff. Ritz Carlton did a wonderful job. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years and the service is really top notch. The property is lovely, pool and pool service excellent, food great and the Spa is very good. AMEX PTS upgrade and got a "Club" room which was an outstanding value. I would not stay anywhere else in San Juan, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler41846
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Ritz. It was pretty, clean and the service was excellent. The beach was beautiful. I tend to be on the picky side so I am not sure why other people have complained about this hotel. I can't think of one negative thing about it. We ate there and also at some local spots. Both were excellent. The people in Puerto Rico are friendly and we would return to this hotel. It was an extremely relaxing 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GaTxNy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in a few of the Ritz properties and I say with honesty that this hotel lives up to the brand. Wondeful experience! Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Don't miss restaurants Pamela's and Uvva, worth the 5-8 minute cab ride since both have on the beach (feet in sand) seating.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: arliess2010
Reviews.Content: We love the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. They have the perfect location on the beach, and it's only minutes away from the airport. We go for our anniversary every year and have done so for the last five years. They greet us by name every year, and the service is very personal. It's also within walking distance of the other hotels/casinos, and it's a short cab ride into town. There are wonderful restaurants in the hotel and also in town, and the hotel itself has a small and elegant casino. The pool is wonderful though gets very crowded. And it's steps from the beach as well. It's a beautiful paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Third Times a Charm”
Reviews.Author: JayBPlainview_NY
Reviews.Content: My wife and decided after visting the Ritz Carlton twice before without our kids that we should take them along. As my expierences before were amazing I did not expect anything less. I was right. Time after time this place and it's employees are just fantastic. Where else but at the Ritz do you get a smile a hello and a greeting by name from all employees. BLT steak as usual did not dissapoint. Jennifer and Bertha and Mares treated us like royalty and family> I can not wait for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ritz Experience!”
Reviews.Author: PBS99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan and enjoyed every moment. The staff was incredible and our every need was not only met, it was anticipated. Our room had a view of the front of the hotel and parking lot and was very basic. The windows were double-paned hurricane windows so the noise from the airport (the airport is very, very, very close to the hotel) did not bother us. It rained quite a bit while we were there but we couldn't even hear the rain right outside our window. The housekeeping staff cleaned and restocked it twice a day and we always had fresh towels, coffee, tea, water, etc. Our only problem in the room was the fact that the shower curtain liner is made from fabric. When we would shower the water would leak through the curtain and drip onto the floor! The housekeeping staff replaced the shower curtain twice, but we had the problem all week. We would simply tell the housekeeping staff when we left our room that the shower had leaked and it would be cleaned up upon our return. The wait staff in the lobby lounge and restaurants were incredible. They could not do enough to make our stay as lovely as possible. I wasn't impressed with the hotel gift shop or the staff there. The woman stood behind the counter the entire time we were shopping. Not once did she offer to help us with our shopping. The spa was FANTASTIC!! My massage was SO good that I was almost asleep. That has never happened to me before. I wanted to have another body treatment but we ran out of time. The pool and beach area were gorgeous with plenty of pool attendants to get us towels, make "pillows" for our lounge chairs and bring us ice water. The property is gated and there is a door which requires key access. This was for guest safety as leaving the room at night was not recommended. During the day, it was gorgeous!! We ate at BLT Steakhouse which was delicious but very expensive! The casino was a lot of fun, but as we are not gamblers we didn't spend much time or money there. We did manage to win a little bit of money which made it fun!! Overall, I would give our stay at the Ritz Carlton Spa & Casino San Juan 10 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “not that impressed so overpriced”
Reviews.Author: beachLover8484
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way overpriced and needs to be updated for the prices the Ritz charges. First of all "the ritz carlton" just ruined their name with this hotel, i do not mind paying but i demand quality. This hotel was nice but not that nice, where i would not go back. There are other hotels in Puerto Rico that are a lot nicer and newer. It all started when i arrived, i reserved a particular room and got something else instead, they told me that my room was taken, the manager ended up upgrading me bacause of the mix up.We had a club level room which we had acess to the club level , that had a nice layout of variety of food. When walking down the halls it felt like i was in a cheaper hotel, the rooms were clean but very old, the spa so old, it looked like it belonged in a 1980's movie, spa was so so and so overpriced, nice pool and beach, but i have been to better places. The only thing that i liked about this hotel was the retaurants. We had dinner at BLT and that was good, the food was a little to rich but service and dinner were good. We also tried il Mullino, which was very good, the food and service was excellent. I would not stay at this hotel ever again, not for the prices that they are charging, i felt it is a ripp-off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Scarletknight1766
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fabulous trip to Puerto Rico. We booked the Ritz through Costco and got a great deal. We loved our stay at the Ritz. The service was outstanding. Every one greeted us with a smile, we walked up to the front desk with a question and they knew our name. Clearly the employees are encouraged to take the time with each guest and make them feel special. The food is very expensive, typical hotel prices. You're in Puerto Rico, don't go to a steakhouse. Find some good Puerto Rican food. If you stay here, or in the area you must try the mojito. Amy at the lobby bar makes an outstanding one, worth every penny. The entire hotel was clean and well kept. Our room was taken care of and very spacious. The beach was very nice, and the staff did a great job. Loved the pool too. We went as a couple, but we would take the kids back. We walked across the street for dinner at Metropol, very good, and walked to a local diner for breakfast one morning. There is nothing wrong with the area around the hotel, it is not "ghetto" at all. Loved my stay at the Ritz, can't wait to go back. Rent a car from Enterprise located in the hotel, very reasonable prices. There is so much to see in PR, check out Old San Juan, and El Yunque. Also, take a drive up the road to Pinones for some great Puerto Rican food, it is a bunch of shacks on the side of the road, outstanding food. Not a place a tourist would stop in at, a friend who is a local told us about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but be aware...”
Reviews.Author: lilsagekp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the staff was very friendly, and the establishment was nicely kept. Which is great, but how can they afford to do this? Oh, that's right, we were constantly being overcharged for what we did order/buy, and charged for things we didn't order/buy! If you stay here you need to check your tabs closely. Also, when we checked out, we were charged for items taken from the in-room refridgerator. We didn't take anything out, so we got this item removed from the final bill and then received an email reflecting this change only to be charged yet again for the same reason but for even more money on our credit card AFTER we checked out and had returned home! Unbelievable... Lastly, the walls are VERY thin, you can here all activity in the rooms next to yours :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay, Great Customer Service, Clean & Fun!”
Reviews.Author: alphaTHEgreat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff was friendly, we ventured to a bunch of other hotels to see what they were like, and Ritz Carlton by far surpassed it. Great eating places inside, Casino gives free drinks (not the cheap watered-down stuff, I'm talking REAL delicious drinks!), and also gave out free ham/cheese croissants at casino. There was live music on one of the days and the hotel pool and access to the beach was clean and very well kept up. Only problem was the surrounding area, it is in a VERY disgusting/ghetto area, did not feel safe leaving the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - not the best area for strolling around”
Reviews.Author: thelocalmediaguy
Reviews.Content: This was a first trip to Puerto Rico / San Juan, and we're glad we took it, and we're glad we stayed at the Ritz. Despite what you might read in some reviews, this is HARDLY a threadbare, poor substitute of the Ritz standard that some have asserted in a few of these reviews. It is not an "ultra" luxurious hotel, but it is a well-appointed, up-to-date luxury hotel with great pool and beach, two fine restaurants and one that's fine for breakfast / dinner. The casino is "fine" - if you're into them. The staff is attentive and professional. What could be better? #1 Location in relation to the most popular San Juan attraction - Old San Juan It's a bit of a hike to get from the hotel to the city's best attraction. Not a huge hassle. The cab fare is about $20 - not too bad, and cabs are plentiful. Also, if you do want to rent a car, perhaps to drive the El Junque rainforest - about an hour away, there is an on-site Enterprise rental location that charges fair rates. #2 The neighborhood - not the worst part of San Juan, but not the best either When you take the (very short) cab ride from the airport, you'll probably pass the "Cockfights" arena - walking distance to the hotel. "Nuff said? #3 We thought the rates were good, but you get dinged on food expense and there are not too many decent alternatives close by If you have breakfast for 4 at the Ritz, you'll be plunking down ~$100 (+ tax and tip). It's a little thing, but there is no free coffee service for early risers. #4 San Juan's "contradiction" a tourist destination vs. a real-life city with real stresses San Juan is partially "built" for tourists, but is not the vacationer pure-play that many other island are. It's also NOT the Dominican or Jamaica with the grinding poverty that is kept at armâ€™s-length when youâ€™re sealed up in some resort. As a little example, the day before we arrived, the FBI sent in 750 agents from the States to join with the agents stationed in Puerto Rico to roundup and arrest over 130 Puerto Rican police and corrections officers who are accused of providing protection to drug dealers. Also, the total murder rate stood at about 750 through mid-October, which is about 10 times the total number of homicides in the greater Boston metropolitan area. Are you likely to come to an untimely end in Puerto Rico as a tourist (assuming you're not completely stupid)? - Of course not, but when you ride through or by certain parts of the city, or even rural areas well outside San Juan, you are constantly reminded that you're somewhere between the "First" and "Third" worlds. Bottom line: Do go. Don't worry if you're booking at the Ritz. There are some other large all-inclusive resorts that are an hour+ ride from the airport - if you don't want to negotiate the complexities of San Juan. If you go, and even if you do stay at one of the resorts, try to stay a day or two in or close to San Juan, and DO walk though Old San Juan. It's a great part of the city, with attractions like the great fort El Moro that date back to the 1500's. There are also great restaurants there (with plenty of fine and honest recommendations on Trip Advisor).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but next time would stay at the El San Juan”
Reviews.Author: karenandsteve
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel. Many complained it is not up to "The Ritz Carlton" standards. I thought it was a lovely resort. Beautiful, clean, staff was exceptional. The beach was nice and water was calm. The only complaint I had was about the housekeeping staff. The first night they did a wonderful job, but the rest of our stay the only thing they did was make our bed. They never disposed of empty beer bottles and wine bottles. They never left fresh towels. and we never received turn down service. The couple we traveled with had all of these things and were very happy with their housekeeping. We didn't eat here b/c the prices were so marked up and all the night life was down the street at the Waldorf Astoria's El San Juan hotel. If I return to PR I will be going there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely common areas, but common rooms”
Reviews.Author: anchmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days at the Ritz - there were both low points and high points. The location to the airport is great - about 10/15 minutes and $11. The lobby and common areas of the property are also very inviting. Kudos overall goes to the staff (excluding front desk staff, which I'll get to). The doormen, bell staff, security guards, Club Level staff, etc., were just lovely. I especially appreciated that they went to the effort of learning our names. We stayed on floor 9 (not sure if that's meant to have nicer rooms) and the room was just average. It was very clean and the coffee machine was good, but it wasn't what I would expect from the Ritz. (I've had nicer, more modern rooms at Holiday Inn). The pillows were also very regular ... even the non-feather request I had was met with a very limp pillow. Other reviewers mention that this is an older property .... I could see that from the quality of the rooms. My biggest concern was the level of service at the front desk. It took a very long time to check in, and once we were served, it was not adequate. We were upsold a room on Club level for $150 per night for a party of three (plus $30/night in tax that wasn't mentioned!). The desk staff however did not check the reservation to realise that we had two rooms, so once we agreed and she realised her mistake, all of a sudden the charge was $300 and she didn't even bring it to our attention. When we were queried the mistake (ie, $300 instead of $150), it didn't even seem to matter that the mistake was made by the hotel. I had to ask to speak with a manager before any concessions were made. I haven't stayed at a Ritz before, but I would have expected better customer service - either the mistake shouldn't have happened in the first place, or the guest would not be made to pay for the mistake of the staff. The hotel food is expensive as others point out (that's why we upgraded to Club level), but unless you drink enough it might not be worth it. The food in the Club Room was just average (mainly pastry, bread and cheese, with a few featured proteins) although the friendliness of the staff was exceptional and it was nice to have internet access. Overall it was a good stay, but not necessarily value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSC
Reviews.Content: We has a wonderful stay at this property. The grounds are gorgeous. The service was a little slow at times but perhaps it was due to the unexpected complete capacity of the hotel... The mojitos in the lobby bar are FABULOUS. The rooms were typical Ritz rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: princessinbk
Reviews.Content: Not the average ritz carlton but it was very nice. The ground are beautiful and maintained. The overall hotel is clean including room. We had room service and turn down service everyday although turn down service was a little late some nights. The food is very pricey so I recomend venturing out to eat some nights. If you make a quick right at hotel entrance there is a strip of hotels and resturants. The staff at the hotel was nice and helpful but I have stay at hotel where the staff was more personable. I had to contact the front desk twice while I was there and both times I was placed on hold for about 15 minutes. Once I was so tired of holding I hung up and went down to the front desk which did not appear to be busy. The hotel is 5 minutes from the airport so at times you can hear the planes however in your room it is not loud. Our room was facing the pool/beach so we did not really hear it. I recommend staying at this hotel if you find a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KimPatton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you're on a long holiday weekend!! I found the overall experience to be very relaxing, the facility is in prime condition and certainly met our expectations. The staff was VERY Friendly and more than willing to assist in anyway possible. Please make a point of getting to know Orlando & Robert -both are bartenders - funny, kind, knowledgeable. Should you go to Puerto Rico in October - expect RAIN - a lot of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Indescribable experience!”
Reviews.Author: Site1020
Reviews.Content: I stayed during September, I just donâ€™t have words. First Carlos greeted us as royalty (every time we walked by him) and then presented us to somebody in the lobby, the nice lady escorted us to the front desk. the front desk looked extremely busy plus we were so anxious, to be check in, while standing about one or two minutes a lady comes from the back of the front desk out of nowhere takes the last computer available and after a few seconds she lifted up her face and with a delicate smile she points at us and calls us by our name .Our name! How bizarre is that? In a moment of shock I even hesitate thinking she was calling another guest but yes. It was for us. She even was aware of our honeymoon, and for that she gave us a beautiful jr suite. We really donâ€™t remember her name we just remember her nice big black RB eyeglasses and that her name started with J. We call her Jay. She gave us advice on places to eat and to hang out. Truly the best check in of our lives. After that we were again escorted to our room, the bellman was really attentive and gave us a lot of tips for our stay. The concierge staff its awesome and extremely helpful. Thanks for advising Marmalade and Bombinera a great accent on our trip. Luis is out of this planet it felt like he was 24 hours on duty I mean he was everywhere, lobby , pool, beach ,etc. On the day of our check out he was even in front desk. I mean where they get these people , itâ€™s just fantastic . The hotel yes looks a little old fashion, boring and not to technological for our taste but the staff is truly unique. Our name was always said and it felt like we were so important that I donâ€™t think we will ever feel the same in any other hotel it felt like Hollywood home.

Reviews.Title: “At your service”
Reviews.Author: iutami
