Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is classy. The staff were all very accommodating and wanted to make sure that all the guests had everything they wanted. By the pool, Frances and Jarissa were always attentive. The pool staff would bring around complimentary water, nuts, small sample smoothies... we never had to leave the pool. Luis from concierge hooked us up with reservations at local restaurants and clubs. And all the staff answer your requests with "My pleasure" or "At your service." My friends and I felt like visiting royalty. Only downside to the hotel is that there is no swim up bar. However, the staff brought our drinks right to the side of the pool while we floated along on the hotels floats. Also, they dont have Queen size beds in the double rooms, but we managed anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: LCB75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the property in early, October. I don't know how anyone could say they didn't get outstanding service at the Hotel or its restaurants. There are always employees who have a bad day, and strange situations that can happen while traveling. However, from start to finish the employees at the Ritz were friendly, helpful and attentive to guest needs. Front desk made sure you had the right rate, room and needs met. Housekeeping came twice a day to clean up and give new towels, water, amenities, etc. Concierge would help give the best advise possible. Servers were always around and made sure you were taken care of. The beach and pool were very nice. Great place to lounge around on a warm day. The airplane noise never bothered me, especially if you get a room facing in toward the pool or beach, as I never heard a plane while inside at all. You would hear a plane take off on occasion when outside, but not really distracting. Also, keep in mind you are in a largely Spanish speaking country, so some staff may have a little trouble communicating. Especially if you are rude and pushy yourself. Some staff spoke only English. Did see a few Latin American travelers who were demanding and would not wait for answers or help, but I see that everywhere. The hotel was very nice. A little wear outside from being in a tropical environment, but expect this anywhere in the tropics. Il Molino (italian restaurant at hotel) was amazing, but very pricey). BLT Steakhouse was very good as well. The Lobby lounge had some very good appetizers (especially the prime rib flatbread special), and has 1/2 price drinks from 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm. Helps cut down on the $9 regular price. Go next door to Spice (fun bar) for $5.50 drinks at night. Hotel can be expensive (but I found a deal for 2 nights free). However, I believe it was the best in the area. I think most people who complain just need to relax (it's a vacation). You will get better results and have more fun if you do. Last note (Don't eat outside the hotels in the Isla Verde area). Most places are terrible (a few mediocre), although I did hear a few good things about Mi Casita. If you want decent local food, go to Old San Juan (Dragonfly, Aquaverde, Raices, Cafe Puerto Rico), or Ajili MÃ³jili in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Classy beachfront resort”
Reviews.Author: NawlinsNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Ritz has a very convenient location, 10 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from Old San Juan. It has an elegant and large pool with fountains and plenty of places to sit. The beach is the biggest draw. We spent two days in lounge chairs enjoying the ocean and rum cocktails brought to us by the attentive staff. We took surfing lessons with Mo and had a blast. If you've ever considered learning to surf, definitely try it here! The hotel has a beachfront bar that serves lunch. I'd say one of the main downsides is there is no option to dine outdoors for dinner. The two dinner restaurants are BLT Steak (good though very pricey - a piece of snapper with no sides for $30) and Il Mulino, a charming Italian that serves lots of complimentary antipastos. Rooms are simple - comfortable but lacking a wow factor. The windows are extremely sound proof - we never heard the planes, though we did hear the people next door a little. This is a great place for a relaxing long weekend at the beach. You can enjoy the beach, pool, casino, fitness center, tennis, surfing and multiple restaurants without leaving the property, or take a short cab ride into Old San Juan to explore the picturesque streets, visit the impressive forts and try delicious Puerto Rican food! Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time at the ritz”
Reviews.Author: Danspeanut
Reviews.Content: stayed at the ritz carlton san juan for 3 nights in early October. The hotel is an older property, and is showing some signs of wear. We got a great rate for the room, but had I spent rack rates I would have been upset at some little details. However, the service was fantastic. Everyone treated us like royalty...from the spa to the cocktail waitstaff to the restaurants and the casino. It was wonderful. The property is on one of the nicest beaches in the San Juan area and, while it was near the airport, we never heard the planes fly overhead. One thing we did hear, unfortunately, we the loud people who were in the room next to us. Management took care of it right away, but it wasn;t exactly the caliber of people one would expect from a hotel that generally draws and older crowd. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants except for at the pool, but we had great dinners at Metropol (Cuban) and Platos (puerto rican) down the street. All in all--if you can get a good rate this is a fabulous hotel with excellent service. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best one I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DougGroveCity
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport but very little noise. Rooms clean and comfortable. As you would expect the bars and restaurants are pricey. Casino is on site and has wide choice of games. Security is good, you can only get off the elevators on your floor, scanners read your room key and do not allow you to push any floor button other than the one you are staying on. Probably bad for friends and families that are not on the same floor. Friendly staff but service was sometimes very slow. Biggest complaint is the towels for the pool, we could not believe that many had large stains on them. We had trouble finding a towel that did not have a stain, sometimes would go through a dozen or so before you get a "clean" towel, that is not the Ritz Carlton standard that I expect. A number of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance to the hotel. Language was not an issue either in the hotel or at the nearby establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Real Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Elahee
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we noticed that the property wasn't up to the typical standard and design or th Ritz Carlton brand. We were eventually told that the property was formerly a Holiday Inn. The service was fine but the architecture and property while on a very nice beach was very disappointing. Our original room was a very standard room with a view of the parking lot and runway 4 at the San Juan airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterGal2010
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and provided a fun getaway. I did not get the same intimate feeling I usually get when staying at a Ritz Carlton. The staff were nice and accommodating, but I don't feel that extra something special you usually get when you stay at the Ritz was present. I liked all the nice restaurants there. There was a variety to choose from without having to leave the grounds. Most of the food did not seem typically Puerto Rican, but it was very good. The outdoor cafe serves good desserts. Make sure you check when rainy season is. The pool areas is very nice and the beach is kept well. This is a good place to come for a long weekend when you want to escape the cold.

Reviews.Title: “wife said it was like a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: mudduck300
Reviews.Content: the pool, the view,the service were top notch.we never got charged extra for anything from the tennis court where they treated us like we were in a tournement. they brought out a cart with towels, a huge water barrel and even blew off the court amazing!!pool is shallow but huge they had a net and a beach ball staff always friendly remembered our name at the door. the beach is truly fantastic we had an ocean view 9th floor it was stunning ,the frog sounds outside sounded like a disney ride very cool!!

Reviews.Title: “It's only okay...”
Reviews.Author: kim_kim133
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only okay. As far as the rooms go, dont expect anything special because of the money you are paying. The rooms on the club level look like any other room and because lower rate hotels have upped their game, you will not be impressed. Will you get a robe? Yes. Slippers? Yes. A nice bathroom? yes. but I'm not impressed. I've stayed on the club level at many RC's and maybe because it's the carribean I found the staff to be way too layed back and comfortable for my taste. To wait 10 minutes to be asked what I would like for a drink is a farce at these rates. At any given time there are more than 3 people on staff in the club lounge who sit around - well, lounging. At other club lounges, I have tipped the staff at the end of my stay almost a hundred dollars for their attention to detail. Not here. Save your money and find a hotel with a club level-immendities. Seriously. The club lounge staff seriously lacks professionalism and polish. I would suggest getting some training from the RC club staff in Atlanta, Chicago Montego Bay, San Franciso. My room smelled of smoke and had a huge burn in the carpet as well. TIRED. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stowne1
Reviews.Content: We tried the reconnect package and loved the hotel. The room was $289 plus free breakfast and a $100 per day resort credit. The location of the hotel is good but it is a $21 taxi ride to Old San Juan. It is close to the airport. You cannot hear the noise from inside your room but you can hear it from the beach. It did not bother me one bit. The beach is fabulous and perfect if you have kids, but there were not many kids at the hotel. The beach is flat and wide directly in front of the hotel. The pool is a bit small but very nice. The patio is great. The pool servers take so long to get you a drink you would think it is an all inclusive resort. They are however very nice and always say "my pleasure!" I bought beers at the market 10 minutes away and got no flack for drinking them right at the pool. In fact they brought me ice for my little bucket! The rooms were very nice, but the halls leading to the rooms felt a little Holiday Inn. The beach, pool, and common areas were all very Ritz. There are two restaurants in the hotel. The Italian restaurant was bleh. BLT was fabulous! The bar in the lobby, felt like a bar in the lobby. It did not have the nice club feel of most Ritz properties. The El San Juan is walking distance. They have an fabulous lobby scene with live music. However the rooms are crappy and loud. I advise that you stay at the Ritz and walk over to the El San Juan hotel for the night life. There are also tons of great bars on the way there if you need a breather beer. Overall I loved this resort and I am planing a return trip in January. On a side note the Casino was adaquate with all the table games you may need. I am not a gambler, so not much help there.

Reviews.Title: “where not to stay”
Reviews.Author: pink0525
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located about 1/2 mile from the end of the airport, all you hear are airplanes taking off all day. there is no security at the pool area which allows all of the public to take up residence at the pool.People where having items stolen pool side,not what to expect from a ritz.. Reminds me of a remodeled Holiday Inn, don't let the pictures fool you.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary and I read the reviews for alot of Hotels in San Juan and after reading the reviews from people who stayed at the Ritz I decided I would give it a try. When we arrived I expected to be WOW'd because it was a Ritz you think your going to do alot of Ohhhing and Ahhhhing and I didn't the hotel was nice don't get me wrong I just expected MORE..... But what they didn't have in the lavish look of the hotel they made up for in SERVICE everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff were Friendly, Helpful and always smiling. The hotel upon arrival greeted us by name and always made us feel welcome and stressed that if we needed anything to simply ask and they meant it. I called a couple of times for things and it was done right away they even but rose petals all over our bed and shaped them in the form of a heart and there was a card Thanking us for staying and sharing our special moment with them it was really touching. I would DEFINETLY stay at the Ritz in San Juan again!

Reviews.Title: “"Quite Simply, The BEST Resort Property I've EVER Stayed At" (Room 945)”
Reviews.Author: goriajk
Reviews.Content: I was on a Air-Hotel package from United Vacations, we chose this resort from a list. Quite Simply, The Ritz Carlton San Juan was not just a wise choice, but the best choice. From check-in on Sat. Sep. 18th to our departure on Fri. Sep. 24th, our entire family was treated with respect and given so many options in terms of activities that we weren't able to do it all. My parents were given a room next to where my brother and I were staying (Rooms 945 & 947) and the 2 Double Beds were great. The view of the Airport on one end and the beach on another was cool. The Pool and Spa was sensational, spent many evenings at the jacuzzi after our daily sightseeing activities (we had a rental car) Overall, From Daniela at the front desk to the staff at Concierge to the folks at BLT Steakhouse, thanks for a great stay. Best Stay EVER at any Hotel Resort - I will be filling out the card to mail back. Also, pictures are coming. You have to GO HERE. JG

Reviews.Title: “unexpected delightful trip”
Reviews.Author: cathysuesmith
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised with the accomodatiins and stay at ritz carlton san juan puerto rico , June 2010. Traveled with my husband and people from his company, my kids and some of their kids. I had read mixed reviews about this place but sometimes you have to see for yourself. The beach is beautiful with delicious refreshing orange water by the towel stand to quench your thirst. Pool is wonderful. Restaurants are expensive. We paid for club restaurant which is offered at the hotel but not too many people know about. The person that booked our trip never mentioned it. I read about it online and inquired when I got there. If you are traveling with kids, teens, I recommend this. Jessica, one of the managers here on club level went out of her way to accomodate us , even sent my girls necklaces that were freebies but I forgot to get after we got home. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: shoelessrose
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very accommodating as we were traveling with a small child. They also gave us a special treat for our anniversary. The hotel was spotless- which is huge for me- and after traveling 8 hrs to get there- it was easy to begin unwinding and settle in to our vacation. The hotel pool was stunning and the staff was incredibly attentive and helpful. Make sure to have the breakfast buffet at least once at the restaurant downstairs. Its $26 a person- but the food is incredible and its all you can drink mango mimosas (yum!) which put a nice spin on our morning! The beach is beautiful but be careful when ordering drinks as they add up quickly- 2 mojitos came out to $37 with tip (ouch!) One tip- if you plan on going into old san juan- a cab cost $22 and the bus is only 75 cents! Its a great way to see the city and interact with locals. We had such a wonderful time and highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool, luxurious get away, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: KarenMG_10
Reviews.Content: Pool & Beach - The pool is clean, beautiful and warm. My husband, our 3-year old son and I were in the pool all the time. They have floating lounges so it's fun to float around the pool and the falling water from the lion sculptures is relaxing and keeps the noise level (voices) at a minimum. We've been on Mexican vacations where the pool is so cold that I don't go in the water at all and our little boy can only stay in for a short time without shivering, but this pool was wonderful. The water at the beach was also warm and the beach attendants were quick to set up chairs, umbrellas and towels.Food and beverage service at the pool and beach was great. Room - Our room faced the pool and ocean and was spacious and clean. The bed was super comfortable with Frette linens and down pillows and comforter. It was also quiet for the most part and dark so we all slept really well. Food - All of the food at the hotel is expensive. A latte is $8 at the hotel (they don't have a coffee shop, need to go to the restaurant), a mojito at the pool was $14 and on the kids menu breakfast was $12 for 1 egg and 1 strip of bacon! I have to say I thought that was rediculously overpriced. Right around the corner from the hotel (less than 5 minute walk) is Denny's (kids meal for $3) and Piu Bello offered reasonably priced breakfast so we opted for that most days. At the hotel, we had dinner at Il Mulino (Italian restaurant) and the atmosphere and service was great but the food was only average. We thought it wasn't worth the price. We also ate at BLT (steakhouse at the hotel) and the food was fantastic...the bill was over $200 but worth it. The concierge also recommended several other good nearby restaurants. Walgreens is also right around the corner from the hotel so we stocked up on some snacks for the week. Spa - The spa is lovely, don't miss out on the complimentary seated chair massage available anytime to anyone (don't need to be a spa guest). The massage is done at a chair near the reception desk inside the spa and by a massage therapist. I went twice, but they wouldn't mind if you show up every day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but not one of the better Ritz properties”
Reviews.Author: cabinetmonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with a great pool but it is starting to show it's age. Things like joints in the spacious bathrooms are not being maintained, the towels in the SPA and pool are getting tired. Millwork is or never was painted very nicely. None of which really affects one's stay, but just be aware. The staff is friendly and helpful, unless you are a impatient or demanding jerk. Stand around screaming that you don't like the bed or want a bottle of boons' farm NOW, or don't understand why your room isn't ready when you get there at 1:07 pm is going to get you butkus. Be aware that check in is 4pm and check out is 12pm. It's possible to get in earlier but don't count on it, especially in high season. This is a full service hotel so drinks are going to cost over $10, room service will cost more than going to your local diner and not taste as good as grandma's . The bar area/ living room is a nice place to get a lite dinner or snack in a casual setting. Orlando the bartender is funny and knowledgeable about the local area. BLT and iL Molino are the two restaurants. They are typical steakhouses, water will cost $7 , steaks will be $40 and if you want a veggie that will cost too, just like ate every steak house in America. That's how steak houses work. The dining spaces are fairly small and have gentlemen's club like feel. If you want a slick , white marble Italian experience then La Piccola at the Waldorf (formerly the Wyndham) is your place. If you want action with your steak the Palm is in the same hotel. Other eating options outside but nearby the hotel are Metropol across the street for PR /cuban cusine. Service is hit or miss. If you speak Spanish and don't look like a tourist your chances for good service are better but not guaranteed. There is a Denny's about a block down to the right but it's nothing special. Piu Bello is just past the Wallgreens also on the right and has great orange juice and a good breakfast selection with a cheerful staff. Pickup a local map there too. They also have lunch and lite dinner selections served all day too. Platos is also nearby for local dishes and is pretty good, not spectacular, and service friendly, competent but leisurely, I think the kitchen is tiny. Live music on the weekends. Casino is handy , but the one at the Waldorf is better. Business center is on of the best around in my opinion. Isla Verde is a bit remote, you'll need a car / bus/ cab to take you to see anything but the beach. A cab into old town is @ $20-25. You can get the T5 city bus for $.75 outside to take you to old town. It's fine as long as you don't come-go during rush hour when it's very crowded and can take an hour. Expect to wait a while for a bus as this is not Germany or Switzerland.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: ehorsman
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds, lobby and pool area are beautiful. The Concierge staff was wonderful; always extremely helpful. My only problem was the room seemed stuffy and stale. I think if they replace the carpet with nice tiled floors, it would seem cleaner. Don't get me wrong the room was always tidy and neat - I am just a little germaphobic (sp) when it comes to staying in hotels. I wish there were better choices of restaurants in the hotel. Il Mulino was nice a bit pricey for the quality of food. The portions were huge so you may want to consider sharing an entree. BLT was horrible, do not go for dinner. We were warned but went anyway - bad choice. Mares restaurant served breakfast and lunch and I would highly recommend the breakfast - it was wonderful. The pool area was beautiful, the beach was nice and tidy. Our server on the beach, Jason, was always attentive and I give him kudos on a job well done. Although the beach was busy, we were able to get lounge chairs and be comfortable. Although it is a public beach, it was still nice and relaxing. The casino was small, but kind of a nice thing to have available at anytime of the day. The tables were very reasonable at $5 - $10 blackjack and $10 craps. Overall this hotel was just okay. It did not excite me as much as the name of it evokes such quality. I am over the staff telling me "my pleasure" - really is it really your pleasure. I would much rather prefer a "thank you" or "great" or just even "sure great". Please Ritz Carlton executives, canned responses are not heartfelt.

Reviews.Title: “Overated and disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Anncraver
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Very disapointing experience. I usually love to stay at an rc but either they were understaffed of their quality has taken a dive. For instance I call the front desk for help with a problem w my room and was told there were six people ahead of me and they would get back to me which they never did. Next morning-- after a leaf blower woke me up at 7:30am -- I went to the desk and asked for a board to be put under my overly soggy mattress. Upon return to my room that night it was not done. I asked to speak to the mgr. He never called me back. Lastly I stayed there a few yrs ago and and it looks like there have been no upgrades done to the property. Room decor looks very "tired". For the money I suggest staying at the Marriott. It's on the same beach and is about half the price. Sorry Ritz. But ur just not the hotel u use to be. :(

Reviews.Title: “We definitely recommend staying here!”
Reviews.Author: hate2go
Reviews.Content: We needed a quick getaway and decided on revisiting the Ritz San Juan. They did not disappoint. After our stay I wondered why it had taken us several years to return. This Ritz is like a large city hotel that happens to have a beach attached, donâ€™t expect a â€œmega resort â€œexperience. However, you will enjoy â€œresort hotelâ€� services like a relaxing spa, tennis courts and great restaurants. Their website gives you an accurate feel as to what you will find. We both had a message and found the services to be very good, the spa has a steam room in each locker area however the sauna and whirlpool are co-ed and at the end of the day the sauna was filled with businessmen looking to relax and recharge. That fact that the hotel has a mix of vacationers and business men it not all bad, it keeps the hotel well staffed even during the slow tourist season so service is not compromised. We enjoyed several meals there and they were all very good. Poolside service was prompt, but pricey. The BLT restaurant was very good much like any upscale steak house in any large city. Lunch and breakfast there was very good and we always enjoyed excellent service. The hotel was very clean and in good repair. One reviewer stated that the hotel beach chairs were wore and he is right about that. However in an economy where hotels are cutting back I would much rather have worn cushions over a cut in services offered or staff. We found the staff to be welled trained and very gracious. They were a large part of why we enjoyed our stay so much. We returned home counting the months when my husband has more vacation time so that we can steal away to our rediscovered Caribbean destination.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiGe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for vacation. We loved this hotel. The Ritz is plush and very beautiful. Staff is very polite and seem to go out of their way for you. The hotel has a very nice pool and beach. We only dined onsite once for dinner, Il Mulino was excellent. We did the sunset menu at reduced rate. You get very large portions and the food and service were both excellent. We had no complaints and would absolutely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not quite at the level of other Ritz locations”
Reviews.Author: omvilla
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful, clean hotel overall, but not as plush as one would expect from a Ritz. Nice location right by the Luis Marin Intl airport, however you don't have to worry about the noise. Our large room was facing the airport on the 8th floor and we watched planes land and never once heard them. Front desk staff very nice (especially Venus), concierge staff nice but some were considerably more knowledgeable than others, and they gave us innacurate information a few times. Don't rely heavily on their directions print outs as they are very poorly written. Pool area and beach area very beautiful. Self parking $17 per night, valet $22 per night. At the parking garage entrance, the taxi drivers were always hanging out, sitting in plastic patio chairs, playing loud music and eye-balling everyone that drove in and out. Not a welcoming display right in front of the Ritz Carlton. Why don't they wait in their vehicles just like at any other hotel? I've never seen that before. A few expensive restaurants are on site as well as Tiffany's, gift shops, etc. Metropol restaurant is across the street and has fantastic food. Try the arroz con pollo but don't expect great service there. Toiletries in the room were were of poor quality, bring your own. Live music on several nights of the week was nice. Roomy business center on the 3rd floor with free use. Several computers with printers so no waiting for people to finish. Free wi-fi in the hotel. Stay here if you can find a deal or package rate but I would hesitate to pay the rack rate of $230 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy029
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, quite opulent, but the best part of all is the total SERVICE given to its clients. The staff go out of their way to be helpful, kind and considerate. Since they ALL behave the same way, it is obviously the hotel policy to insure that it's guests are taken care of. The only complaint, if any is that it was our 43rd wedding anniversary, and I was hoping that a small gesture on the hotel's part would be forthcoming. The only thing we got was, "Oh, that's nice!" Having stayed at other hotels on the island during other anniversaries, and having them be acknowledged by the hotels, this omission left us a bit sad. However, we would recommend this hotel, and would stay again. Anyone staying should be aware that there are many restaurants nearby that serve very good food, with good service, EXCEPT for the PLATO RESTAURANT to the right of the hotel. This restaurant is extremely rude, and the food 2nd rate.

Reviews.Title: “Under delievered-”
Reviews.Author: scootallover
Reviews.Content: Resort is very clean, modern, and has a nice sized pool and pool area. The main complaint my wife and I had was the service in the pool bar area both bar and for food was abysmal. I am getting away to be serviced not to have to practically drag a waiter to my table or hail a bar tender as he talks endlessly right in front of me while I waited to be served. Our waiter at the pool bar where we had lunch made a mistake on the order, kept pulling away the sugar from the table as we used it, and seemed to be making mostakes on other tables near us. Front desk was competent, and the bell hop service was excellent and attentive. The whole food experience was ok and was priced off the charts. We ate at a Cuban restaurant within a 5 minute walk of the resort and was excellent and priced accordingly. Several other resorts priced more in line withthe level of service they offer and in better proximity to local attractions. beach area behind resort was blahhhhhh!

Reviews.Title: “Value Plus . . . !”
Reviews.Author: NotJustAnotherJoel
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, son - 12, & daughter - 14) vacationed 6 nights, from August 13 â€“ 19, 2010, at the Ritz Carlton, San Juan, Puerto Rico and experienced far more than expected accommodations and especially service. It is to note that we typically lodge in three (3) star hotels; this time however having the opportunity to consider a five (5) star via a wonderful last minute relatively affordable package (flight & hotel) through Travelocity. From the moment we arrived at the Ritz to our departure, we received outstanding greetings and service from each of the hotelâ€™s service representatives we encountered, despite â€œitâ€™s their jobâ€�. It is understood why one considers higher dollar hotels (for the most part), thereby receiving a high level of respect and in-turn value. We did find the food/drink expense to be unreasonably high, whereby we primarily patronized walking distance eating establishments providing an opportunity to potentially mix with the locals. One example of the outstanding service we received is as follows: at 1:00 am our son became ill; we called the front desk for Pepto Bizmo, whereby the service agent made arrangements for security to open the gift-store, retrieve the medicine, and deliver to our room all in less than 10 minuets. Then our son heaved on the carpet, we called guest services and again is less than 10 minutes staff cleaned the mess; more than pleased we were. The only downside we encountered was my wife had a small issue with the bed firmness, whereby guest services was very accommodating with improving this matter. We highly recommend the Ritz Carlton if yaâ€™l and muster the expense. We may not have the future ability to afford the Ritz on a somewhat frequent basis, but we will certainly save our money to treat ourselves more and more.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ritz Carlton Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Luxtvl
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Mgt. should consider rebranding this hotel or their standards have considerably dropped and this terrible standard of service is to be expected! Significant investment is required to upgrade this property and standard of food quality. The service depends on who you get on average the service is not upto what you would expect at a Ritz Carlton. Very disappointing stay and would not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-standard service in Ritz-Carlton, San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Nageur000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week. For 2 out of 7 days, the room was not made in the afternoon when we returned to the hotel - see the attached picture of how the room looked like at 5 pm (same as we left it in the morning). I wrote an email to the General Manager of the hotel attracting his attention to what seemed like a systematic issue but got no response. I had enjoyed staying in quite a few Ritz-Carlton hotels around the world. However, the experience that we had in San Juan definitely didn't meet the usually high standards of the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a Ritzy Experience!”
Reviews.Author: fasart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 11 year old son for an end of summer getaway. Based on our previous experience with the Ritz Carlton hotels, we were expecting to have a fantastic stay. Unfortunately it started off on the wrong foot and never got better. When we arrived the check in girl, Carla, was most unhelpful. She let us know our room with the double beds (which we specifically booked in advance) was not avaialable and our option would be a roll away bed or an upgrade for $70 per night extra! After a manager's intervention (in the back room because we were never addressed by the manager) they found a room with double beds. While this was occuring, the concierge came by and tried to smooth things over by offering us bottled water. We never saw him or the water again! The service for the most part was slow, the employees seem distracted and uninterested. Certain employees did provide excellent service but were overshadowded by those who did not. The pillows outdoors were dirty and dingy. The towels by the pool area were stained. I do hope they get their act together and adhere to the level of service that has come to be associated with the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time & Value on Ritz Club Level”
Reviews.Author: bfernandes
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted by our names by the lobby concierge and taken to the 9th floor for a private checkin. It was amazing !!! So here is the low down on the club level. It's around $150 more a night....but it includes a continental breakfast daily in the club lounge. No crowds, very calm and relaxing. Cold meats, boiled eggs, danishes, croissants and lots of fresh fruit along with all juices and coffee. No hot food!!!! Lunch was meat and veggie sandwiches with a panini press machine. Green salads with assorted toppings. Fresh Tuna and chicken salad. Assorted cheeses, breads, desserts. It got a bit repetitive after 4 days of the same or similar items. But it was great. The best was free drinks from noon to 9:30 daily. The mojitos were great and so were the martini's. Grey goose and Kettle one were available. The cost of drinks around the hotel were $17 for a martini and $12 for a mojito. Overall, the club level was amazing and well worth the price. The staff were amazing. They did all job functions from checking you in, arranging tours, car rentals , serving the food, played bar tender and welcomed you by name every time they saw you. It was absolutely great. The rooms were the same size as the lower level rooms but had several added amenities. The pool view was great. The club lounge has a living room setting with couches, tables and even a balcony over lookin the pool / beach with tables so you could eat outside. The pool area is the nicest I have ever seen. Lots of palm trees, extra large umbrellas and very nice beach. Its safe and clean and the pool staff set up chairs and umbrellas all along the shore line and under the palm trees. The pool staff were extremely accommodating and set us up with chairs, towels etc and never expected a tip. But they deserved every $ I gave them. We ate at BLT....it was an average steakhouse. Go to other local options and save the steak for a local steakhouse in your town. Marmalade rated as the 2nd best in san juan was amazing. The pre fixe is awesome and the entire experience was "fetch". Also, metropole across the street has reasonable and good P.R food. Atlantica , a 4 min cab ride was the best sea food ever. Rent a car and go to El Yunque Rainforest. The tours are rushed and pricey. We rented a car from Enterprise located in the Ritz garage. $45 a day and did the 30 minute or so ride to the rainforest. The highways are just like the ones in Tampa and driving was a breeze. San Juan was amazing because we stayed at the Ritz. We visited the El San Juan Hotel and ran back to civilization after just 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: ti97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carton for 3 nights with my fiance, and we are both thoroughly impressed. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We actually arrived for check in at 11PM after coming back from Culebra, which by the way, has the most incredible beach of Puerto Rico. We were upgraded to a junior suite, and when we arrived at the room, a tray of fruit and a wine bottle was waiting for us, complements from the house. All the comments here regarding service are accurate. All the staff went above and beyond to make us feel unique and special. Casino is low key with low limits. Highly recommended. Ritz Carlton of San Juan will be my default hotel whenever I return to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny and then some.....”
Reviews.Author: rmtjmt
Reviews.Content: Booked a city view room with a buy 3 nights, get 4th free special. Arrived around noon on Thursday, early check in was no problem. It was our 20th anniversary, so we requested an upgrade to ocean front room with balcony. Front desk person was extremely accommodating & room was Incredible! Beautiful decor, large bathroom, love seat & desk with french doors out to a large balcony overlooking the pool & ocean. Every staff member we encountered for 5 days was friendly & helpful & always greeted us, regardless of what they were doing. Beach staff always had chaise lounges, towels & umbrellas set up as soon as we got to the beach. Waiters rotate between restaurant, pool & beach & they greet you by name after the first meal or drink. Concierges were extremely helpful. Booked a half day tour thru Castillo Tours onsite & were very happy with the tour & our guide, Ricardo. On our last night, ate at Picayo, which the concierge & staff said was the best restaurant in San Juan & they were right! Fabulous dining experience. We had room service breakfast one morning on our balcony & that was special too. High quality coffee & tea are in your room if u want to make your own. Ritz Spa has an excellent gym (for a hotel) and we even took a spin class & salsa class while we were there. Ritz does charge $32 per day resort fee, but we were forewarned by TripAdvisor reviews & we enjoyed the facilities. Overall, a fabulous stay with no complaints whatsoever. We highly recommend the Ritz San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Service.”
Reviews.Author: Withatwist55
Reviews.Content: It all started when we checked in early and our room wasn't ready so they upgraded us to an ocean-view balcony room for no additional charge! Then Osvaldo Rivera (should definitely be the guest services employee of the year) helped me surprise my parents on their anniversary with rose petals, chocolates, island-scented candles, a beautiful card and a crystal souvenir (which were all his spectacular idea). Osvaldo, so adorable and conscientious, was one of the MANY friendly and amazing staff members at this hotel. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure we had a fantastic vacation. They really knew how to make us feel special. From the amazing cuisine at BLT to the complimentary Zumba and Spin classes every day at the Spa, this resort was 5 Stars Plus. I can't say enough about the customer service and hospitality at this hotel. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “4 Diamond - yes. Ritz - no.”
Reviews.Author: vegasflyer
Reviews.Content: Comparable to a Hyatt or better Westin in terms of service/amenities. After reading reviews here we decided to upgrade to Club Lounge - for us it was a huge disappointment. Kids running everywhere, mediocre food at best (no better than a Regency Club), and "Korbel" served as their "champagne" believe it or not. Yes - gas station sparkling served at The Ritz. They even had the nerve to bring the bottle out to serve it! The lounge staff were great however, which more than makes up for any issues. If you just want to "fill up" on filler food and alcohol than it's a good deal, but certainly not a culinary experience by any means. Most guests did just that - piled up on heaps of pale off-white, textureless food and washed it down with cocktails and Korbel. Just adding some fresh fruit to the presentation would make it more appealing. No hot items at all in 9 days. They consider cold salads as their evening hors deurves. If you ask the staff for anything they will do their best to get it for you however. Enough about the lounge. We enjoyed most of the staff, but felt the pool/beach staff could have provided more of a luxury experience by setting up chairs/umbrellas, and serving water/chilled fruit without having to be asked. After being stung all over by jelly fish I asked for assistance and was handed a small cloth with vinegar prior to the attendant walking away - how was I to reach the stings on my back? Many, many more children than one would typically expect at a Ritz. Fine, but made the whole experience much less relaxing with Marco Polo all day in the pool. Also, the towels in the room were threadbare, and pool towels faded/stained blue with musty smell. I am talking about rags - not exaggerating here. After complaining twice we noticed some new fresher towels at the pool. Concierge and Front Desk very helpful but difficult to reach over the phone. Good value for the price, but do not expect Ritz Carlton standards. Think Westin (which I am perfectly fine with) and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Tghost1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-day getaway to the Ritz Carlton, San Juan and it was a great choice. The grounds, the service, the rooms, spa, and restaurants were all top notch. Ritz staff went out of their way to make the stay pleasant. BLT Steak was spectacular and I thought it was better than the original in NYC. The spa was a thoroughly relaxing experience and I highly recommend the stone massage. Drink prices at the hotel bars were certainly pricey, but this is a resort and a Ritz Carlton at that, so I'm not quite sure why anyone would expect bargains. Pool area was beautiful and spacious with very good service. Beach was decent. Complimentary Wifi throughout was a plus as well. I was already enamored with Puerto Rico, and having stayed at the Ritz, I love it even more. It was a quick, easy trip from Newark, NJ and I'm looking forward to a return trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place...beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: msly43
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Ritz. Such a beautiful hotel! Hotel staff was amazing and anything that we needed, they were right there to meet all of our needs. Hospitality was great..down to the Doorman (Carlos) who remembered our names from the first day of check in. Just wonderful! Had a few problems with the plumbing (shower water not draining properly), but they had someone to come and check on it and got it fixed right away. Overall, just a fabulous vacation, I only wish we had more time!!! We will be returning and I would highly recommend this beautiful place to anyone looking for a pleasurable/enjoyable vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Plasticchips
Reviews.Content: Not up to the cleanliness standards of a Ritz Carlton; however, very nice hotel. Very convenient with beach right there-some days a lot of seaweed. Close to airport. Friendly service throughout. Great place for a relaxing vacation. Restaurants were expensive but great food. Rates were high with added fees per room charged each day .

Reviews.Title: “WOW - what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: njdebra
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "wow" to this hotel....I'm very impressed. They accommodated & catered to us like we were stars.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend Trip”
Reviews.Author: skillz757
Reviews.Content: Happy that we picked this hotel. Great deal and location. The only downfall is that we came during Hurricane season, but I would return here. The service throughout our stay was timely. There were only a few times that it took awhile to meet some of our needs. Namely the enterprise counter was hardly available over the phone. Check in and concierge were very helpful with all of our needs. Il Mulino is well worth a resservation sometime during your stay. All four of our meals were delicious. We ordered from their Prix Fixe menu which was awesome and economical. Both Il Mulino and BLT had Prix Fix menus that were excellent. Getting around the city was easy from our hotel because we were right near the highway. There is a Denny's a block away and a Walgreens . Our only disappointed is that we are from NY and we felt that we couldn't find inexpensive authentic food. Other then that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: DartonProf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful - the grounds are beautiful, the pool area is fabulous and the beach is typically PR - clear blue waters and white sands. The cafe by the beach has a wonderful view but stick to the hamburgers. The pina coladas are wonderful. Mares has a great breakfast menu. The location is rather isolated but the cabs are reasonable and will take you anywhere. We rented a car for the day and the Enterprise office at the hotel was great! We felt very pampered and would recommend the hotel for beach lovers! (It rained out entire trip but we lounged on the porches and read books and watched the rain - had a ball!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect reconnect hotel”
Reviews.Author: casoenna
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in one of the least accessible beaches to the public. Excellent service - the staff remembers your name and you won't get No for an answer. Good food too. There are families with kids there but it's not the usual resort ambience with a lot of rowdiness; certainly there's plenty for everyone without feeling it's more one type than the other.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, use your common sense”
Reviews.Author: TX_Moon
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little concerned with the Ritz. We were party of a wedding party. Some of the party had trouble upon check-in and could not get a manager. However all these issues were cleared up the next day and the hotel management went above and beyond to make sure everyone was happy, especially the bride, groom and their families. The service was excellent and not overbearing at all. We were in a very large group and they did a great job messaging everyone in the party about details on the celebrations. Drink service was a bit slow at the lobby bar every time we visited. Beach chairs get picked up at 6pm. Beautiful hotel, we enjoyed the patios and listening to all the coqui frogs at night. Good location close to the airport and withing walking distance of local restaurants. We went to the Pueblo and stocked up on beer, rum and snacks. I did see a beach vendor that was selling jewelry later that night in the lobby later dressed as a guest and then the next day on the beach selling more jewelry. The guys all went to play blackjack one night and ended up at a table with lots of locals speaking about them in Spanish. So remember you are traveling and keep your guard up. Great maid service, beautiful property, pool, hot tub, extremely helpful service, brought us plenty of glassware for our wine and flatware for the night we did order in pizza for our large group. The Ocean Bar and Grill is a nice place to relax and have a rum cocktail. We did not visit any of the the other restaurants but they smelled amazing. It was nice to have a robe, room safe and umbrella in the room also. The beds were extremely comfortable, even my husband who has a lot of trouble sleeping had very restful nights. I loved the coffee machine in the room, used it every morning. Next time we will stay in a boutique hotel or on Culebra for a different Puerto Rico experience, but very pleased with this one!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: fsusports
Reviews.Content: A great resort with all the great service you would expect from The Ritz. Dined on the property, used the fitness center, spent some time in the casino, lounged by the pool and had several spa treatments and all experiences were up to the Ritz standard. If you stop by the concierge, ask for Luis...what a pleasant young man!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1-year Anniversary!”
Reviews.Content: Despite some negative reviews on Tripadvisor, my wife and I just returned from a week stay at the Ritz Carlton San Juan celebrating our 1-year anniversary. The trip was amazing. San Juan is a beautiful island, the people couldn't be nicer, the food is delicious, and the drinks are always flowing. The staff at the Ritz was very friendly, helpful, and attentive - welcoming us with happy anniversary wishes and complimentary champagne at our anniversary dinner at BLT. We had a city view room, which was plenty nice, that was cleaned daily and "turned down" each night. A quick side note, book the San Salvador Rainforest Ziplining & Rappelling adventure with Ecoquest Tours (ranked #1 excursion in San Juan), the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo (these are both physically demanding so make sure youâ€™re up for the challenge, but they will be the highlight of your trip if you can make it), and spend at least one morning/afternoon walking the streets of old San Juan As for the common negative reviews Iâ€™ve seen on Tripadvisor, some are true but I feel overstated. The main one I see is the airport noise. The resort area of San Juan where the Ritz is located is near the airport, but so is every other hotel in this area (i.e. Waldorf, Intercontinental, Marriot, Embassy Suites), and you can hear the airplanes from all of them. That stated, the airplanes are not so loud that they affect your relaxation, and are unnoticeable once youâ€™re inside. The other main complaint I see is the staff, which I will just have to differ with. We were asked about every 10 minutes whether we needed anything while we were pool/beach side, unless we were napping or had recently received a beverage/food. The concierge, casino staff, spa staff, and cleaning staff were great as well. The only negative I can recognize is the price of food and drinks pool/beach side ($14 burgers and $5 beers). However, the food at the other restaurants seemed comparable to what I see at any nice restaurant. If you want more of a selection, try old San Juan. Or, you can go to Pueblo (the local grocery store), and stock up on beer, wine, and snacks on your 1st day and save a bundle. Finally, Iâ€™ll admit that we stayed at the Ritz on a professional discount, and perhaps that has slightly affected my positive recommendation. However, I must say that I think Iâ€™ve accurately represented the stay youâ€™ll find at the Ritz. If you want a more affordable place, try the Intercontinental, Marriot, or Embassy Suites. -Ryan & Lauren

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a small glitch”
Reviews.Author: SGECHAMPION
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz over the July 4 weekend as guests for a beautiful wedding. We really liked the beach and pool area. The rooms were very spacious, perfectly clean, and staff were very friendly. In short, we had a great time. What bothered us were the tip charges added at the end of our stay. We have been to resorts before and are aware of their usual add-ons (resort fees, etc), but our confirmation did not specify that we would be charged tip for bellboys and housekeeping. When we inquired at the hotel reception at check-out, we were told it's part of the wedding package contract and should have appeared in our reservation. Well, it didn't, and one would normally expect that given the lack of disclosure they would take the charges off, but they refused to do so. While the amount is small considering how much we paid for everything, we found this unprofessional. But we will still keep great memories of our friends' beautiful wedding and the nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paindoc770
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over July 4th weekend. The hotel was full including 3 weddings. I have stayed in many hotels and I can say that the service here has been outstanding. Whatever, whenever, wherever. Always with a smile and usually pretty quick. The room was nice, not huge but enough room, nothing worn or dated. Property well laid out, pool area with a lot of stone, no diving (pool is 3 1/2 feet all around). Enough chairs and umbrellas for everyone. BAD Thing.....Drinks are WAAAY overpriced, beware TIP: There is a tennis court and THE HOTEL can provide rackets. Microwave and fridge are complementary if you ask for them to be brought to your room.

Reviews.Title: “We expected better.”
Reviews.Author: irwinjosephneil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on June 22 after a cruise out of San Juan. We arrive at the hotel at 9 AM and, as expected, were told that no clean rooms were available. We were offered an upgraded room with a balcony for $60 more. We took the room (611) which had a good view of the grounds and the ocean. We walked on the beach and noted that there was a fair amount of sea weed and litter plus the sand was dirtier than any of the beaches we experienced on our cruise. We opted for the pool instead. Be aware that bar drinks are $14 apiece. (and we thought cruise ship drinks were pricey) Our room was spacious, but surprisingly, the only place to sit was the desk chair or the bed, even though there was plenty of room for a love seat or additional chair. There were stains on the ceiling. The toilet wouldnâ€™t flush properly, requiring the handle to be held down. On the positive side, the staff was polite and attentive. The grounds and lobby are impressive. I liked the complementary wi-fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a dream!!”
Reviews.Author: Gpar09
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful during our stay!! The hotel is great, and the location is perfect: 5 minutes from the airport, but you definitely forget it's so close! We loved our room: it had a beautiful terrace overlooking the palm trees and the sea. So relaxing! We spent our days travelling around the island, and would go back to the hotel late in the afternoon. We loved having a cocktail on the beach before dinner! The staff is truly wonderful, they are incredibly nice and helpful! We can't wait to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCityKitty
Reviews.Content: I spent the last night of my week long Puerto Rico family vacation in the Ritz to be close to the airport for an early morning flight the following day. I booked a city view room but received an upgrade to a pool view room. The room is very nicely appointed, and the furniture appears new and very clean. The decor is very traditional. The large marble bathroom and comfy bed with delicious linens make this a very comfortable room. We rented two movies and the picture quality was blurry and second rate. The TV is a seemingly new flat screen, so I am not sure why the picture quality was degraded. We ordered basic food from room service: 1 burger, 1 ceasar salad, 1 cheese cake, 1 glass wine, 1 small ice cream. The burger was fine, but the ceasar salad was a wedge of romaine topped with a glob of creamy italian dressing (not real ceasar dressing), and thus was disappointing to me. The cheesecake was flavorless and tasted like it was made from soy cream cheese. The room service bill was $100. I would recommend eating in San Juan, but we were just too tired to budge after traveling from Vieques that morning. The pool was not as clean as I had hoped-- with my goggles I could unfortunately see clumps of hair, wads of gum, dead bugs and other detritus on the bottom. But, It was the end of the day when I got there and also quite crowded that day -- I imagine they clean it at night. The pool is also very shallow throughout, bath water warm and lacks a lap lane. This was disappointing to me as well, however, my young son loved the warm shallow water, and copious floating water mattresses. The beach was nice enough, warm cerulean water, nice clean sand. I heard there is snorkeling but the day I was there was quite windy, and as a result the tides were high and there was a wicked undertow and no visibility due to sand. It was perfect for a dip though, and there were ample chaise lounges on the beach if I were the tanning sort. There are more beautiful beaches farther east, but for a hotel so close to San Juan and the airport, the beach was perfect. As everyone has stated, the service is impeccable and the surroundings are well groomed. Also when I checked in, I received a free necklace as a gift from the jewelry store, which was an unexpected surprise. It looks to be silver plate but it is still a nice memento of the trip. The Ritz compares favorably to the Caribe Hilton just down the road a ways, where we spent the first night of our trip. The Hilton had a smaller pool, a dirtier stretch of beach, and the rooms were not as nice. The Hilton was a tad cheaper, and overall was nice enough but the RItz is a cut above. Next time I will stay at the Ritz on the first and last nights due to its proximity to the airport. With regard to that, you can hear the planes from the beach but not from the pool or the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: ams779
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from 5 days at the Ritz in San Juan. We decided on this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and discovering that this was one of the only hotels without glaring negative comments. We found the same. It was very pleasant, clean, and the service was top notch. The beach was clean, white sand with no rocks. There were ample towels, beach chairs and umbrellas for all. The pool was also lovely, but there were lots of kids making noise during the prime times. Be aware that there is a "resort fee" per day which was extra added to out bill at the end of our stay. It turned out to be about $70 for 5 days. We booked on orbitz and it probably was written somewhere, but we were taken by surprise. This fee included use of the sauna and hot tub in the spa and exercise classes and gym. The restaurants in the ritz are very expensive. We paid $16 for 2 bagels and 2 coffees which we took to go. I guess that is to be expected at the Ritz. There are lots of chain restaurants in walking distance and a starbucks in the hotel next door. We felt safe walking on the streets surrounding the hotel even at night. We actually parked our rental car on the street to avoid the $17parking fee at the hotel. We ended up going to El San Juan hotel next door alot, it seemed a bit younger and more fun. We found that it was more affordable to rent a car than take cabs from the Ritz. A cab ride to old san juan was $21 one way. We rented a car at the enterprise in the hotel for $25. Everyone who worked for enterprise were great and very easy to deal with. I am happy that we stayed at the Ritz our first time in San Juan. The service there can't be beat. The concierge was excellent and we received printed door to door driving directions and information for everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Staff Friendliness Top Notch - Expensive But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Weather_Guru
Reviews.Content: I booked a brief getaway (4 nights) for my wife and I having never been to Puerto Rico, but hearing good things about this property and the beach. It was a very good decision. We went on the expectations that we were going to just stay at the property, relax, lay in the sun, and not do much else. Immediately, one benefit is that this property is located right off the airport so the taxi ride took about 5 min. We were immediately greeted by superb and friendly valet staff and a front desk person who was also friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. We chose the city view room because of expense and it was basically a view of the property next door so nothing spectacular. The bed was soft and very comfortable although my wife had some back issues because of the softness of the bed. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. The bathroom had marble and a separate room for the toilet. The room is supplied with coffee and tea which I enjoy and utilized. It is also supplied with a fridge/bar containing items I've never seen before including an abundance of nuts, candies, soda, alcohol, etc. Prices were spendy, but it was nice to have in case you were hungry or thirsty. We utilized Room Service twice and it was one of the best in-room dining that I've eaten. The food took about 30 - 45 min to be delivered and it was delivered by continued top-notch staff who were friendly and would answer any questions you had. The food was also great. I guess we don't normally expect that much from in-room dining, but the food was good and they had a great selection. Again, like everything else at the Ritz-Carlton, it is expensive and I'm sure for the both of us we spent $75 - $100 each time. The property is beautiful. Flowers and green foliage everywhere. The grounds are kept up well. The pool area is very large clean. There are a large number of loungers although it can still be difficult to find an empty one at the height of the day. We were worried about the temperature with June being in the low to mid 90s and dew points in the middle 70s. These are stifling conditions for a Minnesotan, but we were pleasantly surprised that the constant breeze made it feel very pleasant. The beach is well kept and wonderful to lay out on. The staff will eagerly assist you with towels, setting up your lounger, and putting an umbrella up for you. There is plenty of space on which to lay around and you can even find good spots under palm trees for some shade or choose that umbrella to cool off under. Staff, from the beach-side restaurant, frequently make trips out to see if you need any drink or food. The ocean water is bath-water warm which I think is great. I love getting in warm water so it was a wonderful ocean experience. The waves were not high at all so it was fairly calm the entire time. Weather conditions were pleasant most of the time with an occasional rain shower here and there. It had been rainy the week prior and I guess it can be rainy at times, but who can control the weather? My wife made use of the spa for 2 massages. She had a standard massage and came back saying it was the best massage she has had in her life. I think that was until she had her 2nd massage (a Reflexology massage) which she claimed was even better. She told me that the staff were absolutely wonderful and pampered her in every way possible. Again, be prepared to pay at least $150 per massage which is not that outrageous since it seems like most resorts charge this amount. My wife said it was worth every penny! We utilized all restaurants on the property and really did not have any bad experiences. The BLT Steak place had good food and good service. We spent a little over $100 for the both of us. The Italian restaurant, on the other hand, was by far some of the best Italian food I have ever eaten. It is pretty fancy and felt a little stuffy, but after eating the food it was worth it. The staff are attending to you practically every second. We did have one staff member who made a slightly rude comment, but all of the other staff were superior in every way and friendly just like all of the staff at the Ritz-Carlton. My wife had mushroom stuffed ravioli in a truffle sauce that I regretted not ordering! Be prepared to really fork it out here. Prices for both of us with tips and everything ranked above $150. That did not include any wine. The beach side restaurant had good food with a basic "beach-side" menu. We enjoyed having something light for lunch here and watching the ocean. Overall, I have to say that the service was the best I've ever seen. I've never stayed in a Ritz-Carlton before, but it was definitely worth splurging and paying extra for all involved. We will return here...just remember to pack plenty in your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Creme de la Creme!”
Reviews.Author: MoonchildNewYork
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an upscale and top of the line service you must visit the San Juan Ritz Carlton. We stayed memorial day weekend and it was the best stay ever! The staff is very accomodating and pamper their guests. They are located near restaurants, main highways and the airport. I highly recommend it and even if you do have to pay a bit more its worth every penny compared to other horror stories in other hotels nearby. Its peaceful and the pool and beach is amazing as well. Five stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “First Class service”
Reviews.Author: joannkel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at Ritz Carlton . Although the weather wasn't great the service was first rate. We stayed club level which was awesome. Every morning we ate breakfast there and were greeted by name. We also enjoyed happy hour as well as dessert and coffee. With the rain, it was nice to have a place to go to and relax without being confined to the room. Room was clean and nice . The pool and beach were beautiful. If you are going to San Juan , the Ritz is definetly the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MoDiva
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I find it somewhat odd that the very things I enjoyed about this hotel, were mentioned in the last negative review. First, the staff is VERY friendly and helpful. That includes everyone at the front desk, by the pool and at the beach. My friend even left her iPhone on a couch in the lobby and the hotel staff called numbers in the phone to find us and return it. There is a casino in the club which is nice considering it is a resort and not Vegas. There is a also a great nightclub at the hotel. The pool was great and there is more than one and the beach was great also. Great fitness center The rooms were cool and I thought the beds were actually very comfortable with great down comforters. The air worked well and I never heard it at all. The shower pressure was very good and the bathrooms were fine. There was also a lot of closet space. The restaurants at the hotel are kind of pricey but we found ways around that as places like Palm (an expensive restaurant) had a happy hour from 4-7 with $3.50 appetizers. We ordered like 10 appetizers and were straight for dinner. The only downside that I can think of was how hard it was to find a bell hop. It took them over 40 minutes to come when we called down stairs to check out and no one brought our stuff upstairs. That sucked. Also, our last night we were fortunate enough to be a few rooms down from a room full of fraternity members who stayed up until well after 4:00am expressing themselves in the hallway. I had to call security on them twice. Other than that, it was a great trip and I enjoyed this hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars?!”
Reviews.Author: kokiri
Reviews.Content: The good news is that the hotel is clean and the location is great -- right on the beach but still just a few minutes from the airport. The hotel lobby was elegantly appointed as well. The rooms were another story. If someone took me directly to the room and told me it was a Radisson, I would have completely believed them. It seems as though it's been a while since this hotel has been updated. Some of the beds seem to sag. I know this b/c I got stuck with a room w/ 2 doubles (which usually irritates the heck out of me), and one of the two beds sagged while the other was tolerable. The thing that really irritated me though was the fact that I had a mosquito in my first room, and when I called to ask for help in killing it, the manager suggested that I just deal with it b/c Puerto Rico is an island and mosquitoes happen.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Just Terrible - Obnoxious Staff”
Reviews.Author: calcio20
Reviews.Content: I have not been to the best hotels of the world, however this hotel is along the lines of a bad holiday inn. First, the good... Location is great and the pool/beach area is fantastic. That's it. As to the bad, the food is mediocre, very cheap. The staff is obviously underpaid and do not resemble Ritz staff at other locations. I wonder if this hotel is just given the "Ritz" name. The bed was HORRIBLE. Very hard, to the point where I couldn't sleep on them. Also, I could hear the AC kicking on and off the entire night. The room itself was nothing special and the water pressure was horrific. The TV program that allows you to choose movies is horribly outdated too. At one point, I had a movie cutoff in the final 10 minutes. It was almost funny. Room service was bad. Asked for an itemized receipt and never got one. The people who delivered the food seemed unhappy. Overall, just very unprofessional. The hotel is conected to a horrible, small, trashy casino (which should have given me the hint that this isn't a normal Ritz). Luckily, I didn't pay for this trip... but if I did I would have been furious. Please choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: traveler654
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 5 nights at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. It was a very nice stay. The hotel staff were very professional and polite. The pool and beach here are wonderful. Convenient to the airport. I read previous reviews about plane noise, but I did not experience any and we were at the pool daily. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The maids were thieves.”
Reviews.Author: dsputh
Reviews.Content: When I sent my son up to get money out of the safe, he accidently let $550 fall on the floor. When I went up later to discover it missing, I informed security. Even though they had record of a maid entering during the time it was on the floor. THEY DID NOTHING ! This isn't what I expected from from a hotel with it's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjs4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan from April 22-28, 2010. The hotel is beautiful and very close to the airport which is very convenient. We did purchase a room with club floor access. Wow....was it worth it! There was a full breakfast and luch each day. They also had a nice array of food for dinner as well. There was unlimited wine, champagne and any other cocktail you desired each day! We went with friends--but for a family the club floor is definitely worth it. It also was very kid friendly. The staff at the concierge club was more than accomodating. They greeted you each day by name and did everything possible to make your stay the best. You could also book exursions and check in or out on the club floor. The hotel is very beautiful and well kept. The rooms were nice as well and the staff upgraded us to a pool view just for asking. The beach is very nice too---but don't expect the beautiful Caribbean waters of Nassau or Turks and Caicos! Again, the waiters were always there to serve either around the pool or at the beach. Both restaurants at the hotel----- BLT and the Italian one are not to be missed for a nice dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and fun retreat”
Reviews.Author: bokim777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ritz during our summer vaction after our caribbean cruise and we had a fabulous time! It was right on a beautiful beach and our room had a lovely view of the ocean. The pool facilites are beautiful or the staff will set up a lounge chairs, umbrella and towls for you on the beach. The service was wonderful and the food at the two restaurants we tried at the hotel was fabulous. The breakfast buffet was second to none, and no lines or noise. Just completely restful. The dinner at the Il Mulino was amazing. Their poached pear dessert was a work of art, not just the dessert but the presentation was outstanding! The only not so great aspect was the room was a little on the small side, but comfortable and refined. Would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: MCMS10
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at this hotel last summer, and I have been meaning to write to comment on the lovely trip we had. The hotel was very clean and nice, and we loved both the pool and the beach. Our main thought was that the staff was very accommodating, and they would even bring ice water to the beach to cool down the guests who were laying out in the sun. Overall, a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: johndee21
Reviews.Content: I researched all of the higher end properties around SJU, and definitely made the right choice with the Ritz. The room was very clean (very important to me), the staff was very nice, and it was very well maintained. The only down side is that not many of the rooms had balconies (including ours). This would have been a huge plus. There's a Walgreens next door, and a really great restaurant, Piu Bella which also has the best gelato (same as in Italy). Really can't go wrong with the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “No Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: ceits200
Reviews.Content: I was there on business this time (have stayed previously) and I do believe that if at all possible, the service has gotten worse. The room service, which is extremley pricey was slow to be delivered but rushed to get the table back so much so that they entered the room while I was on a conference call (not a safe feeling for a female business traveler on her own). They removed my uneaten food and attampted to charge for it! When a smale plate a fruit costs $35 you it should not be removed if not eaten. That aside, certain items are not tended to examples: tennis courts - why have them if no pro or equipment maintained? cycle studio - no class schedule posted. Morning coffee used to be stationed in the central lobby and it was copimentary - no longer exists. This was my last stay - service in general not up to the Ritz standard.

Reviews.Title: “If we had only stayed for 7 days, it would have been perfect.”
Reviews.Author: 2jdsindc
Reviews.Content: We pored over the hotel reviews on this site and other sites for months, and we didn't pull the trigger on a hotel until about 10 days before we left (even though we had booked the air tickets 4 months earlier). Ultimately, we decided on the Ritz Carlton because we are very familiar with the brand (having stayed at many RCs in the past), and while we know the hotels within a brand can vary (as other reviewers have noted, this one is not going to knock your socks off like other RCs will), we were still confident that the hotel would be very nice -- and it was. No, the rooms were not as big as other RCs, and the bathroom was a little smaller; but it was still very nice, quiet (we never heard our neighbors, and the hotel was at full capacity for half of our stay) clean (there was no mildew smell as in other four-star hotels just down the street), and comfortable (we all slept so well). The fitness center was great, loved the free wi-fi (other RCs charge for this), the casion seemed nice and clean (we don't gamble, but when we walked through it to find an ATM, we saw that it was very clean, staff was friendly), and the onsite dining was phenomenal -- especially BLT and Il Mulino. We liked the location -- five minutes from the airport is super convenient, especially when you have to be at the airport by 10:30 a.m. It's nice to get up, grab breakfast and pack without feeling rushed. And during the eight days we were there, we only heard about half a dozen planes take off -- and only when we were outside. Also, we discovered some restaurants nearby that allowed us to just grab quick/casual bites -- Starbucks, Metropol for dinner, Pui Bello and Dennys for breakfast... Price -- I am puzzled by the negative reviews related to the cost -- what do you expect? It's the Ritz, not the Hampton Inn (which, by the way, I think is a great hotel chain -- and there is an HI right across the street -- but please, don't expect HI prices at the RC). We spent what we thought we would spend for each day. And the hotel does offer "happy hour" specials -- lobby lounge had 2-for-1 drink specials; BLT (awesome) had a great price-fixed menu and half-priced bottles of wine from 6-7 p.m. But still, it wasn't "cheap." Yet we do feel like we got what we paid for. Service - yeah, this was the hotel's downfall. The last night of our stay, we waited 40 minutes for a waiter to get our drink order in the lobby lounge -- and they never actually took the order. I had to approach the bartender twice, and he had a really bad attitude. The manager promised our drinks would come -- but they never did. It was pretty bizarre. On top of that, we had other service-related issues on the last day of our stay. Up to that point, it was all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Ritzy as other Ritz's but still a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: micheleandjohn
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to take this mini-vacation and we wanted someplace that was a convenient direct flight and chose San Juan. I was hearing conflicting things about San Juan and so we decided to go with a hotel chain I knew had a reputation for pleasing. I am glad we went with the Ritz as the area is very built up and the surrounding buildings looked quite outdated. The grounds are lovely but I did notice alot of wear in our room - something you would not expect at a Ritz. Some of these things may seem trivial to some - such as stains on the carpets, shabby towels, mildew in the shower, but when you pay this type of money, your expectations are high. Another disappointing factor for us was that this is a VERY FAMILY FRIENDLY RESORT! The place was PACKED with children, which could have been expected considering we arrived the Friday before Easter and kids were out on Spring Break. We did not even attempt to find a chair at the pool or even go into the pool since it was invaded by children having fun (just not our thing for a "relaxing vacation"). By the way, one of the children had an accident in the pool and the pool needed to be closed for hours on one the days we were there. No fault of the hotel of course, but it still happened. Another thing I noticed at this hotel was that NOT ONE of the hotel employees responded with "My Pleasure". We heard it often from the servers at the independent restaurants within the hotel but not Ritz employees, One night we came back to the hotel and the door man did not even hold the door open for me. Again, something you expect from a Ritz, but this location simply did not deliver on the Ritz reputation to the fullest. My complaints are only that this location did fall short on what you expect from a Ritz, but it still is a lovely hotel. We did spend most of our time on the property and enjoyed the food. Pricey, but it is the Ritz and we expected that. One night we had dinner at La Piccola Fontana in the El San Juan Hotel, one night we had dinner at BLT and one night we had dinner at Il Mulino, both in the Ritz.
