Il Mulino was very expensive but we were in heaven within minutes after sitting with the anti-pasto selections that were immediately placed on our table. The entire experience was pleasant to say the least. The final night we had dinner in Old San Juan at a place we stumbled upon. This was the best day of our trip - walking around in Old San Juan and having dinner at La Cucina di Ivo, a gem of an Italian restaurant. There was outside seating, but lovely inside seating as well. I literally lost myself and felt as though we were in Rome. The gnocchi's are homemade and this was the best meal for us during our stay - and the cheapest too. The restaurant was just behind Harry Winston's which our stop in this store was just a fantasy shopping experience :) All in all, we did enjoy our stay even though this location does fall a tad short on what you can expect from a Ritz. Just my honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very relaxing time at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: sojt08
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Ritz. We have nothing but nice things to say about this hotel. I have stayed here before (the year it was built) and it has been re-done since then and has 3 restaurants. The rooms were comfy, bathrooms were big and the bed was very comfy I didnâ€™t even miss my bed at home I slept great. We ate at the steakhouse and at the Italian restaurant and both were good. Since we are from NY we have been to a lot of excellent restaurants and though we thought BLT steak was good, we didnâ€™t think it was excellent like other reviewers did. We both ordered our steaks medium-rare and mine came out well-done and my husbandâ€™s came out very rare. We didnâ€™t want to send it back but told our waiter (who was extremely nice) and he came back with a brand new filet immediately that was cooked perfectly. The best restaurant by far that we went to was the Italian restaurant in the El San Juan. The Ritz Concierge set it up for us. The last night we ate at the Italian restaurant in the Ritz and it was very good too. We had a late reservation there at 9:30pm and we left there around 11:30pm so you see what I mean... when I talk about service below. We thought the service at the hotel was very good, we got to know the staff at the beach and got excellent service and they knew us by name. This place is all about quiet and relaxation so if you expect very fast service this is not the place for you. In fact, even at the El San Juan they didnâ€™t have very fast service either. We didnâ€™t care cause were on vacation and we don't want to be rushed but I know some people want someone to come up to them more often and they donâ€™t do that here unless you ask them toâ€¦. We loved the beach and we never even sat by the pool, we personally thought it was so much nicer on the beach. It's a public beach but nobody comes up to you trying to sell you things like at other Caribbean locations. It's completely safe and clean. The Ritz hotel is very, very clean and well maintained. Not much going on at night besides dinner so If you want a party atmosphere or more to do then go down the block to the El San Juan. We went there on Friday and Saturday night and it was so great for people watching. It was so crazy over there, the lobby bars were packed, it was very loud. Everyone of all ages were so drunk we saw 70 year old's that couldn't walk at 10pm they were so hammered. We also went to the dance club on Saturday night. It was ok, nothing special. It wasn't very clean at the hotel though, the bathrooms were dirty. We were happy we were staying at the Ritz, we went back there and laughed the 2 places were like night and day. The Ritz is very small and intimate, it's the perfect place to relax if what your into is beach/ pool/ drinks/ dinner/ and the same the next day. If you want more than that it's probably not the place for you. Wed did go to the casino for a little bit every night and noticed that the only people in the casino were the locals. I lost every time on slots, I didnâ€™t see one person winning anything. My husband played in one of the nightly poker tournaments and after about 6 hours of playing won $150 in 5th place. He felt it was a waste of time since it took so long so never played again. Again, it was all locals playing. He felt out of the loop cause they were all speaking Spanish the entire time and he had no idea where they were saying. It rained a couple of days when we were there so there was nothing to do at the hotel, we asked the guys outside where to go. Anywhere you want to cab it is pretty much $15 or $20 each way. One day we went down to Old San Juan to the shops and walked there for a few hours. If you want to get souvenirs then this is the place to go. Then went to the mall later on, just like any other mall near you, nothing special. The next day we went down to Ashford Avenue- they say itâ€™s like their Rodeo Drive but we werenâ€™t very impressed. They could make it really nice if it gets built up. We did see the La Concha hotel which looked nice, we walked around in there to dry off since it was raining. Other than that they didnâ€™t tell us anything else to do so hopefully it wonâ€™t rain when you go there. Lol. We were hoping to just spend the whole trip at the beach but that wasnâ€™t possible for us. We had the club level which had food out for breakfast, lunch and dinner and you could also go in there for drinks at anytime, but we didnâ€™t use it enough for it to be worth it for us. If youâ€™re going to go there to eat then it might be worthwhile for you. We saw what they had at dinner time and it was nothing of interest to us. We ate breakfast at the hotel 2 mornings and both times it cost us close to $100 (for 2 of us) The food was excellent. We spend about $200 at the beach on food and drinks the days we were out there. That was just my husband drinking beer (Iâ€™m pregnant and drank seltzer) At the beach bar it was around $18 a hamburger and fries. Everything we ate there was very good. Itâ€™s a 5 star hotel and we expected it to be expensive and didnâ€™t worry about it, but if you want to save money there were restaurants close by. Not sure how they were but the prices looked reasonable when we walked by. We ran into a couple from Alabama and they told us they ate at the restaurant on the beach right next to our hotel and he said that he had the best burger he ever had in his life. Overall, we had a great vacation at the Ritz, we immediately felt comfortable and like we could relax upon arriving and we didnâ€™t want to leave. We stayed 5 days and wished we had longer. All the staff we dealt with were great. The food was great, the atmosphere beautiful, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it...”
Reviews.Author: debbierich
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, then go and stay at the Ritz San Juan. We wanted a nice, easy break from winter and we got it at the Ritz. The flight was easy, it was still the US so no hassle of clearing customs, the hotel is literally five minutes or less from the airport yet the air traffic is directed away from the beaches and never bothered us. I was very disappointed with our first room, a city view. We upgraded to a room with a balcony and I was shocked at how few of these type rooms there were. The upgrade was expensive, as was the resort fee added on. I love not being bothered with extra fees like wireless, but the resort fee is quite high regardless. We took the club level so we only had to deal with dinner. I thought the club floor more than paid for itself. The restaurants in the hotel are outrageously expensive. Whether you can afford it or not, come on! Once we settled in, the pool and beach couldn't have been any nicer. The staff was attentive but not intrusive. In fact every staff member we met went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Bottom line is we went for great weather, great beach, great service, and got all of the above. We loved the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Was hoping for a little more...”
Reviews.Author: NYCcitygirl77
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan on a bit of a whim. Wanted to escape NYC for somewhere guaranteed to be warm so we could just relax and unwind. Chose San Juan because it's an easy, direct flight. Once we made the reservations, I discovered several friends who had been to this hotel and really enjoyed it. Let me start by saying that, overall, it was an okay stay. Would I go back? No. Why? I think you can do much better for the money...let me explain. A previous poster mentioned how close it was to the airport. That is absolutely true. Rooms in the front of the hotel overlook the airport runways. You do hear the thunderous roar of airplanes coming and going the entire time you are lounging at the pool or the beach. Side note: the cab driver overcharged us by $5...just FYI, confirm that it is a $10 fare plus a $1/bag charge before they start to drive. It's literally a five minute cab ride. We arrived at 1 a.m., so we probably didn't get the typical first impression of a Ritz Carlton guest. We dragged in our own bags, front desk guy was nice and efficient, but we had to confirm specifics of our check in...he didn't offer them. The offer to help take our bags up to the room was more of a hesitant, please-don't-say-yes question. Got the feeling they were operating with a very lean staff at that hour. While the lobby was quite elegant and classy, once stepping off the elevator on our floor it was clear that the hotel was quite old, and possibly refurbished from something that was not a Ritz Carlton before. It was clean and well-cared for, but worn doorways showed clear signs of age. We had reserved a club-level, ocean view balcony room and were quite surprised by how unimpressive the room was. It had all the standard appointments, but it was rather small, very little closet space (we had trouble fitting our suitcases in the closet), and the bathroom was nothing remarkable (one sink, shower/tub combo...did have a water closet, though). Our room clearly had some of the best views in the place, but we still overlooked unattractive rooftops of the buildings and apartments to the west. We had great views of the pool and beach, but the beach was quite far from our room. The only other rooms with balconies had a decent view of the beach, but no real views of the pool...instead they overlook the basketball court/wedding gazebo. We popped up the first morning to spend the day at the pool and were surprised by how hard it was to find two decent lounge chairs together. Obviously, even though the pool area was jam-packed with lounge chairs, people had come down early to reserve seats (and frustratingly enough, we observed that many of the "reserved" chairs went unused over the course of the day). We ended up stuck by the beachside restaurant that day and were subjected to the not-so-great music coming from the bar and a steady stream of traffic (made up of waitstaff, guests going back and forth the bathroom, landscapers, etc.). It was hardly private or relaxing, but we learned our lesson and went down to reserve chairs at 7 a.m. the rest of our stay. If you can't beat 'em, join 'em. (Note: shame on Ritz Carlton for maintaining such a large, private cabana area in a prime location. We looked into reserving those, were told they were booked for the entire weekend, and saw that they were more than 75% empty the whole weekend. You really should have plenty of comfortable seating for your paying guests.) Somewhat surprising was the fact that the Ritz sits on a postage stamp-size property on a public beach. We preferred to hang by the pool during the day, but we were disappointed that walking the beach in the daytime or evenings was not appealing. Neighbors of the Ritz Carlton include: a rundown sports club, an unattractive condo building (which rooms on the east side of the building overlook), a Marriott Courtyard (which looked quite decent and appeared to have better ocean views than we had!), etc. Also disappointing, because of the way the beach is shaped and the height of the buildings to the west, we didn't get to see one sunset while we were there (even from the 9th floor balcony). Such a shame...I'm sure they were lovely. I could easily get bogged down with other details about the pluses and minues, but I'll do my best to sum up here. Pluses: - The people were very friendly...we generally had great service from genuinely great and helpful staff. - We had some EXCELLENT meals. Mares serves a great brunch and has a very nice lunch menu. BLT Steak and Il Mulino, while very pricey, were outstanding. In four days, we only left the property for one meal away, and I wouldn't have changed that. - The atmosphere was surprisingly casual. I had been warned that dress codes were strict at the restaurants, but was disappointed that we had gotten so dressed up when others showed up in jeans. Minuses: - Property and room were rather disappointing. Housekeeping missed a few beats by not removing empty glasses (to the point of absurdity...like 10 over two days!) and not properly stocking our towels (we only had a bath mat two of the four days). Also had a bizarre situation where a bottle of wine was errantly delivered to our room. We unknowingly tipped the guy who delivered it, only to find out it was sent to the wrong room after he had walked away. We notified the front desk, and they took the bottle from our room during turndown service without leaving a substitute or just telling us to keep it. We were out the $10 tip for that one...kind of strange. - The proximity to the airport was pretty annoying. - Beach was nothing special. Hard to walk and crowded with local surfers. - Club level lounge had a pretty lame breakfast spread and the lounge itself was small and dark. It didn't compare to other Ritz Carlton lounges we've had the pleasure of visiting in the past. - We were shocked by all the families. Could have been the time of year we were there, but we had a couple of instances were children were very disruptive during our meals. Frustrating that parents don't consider other diners when their children are running laps around the tables and bouncing on seats. I'd expect that at a hotel near Disney World, but not here. Conclusion Overall, we had a pleasant but unremarkable stay. We were hoping to come across a place that could be a regular long-weekend getaway for some late-winter R&R...but this was NOT the place. We kept saying to each other that while there were things that were very easy to nit-pick, the biggest problem was that we could have gotten A LOT more for our money somewhere else. Had we stayed in one of the less expensive rooms or gotten a great deal, perhaps we'd have felt differently. But for $900 a night (after tax and resort fees), I would hope for more...MUCH more. Photos: I've included photos here, but keep in mind that they were taken during off hours (pool doesn't look croweded) or I went out of my way to crop out "unsightly" elements (like the rooftops, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “how much better service is there?”
Reviews.Author: V&PBostonMA
Reviews.Content: Good grief!! Some of the negative reviews about this Ritz Carlton are absurd; how much better service do you require? They meet you at the door, they tell you to sit in their gorgeous lounge while they carry your bags to your room, they have pillow-top beds that are heavenly, they offer Bulgari bath products, room service is efficient, tasty and cordial, the pool attendants come around every 1/2 hour and ask if you want an iced facecloth to beat the heat AND offer you a delicious sorbet, there is a shaved ice-chip cart that offers your favorite childhood memory of a snow cone, the hotel's choices of dining experiences are terrific (albeit expensive.....but come on, it's the Ritz Carlton), the casino is smoke free, the Ritz Carlton staff are impeccable and have an eye for your every need, and the decor is top notch, reminding you that you are in a luxury hotel. You would have to be a pretty spoiled individual to find fault with this luxury hotel. San Juan, itself, is not the prettiest Caribbean destination but The Ritz Carlton in San Juan is set apart from the noise of this bustling city and the airport traffic. If your pocketbook can stand a rare treat, then spend a few days at this beautiful hotel, and be spoiled by their outstanding service and amenities. The Ritz's motto that we heard over and over and over again, every time we asked for something, was "it is my pleasure." I'm going to use those 4 words now that I'm home, in every aspect of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: Though this was my 9th trip to Puerto Rico, it was my first at the Ritz Carlton. I was largely disappointed. The hotel itself is nice enough but the rooms are in need of a renovation. My room was a good size, had a minimal ocean view, the pool blocked by large palm trees (on the 6th floor). The carpet in the room had several dark stains. The bathroom sink area was streaked with (I presume) other peoples' makeup -- it came off on a kleenex-yuk. The hairdryer was so dirty I didn't use it. Housekeeping was problematic -- rooms made up late -- one day after 3:30PM and early "turndown" between 5:30-6PM except one night when they came after 9! One time they took my used towels but did not replace them. My hotel directory was missing several pages including most of the room service menu. Are all of these horror stories -- not really but when you're paying in excess of $500/night plus resort fees and it's the RITZ, you expect a little more. The staff were all cordial and enthusiastic and the internet access was excellent -- a real plus for me. The grounds are small -- a nice (but not spectacular) pool area and that's about it. The beach area is public and you are warned that you are leaving hotel property. I"m not a fan of Isla Verde -- the section where the hotel is located -- because there's nothing much to see or do. Old San Juan and the Condado are (an expensive) cab ride away. Shopping in the hotel consists of two jewelry stores and a vastly overpriced logo shop. No toiletries, soda, water, etc anywhere. You need to venture out to Walgreens for that. I ate twice in the BLT STeakhouse. It was quite good and the service excellent. On my last day I had lunch in Mares -- I opted to pay with a credit card so my room bill would remain closed out. Well, they charged my credit card and then at check out was told that my room was charged also. To boot, it wasn't even MY bill charged to the room. No one seemed to be able to sort it out in a timely fashion and I needed to leave for my flight. They took off the charge but still need to "investigate". The conference facilities were very good but they seemed to have difficulties with our continental breakfast each morning. Couldn't make two toasters for bagels work at the same time and they kept shorting out. THIS IS THE RITZ. The upshot -- I felt the hotel was below Ritz standards -- and I've stayed at a few -- and I was frustrated enough with the unevenness of service that I probably would not stay again even if my (yearly) conference is there next year. (PS While the hotel is right near the airport, I was not bothered by flight noise except by the pool -- and then not that significantly)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pandora_1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our second anniversary. We chose the hotel after sifting through the many available in Trip Advisor and I must say, we were not disappointed. Right from our welcome and throughout our stay, all our needs were attended to by the wornderful concierge. My husband has informed them that we were comming for our anniversary. We were greeted with some coconut rum and a cake from their kitchens. The staff greeted us by our names throughout our stay, wherever they saw us. We had a view of the pools which was great. Their cocktail lounge was a bit pricey, but good for alcohol. The casino was good (although we din;t spend much time there) The room itself was big and very quiet so we had our privacy. The pool was big and the beach was excellent. You had staff that put out hammocks, loungers and towels in the beach at your request free of cost. And since it was our anniversary, we received a surprise rainforest turndown and that too free of charge!!! It included some soothing music, flower petals and fern decorations, a mini spa in the bathroom, some scented candles, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries...We were very pleased with the overall service and this was an added bonus. We will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: SLathropMSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan last week and had a wonderful experience. The service is wonderful. At times, it feels like there is staff everywhere! They are very courteous and helpful. The rooms are very nice and simple. They are clean and the beds are super comfy! The beach staff are very helpful and accommodating. The pool grill is right next to the pool and beach and the food is fabulous. Try their black bean burger! It's SO good! The restaurant serves food poolside and on the beach. We also ordered rooms service and the food was very good (pricey though). The hotel has a business office area which is also nice. I read a lot of the previous reviews of the hotel and there were a lot of negative ones. I am not sure if things had changed before we came, but we were very happy with the hotel overall. And, there's free high speed internet! The area surrounding the hotel is not great. Although, it's about 10-15 minutes from Old San Juan and other great shopping. We were a bit disappointed with Old San Juan's shopping overall. There were lots of shops, but most of it was not of interest to us. If you are in Old San Juan, make sure to go and see Fort Cristobal. Also, Sofia's Italian Restaurant is fabulous. Make sure to try it!

Reviews.Title: “Huh?”
Reviews.Author: northcar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz march 8th through 11th. I read a lot of negative reviews before going so was worried about this trip. Let me say up front we were there for a Mercedes Benz meeting/vacation. Mercedes Benz did pay for all of meals, drinks, room, flight.....having said that I must have stayed at a different hotel. We were on 7th floor ocean front with balcony. Glad we upgraded. Loved the balcony. I read reviews about the 7th floor having bed bugs. I never smelled bugspray, never was bitten by anything. Room was very clean, housekeeping checked the room several times a day. Beds were comfortable, never heard a sound at night. Airport...yes it is very close which is a plus to me. You can hear the planes when out by the pool....big deal...I enjoyed watching them. Food was great, service was great. I'm not much of a beach person, but enjoyed strolling on it. Pool service was excellent. Only negative I had was the spa. There were over a hundred of us there with Mercedes Benz and all of us were given three complimentary spa treatments. Everytime I showed up for one of my scheduled treatments somethin was always wrong. Either the time, or the treatment. They always managed to fit us in though, but that seemed a little unprofessional. Loved the Rain Forest hike. Loved the casino. Won $200 at blackjack on our final night. Wish they had some regular cash games with the poker. Only way you could play was at night in a tournament.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: blondieEastcoast
Reviews.Content: I will start out with, I read many reviews on this hotel for months before we actually went. So I was a bit sceptical because of the many not so incouraging remarks, But with that being said We packed our bags and went. The Ritz Carlton did not dissapoint us. From check in to check out, the service and people were all very friendly and always willing to fullfill our request on anything asked to make our stay a happy one. the grounds are beautiful, and yes it is near the airport but that was not at all an issue. As far as charging for a late check out, They do that , Our flight wasn't until 6:00 at night. But we checked out at the regular time, had them store our bags spent the day at the pool and showered and changed in the spa before leaving. so really this is not an issue. drinks are always a cost in the islands , But paid the same at the airport before leaving to go home. I would suggest this hotel if asked I stayed there 10 days and had a wonderful relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful venue.”
Reviews.Author: TLC26
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ritz-Carlton. We chose it because we wanted to be sure we were in a safe area with good service, as we were not familiar with the San Juan area. And, of course, we felt extraordinarily safe and taken care of. In retrospect, a lesser hotel would also have been fine, as it turns out that San Juan is very safe and modern. But we paid a premium to stay and the Ritz and had a great time. The beach area is wonderful. Don't miss out on walking along the beach and visiting other hotels and restaurants for lunch. We also greatly enjoyed the pool and the poolside restaurant. (Fabulous smoothies!) The service in the breakfast restaurant was particularly good. One of the waitresses even helped us plan one of our free days by making recommendations. Poolside service was uneven. Some great, some not so great. The room was clean and well attended to with a nice view of the courtyard. The location was excellent. But if you want to be closer to trendy restaurants, Condado would be the place to stay. For our family, this location was fine with some local restaurants that were frequented by locals. We rented a car one day and wandered around the island and found some beautiful beaches. The area is easy to navigate--except there are no street signs! We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Creme de la Creme in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: francofille12
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and lovely visit. Service was great but we found people all over the island to be extremely friendly. The food is pricey, but this is the Ritz: you're paying for service and overhead not to mention that considering how far the hotel is from SJ, you're a captive audience. The bar does have drink specials that you can and should take advantage of...what's the point of coming to the islands if you're not going to knock back a little Rum? The biggest down side to the hotel is that it's a 20 minutes drive ($20 cab ride) into SJ...on the other hand, it's beach front with a private beach and there is absolutely nothing of comparable quality in SJ itself...we checked out El Convento, one of the only other 5 star properties actually in the city, and it was nothing compared to the Ritz in terms of service or aesthetics. Personally, I thought that Il Mulino was overrated but BLT was just as good there as it is anywhere else. Another hiccup is that the walls are very thin. We had what sounded like a colicky baby in the room next to us who occasionally disturbed our peace but the walls were so thin that you could hear phones ringing...if you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs! In summary, the biggest thing that impressed me about this hotel were the employees. Anyone who says that their customer service is lacking either had a one-off bad experience or is just a difficult and demanding customer. Just one example of their service: we went into Old SJ one night to meet with a friend who lives there and upon giving the address of our destination to the bell hop (who we had befriended over the course of the stay), he proceeded to have a 5 minute conversation with the cabbie about how he wasn't to leave us anywhere that didn't look above board (we were two women traveling alone) and that he was to stay until we went in to make sure that nothing was amiss...true to his word, the cabbie did stay with us because as it turned out, we were a little early and our friend wasn't home yet. Anyway, this anecdote speaks as highly of Puerto Ricans in general as of the hotel staff but the point is the same: it's a great place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Soosui
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with hotel. Staff was very courteous and polite. Concierge helpful and nice. We liked the little printer in lobby to print boarding passes. Other reviewers complained about the resort fee and that they charge half a day room rate for a late checkout. We were told quite clearly about them when we booked, so we knew what to expect. We had a balcony room overlooking pool and ocean. We loved it. The beds are "double" as opposed to queen in the double rooms, so people should be aware of that. Pool was crowded, but there were still chairs available. Bathrooms nice. Lobby and grounds very nice. Very easy to get to Old San Juan and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: OBX2002
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Ritz in San Juan three times and are headed back again soon. We've stayed in a pool view room, city view and the ground level courtyard suite. Each time, the rooms met our expectations and the service was great. Yes, the service is at a higher standard at most other Ritz properties, but you are in high season at a nearly booked hotel, So you must have patience at times and realize that you are not the only one paying to stay there. We have never spent time at the pool as it is not really our thing (too crowded, plus I can sit at the pool at home). We usually spend our time at the beach and it's great. Yes, you hear the planes, but they are not annoying. You need to realize you are at a resort in the city, This is not the Ritz in Abaco. The beach is not private, but really, who cares. No one bothers you and the staff is great in setting up chairs, towels, tables and umbrellas if you wish. The service is great too, but sometimes lacks a bit when the hotel is really crowded. If you slip the server some cash when you first place your order and ask them to check back every so often...they take great care of you. As for the prices, they are not unreasonable. They are in line with Ritz prices elsewhere and if they are too high...stay somewhere else. This is how they maintain the "Ritz". We've eaten at IL Mulano, BLT, the outside bar and the breakfast buffet and all were great. The casino is clean and one of the nicest in town. Is always nice to spend some time in there after a meal in our out on the town. Some other places in Old San Juan are Gallery Botello (if you have a fat wallet) if not, they have side room with inexpensive prints. Places we enjoy to eat are Dragonfly, Cafe Puerto Rico, Sofia's (great pizza). All in all, the Ritz is one of the best hotels on the island. El Convento in Old San Juan is nice, but on a totally different scale (stayed there too).

Reviews.Title: “Are you sure this is a Ritz Carlton?”
Reviews.Author: ritzyme
Reviews.Content: The lack of hospitality was palpable from the awful mango punch to the countless times I was told how sorry the management was, but could do nothing to correct the problems. For myself I was trapped in a hotel without windows that open. The dust and feathers in the bedding made it impossible to relax in my room. I had requested a feather free room when booking the reservation, at check in I was told that they could not accommodate my request, as they were booked. I wheezed ,sneezed and was most displeased 2/17 thru 2/21 . This is not A Ritz!. I have stayed at Ritz Carltons in Orlando and San Francisco. Marriott needs to send these folks to Hotel School. Hospitality means service Not just say I'm sorry and do nothing to fix the problem. The grounds and the physical property are very nice but the hugh markup for food and drink is unwarranted. If you are looking for better service look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Another great time in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: PTM1962
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Ritz since it opened 12 years ago. Yes it always takes some time at check-in before your room is ready; we bring a carry on with a change of clothes and use the spa to change clothes. This is the best resort in San Juan, others do not come close. We tried a few and were disappointed. We always stay on the club floor and it feels like home when we arrive. The club staff is always there to take care of your needs. We have breakfast and lunch on the club and usually grab a cocktail before heading out for dinner. Many people eat all meals and desserts on the club as well. We ate at IL Mulino twice this year and the service and quality of food is fantastic. We had Valentineâ€™s dinner there and it was awesome. Ruthâ€™s Chris steakhouse is nearby at the intercontinental and Mortonâ€™s is a short taxi ride at the Hilton. There are many excellent restaurants in Old San Juan as well. We usually spend one afternoon shopping (Coach, Polo, Guess, Burberry and many more). I would rather use the beach instead and just relax. San Juan has a feeling of being in a city with a tropical feel; you have to know this before going. Many people are disappointed about all the buildings, the airport etc. We like looking at the planes taking off while you are swimming in the ocean, others complain about the noise. The resort has a city feel as well, many of the rooms do not have balconies. The rooms are very clean (never had a bad experience) and the cleaning staff is great. Call them when you check-in a let them know what time you want your room cleaned and turned down, they will accommodate all requests. Keep an open mind as well, many guests think that just because they are staying at a Ritz Carlton that they should be treated like royalty. Be prepared to spend money, nothing good is cheap. If paying $20 for a burger is not your thing, then donâ€™t come here! My recommendations: If you can stay on the Club level (Worth it!) and take advantage of all it has to offer, it will save your money in the long run. Tip the Club staff; they go beyond the normal level of service. Have dinner at Il Mulino. The quality and service are great. The Ritz does make you feel special and that is what vacations are all about. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “92 Dollar per day Resort Fee From Hell”
Reviews.Author: tabarber99
Reviews.Content: This is your basic Ritz, a nice hotel, service is spotty. We only had three nights away from our kids and paid top dollar for ocean front club level -- 659 dollars a night. Check in was bumpy -- at 2:45 pm we waited in line downstairs for fifteen minutes then were whisked up to club level where we waited another twenty minutes to be told by a rather surly woman that our room was not ready and "we have till four come back at four" It went on and an until I requested the front desk manager who found us a room immediately. Rest of stay was uneventful, until we got our bill and discovered we were being charged $92.26 PER DAY for a "resort fee". The room tax was only 89 dollars a day. I have stayed in Ritz hotels all over the world and sometimes they charge you 25 bucks a day for a "resort fee" but $92.26? Apparently they add fifteen percent to your bill to tip the bellman and pool guys (who we tip anyway). The front desk manager on duty did not return our call. My husband had to go down and fight with them for an hour to resolve the issue. It was a nightmare. Not a good way to end a romantic trip. I am in the process of writing to the corporate headquarters and the hotel GM to express my indignation. As a result of this experience I will probably not ever stay in another Ritz again --- there are other choices in the high end luxury market that do not try to tack exorbitant fees onto the bills of loyal guests who are already paying top dollar. BE WARNED BEFORE YOU BOOK!!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, under achieving........save your money.”
Reviews.Author: goooooocats
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week here and were not impressed! The location is great being close to the airport and the RItz has a VERY nice beach. There are a lot of restaurants, shops, and attractions within walking distance or a short cab ride as well. That is about the end of the compliments. Almost all of the rooms have no outside access. No windows that open, no balcony, just a box and not a very big box. We called the front desk about getting a balcony and they would upgrade us for ONLY $150/night more than the $400 / night we were already spending..... rediculous! One of our first days, we sat on the beach paying $14/ drink and watched our waiter serve free drinks all day to his "sweetie" who happened to be a local. My wife confirmed this by striking up a conversation with her at the end of the day. Infuriated, my wife complained to the manager and was told it was a "misunderstanding". After that, we went and bought our own beverages outside the hotel and packed a cooler. It was not worth the money when you know they cater to the locals unfairly.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing get away”
Reviews.Author: JamieCleveland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The service was excellent. We do not like overbearing service, so this was perfect. The housekeeping service was great. The room was always clean, but we never saw the housekeeping staff. The pool was beautiful, but a little chilly. The beach was great! No rocks, shells, just soft sand. It is a small hotel, so if you are looking for a sprawling resort (aka Mexico), this is not the place for you. The food and drinks are expensive, but you are on vacation! We walked to several places to eat and really enjoyed them: Metropol, Platos and Pui Bella. We took a cab to Old San Juan and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not be fooled by name!!”
Reviews.Author: tom79762
Reviews.Content: This Ritz is not your normal Ritz. We called it the "I am Sorry Ritz". I do not know how many times we were told after a mistake how sorry they were. It took forever to get a room even at 5:00 PM and nobody in the lobby on a Sunday. I was promised a 150.00 credit and never got it for waiting til 6:30 PM for a room. The beach is full of sand fleas so that is a bummer. The hotel is clean and thats about all I can say. I was hungry all day long. At night they only have a limited number of seats at the two restaurants so you must call a day or so ahead. I ate in my room two nights out of six. The menus at the hotel restaurants are very limited. The pool is nice but no music, bummer. No people in the hotel knew any thing about the hotel. In six days at the pool I was asked about a drink a sum total of 7 times, but they were real sorry. The gift shop is totally a waste. A couple of bags of chips and a couple cookies. No cokes or liquid drinks of any kind. I bought most of my pepsis at the bar, but be careful the maids will throw away any food or drinks in the rooms. They did it to me twice. The casino is the one bright spot it is very nice. In summation I do not think this is a normal Ritz Carlton. If it is they do not deserve the prices they charge. I got better service in Vegas and in Aruba at 3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: SHU1996
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz in San Juan with a large group that was on the island to view a college basketball tournament. I know this hotel is quite expensive, but hard for me to give exact details as my pricing was part of a larger package that included things outside of hotel (dinners,transportation,tours) so it is hard to give an exact detail on price. Hotel is very close to airport, which is a good and bad thing. It is in a bit of a noisy area, planes going overhead, and also outside the hotel at the street. The neighborhood around the hotel is not really a touristy area per se, but there are a lot of options for food and drink in walking distance. While the area around hotel was not luxury, I still think it was pretty safe and many people, both guests and residents walking around, even at night. Several restuarants around, including fast food joints, as well as small strip malls, with drug stores like Walgreens - purchase snacks or other items outside hotel gift shop. The hotel was very nice. Lobby was nice, including a seating area with a small bar. Several nice, but expensive hotels in the hotel. We ate at the breakfast buffet several times, and ate at the il Mulino restaurant in hotel. The food at il Mulino is very good, they have several locations around the world, including NYC. The casino was a nice size, with a decent crowd and choice of games. Pool was very nice, beach was nothing special. Service was so so. Getting drinks at pool took a while and the cost was siginifcant. Pool attendents set up chairs, umbrella and towels for you, but expected a tip. Chairs were nice and padded, but were often wet due to rain or people sitting on with wet clothes. I found this annoying, even when extra towels were placed on chairs they eventually soaked through. Food is expensive. Had a cheeseburger by the pool for lunch one day and I believe it cost something like $18. It was a regular burger, not kobe or angus beef, and the service by pool side restuarant was not great. After that day, we realized to eat out away from the hotel, for much more reasonable and better quality food for lunch. Our group also had an issue with the hospitality suite we were assigned. Even though we brought our own food and snacks for the group (as we were told), the Ritz charged crazy fees for ice, glasses and cleanup that made it almost not worth using. Overall it was a good trip, but I think you could get a better deal at a comparable hotel. You obviously pay for the Ritz name. If money is no issue, this maybe the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carltons I am Used to!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roccodog
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband for a meeting. Were put in room 723 it smelled like cheap household bug killer, then went to the bathroom, and the toilet had leaked on the floor. I had asked not to be put on 7th floor due to some mention in an earlier post about bedbugs. They did move us after we complained and the all the necessary personnel came to check out our complaints. We were moved to the 4th floor, smelled better but really tired rooms. This is just not of the caliber we are used to with staying at the Ritz. It was horribly expensive, with all sorts of addons on our bill, resort fee, bellman fee, housekeeping fees, valet fees, we didn't have a car. Not enough staff in the hotel bar. Usually you had to go to the bar to order and the lounge was always pretty full. WE have written the Ritz Carlton and have yet to receive a reply about our bill. Look elsewhere it is not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for the Ritz in SJ and Elmer's mimosas too”
Reviews.Author: llombardo24
Reviews.Content: Top notch. Glad I had a healthy food and beverage budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not the Ritz we expected”
Reviews.Author: GettingCozy
Reviews.Content: Two of my girl friends and I went to the Ritz for a three-night getaway. We decided to splurge and were really looking forward to top quality all around. We found that some things were very good and others quite mediocre, if not disappointing. However, I will noted that at the end of our stay, the manager, Ramon, thoughtfully addressed my concerns and gave us a deduction on our bill, which we very much appreciated. To address the comment made by another writer about the 7th floor having bed bugs - we stayed on the 7th floor and were just fine. However, we hadn't read that review before we came and then other guests told us about it - about the review and that they had been on that floor and their room smelled funky like bug spray. We were quite alarmed upon hearing it, and at first the staff at the Ritz did/said little to appease our concerns and also could not switch our room b/c the hotel was full. The next morning, however, Ramon promptly told us that the hotel (and all hotels) are frequently checked for bed bugs and insects and that there are none, but rather, people can be bitten by sand fleas. Still, he had an exterminator come to make absolutely sure. We appreciated this measure. The good -The pool area was nice. You can have an umbrella if you like. Waiter/waitress service at the pool, though slow at times and you need to flag them down. -The spa was very nice. I had an amazing massage. -The concierge was helpful with dinner suggestions and providing menus. -The bellmen were very nice, especially Carlos. -Many people seem to love the restaurants at the hotel. I can't speak to them, as we went into Old San Juan every night for dinner. -Some people don't like the location, but I understood where the hotel was located when I booked, and it was quite good for us. We really liked being so close to the airport, and we rarely heard planes overhead. The bad -Our key cards kept not working when we went up to the room. This was an annoyance b/c then we would have to go downstairs and have the cards redone. This happened three times. Ramon was apologetic about this and said that they are fixing this hotel-wide problem. -The pool area staff are not that attentive. And, at times, the pool area is dirty with people's food or drink glasses from hours earlier. -Housekeeping kept giving us one or two towels only and no washcloths. They also did not give us additional shampoo and conditioner, when it was clear we had used up what they had given us and did not refill the coffee, which is in the room with a coffee maker. Every day we had to call housekeeping for one or more of these items. -I was told when I booked that the Ritz beach was a private beach. This is not the case; all beaches in San Juan are public. We didn't go to the beach b/c of the warnings about sand fleas. Overall, I didn't find the hotel all that special, except for Ramon, who I think was excellent at attempting to address our concerns. I would choose a more moderately priced hotel next time b/c I didn't think that we received anything so splurge worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, greedy, resort hotel in ugly setting”
Reviews.Author: JRLP
Reviews.Content: There are some good things about this hotel; for example: pretty gardens, a good pool, beach-side location, and nice enough rooms. But the overall experience is marred by other disadvantages: * it's huge; not an intimate or charming hotel (I guess that's obvious since it's a Ritz Carlton, not a small, privately-owned hotel); * the location isn't good; it's near the airport and the 'planes can be heard constantly from the beach and pool, and the beach is fringed by ugly blocks of condos or apartments; * they tried to add $50 per day to my bill for a "resort fee" which I hadn't been warned about. Why add such a charge as an extra when it's a resort hotel in the first place? Why not charge a "carpet fee" for using the carpet in your bedroom? * my peace and quiet -- and my sleep on one occasion -- were disturbed by stupid and unnecessary phone calls asking if I was content with this or that service (e.g. room service) or if I was sure I didn't want a turn down service.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone loves this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: This is the second time our group has stayed at this hotel and everyone loves the quick to get to location on the beach. The hotel doesn't have a lot of frills for a Ritz, but the staff is extremely friendly and the rooms comfortable as expected. Compared to other facilities in Puerto Rico (I've also unfortunately stayed at the Marriott Stellaris), I am giving this hotel 5 stars as the rate for a Ritz is also very reasonable. The staff is great at organizing and taking care of our meeting needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Were At The Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: AUJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan for our honeymoon, in fact we are still here as I am writing this. We opted to save some money and get the city view room which turned out to be a view of the airport which stunk. From the beach you can see and hear the planes taking off all day. It is a constant reminder that our vacation will come to an end. The pool area is way too cramped. The pool itself is smaller and the lounge chairs are packed close to each other. The other night we walked down the street and decided to check out the Intercontinental Hotel. It is beautiful! The hotel lobby is spacious and comfortable and the pool is huge with a waterfall and swim up bar. Just now I checked the room rates for the Intercontental and found that I could have an ocean view room for less than our "city view" room at the Ritz. I would recommend anyone considering the Ritz in San Juan take a look at the Intercontinental first.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs at the Ritz in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TravelsfromKY
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel occured Jan. 12-17, 2010. I was impressed with the bell service, prompt elevators, and quality of the food. Anything positive during my stay is heavily over-shadowed by being severely attacked by bed bugs on the 7th floor. Never did I expect for this to happen at a Ritz property. After the first night, I noticed three bites in a line on my left foot and one on my back. I ultimately ended up with over 100 bites on my feet, legs, arms, shoulders, neck, and my face!! I had no choice but to visit my dermatologist once I returned home, who told me he'd never seen anything this bad. He prescribed me oral steroids, topical steroids, and anti-itch medication. It was at this point that he told me I, due to the biting pattern of my spots I've definitely been exposed to bed bugs. Two other people within my company who stayed on the same floor also had bites in the same pattern. The hotel will tell you it's sand fleas, but we never spent time at the beach due to the storms everyday. I'm mortified by this experience! Although bed bugs have nothing to do with hygeine, the social stigma surrounding it does! Please do not stay here! No matter where you stay, always check the room thoroughly. You never want to deal with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: VWFreak
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff here is excellent and so is food at BLT Steak. Other than that, the rest of the hotel is nice, but not at the level you'd expect from a Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Cam31
Reviews.Content: For the price and brand of Ritz-Carlton, this particular hotel leaves A LOT to be desired. Staff and service are extremely poor and don't seem to care about feedback or making things better. Location is nice but there needs to be a lot more done to make this a great hotel to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless and lazy staff. Horrible surrounding neighborhood. All for an exorbitant price.”
Reviews.Author: judy017
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, but there are too many other drawbacks to make the expense of staying at a Ritz worth it. 1. The neighborhood is desolate and quite run down. The hotel sits right at the end of the highway. It's kind of a scary walk to the local pharmacy and there isn't much in the way of restaurants nearby. Be prepared to stay in lockdown at the hotel. Condado is a much better location as there are places to walk around outside the hotels. 2. The staff is very unhelpful and is always looking to make a buck off of you. For example, a simple activity of sitting by the pool turns into a shakedown for a $70 cabana. Another example-I was told that I could check out at 1pm (regular check out is noon. this service is often complimentary at an establishment such as this). Nobody mentions that I'd get charged $250 for this service! Apparently late check out incurs a charge between half and full room rate. 3. At the end of my stay I took a look at my hotel bill and found that I was incorrectly charged for something I did not order. I took it up with the front desk and got a whole bevvy of excuses. "The person who reviews this is not available". "Our system is down". " We cannot get a report" etc. etc. etc. It was obvious that they just wanted me to shut up and go away. 4. The beach is nice, but definitely not serene or private for that matter. The hotel beach is adjacent to a public entrance to the beach. Call me an elitist, but I paid a lot of money to enjoy the serenity of an exclusive, private resort, NOT a public stomping ground.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott hotel with the Ritz Carlton Logo”
Reviews.Author: cayman99
Reviews.Content: Wow, it's all I can say. If you are expecting top notch service, Ritz Carlton service, this is not the place for you. If you are willing to pay a ton of money for mediocrity. Knock yourself out this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to give it a 5 but can't.”
Reviews.Author: baysail
Reviews.Content: There was many things about our stay that were very very positive. It really does look exactly like the photos on the website. The staff in Club Lounge was very solicitous. The Club Lounge was well stocked and it provided us with the equivalent of a stocked kitchen and bar from 7 AM to 10 PM. This was a great cost saving compared to buying meals and drinks at the hotel. The setting is gorgeous. The hotel was spotless and for a change everything worked in our two rooms. Walking into the lobby through the front door was breath taking each time. New Years Eve at the small restaurant beach side was memorable. The food, drink, and music was great. The fireworks on the beach was an unexpected plus. The lobby bar occupies a large part of the lobby. It was often filled with happy people chatting, eating and drinking. The location in Isla Verde is very good. Now for the bad news. One of our two original rooms faced the side of the Club balcony about 20 feet away. Within the first few hours I had people looking in my window. I requested a change from the Club concierge with no result so I presented myself at the front desk, told them what room I was in and they knew immediately what the problem was and moved us to a far better room. I have a good idea... how about not trying to stick someone staying for a week in that crappy room. Getting a beach chair or pool chair and umbrella required rising early and getting downstairs to lay claim to a spot not later than 8 AM. Getting the beach staff to help set up required more patience than should be expected from people paying top dollar at this hotel. They were understaffed and under supplied with chairs and umbrellas. After a couple of days of this nonsense, I started taking the chairs off the pile myself and setting it up. Housekeeping couldn't quite remember to leave us a bath mat and shampoo. The two chain restaurants located at the hotel appear to not understand that guests of the hotel should get first priority in seating. At BLT we were refused reservations at 7 PM and told there was nothing available except 6 PM and 9:30 PM. We finally got a 6:30 slot after the Club concierge called and made a fuss. After arriving we discovered that between 6:30 and 8:30 there were three booths, 3 regular tables and all the high tables unoccupied. While this isn't a RC problem per se, they really need to work out the arrangement better. Did these flaws ruin the vacation? Of course not... I'd stay here again; but at these prices I shouldn't have to assert myself at a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “OMG what CHAOS”
Reviews.Author: sledxl
Reviews.Content: Do not even... No beach manager, no chairs no towels, no service, no rooms ready until almost 5 pm. Lovely property with no management. Just try to find someone to talk to and try and make the situation a little better. Impossible - they massively overbooked this week and cannot offer anything like Ritz Carlton service to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Castle in the Caribbean!”
Reviews.Author: Oregontraveler1975
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable. The rooms were well appointed. Turn down service was great, the staff were very professional and friendly. We enjoyed the ammenities. We had a misunderstanding about the Gym hours, and missed a few days of working out in the evening. Check the hours as they are open until 7 or 9 depending upon the sauna and the exercise room. The staff at the spa were great. The facilities were beautiful. We enjoyed the Breakfast buffet which we found was well priced. We honestly have no complaints and enjoyed the immaculate grounds and the surf on the beach. On Sunday, the pool is quite busy with locals and its hard to find a lounge chair by the pool, so that would be a good day to plan a trip to El Yunque Rainforest which we enjoyed or Camuy Caves which we regret that we didn't make it out to see but hope to next time. We spent $70 more and rented a canopied tent in the best part of the pool on the Sunday and enjoyed lavish service and comfortable couches. OK we spent more, but I think it was worth it. It was so much fun for all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property, Staff Needs Customer Service Refresher”
Reviews.Author: GeekVeep
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this was my first trip to PR and I didn't like it, but I will try not to let my bias about the city of San Juan itself cloud my review of this specific property. We arrive in about 15 very short, easy minutes from the airport. This is a big plus if you are going on a trip and don't want to spend 2 days traveling. Get a direct flight and SJ can be almost as easy as driving to the beach. But with this proximity to the airport, you can hear the planes taking off and landing, but only from the outside of the resort. I never heard any airport noise in my room. On the beach, the planes take off approximately every 30 minutes. It's noisy, but since the beach in SJ has waves crashing, it really isn't annoying like it would be if you were on a quiet tropical beach with no waves. The beach is beautiful, but not a tropical beach as I expected. Shame on me for not doing more research on this part of PR because the beach was more like Jersey than the Caribbean. I understand that other beaches on the island on the south, west, and east sides are much better, but this one is on the Atlantic Ocean, so don't expect the calm, clear blue tropical waters of the Caribbean. Prior to going, I read complaints about getting service on the beach for drinks and that the drinks were crazy expensive. The drinks are crazy expensive, but it's the Ritz. If you are expecting bargains, DO NOT come to this resort! We got services just fine, but we made a point to introduce ourselves to the servers each morning, slip them a $20 and then ask them to come back every 30-45 minutes. We also tipped well with each round and service was never a problem. The pool is beautiful, but overrun with kids. This is definitely a family resort so if you are annoyed with screaming kids (even in the upscale restaurants!), you will be unhappy here. I do think that for the prices that are charged, there should be some NON-family friendly areas of the resort and restaurants (other than the casino) where business people or folks traveling without children can relax. We rented a cabana at the pool one day and it was a good deal, however we were very disappointed that we ended up beside a family with about 6 kids under the age of 10 and were unable to work. We asked for a cabana at the far end and were accommodated right away; however, if this had been a busy time at the resort, we would have been stuck beside them. The rooms are beautiful, room service was expensive but good, and the maid staff did a nice job. The staff, in general, are not over friendly. We were told that the PR folks are not as friendly as other islands; that they tend to be aloof and that we shouldn't take it personally. I have to say that when I'm staying at a hotel of the magnitude of the Ritz, I do not expect aloof service, no matter what the local culture may be. I expect far better from the Ritz and am sad to say that aside from a few servers or doormen, the vast majority of the staff at the Ritz and business folks around SJ are just not very friendly no matter how hard one tries. This reason, and the SJ beach being on the Atlantic are why I won't be going back to SJ unless I absolutely have to. I'm willing to try another area of the island, though. Fortunately, I had gotten a killer deal on the Ritz and that was why we were there. If I had paid full price, I would have been furious. I understand that there is a "Club Level" on the 8th or 9th floor, where breakfast and lunch and some drinks and snacks are included. Several folks we met were on this program and felt it was a great deal. Be sure to ask about it to see if it might save you money. As a point of reference, our breakfast at the Ritz each morning for 3 of us was $77 including tip, so judge for yourself about how much it costs to eat on property. Again, I can't stress enough; it's the Ritz and the prices are crazy expensive, so don't go if this will cause you stress during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing time and experiece”
Reviews.Author: sxs317
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and young son) had a short break so we decided that it was time to get out of the freezing cold of PA and take a relaxing vacation. We picked Puerto Rico because of a sweet deal from Costco travel of on free night stay at the Ritz Carlton San Juan so it ended up being a better deal for a little more than the Expedia deals. Let me just say Iâ€™m glad we stayed at the Ritz. Weâ€™ve stayed at a Ritz before an so far no other hotels have beaten the quality of stays weâ€™ve been at before. Granted we havenâ€™t stayed at hotel chains such as the Four Seasons or Mandarin Orientalâ€™s but we have stayed at Fairmont hotels and Westin hotels and the Wynn hotel in Las Vegas. We stayed a total of 4 nights and it was a great experience. Maybe because we had a newborn, but this trip was definitely more gratifying for me than past beach vacations. Hotel: In my opinion this is probably the best place to stay in San Juan, both from perspective and from what we have been told and the fact that we did see other hotels which I will explain later why. The pool is gorgeous and relaxing and right next to the beach. The great thing about the Ritz is that you do pay a resort fee but it covers towels, chairs and about anything you need when youâ€™re there. That is totally a convenience especially since weâ€™ve been to other hotels where you need a sign-out sheet, or pay per hour for use of chairs. That IMO just ruins the experience. With the Ritz you donâ€™t have to worry about any of these things. Room The room was an average sized room with a king sized bed. The Ritz surprisingly is quite family friendly in that they provided a crib at no extra charge. Another note with Ritz service is that if you need anything they make sure you get it as soon as possible and they have just about everything you need. They even had pack and plays for the pool. The bathroom was very nice with Bvulgari brand shampoo and soap, plenty of towels, a flat screen tv and feather bed and down comforters. High speed internet LAN and wireless are included. Our view was terrible and they wanted to charge us $70/night extra for an oceanview but that was expected since we got a package deal. Pool The pool and beach we excellent although we stayed by the pool most of the time. Service was good and there were plenty of other families. There are always snooty old couples though that get annoyed when your baby cries but who cares, you paid for the place too. Food by the pool is expected to be expensive but youâ€™re at the ritz. $12 for a mixed drink, I drank a lot of Coronas at $7 a pop, but it was SOOO good in the nice weather. Slighty windy when we were there but I didnâ€™t care. Location This was key for the hotel in that it was only 5-10 minutes away from the airport. The costco package was great in that we had a personal driver that picked us up from and took us too the airport included in the package. That was definitely a bonusâ€¦a first for us too! We were picked up in an Escalade and they provided a car sear for us!! There is a Walgreens like 5 minutes walk we were able to pick up stuff for the baby and drinks and snacks since we didnâ€™t want to spend so much on soda at the hotel. Restaurants: There are three main restaurants there, Il Mulino, BLT steakhouse, and OBG. The mares restaurants is the hotel breakfast restaurant. We tried all of them. We are all about food, so we like the food selections at the Ritz a lot. OBG The first night there we went to OBG for the sushi in which it seemed they were heavily advertising â€œfirst female sushi chef in Puerto Rico,â€� and is sounded like it should be good. I wouldnâ€™t recommend it, probably really over rated, the sushi was just par and very little selection. It was basically the beach side restaurant that served sushi. OBG is the same restaurant that serves the pool , the food was just ok and overpriced, but what do you expect. We go nachos one day, and the chicken sandwich and the salmon wrap by the pool. I donâ€™t think you should expect gourmet cuisine by the pool and we tend to expect overpriced mediocore food by the pool so I donâ€™t really complain about it. Butâ€¦if youâ€™re budget conscious then pool food is not the way to go. BLT We went to BLT TWICE, just because we like steak and wine so much. We saw a couple get the porterhouse for two and it looked so good we wanted to try it. BLT was nice in that from 6-7 PM they offered half price all wines, which is another reason we went there again. They had a nice selection of wine and both nights the wine was good. The steak is on the level of Mortonâ€™s, they overcooked our Porterhouse on the second night (and we specifically emphasized to keep it rare) but we were enjoying the evening too much to even care. Service was excellent and the coconut bread pudding was great. Il Mulino Il mulino apparently is a restaurant from New York thatâ€™s difficult to get reservations at so Iâ€™m glad we were able to try it in Puerto Rico. That restaurant was an EXCELLENT experience. Service was great, it is basically upscale Italian cuisine, but it was great. Itâ€™s pricey, as are all the restaurants at the ritz but you never felt like you were over paying because they give you so much extra! If you ever ate Tappasâ€¦itâ€™s the opposite of that feeling, ie tappas you pay an arm and a leg and get as little food as possible. Il Mulino started us with antipasti that was delicious and aged parmesian cheese. They a huge variety of breads and tasty garlic bread. The wine was very expensive so the wines by the glass sufficed. The menu has a huge selection but Iâ€™m sure all the dishes are good. They have an extensive specials menu also. We werenâ€™t sure what dessert to get but ended up with the Tiramsu, but the gave is a sample of the other dessert complimentary!! They also bring you a nice liquor after your dessert complimentary. In short if I were to go again I would have eaten at Il Mulino twice, excellent service, food and experience! The price was about average too for a nice meal like that, we were highly impressed. Lobby Bar The lobby bar is really nice. Nice selection of martiniâ€™s that run $14-16, and mixed drinks. They give you a plethora of snacks with your drinks like nuts, plantain chips and olives. The lobby bar extends outside to a nice patio area that really relaxing at nice hearing the frogs and the ocean. They also have coffee, desserts and tappas if you are interested in a little snack. Mares Breakfast We had the breakfast buffet twice which was great! We often got up late and just used it as a brunch and skipped lunch because you get a huge amount of selection. You can choose between the continental buffet or the hot food buffet. Contintal is often good enough in that you get coffee, champagne (which was awesome) and a selection of fruits, breads, cereals and cheeses and cold cuts. We love the smoked salmon can cold cuts. The hot buffet includes omlet stations and sasauge waffles and everything else you would expect. The price was $20 for the continental and $26 for the hot foods, and it almost seemed as though it was more worth it the get the buffet over the ala carte. Overall the food at the ritz was excellent. Weâ€™re kind of lazy so we didnâ€™t want to venture out too far to get food especially with our baby but if you are on a budget there are a bunch of reastaurants outside the hotel within walking distance. What to do The only excursion we took was to the El Yuncai rainforest. But there is probably plenty of other stuff to do like visit other islands and go to old San Juan. The rainforest itself is ok, I felt it wasnâ€™t anything special but nature lovers may like it. I wouldnâ€™t recommend a tour either in that the whole tour we took started at 830 and ended at 300 PM. I say we spent 1.5 hrs looking at the rainforest and then 4 hrs on the road picking up and dropping off people on the tour. I would recommend just going yourself if you are interested so the time there isnâ€™t wasted on the road. Our time was precious in that days are short in the winter and we just wanted to sit by the pool and get fried. After a majority of the day was burnt from the tour we decided not to go out on another excursion since the resort was so sweet. It was on the tour though we were able to see other hotels like the Conquistador and the Gran Melia Resorts. They didnâ€™t look as inviting as the Ritz and were SO far from the airport, we were glad we stayed at the Ritz. Final Thoughts All in all the Ritz is a great place. There is a casino there but we didnâ€™t even have time to go because we were enjoying the rest of the hotel so much. Complaints of price I feel arenâ€™t warranted because it should be expected being at the Ritz Carlton, they gotta keep up their name somehow. Weâ€™ve been to other beaches like St. Thomas and Bermuda so the prices in Puerto Rico werenâ€™t so shocking. The service, resort grounds, food and pool were great. I highly recommend the Ritz San Juan to anybody looking for a stress free and amazing vacation. Thanks to the staff who were all so polite and made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: INES58
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel in a garden pool view suite, a lovely one, with a very nice view of the pool, the terrace very pleasant with 2 lounge chairs and a big table. The swimmimg pool very nice too even if a bit cold, were surprised. The beautiful beach is just in front and very nice. The hotel has 3 restaurants, Il Mulino too expensive and not so good, the Steak House better. The problem is that if you do not book in advance you do not get the table and you do not have any other choice than go outside the hotel and this is not the best solution. We went to the pool area restaurant and had sushis, excellent, but not so funny, the restaurant is better for the lunch time with a beautiful view on the beach. We had a problem at the pool, our 2 pairs of shoes has been stolen. This was a little strange and we complained about that. So be careful not to let any personal belonging at the pool if you go to the beach!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jasmineinma
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was absolutely perfect for our much-needed 4 nights of rest and relaxation on Puerto Rico. Facilities: The hotel itself is gorgeous. The garden, pool, and beach are perfectly groomed, immaculate, and stunningly beautiful. Our room was clean and bright, with large windows. The "city view" actually included some distant mountains, so if you could overlook the big and less attractive rooftops, there was something pretty rest your eyes on. The lobby is perfectly lovely and the spa is beautiful. I took a complimentary yoga class, which was invigorating. (There were only two students in the class, and I felt the instructor could've given more personalized attention, considering this, but other than that, it was a good class.) The treatment at the beach is first class; they will set up chairs and towels into a lovely bed and arrange that umbrella just to your liking. Very personalized, very helpful service there. Service Overall, service was a bit of a mixed bag. When we had someone's attention, they were consistently helpful and a few employees truly went above and beyond. There were other moments though when it was unnecessarily difficult to get someone's attention. Trying to order food at the beach and cocktails in the lobby took much longer than necessary. And it took 2 phone calls and 1 hour to successfully obtain extra towels in our room. But who cares? We were on vacation, and it didn't concern us too much. Didn't diminish our enjoyment of the stunning views and peaceful atmosphere. If you expect to feel like other people are bending over backwards for you every time, then stay somewhere else. But if you want to be relaxed and a bit indulged (you're on vacation!), then you will be here. Chill out. You'll get what you need, it just might take a few extra minutes. Food We ate at Il Mulino and it was fabulous. Be sure to eat here if you can swing it; it is a true indulgence. The staff was impeccable and the food was delicious. The amuse bouches were abundant, rich, and wonderful. Make a reservation! Breakfast buffet was fine. Included mimosas, which was lovely. The rest of the buffet was kind of typical. I felt they should've worked hard to incorporate local, tropical fruits and flavors. (Rice and beans, plaintains, fresh citrus, different banana varieties, fresh coconuts--any of these would've been a welcome addition.) But it was enjoyable, nevertheless. I am vegan and they did a fantastic job accommodating me at every meal. Soymilk was on hand, waiters were well informed about the ingredients in the different offerings. A+ for that extra service! People complain about food prices here, but we didn't find them shocking. They were the same as we would expect to pay if we walked into any upscale hotel in our hometown (Boston), so we really didn't think that was worth a comment. Yes, it's pricey. No, its not more than we were expecting. And, anyway, there are a dozen cheaper options if you are willing to walk 5-10 minutes off the hotel property down Isla Verde avenue. There's no shortage of food options. Location Perfect for a quick getaway. So easy to get to from the airport ($12 cab, 5 minute drive), and on the most beautiful stretch of beach. Soft sand, gentle surf, not-too-deep water for a good distance off the shore. Trip to Old San Juan is less than 15 minutes without traffic ($20 cab). 1 hour drive from the rainforest. We also visited the mangrove forest in Humacao on a Pure Adventure guided kayak trip, which was a great time. Overall, we felt we got a great value and had a wonderful experience at the Ritz on Isla Verde. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: travel421NYC
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend to puerto rico for a mon-sat night trip. We found this great deal on expedia for the ritz - stay 3 nights and get 2 free! couldnt pass it up! The second we got to the hotel, perfection settled in! The greeters at the door always said "have a nice time" when leaving and "welcome back" when we returned. It is a small gesture but every time they did it, it made me smile! The hotel was immaculate and had such friendly staff! they put in vanilla and cinnamon scents in the air vents so the entire lobby smelled wonderful! The poolside staff was friendly and helpful - a waitress gave me a free drink when the bartender made an extra by accident! and at breakfast one morning, i couldnt decide between the continental breakfast (cold things) or a belgian waffle (biggest decision on vacation!) - the waiter saw my "struggle" and brought over complimentary waffles so that i could have the best of both :-) The other thing that won me over was the way they celebrated Chanukah (i was on a Norwegian cruise last year and i did not see ONE menorah! i wrote a letter...) The ritz not only had a menorah that was lit by a rabbi, but they had cookies out each and every night next to the menorah! How sweet! There is a Tiffanys in the hotel and i thought "oh boy, i dont belong here" - but it was not a pretentious hotel at all! it was absolutely amazing! I had never stayed in a ritz carlton before...and now i dont know if i can ever go to another hotel! It was truly one of the nicest places i have ever stayed and was made to feel special!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving-- Great experience”
Reviews.Author: spatraveler8
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was great, yes there are better Ritz properties out there, however I believe this is the best hotel in San Juan. My family and I walked into some other hotels we considered as well and we glad we chose the Ritz. Some advice. The cab ride is about $12 from the airport to hotel and is about a 5 min ride so don't do transfers with your travel agent. If you are sick of the $15 drinks at the Ritz there is a modest sports bar around the corner that has drinks priced very reasonable. There is also a great little gelato/dinner place called Pui Bella about two blocks away is is great for Breakfast and the Gelato is fantastic. There is also a Denny's around the corner if you need something at 2am. :) There is also a Walgreens within walking distance so if you want to buy hairspray, or sun tan lotion there you can and it will not be an arm and a leg. Plus it is always nice to fill the mini fridge with water that is not $5 each. If you are not on a plan with the Ritz breakfast alone can set you back over 30 per person. So there are some reasonable options nearby. The casino is one of the best on in San Juan. I didn't eat in the Resturants at the hotel for dinner but did eat at Taste in Old San Juan... By far one of the best places I have ever eaten. A little trendy in decor, specializes in smaller plates but fantastic and you should try it out. The owner was wonderful and spent alot of time with us just chatting. Great Place. Cafe PR is amazing as well. The Ritz is great- PR was wonderful... Visit the forts!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous island vacation....Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: halisue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in PR during Thanksgiving break. We had an amazing time. I research hotels ten ways to Sunday before we book and we had been referred to this resort by a friend, who told us it was the best on the island. We were happy to arrive from our direct flight (another plus) to an air conditioned airport with no customs line. We took a short 5 minute cab ride (another plus) to the immaculately landscaped Ritz. From the moment we arrived, we received excellent service. We had requested a pool view room, which were told would have a balcony and it did not, but that was o.k. The rooms were spacious and the staff calls you right away to see what you need. I recommend a pool or ocean view room, to save yourself the worry about airport noise. It never bothered us, even at the pool and beach. We got the Reconnect Package, which I highly recommend, plus our kids ate free. It saved us a lot of money. You get two adult breakfasts free daily, plus $100 resort credit to use at several of the restaurants, spa or gift shop. You can certainly find deals here if you seek them out. The pool and beach were great and there were a lot of children, but we had kids also, so that didn't bother us. The hotel had movies and a kids camp for the younger children.
