The food at BLT Steakhouse was fantastic and our credit covered a meal there. In fact, we ate dinner there twice. My one suggestion would be that you stay on top of your bill, which we did daily. There were erroneous charges every day, that had to be taken off, and I think that was due to the fact that we got a vacation package when we booked. The staff was happy to oblige. We walked over the El San Juan, which I had read about, and it seemed unimpressive and outdated. The lobby was smoky. We returned to the Ritz, where we never left again. We would definitely return, no question.

Reviews.Title: “nIce Thanksgiving weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Lecarrow
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fun five day family getaway at this hotel. First of all I echo the previous review of the property 100%. This is a perfectly nice hotel and we had a very nice trip but there is nothing about the vvisit that really "blew us away". We are a family of five, two parents and three older teenagers. We were very comfortable in two adjoining rooms. We had pool view rooms on the 7th floor which had a decent view but no balcony. The room and the location were good. The rooms are not very large but our rooms were very clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were amazing. The restaurants at the hotel were really just ok and even for the Ritz they were expensive for what you got. I am more than willing to pay for good food but the food here was less than average and way more expensive than average. We also ate at Morton's at the Caribe Hilton, The Palm at the El San Juan and the Ruth's Chris at the Intercontinental (do you sense a theme here) which were all great with very good service. At the Ritz we ate at BLT, Mares, OBG and the Il Mulino and none of them were great. We paid close to $500. for the Thanksgiving Buffet at Mares and it wasn't very good. We ate at Mares for the breakfast buffet at $26./person and that wasn't even average food. The pool food I also found less than average although my kids thought it was fine. My kids (14, 17 & 22) enjoyed the fitness center, it wasn't crowded and they especially enjoyed the (free) Yoga classes in the morning. The classes were very small and the instructors were great! Unfortunately otherwise there was very little activity at the hotel. The pool area was nice and I actually thought it was less insane than most resorts I have stayed at. The kids and families were generally surprisingly well behaved and well mannered. Of course there were the few that felt that they were entitled to get their "money's worth" by staking claim to all the chairs and pool floats whether they really needed them or not. (sorry for that small rant) The beach was very nice also. Despite the holiday crowds the pool and beach staff were great about finding chairs and umbrellas whenever we needed them. There is usually a bowl of oranges at the towel stand which was nice as a snack. The waitstaff also came around a couple of times with small smoothie samples and on our last day the towel stand was making free snow cones. The waitstaff at both the pool and beach were a little harder to pin down. It seemed better if we flagged them down earlier in the day (around noon time) before the lunchtime rush. My oldest son was the only one who spent anytime at the Casino. He went down for about 45 minutes each night and won between $50-$100 each night at the Blackjack tables! All this said, we got a good deal on this trip and we had a nice relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, But Among Best PR Has to Offer”
Reviews.Author: judubbb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from nice four-day Thanksgiving stay at RC. I travel to PR often for business and have stayed at most of the finer hotels on the island. While I agree with those who say that this RC does not compare to some of the chain's finest properties, it certainly stands above all the other resorts in PR in terms of amenities, cleanliness, and yes, service. I found the attitude of the staff to be very service-oriented, though execution was inconsisent. The property's public areas are in exellent shape and well maintained. The pool area is impeccable, and while there is no adult-only section I did find more privacy/serenity near the bird fountain. Ironically, I found the pool service to be the fastest and most organized in the hotel: wait people constantly asking if I needed anything, and drinks and food delivered crisply (they may have had extra help due to the busy holiday period). The rooms are somewhat small (as are the balconies if you happen to want to pay for one), but they are clean. Wear and tear is evident, but nothing terrible. The food in the hotel is generally very good (surprisingly so at the pool); yes, it is very expensive but we knew that going in and it didn't bother us. We ate at all the hotel's restauants: the prices at Il Mulino (for what you get) actually did disturb me and overall I left with the impression that it's nowhere near as good as it (and so many others apparently) thinks it is; BLT was our favorite in all regards (excellent wine list with some gems), we actaully liked the fish dishes better than the meat; breakfast/lunch at Mares was not as good as other RC's, but was fine....service here was the worst, long lines at host stand, endless waits for coffee refills, etc.; Ocean Grill is good for lunch (pool food comes from this kitchen, too), it also serves sushi Wed-Sun nights which was good-not-great but the ambience was nice (outside, ocean, etc.). The Lobby Lounge is enigmatic at best what with loud music at night, children running around, food service, etc. We did not return after the first night. Casino looked nice but honestly we didn't partake. Overall it was a fine vacation at a fine hotel, nowhere near the glitz and refinement and beautiful people experienced at other RC resorts (Florida, Hawaii, e.g.), but that's not such a bad thing because the at-tee-tude and entitlement (among adults and children) is also very much in check compared to others....to me this is a (pleasant) reality of vacationing in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect vacation resort.”
Reviews.Author: jmldra
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan was great. The staff was very pleasant and eager to give you information for transportation and places to go. Our room was nice which also had a balcony. Housekeeping supplied towels two times a day. We went to the Spa where we were treated very well. The location of the hotel is in walking distant to several nice restaurants. I would recommend stayin at the Ritz Carlton. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “$15 for a pina colada at the pool leaves a bad taste.”
Reviews.Author: john0105
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night at the end of our trip. At the front desk, they treated us as if they had been waiting all year for us to arrive, which was fun. But, poolside service was nonexistent. We saw one waitress in the distance, but the pool is so huge that she never made it over to us. After an hour or so, we gave up and walked over to the bar, where we ordered our $15 pina coladas. Yikes. The room was nice, and the hotel was fancy (with its own Tiffany's inside), and the pool was great. But in the end, my most vivid memory is being handed the $30 bill at the poolside bar and laughing out loud. Next time I'll bring a cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: TheKaiCA
Reviews.Content: Our stay would have been perfect except for the fact that the service in the pool and beach area was lacking. One day it was over 2 hours before someone asked if we wanted any food or drinks. This is definately not the level of service I am used to for a RC. Had service been better, we would have spent more $ at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definitely check it out”
Reviews.Author: iluvtravel_9
Reviews.Content: I simply must say, GREAT SERVICE. this is NOT my first time in Puerto Rico and I have stayed at other resorts out there and i must say, this is by far the best. I stayed here with my husband and baby (11 month). When we arrived, they gave us a smal room - with two double beds. At the time they said that they did not have a king size bed and that the acutal room accomodations were not guaranteed. I did not know what that meant exactly but they did say that they would change our room the next day. I was a bit annoyed but, we made the best of it. They did provide a crib for our baby and some toiletries for her. The next day, I reminded them about the arrangements and they promptly changed us to a suite. The lady working at the front desk was very nice and she moved us quickly. We were very pleased. What i liked most about the hotel was the service. I must say, the staff was very attentive. They provided cold water at the pool and the beach area without xtra charge, and they would sometimes even give you frozen drink samples. There was also fruit baskets at the towel stations that you could eat. They also provided us with a pack and play both at the beach and the pool which I must say, was a blessing when u travel with a baby. We were very comfortable. The service at the beach was just as good. We met the towel/chair guy Juan Ramos which was very nice and went out of his way to accomodate us. The cons about the hotel are: 1. the food is outrageously priced. I mean, $14 for a burger was a bit much and we come from NYC where prices are already high so we are used to that, but. we still found that to be a bit too out there. we found ourselves eating out of the hotel most of the time.:( which is not the best or most comfortable thing to do when traveling with baby. 2. the cost for the parking is $25 per day, which was also outrageous. We did not rent a car b/c of it. Other than those two factors, the hotel itself was great. the beach there is not the best in PR but is not too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, But Totally Worth It”
Reviews.Author: TeamTestudo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a very nice three day trip, where we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. While this is clearly not the best hotel in the Ritz porfolio, it is definitely worth booking if you head to San Juan. Pay close attention to this paragraph if you have complaints about the price of this hotel - remember that this is a top-line hotel in a resort town. My advice is to book through Apple Vacations online. We did this, and the price for a three-night stay with airfare from Baltimore was only $1250 for the two of us. That's only $416 per day WITH airfare! In fact, it was $65 less per person than the same package at the Marriott. I read a review where the family spent $526 per night and got charged for additional fees. I can assure you that the $1250 is not a misprint and the only additional charges on my final bill were the restaurant/bar charges that I put there during my stay. I tipped the doormen and the maids when I used ther services - there were NO "resort fees" on my bill. There was no charge for using the fitness center either. LOCATION This may be the only downside to staying at this hotel - if you plan to venture out a lot. Even though it is only 5 minutes from the airport (in fact, practically right on the airport property!), it is a $15-$20 cab ride to get just about anywhere else. This was possibly our biggest expense for the three days because all of the restaurants and other places we wanted to visit were in Old San Juan and Condado. It almost made more sense to rent a car. STAFF Check-in took about 5 minutes and the front desk person was as curtious and friendly as possible. Ditto the bar staff and the lunch staff at Mares. Casino staff was equally as friendly. FOOD The only time we ate at the hotel was for breakfast/lunch and tapas in the afternoon at the bar. The food at Mares is very fresh and well-prepared, albeit very pricey, and the staff was fantastic. The bartenders in the lobby bar were friendly as well and the tapas were decent. I did not eat at Il Mulino or BLT (although I have been to the BLT here in DC), but the menus looked great. POOL/BEACH Awesome. Pool is large and very nice. Beach area is clean as well. I never had a problem getting as many towels as I wanted or finding a decent spot by the pool or beach at any time. Beach staff was quick to move chairs to my desired location and set up an umbrella quickly if I so desired one. My only complaint about the beach/pool is that it is definitely quicker to go to the bar for drinks as the waitstaff was tough to track down. Overall this is a great hotel and again I highly recommend checking out the deals with Apple Vacations. I can see how this hotel would be extremely expensive through direct booking. Hotel staffs don't get much friendlier and if you are overly concerned about price, then you clearly shouldn't be booking a vacation at a Ritz Carlton. There's an Embassy Suites and a Holiday Inn right down the street. Bottom line - if you want a relaxing beach getaway at a classy hotel, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: 6van
Reviews.Content: Third-time repeat guest and enjoyed three night stay. Perfect location 5 minutes from airport especially if you're tight on time. Grounds and facilities are in excellent condition. Logisitics are superb with breakfast area just steps from the pool and beach. Beach crew very courteous and patient. Standard guest room (poolview) was adequate but there are more spacious rooms, if you prefer to upgrade. Regardless, it's hard to beat their service-oriented style. Housekeeping arrived almost in seconds if you need extra towels, pillows etc, they took care of printing our boarding passes and delivered same to the room, not much they won't do for you. There may be more elaborate Ritz Carltons but we were certainly satisfied here and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: H2Yellow
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the Ritz-Carlton for my second year in a row with my family. I have read many of the recent reviews and have formed some of my own opinions. Arrive at the airport, collect your luggage, go to the taxi stand and in 5 mins. you are greeted with smiles at the beautiful entrance to the Ritz-Carlton. The check in process is very simple, although I had found that some of the front desk staff are not as accommodating as others. The manager was very nice and welcomed us as well. The room we booked was an ocean view with a balcony. ( Make sure you have a room at least on the 6th floor as tall palm trees block the views below. ). The room is what one would expect; solid doors, robes, slippers (by request ) free water bottles, ipod clock radio and clean! The only complaints in the room are 1. the 12" mattress with a duck filled mattress top is out dated. For a hotel of this caliber I would expect some of the most comfortable beds known! 2. The bath towels felt old, never soft. Again, I would expect much better quality. Breakfast was the best part of the day. The staff in Mares Restaurant are the nicest bunch of people I have ever met. The food is fantastic and with most packages, it is also free! Special members of this staff include Letti, Angel, and Chef Jeremy, who made my family feel as if they were the most important people at the hotel. After breakfast, off to the pool or beach. The lounge chairs are very comfortable and the staff members at both locations are really nice and accomodating. Some reviewers complained about paper cone cups for water at the pool. They are right, it is annoying. But if you ask for a cup, the staff is more than eager to accomodate your request. We stayed at the beach most of the time. Several Hints: Go early and reserve your lounge chairs, umbrellas and tables. Bring bug spray as the beaches do have problems with sand fleas and flies. I was never bitten but my wife had numerous bites. If you have children with you like us, walk 2 blocks to walgreens. Buy pails, shovels, water boards, lotion. My kids loved the waves and clean warm water. The ocean bar restaurant serves very nice lunches and competitive prices to what I would expect in a hotel like this. A special member at this restaurant was William, who again made my family feel like royalty. For dinner, we went to BLT and Il Mulino several times each. BLT has great food but pricey! We ordered a bacon appetizer that was great, a rib-eye that was perfectly cooked and I had a great dessert; crepes with passion fruit. Il Mulino is by far the best italian restaurant I have ever gone too. Outrages food and a friendly staff made the evening complete. Hint: For my family, 1 salad, 1 dinner, 1 kids dinner and dessert was enough to feed my family of 4 quite well for approx. $70 plus drinks. Not bad for a great restaurant. If you go to Old San Juan, try Raices restaurant. Really good authentic food. Visit El Morro Fort and spend some money at the shops in town. You can find some real bargains. Oops, I almost forgot, the daily resort fee. You are charged 11% of your daily room rate for a resort fee. This allows you to use the facility and internet. If you calculate, a ocean view balcony room is approx $526 dollars so this comes out to $57.86 a day. A RIP OFF!!!! Add 12% tax per day and the daily price soars! We booked the piece of mind package so the free days were not charged either of these fees. Shame on the hotel for charging these outrages fees! But we will still return. If you are looking for a retreat to relax, spend quality time with your family, eat well, and meet some really special staff members, then go to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 'Ritziest" of the Ritz Carlton's”
Reviews.Author: MCKNJ
Reviews.Content: What I'm most impressed with when staying at a Ritz Carlton is when I first enter the property and the staff makes you feel like your a "Rock Star" Not at this property. I Love the Ritz pampering. Not here. While it's a beautiful property, it does need some updating. This place just didn't have any "Ritz" to it. Menus are limited for lunch. Il Mulino for dinner is fantastic. Absolute best part, it's 5 minutes from the airport. Close by are more reasonably priced places to eat. Within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel must be going broke, Lousy Service, Lousy Gift Shop.”
Reviews.Author: David2009068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is obviously in financial problems. I have stayed here more than a few time over the last year and need to let you know I will not stay here again. Service is not Ritz standard from any other Ritz location I have been to by a long shot. At first everything seems great, then as you need help, or an issue arrises, everything falls apart. I rate this hotel at 2 stars best, only because the grounds and lobby are maintained. Pool beautiful, casino small but fun... There are signs of money problems all over the hotel, from the maintenance of the rooms, the lack of follow up when a problem is reported to management... THE GIFT SHOP RESEMBLES A DOLLAR STORE, one bottle of suntan lotion, 2 candy bars, old magazines, it is obvious there is no money to even stock the gift shop. Problem with room reported to management, they moved me to a different room, insisted on moving my clothes and personal items themselves, move my things while I was out of the room on business.... when I got back that evening, my perscription glasses, my montblanc pen and my medicine in the refrigerator all did not make it to my new room. As I am diabetic, I need the medicine. Key card didn't work either, and had to make various trips to lobby because various key cards didn't work. Finally they find a manager to get a master key so I can get in the room ( 45 minutes later ). I leave a note at the lobby for someone to call me regarding the missing things and nobody ever calls me. Finally talk to a supervisor, and they tell me it was my fault for leaving those things in my room, if you can believe that. Disorganized, unprofessional, and unfortunately, can't recommend the Ritz San Juan to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: CTMACCI
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from a 4 night stay at the Ritz. Overall, the grounds are well kept, the pool area and beach were great! However, I was dissapointed right from the start. At check-in, we were informed that we woule get a room with double beds as our package did not allow a room selection. We had the option to upgrade for $30 per day. My husband basically had to negotiate and plead with the receptionist in order for us to get on a waiting list for a room with a king side bed. While this may not be the biggest issue for the common person, quite frankly we are used to getting upgrades and accomodating services at most 5 star hotels. Overall, the rooms are clean and spacious. With our package we were stuck overlooking the pool. No balcony and a restricted view. At this point, we probably would have been better off at the marrriot to get a balcony, better view and settled with the so, so service. A mojito was about $14.00 and change. We spent approximately $71.00 for nasty quesadillas, a cobb salad, and two mojitos. We learned quickly and decided to venture of the resort to eat a simple lunch. Just next to the hotel is a local sports bar, Score 101. Margaritas and mojitos were approx $4.50. Sandwiches and appetizers were okay and just under $10.00. We ended up walking a few blocks down to Walgreens to get water and snacks and vacated the compact refrigerator of the overpriced Ritz snacks. Overall, the beach was great, vwey calm the first two days and thenn a bit choppy. There was was not much seaweed or coral and you can venture into the water without water shoes. We quickly found out that the lounge and most restaurants shutdown close lto midnight. We like good music and entertainment here and there. We ventured to El San Juan Hotel and Casino for entertainment. In fact, we were regreting not booiking our packege with them as they were significantly cheaper and the ambiance seemed more enjoyable. Our last day having breakfast we were completely ignored and actually asked for our check and it never came. Having left our room number with the waiter who c hecked on us once, we left. He arrived at our room an hour later! I'm glad we experienced the Ritz and we look forward to staying somewhere else next year.

Reviews.Title: “am i missing something???”
Reviews.Author: lily086
Reviews.Content: i am an advid reader of tripadvisor to the point that whenever we are considering a stay at a caribbean hotel { we live in st. croix and enjoy traveling around the caribbean extensively} i read trip advisor before i even consider the hotel" website. ironicly this is my very first post because the san juan ritz was my very first MAJOR disapointment. maybe my expectations for the ritz carlton name was too high, but i have stayed at marriotts and westins with more ammenities and better service. i was prepared for my experience at the ritz to be somewhat comparable to the 4 seasons nevis or the cuisinart anquilla.warm towels and welcome cocktail upon arrival, a little complimentary snack and LArge bottle of water and or wine in room,chocolates upon turn down service. quite the opposite nothing at the ritz is complimentary. on the positive side the grounds and pool area is very nice and so was our room. but that is another story a day or so prior to arrival at a carribean hotel ,ESPECIALLY DURING OFF SEASON, i call ahead and ask for a complimentary upgrade if available.. this request has yet to be denied since we always travel off season. when i phone the ritz they told me they would most certainly try to accomodate my request if upgrade was availabe. we had booked a city view room and upon checkin were told apoolview was indead available...but insisted we pay a per nite extra $30.00 cxharge per nite, which inadverdantly involved an increase in taxes AND resort fees. there were no hot towels or welcome cocktail,just some help yourself fruit drink, no slippers or refrigerators in room,no spritzes or fresh fruit or sorbet on the beach or pool. be assurred we are NOT pampered travelers , some of our fa vorite resort s are little beach front botique hotels with next to no special ammenities...but i did expect more at a ritz carlton. we felt we were constantly being nickeled and dimed ..at turndown service you recieved a mint you might get a a chain resturant the fruit by the poool and beach was a bowl of half rotted oranges, and to drink the water provided you were given a paper cone cup so yu couldn't even bring a glass back to your lounge chair our waste paper basket was not emptied one day and they ran out of towels for a brief period of time...the final insult was the check out letter and bill check out time was @ 12 and the letter stated if you checked out between 12:01 or later you will be charged the 1/2 rack rate of the room wow!!! ithink there are far superior hotel s to be found in the carribean especially if you are willing to pay the ritz carlton rate..do your homework and one other point almost none of the rooms contain balconies is"nt that part of the caribbean experience...??

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but many misteps”
Reviews.Author: SFOPhil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough and I recived an upgrade upon check-in. However, there were several mis-steps. Consider: 1) No staff to assist with luggage on check in, 2) A/C not properly functioning, 3) Coffee maker broken, 4) Internet unavailable, despite its inclusion on the "resort fee", 5) Poor recpetion at brunch and chef refused to make hamburger at 11:15. Manager listened, but failed to offer any kind og compensation. All in all, not worthy of being called a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: redhead1984
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel. The food was great (especially Milano New York Restaurant)! The pool was huge and they have chairs with umbrellas set up everywhere. Would definitley recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in my life!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieAnnMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: This was our finale to our 25th anniversary trip on which we stayed at three spots in Puerto Rico - hat's off to the Ritz Carlton....the facility, the staff, the location - EVERYTHING 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with top notch amenities and service!”
Reviews.Author: emills237
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in San Juan is a beautiful hotel with a gorgeous beach and pool area. We stayed on the Concierge Floor and the access to the Concierge Lounge was an incredible asset to the whole experience. The room was lovely, the service warm, friendly and ready to anticipate your every need. The food and beverages were delicious and plentiful and presented beautifully. The hotel room itself was small I felt for a hotel of that caliber, but again, wonderful amenities . The beach is large and my teenagers loved snorkling. You have to contract with independent operators for other water sports on the beach and that was a little difficult. I wish they had had jet skis, surf lessons, sailboat rides etc. through the hotel. All in all this was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Lissee
Reviews.Content: Wow we were here 6 years ago and can't belive it could get any better... pool/beach amazing (plenty of chairs and umbrellas) restaurants Il Mulino fabulous Didn't dine at BLT brunch perfect. lunch by the pool yummy... all the people that work here are soooooo nice can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vrappold
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a much needed stay at this location. I stayed mid-week off season and found the service to be impeccable. I were there for a 4 day stay and it was great to be so close to the airport. Note that the proximity to the airport in no way impacted the hotel, we heard very few planes. Service: The service at this hotel was among the best we have ever experienced. Every single employee that we encountered was polite, helpful, and welcoming. Check-in went smoothly and our room was ready early. The concierge service was fantastic, particularly with off site restaurant recommendations. There was one service snafu that is a sort of funny. The iguana by the pool went to the bathroom in the pool. The poo was quite disgusting. (Personally didn't know iguana's could swim). I notified the pool shack, and it took an excessively long time for them to come clean it up, 1/2 hours. They should have been on that straight away. This said it was a really random event and I am not sure anyone knew what to do. Room: The room was nice. The room was very clean with 2x daily service. The room was on the smaller side in our opinion, but was perfectly adequate. We did notice the wear and tear on the room, which might not be as noticeable in other Ritz Carlton location. Nice flat screen television, but no Hi Def. There was room in the mini-bar for some of our own stuff. We also used the in room coffee service and it was just fine for our needs. They even left us extra water, coffee, and creamers after we asked. Food: We ate at Il Mulino one night and it was ever better than we anticipated. WOW. The service, the food, the wine. Just WOW. Probably one of the best meals we've had this year. Pool: The pool is very nice. There are plenty of sunbeds and umbrellas. Also plenty of floats for the pool. Poolside service was great. Definitely not pushy service at all, but available if you need them. Towels were plentiful as well. Beach: The beach was less popular when we were there, again plenty of sunbeds, umbrellas, and towels (separate place to get a towel by the beach). The beach and water were very very clean. The water was pretty calm when we were there. We didn't spend much time by the ocean though. Fitness center: The fitness center was quite nice. Plenty of equipment and there were classes as well (I saw total fit and zumba). Water and towels available. Some cardio equipment has individual tvs with most channels. Also tennis courts and equipment available. Casino: We had a great time in the casino. Poker tournaments nightly, and 1 poker table with as cash game. All in all not a perfect stay but we still really really enjoyed ourselves. I can honestly say we really enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this hotel. For the most part the service made up for other shortcomings of the hotel. Note for budget minded travelers. There is a Walgreens druggist almost right next door. Go out the front of the hotel and it is less than a block away to the right. If you keep walking a few more blocks, you'll reach a Sports Bar, Chilis, the El San Juan (starbucks!), subway, burger king, and a whole bunch of other fast food locations (for us it was a 5-10 minute walk and we never felt unsafe).

Reviews.Title: “Elegant. Friendly, Above and Beyond Service.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieCat5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel as a much needed girlfriends getaway. The property was beautiful and very well maintained. The staff always went beyond our simple requests to offer just a little something extra such as tips on dining, sightseeing. Our city view room was really a view of the city, beach and mountain. Rooms were very clean and did not feel outdated as was stated in a previous review. The Spa was a highlight and Kayla worked out kinks I never new I had. I felt like I looked 10 (oh well, maybe 5 years younger) after my facial with Rosalie. Very relaxing and worth the money spent. I am sorry to say I do not recall the wonderful young man name who brought cookies and milk to us at 3 am, but. he could not have been nicer. Dined in BLT... great food and service with Antonio and staff. The beach was very relaxing. Pina Colada was one of the best I every had. Iced lemon water provided by pool and on beach very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Mother/Daughter Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: FishManRichie
Reviews.Content: I saw an article from Liberty Travel offering 5days/4nites @ the Ritz in Puerto Rico. We've previously stayed at Wyndham Condado, Intercontinental, El San Juan so decided the Ritz. At first I thought it would have a more stuffy atmosphere, boy was I wrong! The hotel is simply beautiful, the grounds impecable and everyone person working at the Ritz could not do more for you. You didn't even need to ask for something but the staff would approach and ask if there was anything they could do for you! We flew out of Newark Non-StopContinental PLUS received a $100 voucher to be used anywhere in Puerto Rico; total per person $500!!! When I told all friends about this deal they wanted to know why I didn't tell them sooner so they could get in on it. Forget reading reviews that indicate anything but having a FANTASTIC time. It also helped that our weather was in the 90's while back in Jersey it was only in the 60's :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: starfishStarfish
Reviews.Content: just got back last night from a terrific 3 day get away with a group of friends to the Ritz Carlton San Juan. We had a blast! The service was EXCELLENT. the staff was so FRIENDLY and we could not have asked for a better time. We used the Spa, the Gym, the workout classes, the pool, the beach. Basically almost everything. We started the stay with the evening of arrival in the lobby bar, where the service rocked and the appetizers /tapas were great! We enjoyed lunch by the pool and the pool bar saw a lot of time with us! The water at the pool was so clean, the pool staff was accommodating and the service at the pool, especially Jason rocked! We had a blast in the casino in the evenings were the dealers were really nice and the casino manager was a doll. Overall a super time. THe rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff came in twice a day to make sure we had towels and bottles of water. We would definetely recommend a stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fun!”
Reviews.Author: cxgarcia
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently went to Puerto Rico and booked at a different hotel that pretended to be luxury accommodations. After only a few nights dealing with poor service, lackluster amenities, and overall disappointment, we high-tailed it out of there and sought refuge at this Ritz Carlton. The service was excellent from the moment we inquired about switching hotels. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Our room was fabulous. The dining options were fantastic! The pool area was my favorite part. For just a little more each day, we got a private cabana and received excellent personalized service. It was a slice of heaven. Our goal was to go to Puerto Rico to unwind and simply relax. This property allowed us to do that.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Resort and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mianyc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Went for a few nights and did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ritz-Carlton on a weekend trip to PR and was very satisfied with the hotel and customer service. The beach located just outside the hotel was splendid. There are many restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and the nightlife is happening in this area. Elvira at the reception was so friendly and helpful in giving us ideas for our short stay in PR. Will definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLangs
Reviews.Content: A group of us just visited the hotel for the 1st time. Everything from our initial greeting to checkout was spectacular. The rooms, the pool and beach, the food, everything exceeded our expectations. The staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful or friendly. We all recommend the Mares restaurant for breakfast (try one of the omelets), the pool side bar for drinks and snacks (the mojitos were awesome), and the lobby bar for after dinner drinks (a great bar tender) We all liked the fact that while the hotel was convenient to Old Jan Juan, it wasnâ€™t so close as to be distracted by the hustle and bustle you find in a tourist center. A return trip is already in the planning phase!

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is a must!”
Reviews.Author: TJMOverlandPark_KS
Reviews.Content: Went 10/2008- Just getting around to writing the review. I needed them to make my decision so I feel I should send one back. With all the planning it takes to leave three small kids behind and enjoy some time alone with your husband you need it to be amazing. The Ritz SJ truly delivered. This was our 10th Anniversary so we upgraded to the Club Level. Well worth every penny and then some. The Club level concierge were attentive and knowledgeable and went out of their way to make your stay wonderful. Having breakfast,lunch,countless snacks and drinks available (Club Level inclusive) to us though out the day was awesome. I highly recommend the Mojitos! The Concierge on duty always had one "to go" for me after lunch to take back to the beach. Club level is only offered on the top 2 floors. The limited access allowed us to meet some great greats that we otherwise would not have. Club Level also gave us access to a computer so it was a nice way to email home and check in. We did dine out each evening. There are lots of great local fare restaurants to choose from nearby. We did eat at Il Mulino on site and had a superb meal! Enterprise car rental agency is on-site. This was so convenient and effortless. We enjoyed the morning hiking the El Yunque rain forest. Stopped at a beach for a quick swim then off to the outer Island of Vieques. A 45 minute boat ride to one of the most memorable adventures, a bio luminescent bay. This is a must do! Take the time to do this outer island tour. There are others on the mainland but you can only kayak through those bays, not swim. The swimming brings it to an incomparable level. "Hidden along the Caribbean coast is one of the most spectacular Bio luminescent Bays in the world. The mysterious blue-green light is created by micro-organisms which thrive in an environment uniquely suited to their needs. A trip into the bay on a balmy night is a magical experience. Fish flash by in dark water, and a swim is like floating through stardust." - Captain Sharon Grasso PR has a lot to offer. We will be going back and will only stay at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: debralina
Reviews.Content: annoying maid service.They were banging on the door 3-4 times a day.Finally we had to ask for a do not disturb sign because there wasnt one! Also no creamer for the coffee, we were told they were waiting on a shipment.Replenishing the rooms water and toilet paper was spotty.Expected perfection from the Ritz! Also A.C was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an easy and relaxing vacation.”
Reviews.Author: larklaw
Reviews.Content: If you want a mellow trip at a quiet and nice hotel this is the place to go. Off the plane and in our room in maybe about 30 minutes after getting luggage. Rooms are very clean and very quiet. Almost too quiet for me. Standard RC decor---not hip but very comfortable. Furniture in our room was not shabby or worn at all. Large bathroom. I liked our courtyard view but windows do not open and to really save money the city view rooms are the way to go. Pool is very nice but I don't understand why they leave the cushions out all night--particularly when it rains quite a bit. Only one pool and yes---kids pretty much take it over. We hung out near the fountain so no issues from the kids. Pretty grounds. Nice gym but always packed. Food options for pool/beach were disappointing. Nothing local and pretty much just burgers and heavy foods. Drinks are standard cost for all upscale hotels. Beach/water is not really pretty but lots of space to lounge. We rented a cabana and for the cost they were not nearly as nice as the cabanas they have at other RC beach properties for the same cost. Service on beach was great from guys setting up the loungers and umbrellas but any service for drinks and food was horrible. I would say the Ritz lost about 150/$ from us since getting a drink or food was always a real issue. 2 drinks with tip and tax-26/$. Lots of food options near hotel-Ceviche House was very good although bad interior. Went to Pueblo market about 5 minutes from hotel to load up on snacks-drinks-etc. The PR promo deal we did was excellent and if you see that it is the way to go. Great veg out trip for weekend. At the right price the poor pool service and high drink cost are no big deal. EL Morro is awesome for photos.

Reviews.Title: “The best we've had in PR”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and reliable. Pool is, likewise, clean and without a "deep end" - which is nice for children. Plenty of deck chairs both by the pool and on the beach - eliminating that morning dash to claim space. We found a pretty diverse crowd ranging from honeymooners to families with young children. I'm torn in my rating of service. The vast majority of the staff is fantastic; attentive, polite, friendly. The staff at the Ocean Bar and Grill (OBG) was incredibly inattentive. We waited over 1/2 hour to give our order to someone - and even then, the person took it begrudgingly because she clearly wasn't our server (our server seemed to be MIA to all around). It was actually comical how the other servers were avoiding our section because they didn't want to cover for the missing server. I hate to ding the whole experinece based on one meal and, later, some cocktails at OBG - but, truly, it was horrendous. Still...we'd probably go back; overall the experience was good. It's very, very convenient to the airport (a 7-minute, $14 cab ride). We needed a place for one night on our way to another destination and this was significantly better than the Marriott where we stayed last year. The Ritz had a special package which basically ended up paying for lunch and breakfast the next morning so it felt like an overall very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but pack your own lunch”
Reviews.Author: Anja360
Reviews.Content: After reading and researching where to spend our first trip in PR, we decided to go with the Ritz. Check in was pleasant enough, we were sent to a room, my wife did not like it and we decided to upgrade to an ocean front, which was worth it. (This was our 5th wedding anniversary, so this place would have really distinguished itself, if it had provided the upgrade at no charge.) We were traveling with our 9 month old son and they provided a crib, room was great what you would expect from a Ritz, bathroom was Ritz quality. The hotel is a on a nice beach right outside san juan, we stayed on the premises for a week, only went sightseeing one day so we found the hotel to be very comfortable and relaxing. The beach guys were awesome setting up chairs and umbrellas, the pool guys were very good as well. The only knock on this pace is the price of the food, you would expect a markup on food at the ritz, it comes with the territory, thats not why I am knocking them , I expect the quality of the food to be at that price level. For example, we ordered breakfast from room service our first day there, my wife got the fruit plate, i got an omelet and a pot of coffee. How much would you expect to pay? We paid 75 and there was no truffle oil, juan valdez was not there to pour the coffee, fruit plate was lacking...omelet was good. We also ate at the ocean side bar which was good, considering we got burger, fries and wings... The concierge was good, she mention a few places around the area we could go for lunch and dinner. The authentic PR food is good and the places around the hotel are good. Also check out Old SJ if you get a chance, many food options but is a taxi ride. We did manage to eat at BLT and the food there was good, we went for the prix fixe special and it was worth it. Staff is friendly. Hotel layout is nice, ocean front rooms with balcony are great, pool and city not so great. Casino is nice. Spa is nice, very good masseuses. Wife wanted me to mention that the railing on the balcony needed to painted, you wouldn't expect a little thing like that to be overlooked at the Ritz but it was. You get what you pay for, it was a perfectly nice place that I would recommend and I would go back there, especially if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Burghguy
Reviews.Content: First class facility, beach and staff. Room was great with an ocean view. Il Mulino Restaurant was fine dining at its best. All of the RC staff members were courteous and helpful. OBG was a nice, casual beachfront bar/grill. As others have noted, eating and drinking at the hotel is not inexpensive, but you are paying for the amenities and superior service. Beach was very nice. Free lounges, umbrellas and towels from the RC. The surrounding neighborhood is safe but not attractive. There are several dining/drinking establishments within an easy walk of the hotel and we saw lots of RC guests frequent them. Denny's is a good alternative for a reasonably price breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: cuzit
Reviews.Content: The genuinely friendly and personable staff really make this hotel. Nearly everyone we interacted with was smart, pleasant to talk to, and very helpful. This is a quiet hotel, don't expect a lot of colorful Island flavor. On Friday and Saturday nights the lobby has some live music; but other than this The Ritz is about quiet conversation, a lovely pool and a great beach. The room was nice, the bed comfortable and everything worked pretty well, though the water saving shower head is a drag when you try to wash off sand. I am not much for gambling so I can't speak about the casino, but it is set off from the rest of the lobby and you would have to seek it out. One thing I found slightly disappointing was that while the lobby had a bar, they didn't offer any coffee, snacks or bottled water for sale. I had to go all the way through the hotel to the restaurant to buy a cup of coffee and this wasn't available until 7 AM. Yes, they had a coffee pot and some bottled water in the room, but as expected, this is not great quality stuff to say the least. The gym is adequate, but if you are a serious workout person, you will be hard-pressed to get your workout done, due to limited equipment and a small room. Bring an i-pod since the tvs don't all work. Some other suggestions: pack some pool attire in an easy to reach part of your bag since you will likely arrive before the 4 PM check-in and you will probably want to get right into the sun at the beach or pool; buy some bottled water up the block at Walgreens and put it in the frig. in the room. We ate at three of the hotel restaurants, one being BLT, a NY based restaurant. The food is good and yes it is pricey. But this is the Ritz, so it is not unexpected. We each had a massage, one of us was wowed, the other thought it was ok. Someone gave us gift certificates. I think the massage prices were pretty high. Again, I want to say that the staff made this a wonderful experience. I loved PR and I really enjoyed my stay at The Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: gojo5
Reviews.Content: Although we had to wait for our room and were given a cash credit for the inconvenience, the Ritz was still a wonderful place to vacation. The rooms were a little dated, but spacious. The service could not have been better. Everyone we spoke to was pleasant. Sometimes there was a line to be helped at the front desk, but once they spoke to you, you did not feel rushed and you had their complete attention. We enjoyed the pool with its wait staff having iced cloths and water to cool you off. The beach was pristine and the hotel offered free snorkel gear. We had drinks in the lounge. Normally, they were $12, but during the 2 for 1 happy hour, the mojotos were more reasonably priced. The continental breakfast buffet offered a wide variety not usually found in a continental b'fast. The BLT restaurant was good but did not have all the items on the menu and I thought the BLT in Westchester NY was a bit better. Overall, the most difficult part of our vacation was to decide whether to go sight seeing on the rest of the island or just stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “best customer service anywhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4greatkds
Reviews.Content: Just got back last week from a lovely stay in Puerto Rico, at the Ritz Carlton. I have stayed in 5* hotels and have never seen customer service as phenomenal as the service was at this hotel! Every person working at this hotel from Customer Relations , Concierge to Housekeeping always had a smile and a kind word. Rooms were very clean, well kept, of course the beach beautiful. At the beach we were constantly offered iced lemon water, sorbet, fresh lemonade... If I called housekeeping to replace something in the room, the item was brought up with a smile in minutes! If I come back to Puerto Rico, I would only stay at the Ritz. And, the rates were terrific! Got a $129.00 rate from Orbitz!!

Reviews.Title: “Why not the 5th star?”
Reviews.Author: magnet1125
Reviews.Content: The only reason for the lack of 5 stars, was the condition in the casino.....many chairs were threadbare....shame on whoever is respnsible for letting it get to that condition.....having said that I must say that the rest of the hotel experience is first rate...my wife and I took the upgrade to the club level, and were very glad we did....the staff there is outsanding from top to bottom...every request was handled promptly with a wonderful attitude..... The pool and beach crews are also first rate....towels gladly handed out and put on the comfortable chaise lounges....clean, clean, clean areas.....you can hear the planes, but at no time did I feel it intrusive....in fact, seeing them rise into the sky so gracefull as one sits on the beach is an enjoyable sight,,,, As a side note, my wife left her cellphone on the plane, and upon check in Venus went out of her way to contact the airline....we did appreciate that..... Food and drinks are a bit pricey, but this is a first rate establishment.... If and when we return to San Juan, this will be our choice of places to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great costumer service”
Reviews.Author: miamilatin30
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the Ritz in San Juan and had a great time. Stayed in the 9th floor and had access to the " Club Lounge ", the food was great and the staff was friendly and knew our names, specially the concierge ladies,, very professional and friendly, always with a nice smile. Tania Bernaloa and the other lady concierge among with their staff weres top-notch, went beyond everything. Housekeeping was attentive and clean, I asked for some toothpaste that I forgot and I received it rapidly and then they call me for follow-up, THAT IS SERVICE! Food was good, I had breakfast and was attended by Valerie, very friendly and professional, she knew all about the menu and recommended good things. Finally, I want to thank Nicole Geisel the concierge. She is absolutely amazing, she went also beyond about everything. Thank you Nicole! I would totally recommend the Ritz, great serice and better yet, BEST TEAM!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but falls short of the Ritz you may be used to...”
Reviews.Author: cau3
Reviews.Content: Here's my take: - Service - B / B- ... Restaurants "got it", others did not. I think the whole gang needs to go back to Ritz training. Saying "my pleasure" while still being clearly annoyed with your request doesn't cut it. - Location: B+ - Airport noise didn't actually other us, and the 5 minute ($12) cab ride was nice. - Concierge - D - One person for a HUGE resort - no good! They were so stressed that they threw the whole Ritz training out the window - Rooms - B+ - Ours was fine, except mattress was quite old (sag). Time to replace. Crowd - C+ - very busy at pool - LOTS of kids (Hey Ritz - do we really need the volleyball net in the pool?? - this ain't the Marriott!!). Big local P.R. vacation crowd looking to take advantage of every aspect of the place... - Rate - A- ... Off peak - 265 with breakfast - hard to beat Again, nice Ritz, but if you are used to being "wow'd" this Ritz will likely not provide it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Escape”
Reviews.Author: osnarr
Reviews.Content: Once again the San Juan Ritz Carlton came through for us. It is the ultimate escape venue; just a quick trip from NY and from the airport to the hotel. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms, the staff, the beach are wonderful. We love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ordinary resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here prior to boarding our cruise ship. Everything is fine but nothing is in any way spectacular. Indeed it is not really recognisable as a Ritz Carlton compared to experiences in other parts of the world. If you are looking for a four star ish resort hotel then I guess it will fit the mark. Casino was good fun and an excellent way to spend part of an evening. We found the lack of a quiet place in the evening tricky - particularly when a band set up in the main foyer bar which had been our safe haven. Pool was also busy with too many kids for my preference. Breakfast was also chaotic and really no option but to go buffet as the a la carte options were so expensive (and memorably in one case just taken from the buffet). Had bad experience with service and staff at beachside restaurant one evening but was more than made up for with excellent handling and apology from manager and a complementary lunch. Because we walked out that night we had a small dinner in BLT and it was stunningly good so every cloud has a silver lining. Also pizza and calamari in main restaurant at lunchtime exceptional. Not a peaceful place and probably a bit too family friendly so two days was plenty for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Prices but why?”
Reviews.Author: sbrita
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go for a short three day weekend and stay and the Ritz in San Juan. Its a short flight from NYC and we've stayed at other Ritz properties before. As usual, the Ritz service was excellent; attentive and always trying to help your stay be more comfortable. The big issue I had with this property is the age of it. It is one of the original Ritz properties and its definitely a high traffic resort. The pool was nice and the beach was great - but the hotel was full when we got there and both areas were packed! Grabbing drinks was like trying to wave down someone on a freeway! The rooms were also old. We switched out of our first one because it smelled like smoke. The second one was neat, but there were stains in the paint and on the carpet - things you don't expect when you are paying for a room at the Ritz. The location is also take it or leave it . . . . its literally right outside the airport gate. its good b/c the cab ride takes 5 minutes (and still costs $20 - don't get the Ritz car service for $70 . . . unless you don't care to pay it) when you arrive. But its bad if you want to do any exploring on the island, especially Old San Juan. Its all the way down the stretch of inlet of San Juan - -takes around 20 minutes in a cab. You also hear/see planes landing all day. Also - BLT and Il Mulino on the premises don't hold a candle to the ones in NYC. If it wasn't for the service . . . this would have been not worth it - as it was - we did have a good time, but probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton - Beautiful Hotel in the Wrong Location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelCB
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to San Juan and we decided to stay at the Ritz because it was less expensive than some other options. Check in was no problem. Our second room wasn't ready which was not an issue. They called us promptly when the room was ready. The check in clerk turned on the hard sell for their "club service" which would "save us money" because it included breakfast, lunch, and happy hour for only $100/night per room. We had two rooms and this would have tacked on an additional $1200 to our stay! We did not dine in any of the hotel restaurants because they were astronomically priced. We found the hotel amenities to be ample and the hotel very comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Surprisingly with the proximity to the airport, there was never an issue with noise. The beach was very nice but not for snorkeling as the water is quite murky. For a Ritz property, we found the surrounding area to be not so desirable for a hotel of such caliber. For the most part, dining options were located either in the hotel or hotels on the strip. We took cabs to restaurants in the area, but cabs are relatively expensive for what seems like very short distances. For example, $12 one way to the Condado area, $20 one way to San Juan. We stayed in the Condado area on our first trip. This area offers more in terms of dining options and in what appears to be a less run down area. Very vibrant and bustling in the evening - more options within walking distance. A tip for the ladies interested in the spa - massages and facials were reduced prices Monday through Thursday. Overall impressions - loved the hotel, not the area. If we ever travel to SJ again, I'd definitely stay in the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel like a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: Service: Check-in was quick and front desk staff was professional throughout our stay. Nothing special. The staff at breakfast was less than average. They just didn't seem to go out of their way for you like other hotels. Majority of them would disappear for long periods of time and the rest of the time they would be shouting/speaking to each other in groups. Again, the staff at the beach and pool were just average. Nothing special. The pool and beach staff is understaffed. It would be awhile before we would see anyone to order drinks and food. Overall the service here is not what I would have expected at a Ritz. I believe most of the staff needs to be retrained and should show some euthusiam when speaking to guests. Besides the doorman (Rafy), Venus (Front desk) and Alexis (waiter pool/beach) every other employee needs to be retrained. No one remembered our names after 4 days there and only 1 staff member said "its my pleasure" Beach/Pool: The beach here is magnificent. The water is clean and clear, no waves, no rocks to worry about and no seaweed. The water is so calm and the sand is like powder. This part of San Juan is called Isla Verde and it is considered one of the best, if not the very best, beach in Puerto Rico. For this reason alone, I would recommend the Ritz. The pool is heated - very warm. It is nice and very clean. It is mostly crowded with children. The hotel offers complimentary use of floats for the pool and snorkling masks for the ocean. At both the beach and the pool there were plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas to use. Yes people reserve them with their towels early but there was never an issue finding a seat. Rooms: We had an oceanview room with a balcony (#711). The view was beautiful. The room was very clean as expected. The bathrooms need to be updated. I was surprised to see a shower/tub combo and a shower curtain at 500 bucks a night. They are not luxurious at all. The towels were always clean, unfortunately they smelled like cigerettes everyday (am not a smoker). A reviewer once mentioned a moldy smell in the room, our bathroom also smelled musty but its due to a lack of a fan. Food: We had a great meal at BLT. Just like the one in the City. Tip: if you go for dinner between 6-7 pm, first bottle of wine is 50% off price - any bottle of wine from their wine list!! If you have dinner after 7pm, 1st bottle is full price, and 2nd bottle is 50%. IL Mulino was just okay. Good service and average food. I feel its over-rated. Breakfast at hotel was below average. We had a full breakfast included with our package and the options of the buffet were limited. I've seen better spreads. Guests: The class of people that were at the hotel was surprising. I wouldn't have expected low class behavior at a Ritz. i.e. People randomly cursing while they are passing by, mothers screaming at their children from 20 feet away, groups on the beach being loud and the characters at the casino were interesting to say the least. Overall, I wouldn't recommend the Ritz to a friend. I was disappointed in everything except the beach especially for the money we paid. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, terrible experience at BLT and front desk”
Reviews.Author: mmbarb
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Ritz-Carlton, for the second time, during our trip to Puerto Rico in late May 2009. My mom was celebrating a big birthday year, and since we had stayed here in the past, we recommended staying here again to the whole group. There were a total of six of us, staying for seven days. Upon arrival from the airport, which is only a 10 minute ride, it was about 4pm. Only one of our three rooms were ready for us. I believe that check in time starts at 3pm. It wasn't a big deal though..we stuck everything in one room and when the rooms were ready about an hour later, we just transferred the luggage from one room to the other. The rooms were clean, and bright...just as I had remembered them. We had a city view room, but we were still able to see the beach quite easily. On our second night there, we made reservations for Il Mulino, the Italian restaurant at the hotel. This place was worth EVERY penny that you spent there. Only four of us dined there that night, and the bill came to about $480, which included salads, apps, main course, wine, and desserts. The wait staff there was super friendly and super good. I don't mind paying for something if you are going to get something worth it in the end. On our fourth night at the hotel, we decided to do a special dinner at the BLT steakhouse. This is where the "you don't always get what you pay for" comes in. We made reservations for six, were seated at a table right next to the serving window, and were given menus. We ordered drinks and were given time to look through the menu. A lot of time. We must have waited for 20 minutes or so before we could grab any of the waiters' attention. My husband and I ordered a $89 steak, obviously for 2, and a bunch of sides for the table. We ordered our steak medium well (and this was after asking the waiter what they consider pink throughout the middle), and it came out like a brick. A burnt, blackened $89 brick. I cut into the very middle, thinking that it might just be the outer parts that look well well well done. But no, it was cooked so well done that when you bit into it, it was like having a mouth full of saw dust. I'm not exaggerating. Finally, after trying to get the waiter's attention for another 20 minutes or so, we told him that the steak was too well done, and that we wanted to send it back. The look he gave us! It was like a "how dare you want to return this steak" sort of look. He took it without a word. And about 10 minutes later, another waiter brought over a new steak. Then he mumbled something in Spanish, and then in English about taking the steak from another table. The service was terrible. Absolutely terrible. Our waiter only came by once to refill drinks, and never came back after the food was served to ask how it was. I would definitely NOT recommend going there for dinner. The only other complaint that I had about the hotel, was about our final bill. There was a charge on there from BLT for a night that we weren't there. (we didn't charge any of the restaurant bills to our room) When I went up to the front desk to inquire about it, the front desk guy just looked at me and said, "it's a charge from BLT"....yes, I know that. I then asked for a copy of the receipt. He came back 15 minutes later, to show me that a shrimp cocktail and two drinks made up the bill. He showed it to me. I looked, and saw immediately that it wasn't even made out to our room, but another room on the same floor. I pointed out that the person didn't even sign it to my room. He looked at it puzzingly and then said, well, do you know Mr. blah blah blah? What difference does that make?!! Like, if I knew him that would be okay for me to pay for it? It then took him another 15 minutes to take it off my bill. All he said was "The amount has been deducted." There was no "I'm sorry for the inconvenience, or for our mistake." And then just flipped my final bill onto the counter. I wouldn't expect that sort of service from the Ritz. I've stayed at Ritz-Carltons many times, and have always received the best service. I most likely would look for another hotel in San Juan, should I think about going down there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but expensive”
Reviews.Author: cabosanlucas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz June 18th through 22nd, 2009. Great service and the hotel was very clean. However, the food and drinks were very expensive. $17 for a drink and $7 for a beer (Corona). My friend loved the mojitos. Breakfast for 2 was $55 before the tip. BLT restaurant great service. Food good but not worth the price. Definitely go to Old San Juan. Good deals at the Coach store. Great restaurant El Jibarito a few blocks away from the shopping. Have the pork mofongo. It's awesome. If you venture out of the hotel it's not so expensive. A few blocks away is the El San Juan hotel with a fun bar at the top of the hotel, outdoors. Great dance music when we were there. Authentic local music in the casino. We paid more for the ocean view room that had a balcony and it was worth the extra cost. An overall fun trip. It would have been even better if it was a little less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best babymoon getaway I could have wished for.”
Reviews.Author: tbritt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ritz after a long trip (delays included) and were immediately relaxed when we entered the Ritz. Check in was easy and pleasant. We had booked a package through funjet that had gift cards and coupons. The wonderful staff at the front desk knew about our little extras and was prepared with them for us (I had read on another review that this was a problem at the Ritz - not for us). We were asked if we'd be going to the casino and were given $40 in match play upon check in as well. Our bags were promptly brought to our beautiful room. We were not facing the beach (which we knew ahead of time) and I'm going to be honest - how much time do you plan to spend in your room looking out the window? We headed downstairs to walk the grounds (which pipes in the sounds of coqui - silly and cute) and try our luck at the casino. There were tables ranging from $5 to $100 which was nice. We took advantage of the Castillo Tours "kiosk" in the hotel for the Rainforest hiking excursion. I highly recommend this. It was a fantastic experience and was more organized than trying to plan this independently. The tour guide was very knowledgeable. Great attention to detail by the housekeeping staff who noticed after the first night that I drink water during the night and therefore placed the complementary bottled waters next on the nightstand each night thereafter. The pool was not overcrowded and the friendly and attentive staff walked us to a spot that met our needs (sun with an umbrella if we wanted shade) and set up our towels for us. There were servers who brought cold water and fruit smoothie samples around while we were at the pool. This didn't continue on the beach - but I have to presume it is because it is a public beach. However, the staff on the beach was extremely quick in getting an umbrella set up when we moved out there. We didn't eat at any restaurants except the one by the pool (expensive, but if you go in knowing that you won't be shocked). We did some research ahead of time and found places with authentic Puerto Rican breakfasts and dinners. There is a coffee shop a block away that has reasonable breakfast and good Puerto Rican coffee. One thing to know before you go - cabs run in zones and can get pricey. It is $12 to the airport, $20 to Old San Juan, and $15 to Cornado (very good dinner at Aliji Moliji). Just know that ahead of time. I was a bit nervous after reading some reviews left here about the Ritz - but I just have this to say - it was wonderful. People can find fault in anything if they are looking for it, but they can also find the most fabulous time if that is what they are looking for. And if you are looking for a fabulous vacation, may I recommend the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Get-away”
Reviews.Author: smjones08
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN: we were taken care of very promply and were asked if we would like a beverage several times during the 10 min time we spent figuring out our rooms as we upgraded one room to a beach view. the hotel was accomodating in moving our second room on the same floor as the first. ROOMS: a bit small but very comfortable. the beds are extremely comfortable and the alarm clock is equipped with an ipod dock to play and charge your ipod. the balcony outside of the beach-view room was comically small. POOL: we did not spend much time in the pool but it was nice. you can reserve private cabanas but i'm not sure how much that costs. the layout of the paths around the pool and to get to the beach is a bit cramped/complicated but the palm trees are absolutely lovely. the towel attendents are helpful and there are always cool pitchers of lemon/orange water that you can refresh yourself with. occasionally there were cool aloe towels. BEACH: the attendents were happy to take as many chairs and umbrellas as we needed and set them up on the beach where we wanted them. they also put the towels on the chairs including a rolled towel for a head rest. if you go later in the day you won't have a problem getting chairs but they might run out of umbrellas. FOOD: the food/drinks at the resort are very expensive, but you know that going into it. The breakfast buffet is $25 and includes unlimited champagne. outside of that we ended up paying $35 for two drinks including tip so big drinkers, beware! we opted to dine outside of the hotel several nights. the name is escaping me but if you go out of the hotel and walk about 3 blocks to the right, past the CVS there is a good cheap restaurant that does mexican with a puerto rican twist. we also took a cab into town one night and discovered many "open air" cafes and restaurants. SERVICE: Very friendly and helpful staff. No problems. ACTIVITIES: There are surf lessons on the beach which can be accomodated to any group. I took a private hour long one while i was there and it was a blast. we also took a snorkeling trip that included a nice boat ride with rum punch. the hotel also includes a nice casino.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: mimi56Augustaga
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from May 09 I was very worried about my trip to the Ritz Carlton. However, to my delight, this Ritz Carlton is superb!! It lives up to the standards of the other RC's that I have stayed in. The staff is most accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable. I am a travel agent and will never recommend any other resort in San Juan to my clients. The service could not be topped anywhere!! The Concierge, the doormen, the housekeepers, receptionists, waiters, waitresses, restaurants and spa were just magnificient. Do not worry about other reviews. This place is a must for anyone traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump.”
Reviews.Author: develop5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband over Memorial Day weekend. The service was good. Other than that, what a disgusting place. The guests were mostly sloppy and messy and looked like day trippers going to a public beach to get out of their hot apartments. The rooms were so run down and small they were like cells rather than rooms. We were on the Club Floor and the lounge was disgusting and smelled like "old hotel." I dropped a string bean on the floor my first day there and it was still on the floor when we checked out 4 days later. Even the guests on the Club Floor looked like they belonged somewhere else. There was one couple who was there for every single food presentation loading up their plates with "snacks" and making it a meal that could serve 6. It was obvious they were not paying for any other meals on this vacation other than what they could stuff in their faces from the lounge. There was a computer in the lounge for people to use. Who would want to use it. There was one kid who was on it for hours and when he literally sneezed all over the keys his mother sat there and said "Bless You" like this is acceptable. Gross. Anyone who says that the beach is nice has obviously never been anywhere else. The beach was dirty and one block away from slums. I went for a walk and came across a shanty town right by the beach not more than 150 feet from the hotel. Il Mulino and BLT Steak are very nice restaurants which were the only good thing. They don't even belong in the hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: sicily6872
Reviews.Content: This ritz..definitely not up to ritz standards. Lots of rif raf allowed on to the property. TV does not work in room, Blow dryer need to be replaced. Service adequate at best. do not waste your money go somewher much nicer than this. Looked like a ghetto outside by the beach grafitti and dirty sand..u can much for your money somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: macleodProvidence
Reviews.Content: Our son got married here on May 23, 2009 and we went down for the wedding. Perfect wedding, I should add. We stayed at the Ritz for three nights, with family and friends, and had the most wonderful time ever. Jennifer, the wedding planner is awesome and the ceremony and receptions were the best I've ever seen. The hotel, as well, is top notch, and I give this resort 5 stars for service, accomodations, food, and beach!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is more like a Holiday Inn than the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirle2009
Reviews.Content: Small Rooms Low-Class Clientele, people in frumpfy clothes just walk right in and are not necessarily guests Staff are nice but most are not ver y "motivated" (slow, often not too helpful) Bad AC in the gym Co-Ed waiting room in Spa You have to walk by a "smokers" area whenever you want to go outside to the main area. Roomservice Food pretty good, Restaurants great! There may be Lion Statues an a Tiffany, but this place is nothing more than a Holiday Inn in disguise. Dont waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis in busy loud city”
Reviews.Author: KNUCCI
Reviews.Content: Typical of Ritz Carlton this is an immaculate hotel with beautiful public areas and very attentive, friendly ser vice. My only criticisms: the room was average and the bathroom was disappointing - one sink and a tub/shower combo. The restaurants were way over-priced for average food. Other than that it is very "Ritz"-y - the pool is gorgeous and very clean and the wide beach front is perfect. It is aslso very quite, which is hard to find in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: wluer
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was a great place to stay in Puerto Rico. The area right outside the Ritz is a little shady with a cockfighting arena directly outfront. Outside of the area directly around it it was amazing. The grounds of the Ritz were beautiful and the beach was very nice. Only one problem with the beach is they lock it up at night so dont get caught out on the beach after hours or you cant get back in easily. Rooms were nice, nothing great. Beds very comfortable. Service was amazing. Food on the premises is pricey but not crazy, burgers and sandwiches around the pool and beach are like $10-$20. There are a few high end restaraunts in the resort but we went into old San Juan every night. Aqua Viva and Baru are two must do restaraunts. Both very delicious and not overly expensive, maybe $100 for two with drinks. Casino was nice except for the trashy locals who sit at the $5 black jack table all day and talk trash about the tourists in spanish. Other than that dealers very nice and always open tables to play. All in all great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quite”
Reviews.Author: jcpatterson404
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton had beautiful grounds and the staff was superb! They really were attentive to your needs. Just like the other reviews, the restaurants were expensive so if you're budgeting, you should eat outside the hotel. If you're looking for a trendy, boutique style hotel, than this is not the place for you. The only complaint we had is the $150/day room incidental charge. We didn't budget for that and expedia did not specify room incidental was per day! There is a bar/lounge right outside the hotel - 101 Lounge- the owner was nice and the drinks were reasonable. We were there every night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bklyntas
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to the Ritz for Mother's Day for a 4day/3nt getaway and am glad that I did. I had originally booked at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino, but after reading shady reviews about the rooms, I decided to change tot he Ritz. The grounds were impeccable and the service was outstanding. ALL staff were courteous, and helpful beyond belief. From the front door to the beach, the staff were attentive and made us feel like we were the only one's there. The room was comfortable and spacious. The Bulgari room ammenities added to the delight. Housekeeping and guest services were always available, extending themselves for any additional services. We did not eat in any of the restaurants, as they seemed overpriced. We ate at a wonderful restaurant across from the hotel called Metropol. The local cuisine was flavorful and plentiful. We also had lunch at Edith's Cafe about 3-4 blocks away; great mofongo stuffed with chicken! The place doesn't look the best from the outside, but the food made up for that. Drums restaurant had live music and a great brunch on Sunday afternoon, and Nikka's Boutique upstairs from Drums offered lovely shopping at affordable prices. Overall, we had a great time and would definately go back again. Not your party hotel, so expect perfect peace and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stopover - on the beach”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: The beach is nice at this hotel with plenty of chairs, towels, and not as crowded as the pool. We stayed there for an overnight stopover and the hotel served the purpose well. The room was quite spacious as was the bathroom. The room overlooked a condo complex across the street. It'd be a problem if you book a cheapest rate for you vacation and end up looking out to an ugly condo building. However, the proximity of the beach is what saves the location. We also liked complimentary high speed internet. The buffet breakfast was not very strong - our room came with the continental version of it. Certainly nothing of value. The coffee was pretty horrible. The failure in customer service happened when the check in agent denied that breakfast was included in the rate - we had a printout of confirmation as a backup, but still they charged one breakfast onto the credit card after we checked out despite the front desk agent making a note in the account that breakfast was included. The other problem with the hotel is that once you call them they can barely hear you, so if there is problem it is hard for them to get to grips with it.
