Carolina is a strip with many hotels, stores, Walgreens, etc. It costs 10$ one way from the airport by taxi and $20 to Old San Juan. The self parking costs 17$. The gym is pretty nice even though it can feel crowded and cramped just like the breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Stay”
Reviews.Author: babswel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent pool and gorgeous private beach. Superb spa with very capable staff. The rooms were really adequate with views of ocean and pool. We also loved the Casino, the largest in the Carribean. The only downer was the restaurant "El Mulino" which is mega $$$ with very little quality. We had to ask that our plate be warmed twice for pasta and seafood. Other than that, the hotel was beyond all expectations. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Sure This is a Ritz Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: pimptown
Reviews.Content: When you walked into the hotel it favored a Ritz C however, once you opened your room door it was just your typical room and not a $300-450 a room place. The food was horrible! Do not order room service unless you are truly, truly hungry...other than that DON'T do it. The management and staff were very nice and understanding and will switch your room if they are not over booked. The work out facility was small and crowded. Please ask for an ocean view...if not, you may get a room facing condos with voyers ....yes, there there are voyers!!!! Overall I would rate the facility as a 3.5 star and not a 4.5 or 5 star facility.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniab
Reviews.Content: Ritz-Carlton is a terrific hotel..the amenities are great, including beach chairs, umbrellas..Very friendly staff, willing to accomodate special requests. only two negatives..the hotel is pricey, especially the food ($12 for a hotdog at the pool), but it is probably worth it if you get a good internet discount. We have only one minor complaint: the free internet use in the unmanned business center is frequently monopolized by kids playing video games...annoying. Otherwise a great vacation (we stayed 7 nights)...

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: njstan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton from 4/12-18. If it was possible to give the hotel 6 stars. I would. Excellent, professional, accommodating staff from valet to maid to waiter. Property is beautifully maintained. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Pool is gorgeous. Beach is lovely. Of course, this is the Ritz Carlton, so if you're on a tight budget, meals can get very expensive. The area surrounding the hotel has plenty of fast-food places, which we found to be generally unpleasant/unwelcoming. This was a small price to pay for the paradise that is the Ritz Carlton. We plan to return as often as possible. GREAT GREAT GREAT. One side note: we are a family of 2 dads with a pre-teen son. Felt completely embraced by everyone and everything at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, great memories”
Reviews.Author: psychteach
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to PR and my first at the Ritz. We found an amazing deal through Air Tran which is why I gave it a "5" on value. The lobby is impressive, though not as impressive as the El Conquistador which is a couple of blocks down the street (check it out - that is where the Palm Steakhouse is - good food, but expensive. The desserts are huge!). We didn't eat at any of the on-site restaurants for dinner as we wanted to try restaurants in Old San Juan (Aguaviva is awesome!) For breakfast, there is a Denny's practically next door. We ate lunch beach/poolside 2 days. We weren't really super hungry, so we ended up splittling a lot of food - the fruit salad was yummy and fresh. The room was clean and comfortable, as was the bed. The bathroom was roomy, and I know this is probably petty, but I gave the rooms a "4" because I thought the shower curtain and the tub/shower combo just didn't seem like the "Ritz" to me. It just made the whole bathroom look average. All of the staff were very friendly - no complaints. We stayed out of the casino, as we knew we would end up wasting our money :) The pool is gorgeous, but by the afternoon it was hard finding seating on our own, but don't be shy to ask the staff - they will find it for you, set up your chair, umbrella, etc. They also have floating mats available at the pool, but they get claimed quickly as well. We never had problems finding seating on the beach. The beach was nice, nothing exceptional. Don't expect the crystal blue water that you find at some islands, but it was relaxing. Other tips/recommendations: We rented a car, as we knew we were not going to eat at the hotel, so that was a good thing for us and we didn't have to pay taxis all the time. The hotel charges $20 for parking, while a block down the street (at the Denny's) is only $10. If you like cats, do the walk at El Morro which is down on the water. They keep hundreds of cats there for rodent control and they are spayed/neutered and protected by the Historical Assoc, just like the ones in the Colliseum in Rome. It was neat to see these random cats pop out between the huge rocks of the ocean. If you like Raw Oysters, go to Aguaviva in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Superb for honeymoon getaway”
Reviews.Author: koteygrimes2008
Reviews.Content: Took my wife for a second honeymoon in 2006. That's one of the best destinations I picked without my wife's help LOL. It's great, romantic and quiet. My advise, go with spouse alone for first two nights then allow friends(couples) to join for remainder of days. It worked out great for us. The wine selection was also very good. San juan is Spanish speaking so make sure you tag your spanish translator along. Highly recommend this for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not Cheap”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKirby
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Ritz. The hotel is very nice and the grounds are beautiful. The pool area is quite small, and I was surprised that there was no children's pool. There were many families with small children at the resort and this made the pool area crowded, noisy and hectic for adults who were looking for relaxation. The restaurants were very good but the food and drink prices were exorbitantly high. The beach was nice but too windy and rough during our stay. The rooms were also on the small side and not really anything special. We chose the Ritz because it was a great package deal, but once you get there it is no bargain. We enjoyed our stay but I'm not certain I would chose it again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE! BEAUTIFUL PROPERTY! LUXURIOUS!”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, helpful. Property is beautiful -- great beach and pool. Great restaurant, food -- and very reasonably priced for a Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Mzpigy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Ritz last May and we could not have asked for a better experience! The wedding coordinator Jennifer was phenomenal and made sure that our wedding and reception went off without a hitch. The food was excellent and our guests could not stop talking about what a wonderful time they had. My husband and I have always had excellent service while staying at the hotel. The entire staff has always greeted us and they go out of their way to make sure that are stay is enjoyable. The pool bartenders Maritza, Elmer, Omar and the others are excellent and they even remember what drinks you like and start preparing them when they see you coming. The hotel itself is very close to the airport and while you can hear the planes they really do not bother you, or at least the noise did not bother us. It is nice to be able to get to the hotel in 5 min. from the airport and be able to be relaxing on the beach with-in an hour of landing! We will continue to stay at the Ritz when we got to Puerto Rico and will be returning there in May for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Dressed up average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mma518
Reviews.Content: I have been at so many Ritz-Carltons and I believe the Ritz company should consider renaming it the "Fizzle-Carlton." Of course, you will have your typical Ritz staff who struggle to pronounce your name and sound friendly - but it is clear that they have been coached to the point of hating to do it. Let's start with the location: nothing is nice around it - so forget venturing outside for a nice walk. The airport is very close by, but the noise from the airport is minimal. The property: It has some nice Ritz touches, but it is clear that this property could pass as your average Hilton or Embassy Suites. Those loyal Ritz customers will immediately notice the difference. Everything about this property is either average or below average. It is nice that they have free wifi everywhere, but I just passed a flee-motel and it has a sign that says free wifi everywhere on the property. The pool area is certainly ill equipped to handle even 75% occupancy at the hotel. You will be lucky to find a spot to relax around the pool unless you are there at 7am. There are two lonely tennis courts - no lights though. For a 5-star property, they should have invested in lighted courts. And you will need to cal in to reserve a time and commit yourself to that time. The Ritz should know that if people are on vacation, the last thing they want to be reminded of is appointments and deadlines. The spa is OK, nothing to write home about and it can use some professionally-trained masseuses. Overall, they are not too bad but don't expect what you get at the Ritz in Bali, for example. Then there is the cattle march for breakfast at Mare in the morning. Be prepared to wait in line (don't you hate this while on vacation) and be given the "we-are-busy, you- are-hungry, and we-are-doing-you-a-favor" looks from the wait staff. Also, be prepared to be reminded of school cafeterias - hungry guests in their not-so-clean beach cloths trying to feed themselves for breakfast, lunch, and part of dinner. I mean, people, c'mon, have you not seen food before? Can't you wait until you get to your tables before feeding your face off the buffet while walking around? Yuk! Not the Ritz fault here, but they certainly have to cater to such a clientele with matching attitudes. Then, there are the rooms. Average, and nothing special. But here is a question to the Ritz interior designers: Have you guys heard of cell phones? And if you have, do you know that most cell phones need to be charged? And, did you know that a couple staying in room will most likely have two cell phones that need to be charged? OK, so the next time you design a room for the Ritz, remember to leave some outlets handy by the desk. Gee, Howard Johnsons probably got this one figured out. Not the Ritz in San Juan. And, by the way, the last time the windows were cleaned from the outside outside was when Christopher Columbus sat foot on the island. And the casino, please Ritz, get rid of that eye sore. It is so not nice to have such a trashy place in there. Avoid if you can. Il Mulino is a terrible place in NYC, DC, and also at San Juan. Not recommended. Finally, and here is the best part: San Juan is the loveliest Caribbean place to visit. Old San Juan is so cute, so hip, and so charming, it is worth it to stay at the Ritz. There isn't a better place, anyway. So enjoy, have some fun, and avoid the zoo breakfast at Mare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wrong island”
Reviews.Author: tcoop92
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, the Ritz Carlton Hotel, Spa and Casino San Juan is lovely in itself, but in the wrong part of town and needs a new service staff. Location: in the middle of a somewhat ghetto part of San Juan. Would be much better if located in Old San Juan (touristy area) instead. Lovely pool/beach area, although beach was public and some sketchy people would walk up and down it. Room was lovely. Ocean View and had a balcony. Restaurants need some improvement. BLT Market was the better but was very loud, which is an issue for us. Il Mullino was a total diaster. The waiter, food and noise level all sucked. We really enjoyed the Ruth's Chris in Old San Juan, best dinner on the island. And were only there for four nights anyways. We sailed around the Eastern Caribbean and picked islands that appealed to us and stayed there for a few nights. Went ATVing in the Rainforest, toured the old Fort. Would I go back to this Ritz let alone the island of Puerto Rico? No.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect destination for non-vacation times of the year.”
Reviews.Author: Andie_9
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to go to when the kids are off from school. They were not prepared for the amount of people and my idea of a vacation is not getting up at 7am to reserve a pool lounge chair. The convenience to the airport could not be beat. The weather was perfect everyday and the meals were expensive but first rate! This is a great destination with both beach and pool right outside your room, however, you have to either go without the kids or take them out because going during a popular school break was a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajs0522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz this past October; finally getting around to my review. We were in San Juan after celebrating a friend's wedding in Ponce. I'll preface my review by saying that I am not a fan of Puerto Rico as a vacation destination. I had visited San Juan several years ago, and was not at all impressed. Though I had the same sentiments this time around, I was really happy with the Ritz. The hotel and grounds were beautiful and the service was fantastic. The beach area is as good as it is going to get in that area. If you go to San Juan, definitely stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: nyrangers1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 7 night stay at the Ritz Carlton San Juan. Before booking I read every review on Trip advisor but decided to book the trip anyway. This was a last minute getaway and figured how bad could it be. Well it was pretty bad. Hotel location: About a 5 minute ride from the airport. You could throw a rock at the incoming Jets...that's how close this place is to the airport Check in: Fast easy...We head up to our room to change clothing and head downstairs to get food. Our safe was broken, our phone was broken. Service to fix both were prompt...although the guy that fixed the safe stood there until i tipped him...We head down to eat. We decided upon OBG...or whatever they call the poolside restaurant. we waited about 15 minuted for our beers. The same guy that was serving drinks at the pool was the same guy that was our waiter. Food finally comes...not good at all...and way overpriced even for a Ritz Carlton. We head back to the room to nap ( we had been up since 4am ) we pull the very moist sheet back only to realize the very moist sheets have a ton of sand in them, not to mention the ketchup stains. We call guest services they send up a manager to change our sheets...which were just as dirty and had a pretty decent sizes tear. whatever...at this point we just want to sleep...We spent the night in the room only to realize that every time we leave the room and come back our allergies are pretty bad....turns out there is black mold growing in the bathroom...We switch rooms and the allergies subside...and our bed was a nice dry one ... instead of a moist one. Ground are very well maintained....very small pool area....only one pool...beach was ok....water was not very clear....tons of seaweed....and the jets taking off and landing every minute do not give this place a vacation feel...One thing that bothered me was the constant yapping on cells phones by guests. Its vacation people put the phone and blackberry away. The service on the beach is horrible...we had to flag down someone to get a drink every time except our last day. The towel service people drive around on 4 wheelers to pick up towels...so now you have sand being blown up at you every time one passes by not to mention the smell of the gas... I think there are three places to eat at The Ritz.( besides BLT and Il Milino) all three have really bland overcooked food. We did eat at Il Milino one night and i have to say the food was awesome and the service is what you would expect from eating at the ritz....too bad it wasn't the Ritz. In a nutshell The Ritz Carlton has very very very poor service, bland overpriced food, horrible location, and they really dont seem to care. So if you read all the reviews and still decide to go....don't say 500 bad reviews didn't warn you! If you are looking for a true Ritz Carlton experience head to The Ritz Carlton Grand Cayman...they know how to treat their guest...

Reviews.Title: “Not very”
Reviews.Author: miapia88
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family to Puerto Rico over New Year's and was very disappointed with the Ritz Carlton here on the island. We booked 2 rooms for myself, my husband and 3 teenage daughters. Neither room was ready upon arrival and they weren't available until 5:30 p.m. We were told to keep checking back at the front desk, so none of us got the bathing suits on and jumped into the pool, because we were waiting for our rooms. When we finally got into the rooms, our large window was so cloudy (in between the 2 glass panels) that we could barely see out. We didn't complain at the time because we wanted adjoining rooms and the hotel was "at capacity". Our daughters' room was okay - window was nice. The prices at the buffet restaurant were ridiculous. We felt like we were being ripped off. The New Year's Eve buffett was over $150.00 per person and the food was very ordinary. The BLT restaurant was nice - very expensive - but a nice meal anyway. The pool and beach were pretty but SO overcrowded. The pool chairs are on top of each other - the beach chairs too. If you wanted a cabana at the pool (which was still 3 feet away from the next person/not very private) it was $400. I thought that was an inflated price to say the least. I've been to hotels in Turks that didn't even charge for the cabanas. It was expensive to stay there and we don't mind if you are getting 5 star treatment. I felt like we were being gouged the whole time we were at the Ritz, and it wasn't worth the expense. When I returned home, I filled out the survey and sent it to the corporate offices and have not heard back from anyone yet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: markofbklyn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in the begining February. Here the scoop. 1) Check was a breeze and our room was ready even though we arrived before check in. 2)Bell-hop took our bags to our room and showed us around. 3)The Pool is nice and big but not deep. Everyone crowds around the pool and it can be hard to find chairs if you come late. The towel guy will set you up with chairs and towels. 4)There is always staff around the pool that will get you a drink and something to eat. Be advised that you have to pay for drinks. The hotel does offer fresh apples and water with lime for free by the pool. 5)The beach is nice and can be crowed at times, but there is always room. 6) The casino is the largest from all the hotels. The tables are crowed and the mininum is usually 5 dollar tables. The Carribean poker jackpot was up to 85,000 when I was there. The rooms are big and the bathrooms are extra large with a seperate room for the toliet. Compared to other hotel the Ritz is in a class of it own. I think a fair value for a night should be about 355, however they usually charge more. I visted other hotels and they are all nice but smaller and they dont have friendly staff. The Ritz is beautiful and close to everything. The only issue is that you are next door to the airport and you can hear and see the jets taking off/

Reviews.Title: “think carefully”
Reviews.Author: Fozmonster
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed by the poor level of service, cleanliness and overall maintenance of a hotel charging $700 for a regular room. Pool and beach is great but ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BBHME
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Ritz before, so I am unable to rank this one in comparison to others. As a hotel, it was quite nice. I would have been disappointed if I had paid full price. Location: The hotel is located in Isla Verde, what I can only describe as "Hotel Row." It's a lackluster strip of hotels, fast food joints and unappealing shops that I can only compare to Virginia Beach. I tend to prefer hotels set aside in more authentic areas, but if you want something in the thick of it, near San Juan but with a nice beach, this would likely be good for you. Customer service: Front desk service was great or awful, depending on the attendant. No one offerred to help with our bags (no biggie, we didn't have anything too cumbersome). Concierge was decent. Beach and pool attendants were personable and genuinely friendly, as were waitstaff. Maid service was quite good and room service is 24 hours and relatively prompt. The staff all made an extra effort to greet us with a smile and again, they always seemed genuine. Room: They knew we were there for a birthday and sent up a gift with balloons, and also gave us a certificate for a free trinket from the gift shop. Both were nice touches. The room itself was on a side corridor with a half-view of the ocean. Very nice, big bathroom with great amenities. The room itself was on the small side, with a big but uncomfortable chair and no room in the minibar for our own goodies. Some shabby details like a falling apart lampshade. Comfortable bed. No WiFi (surprising). Grounds: The beach is narrow and windy, but it is very swimmable. Pool area and grounds were immaculate, but hard to find a chair that hasn't been reserved at 8am by someone who doesn't plan to show up until 2pm. The pool was so cold that we never went in. I didn't want to, anyway, due to the number of kids in diapers. They need to provide a kids pool. Dining: We had room service once and ate at the beach bar once. Both were good but not remarkable in any particular way other than the price. We had lunch for four with a total of three alcoholic drinks for about $160. But dining in this area is just expensive in general - our meal at the BBQ "shack" on the roof of the nearby El San Juan was just as expensive. There are some good casual places within walking distance. Try Lupi's for simple Mexican food. Casino: Very crowded, but a good, fun atmosphere with locals and Ritz guests alike. Great people watching. We had decent luck on the slots and at the tables. Overall: I don't think I'd stay again, especially not at the full price. It is a nice place with better-than-average service, but it lacks "wow" factor. Next time I'd pick a smaller hotel in Rincon or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go over a holiday or school vacation (unless you have kids or like crowds)”
Reviews.Author: pmm123
Reviews.Content: My husband I just returned from a long week (Presidents' Day) stay. While we may return in the future for a quick trip, we will never again visit this hotel over a holiday weekend. We expected it to be busy, but unfortunately the hotel was completely overcrowded and the staff was run ragged by demanding guests. Pool: Pool chairs were hard to come by after 8:30 a.m. One staffer told me there were people waiting for him at 6:15 am to "claim" (throw a book on) chairs. The chairs were also totally packed in. I have never sat so close to a stranger in a bathing suit. There was virtually no pool-side service. Spa: Be sure to make spa reservations a few weeks ahead of time. The spa treatments were good, but the spa itself (locker room and waiting areas) could use an upgrade. The fitness center is small and out of date. Restaurants: We ate at BLT and Il Molino. Both were decent. Make reservations a couple of weeks in advance. Rooms: The rooms are ok, a little warn.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay ... rest of property declining rapidly”
Reviews.Author: finpits
Reviews.Content: For years we have been spending 1-2 months each winter renting an apartment in Puerto rico. We frequently dine in the hotels and one of the highlights has always been the Sunday brunch buffet at the Ritz. This year, when some work had to be done at the apartment, we stayed at the Ritz overnight. Since it was a weekend, we planned for the brunch. However, it has been discontinued. A big mistake on their part ... it was one of the truly spectacular culinary events on the island. We had lunch there and were very disappointed ... good, not great, and ridiculously overpriced. $13.50 for a bland, uninspired bloody mary. I suspect that most of their business these days comes from corporate meetings, etc. where attendees don't care how much things cost. (I'll bet that will change now that pricey meetings are under the microscope). As for the rest of the Ritz: casino is awful, full of locals who "reserve" two or three or four machines by putting a dollar or two in them and putting a purse, sweater or package on the seat ... that way they can get a machine they want when they are ready to switch. Most machines are old, payoffs are awful and aisles very narrow. Much better places to play in Isla Verde and Condado. Marriott, for one, is much nicer, as is the El San Juan. Hotel room was okay but uninspired. Did not feel at all tropical. My recommendation ... stay here if your company sends you on a business trip and picks up the expenses; otherwise, there are much nicer places to spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what hotel other reviewers stayed, loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: PATravelGirl_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico (1/30/09-2/5/09) and I just had to write a review because I feel like this hotel is getting a bad rap. Before leaving for this trip my husband and I were a little discouraged about some of the more recent reviews. We have stayed at other Ritz Carltons and were hoping to get the same service that comes along with the Ritz brand. We were looking for some serious R and R (I'm a stay at home mom to 3 and my husband owns his own company). We rarely get away for non-work related/non kiddo trips and this place did not disappoint. Upon arrival we were greeted immediately and our bags were taken. My husband started the check in process (no line) and at least 3 people asked me if "I would like something to drink "or "if there was something they could get for me". My first impression was really good. The decor is beautiful but understated. No gawdy fixtures, brass or overly patterned carpet. My husband asked for an upgrade and we bumped up to an ocean front room with a balcony. They did charge us an extra $100 a night but it was worth every penny, the view was amazing. The room itself was nice (comfy bed, flat screen TV, nice furniture) We were told our room was ready and went to out room to find someone resurfacing the marble countertop. The gentleman was very apologetic. At that moment the front desk called to make sure our room was ok and we explained to them what was going on they were very apologetic also and gave us the upgrade for the night free. We then headed down to the pool area to grap some lunch and some drinks. We had read the reviews and knew the food was expensive and it is. We ordered 2 chicken sandwiches, 2 beers and a "fruity frozen cocktail" and it was $75. This was pretty much the standard lunch bill for the week. Although it was pricey, the food was really good, we didnt have one bad meal at the pool/beach. The service was really fast too and the servers were really friendly. Beach/pool service was excellent our entire stay. The beach/pool attendants were extremely nice and accomadating. Everyday they would set up two chairs (with three towels; one as a pillow, one to lay on and one to use if you got wet), an umbrella and a little table (to put drinks etc. on) for us. We never waited more than 5 mintues for the whole process to be done. These guys hustle, zero complaints about beach/pool attendants. I do have to say the hotel seemed "quiet", even in the middle of the day there were several empty pool chairs and you could pretty much chose any area to sit in. The weekend of our stay was busier but my Monday things had quieted down. My husband spent alot of time in the casino and he said they had some of the nicest pit bosses he had ever met. We ate at both "in house" restaurants and although BLT was good IL Mulino was amazing. The service was so attentive and the food was some of the best Italian I have ever had. If there was one complaint I could make it would be the lack of water pressure in the shower. I also think for the price there should be a seperate shower/tub. These things are minor. We did go down the street and visit El San Juan hotel. As soon as we sat at the bar and ordered drinks we were reassured of our choice to stay at the Ritz.. Several bartenders there had zero personality and acted as if you were bothering them when you wanted a drink. We also visited their beach during the day and it wasnt half as nice as the Ritz's and it actually smelled bad along that stretch of beach. I honestly cannot say enough great things about this hotel and their staff. We will def. go back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here for even the one night after our cruise. The clincher was that Amex had a promotion for 30,000 points for a free night including brfst. We were given an upgrade to a ocean view room that was very nice. I was surprised that you could barely hear the airplanes even outside by the pool and beach. The food is just ok and overpriced but the brfst was good. The property is pretty and the beach in front of the hotel has been enhanced with white sand that was brought in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But Pales in Comparison to Other Ritzs”
Reviews.Author: arp1997
Reviews.Content: My husband, infant son, and I spent four nights at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan for some much needed fun in the sun. The hotel is lovely and a quick spin from the airport. Upon checking in we were told that the hotel was at 96% occupancy and when showed to our room we were appalled. Our room overlooked a small roof (complete with litter), the ballroom veranda (if we could lean through the window we could touch the people), and was located on teh 3rd floor- right along side the ballroom and other meeting spaces. Basically, for any modicum of privacy the curtains would always have to remain shut. We requested to move as the room was completely unacceptable and was basically told that we would have to upgrade to an ocean front room to the tune of another $110/night. We did so b/c there was no way we were staying in that room. The new room had a great view and was nice (albeit a little small)... The pool area was great, but VERY crowded. The beach area was lovely as well, but the water wasn't the tourquise blue you'd expect. The restaurants were good, although EXTREMELY expensive. We had dessert and nightcaps in Il Mulino to the tune of $90... Overall, we had a great time at the hotel but it doesn't compare to the other Ritzs we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the Ritz Carlton you'd expect...!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnytraveler1970
Reviews.Content: Holiday stays are often difficult but I never worry about booking with the Ritz Carlton, until now. My family consists of 2 adults and a 12 and 14 year old. We arrived in San Juan a couple of days prior to a cruise. We arrived on Christmas night and it was very busy in the hotel. Our rooms were already prepaid prior to our arrival and a room with 2 double beds were committed. When we arrived we were told only King sized beds were available but they could provide a cot in an effort to help us. Obviously, this wasn't really an option, I asked if there were larger rooms, different rooms, anything that had double beds (I offered to pay an up charge if needed). I was told the only option would be to get another room with a King size bed. I declined the offer as it came with a full rate $800 per night price tag. I asked to speak with a manager so I could show him all my confirmation paperwork and hopefully get some resolution. The manager was called and after about 10 minutes he appeared and I told him my situation, showed him all my confirmation paperwork. He told me he would resolve the problem, he walked in the back and returned telling me everything was resolved. I thanked him and wished him a Merry Xmas. I was given the key and told to wait a few moments while housekeeping had to do something in the room. After a few moments we walked to the room and noticed that housekeeping added a double bed into a room with a King sized bed.... it was hilarious, essentially the entire room consisted of 2 beds... At this point I had to laugh and make the best of it, I was only going to be there for 2 nights. However, it is clear when you walk around this hotel, the cleanliness and condition of the property is nothing like anything I've ever experienced in other Ritz Carltons. The employees do not have the same dedication to service that I have experienced elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standards of a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: addostone
Reviews.Content: This hotel while being a Ritz Carlton did not meet my expectations. What sets a great hotel apart from a good hotel are the things that you do not see but come up and surprise you. Maybe its the economy but all the "extras" you expect from A Ritz or Four Seasons were not there. The staff is very friendly and will help with any situation but the overall feel was not great. As this was our first stay, I asked many people who have been going there for many years, and almost all said what I felt and many said that they would not return. The rooms are fine (that is after we were moved from our room as there was mold under the windows and on the carpet.....gross). Internet is VERY spotty. What amazed us was that we were told that the hotel was full yet not all the restaurants were open. Be sure to book them ahead of time and stay far away from "Mare" the seafood restaurant. Prices were very inflated as it is a Ritz, but come on 18 for a pool side hot dog and 22 for a pool side ceasar salad with chicken? The magic question is would I return..........the answer is NO.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: ajones24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ritz-Carlton for 5 nights during a recent vacation; the service was excellent (if somewhat spotty), but the overall experience was less than what we expected from a Ritz. We are frequent travelers and during the past 5 years we have taken 10 extended vacations and never had occasion to complain about anything; we're not easily ruffled, and it takes a lot to make me call guest services--something we had to do several times during our stay. Here are the things we had to complain about: 1) When we took a blanket out of the closet to put it on the bed, it was wadded in a ball and had a huge piece of dried cheese stuck right on top. Disgusting. Housekeeping brought a new blanket immediately and it was warm and fresh. 2) We had a standard room which could be used as an adjoining room. On the third day, someone checked in to the adjoining room and we could hear everything they said, even though they were speaking in normal voices. I could hear the man whistling "Little Drummer Boy" - that's not right. We were woken up at 1:30 AM when the couple returned from a night out; they received 4 phone calls within 20 minutes and we heard every word of every call. That should not happen at a Ritz. To the credit of the Ritz staff, we called guest services at 2:00 AM and asked for a non-adjoining room, which they quickly located for us and we were moved within 15 minutes. Excellent service. 3) The next day we had to call guest services again and ask for a new iron, since the one in the new room was coming apart and didn't work. I didn't want to have to call again (I felt we had already earned a reputation as hard to please, unfairly), but we couldn't show up for dinner in wrinkled clothes...They brought a new iron within 5 minutes. We had an excellent time despite the small problems, but we concluded that the hotel quality was more in line with a 3-star hotel. We've stayed in Hiltons and Sheratons that were MUCH nicer than the Ritz, and for much less.

Reviews.Title: “If I had the choice again . . .”
Reviews.Author: Visitors4
Reviews.Content: If I had the choice again, I would stay at the Marriott resort in Condado where I stayed in last visit. I stayed at the Ritz for two nights for business, and though I didn't utilize many of the services included in the resort fee, I was not overwhelmed and impressed with the hotel and rooms. It has beautiful grounds, though not in a very good location. At least $20 taxi fare to central areas like Old San Juan, business district and Condado, and can't really walk out to anywhere. The rooms in comparison to many other hotels I have stayed was average, and in my view comparable to Marriott. The room I stayed in need some refurbishing in the decor. The service was average, attentive, but not exceptional and I would find elsewhere in other hotels. In all, the hotel is average; I was expecting more for a Ritz, and the high price that a traveler would pay for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel....Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz just for one night prior to flying over to St Maarten/St. Martin for more vacation time. Hotel is beautiful with lovely grounds, pool and hotel rooms. All amenities in the rooms are Bulgari. Check in went very quick and easy. It was later in the day but decided to get alittle sun before it set so we went to the pool right away. The pool bar/restaurant was closed for renovation. We wanted to order beverages so looked for a pool server walking around. No one seemed to be interested in taking our order. We had to wait a long time and finally I got up and went over to someone to get service. He did bring us one beverage but we never saw anyone else so we gave up on any other service at the pool. Had dinner at Mares which was excellent. Prices are a bit high but since it is a Ritz, to be expected. Seafood was fresh and the Sangria was very tasty! (of course it was $55.00 for Sangria so keep that in mind if you are on a budget!) Went to one of the shops and decided to purchase a copper tile of a parrot which was in the window. The girl checked the price on the back which said $30.00, which was a pretty good deal. When she went to ring it up, it rang up as $45.00....a bit more than was quoted. She was nice and said she would give us a 10% discount since we were staying in the hotel. We did buy it anyway. Went to the casino which was fairly busy considering it was slow season. Roulette was pretty fun and I actually won some $$, since my husband lost I guess we broke even. Got complimentary drinks, which was very nice since we didn't get our beverages at the pool earlier! Checked out the next day and requested a valet to handle our luggage. We waited for a long time but no one ever came so we just handled it by ourselves. When we went to the front, they weren't very busy so that was not the reason for no valet service. Overall, the hotel was very pleasant and attractive, however, being a Ritz I would have not expected the issues we had with the pool service or valet service. Still a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: chicagoblonde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for one night precruise. From the check in to check out everything was great. The hotel bar had comfortable seating (couches & chairs), a welcoming atmosphere, warm lighting and entertainment, not to mention the mojito's & plantain chips were wonderful.The pool & beach were very clean and accomodating. The service on the beach was excellent, as soon as you come through the glass doors and down the steps the beach the guys that set up your chairs are there to help & very tolerable. They are there for whatever you need. The only downfall is the beach has rocks that you don't see until you trip on them. My foot went completely into a hole in one & cut my heel, my husband tripped over another. The casino is clean but didn't spend much time there.The Blvgari soap & shampoo are awesome. Check out is a breeze, on the TV in the room, so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel; worthless as a resort”
Reviews.Author: greeper
Reviews.Content: For a business traveler, this hotel has some things to offer, namely: nice beds and bathrooms, proximity to the airport, decent in-house restaurants, an air of quasi-luxury, and a passable bar/lounge. With that in mind, memo to hotel execs: two things any business hotel absolutely must have are (1) easy access to Starbucks --FAIL-- and (2) wireless internet in every room --FAIL. These are not hard to accomplish, and something pretty much every Hampton Inn has managed by now. So even as a business hotel, it misses the mark. As a resort, I would love to have been in on the meeting which informed the planning and decisions behind this property. It's as though they decided to have a resort and left all the planning to someone who had never been on vacation. First --why on earth would you situate a resort on the most inhospitably windy point on the entire island. The wind is insufferable, strong, constant, and nagging. It blows the dirt-like sand everywhere, and every chaise is coated to the point where they don't appear blue, but brown. You can't hear the person next to you, it's so loud. I'm surprised more reviews don't mention this. It is very, very inhospitable, the windiness (the staff told me the wind was typical). Another point about location -- remote from everything. $50 bucks round trip to Old San Juan. If you are going to have a windy beach and pool area, for god's sake, heat the pool. I'm here on a weekend that is jam-packed, and have seen 9-10 people use the frigid pool the entire time. It is FREEZING, and when you get out, the wind is chilling. It doesn't help that the pool is beneath a forest of palm trees that effectively blocks the sun almost entirely. The hot tub has the usual resort problems. It's not hot. It's filled with infants and screaming children. Why bother, really? The "gym" has a lot of decent equipment packed into a regular-sized hotel room. It's unacceptable and pathetic. If they moved the same exact equipment into a space three times the size, it would be decent and even good. They should do away with the yoga studio (and I do yoga every day, so I'm not putting yoga down), and expand the gym facility or just do away with it altogether. It's almost dangerous how packed it is. Again, it appears to have been planned by someone who does not use gyms. Nice idea, bad execution. On the upside -- great staff, good concierge, great in-house restaurants, picturesque. Rooms are nice, though the standard room has a fairly small window and it gets a little dark. The showerhead sucks but decent water pressure. Tips -- the El San Juan Hotel down the road has 2 Starbucks and a very good restaurant called Coco that was pretty empty. The hamachi appetizer is good, crab balls were good, drinks were amazing. The little gelato store 2 buildings down has cheap, decent lunch and great gelato. Walgreens next to that for snacks, cokes, and lotion. Dont bother with Ritz poolside food and drinks. Lame on all accounts. BLT Steak and Il Mulino both fine. in sum, the very, very low end of the Ritz brand. Not a good location for laid back sun, and poorly planned/designed. Go somewhere else for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Professional Gives the Ritz San Juan a Thumbs Down”
Reviews.Author: marybrenta
Reviews.Content: I work in the travel industry and have high standards for a hotel stay. I booked the Ritz in San Juan at a travel industry rate for a stay pre-cruise. When we arrived at the hotel I asked if we could pay to upgrade to the concierge level as this room type wasn't available when I originally booked the room. The front desk agent proceeds to pull out a laminated card and try and "upsell" us to various rooms. It seemed a little tacky to me and she never really addressed what I had asked for which was the concierge level. After the upsell speach, she ends up giving us an ocean view balcony room for free. Why waste my time if you are going to upgrade me anyway? When we get to the room, there is no promised pull-out couch for my son. So I trek back down to the desk and go back to the same lady and she acts like I am lying about there not being any pull-out bed. She has to call someone in the front office and confirm that I am lying (I understand some Spanish). Ends up that I am not lying about the bed and she moves us to a regular room. So much for the "free upgrade"! After finally getting a room, we headed to get some dinner. We decide to head to the pool bar and arrive a little after 6pm. We ask the server for a menu and she tells they closed at 6pm. The only other restaurants available were not kid-friendly so we are forced to go to our room for dinner. What a shame that over the Thanksgiving holiday week at a hotel full of kids that they could not open the pool bar area longer! We get to the room and I am trying to entertain my son while we wait for dinner to come to the room. (Instead of us being able to swim and wait for dinner...) Of course, the TV remote doesn't work. It took over an HOUR for the replacement remote to arrive! That is poor customer service! After a long day of travel we were ready for a good night's sleep. Good luck with that at the Ritz in San Juan. We were in room 742. Something in the AC made a loud bang every once in awhile. The bed was less than stellar. It had a hump in the middle and something made your feet go upwards at the end of the bed. Horrible! With this said, the Ritz in San Juan has lovely public spaces. The pool is beautiful and my son thought the "spitting lions" were great fun. I tried out the fitness center and it was nice. We have yet to find a hotel in San Juan that we really like but we'll keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “My "Go To" Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is my "go-to" hotel whenever I find myself in San Juan in transit to another destination further down in the Caribbean. (With airline routes being cut, this is happening increasingly). In addition to the location convenient to the airport, and within walking distance of many restaurants, it's simply a great hotel. The common areas are elegant and luxurious, the service is up to par with RC standards, and the rooms are comfortable, fresh, clean. RC beds are simply luscious, and I can always count on a wonderful night's sleep. Despite the proximity to the airport, there is never any airport noise that you can hear in the rooms. The pool area is not huge, but between that and the beach, there never seems to be the unpleasant jockeying for beach loungers that one sees at other hotels (including the RC in Grand Cayman). Isla Verde's beach is nice enough, and certainly fine for a single night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Casually Elegant, Super-Clean, But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: sraema
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a wonderful island hotel. It is elegant, yet unpretentious. Impeccably clean, with comfortable rooms and superb bedding. I've never stayed at such a clean hotel in the Caribbean. The bathrooms are huge, with nice marble. Our "courtyard/pool" view was really just the tops of palm trees and blue skies above. The pool is very nice, laid-back vibe, moderate size. Wonderfully comfortable chairs and plenty of servers. Obviously this is not a huge Sandals-style pool scene. The beach was very nice. If you want many shades of blue in your ocean, you will be disappointed. This is middle-of-the-road as far as Caribbean ocean colors. The added 'resort fee' pays for chairs/umbrellas/kayaks/floats/sail boat..... Airport only a 5 minute cab ride, $10.50. Yes, you hear planes when outside. No, it didn't bother me one bit. It only seemed to occur once or twice an hour. But it was not overpowering nor intrusive. You hear the plane start to rev up, so it is not shocking or sudden. The positives outweigh that negative as you are on the beach so soon after landing. Likewise, we hopped a cab back to airport less than 2 hours before our return flight. We got as much out of our last day as we could, and thus huge pluses. If you take the 1:30 to 2:30pm non-stops back to the states, you will still get a few hours of sun before you leave. Food/Drink Prices: Expensive. But if I compare to other resorts and not the States, it is closer to that reality. Mojitos $14, angus burger $18. The kicker was a fried grouper sandwich at lunch was $38 . Ouch! I'd expect to pay approx $40-50 for a steak when on an island, but a 6 to 8 ounce grouper fillet on a bun was murder. Otherwise, yes it is expensive, but so is the El San Juan and the Intercontinental and the..... A great plus is the proximity to the El San Juan Hotel. We walked on the street and it took less than 10 minutes. That is THE place to be on a Thursday Friday or Saturday. Color and sounds and energy. We intended to hit the nightclub, but the expansive lobby was so great that we did not feel the need. Latin bands, DJ, 3 bars, ultimate people watching. Amazing! On the walk between the hotels we hit a nice Mexican place and a nice PR restaurant Platos (concierge recommended). Dinner at Platos with 2 rounds was less than $100, reasonable compared to Ritz restaurants. Take a $21 (each way) cab to Old San Juan - worth the experience. Early Sunday evening, stumbled upon a wonderful Puerto Rican festival or such. Down on the water near the cruise ships. A huge gathering of locals listening to large Latin band and dancing, with an outdoor 'bar' and food stands. Seemed like we were the only tourists in a sea of locals, which is wonderful immersion. (cruise ships nearby concerned me, but the cruise masses were elsewhere or perhaps had boarded by then?) Was told they do it every Sunday. In a nutshell, we loved to 'stay' at the Ritz by day, and 'play' elsewhere. The El for aforementioned nightlife. Old SJ for culture and food/drink. But if you are not looking for nightlife, obviously Ritz would be adequate at night as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: EdinATL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a long weekend getaway in mid-September. The stay exceeded my expectations. Check-in was fast and efficient. We were early, but they had another room that was ready so we could go right to our rooms. Lobby was typically Ritz furnished, the 2 story central area with a view out on the pool and garden was very nice. Our room (7th floor, Oceanfront Balcony room) was very nice. Typical Ritz room, very comfortable bed, enormous bathroom. The only downside was a lack of comfortable places to sit. One upholstered chair with ottoman and a desk chair, neither was super comfortable. I spent more time sitting on the balcony however. Complimentary bottled water in the rooms both for drinking and for making coffee. Room was serviced twice a day as expected, room was very clean, no odors or anything. Complimentary high-speed internet (wired) in the rooms, wireless was available in the lobby. I must admit I was concerned by reports of the construction noise. It did not start until 10 AM on the weekdays, and there was none on weekends. It was occasionally a tad loud lying by the pool but it was not bad and did not detract from the stay in any manner. I never heard any noise in the room from construction. Pool and beach service was excellent. Staff remembered our names, brought extra towels and such without prompting and offered to bring water, coffee, floats, etc. There were cabanas available for rental but other than having better lounge chairs they didnâ€™t seem worth money (the lounge chairs by the pool were completely adequate). Being September, there was never any problem having our pick of locations around the pool; if anything there are too many chairs. Probably not on a busy weekend in the winter. Restaurants: We had breakfast in Mares every day but one. It was excellent, ample, and the service was outstanding. On our first day my partner ordered a glass of milk with his breakfast. On our last morning, the waitress who had waited on us that day (who had not been working the days between and was not out server this day) saw us and came to greet us and offered him milk. The food was all very good, the Guava Pancakes were outstanding. The cost, although high, was not unreasonable for the quality and variety. Champagne was even included. We had lunch at Mares one day and it was also very good. Lunch by the pool was fine, if uninspired. We dined in the hotel only one night, at BLT Steak. It was mostly empty. The food was exceptional. There were some local twists to some of the items, such as the sauce for the wagyu skirt steak I had. The only item that was not great was the Parmesan gnocchi side dish that had way too much nutmeg grated on it. Casino: Iâ€™m not much of a gambler when vacationing, but I did venture into the casino one night. The casino was nice, large and clean. If I wanted to spend any time gambling I would prefer the casino at the El San Juan, solely because of the ambience. Overall: I would not hesitate to recommend the Ritz-Carlton San Juan to friends. We had a great time. I prefer the Ritz to the El San Juan, the only other San Juan hotel I have stayed at. And, the ease in flying to San Juan from the US makes it an easy escape.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DanaZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several nights. Our room on the fifth floor was small with nothing in particular to suggest any luxury except a full length mirror partially concealed by one of the beds. The room had a bad smell which on the last day we finally determined was coming from the mattresses. The room was equipped with fairly standard appliances, coffee maker, iron, and hair dryer. The TV was a modest flat screen TV. The bathroom had one sink. The toilet was in a separate small room with a wall phone next to it for some reason. There was a minibar which was wildly overpriced. A can of coke cost $3.50. There is a large pool in back with extensive landscaping. Beyond the pool, a door takes you to the beach. The beach seemed clean but otherwise nothing special. The restaurants in the hotel seemed very expensive. We had planned to try the casual one but found it inexplicably closed. There are other restaurants within walking distance of varying quality and cost. The ones in hotels are invariably overpriced. Probably the best bet bet is the Metropol restaurant across the street. There is little to see or do at this location. There is a cockfighting arena across the street and that is about it. A taxi to Old San Juan costs about $42 roundtrip without tips but offers considerably more nightlife than Isla Verde. We went into the rather dreary casino at the Ritz but only to use the ATM. Excursions from the hotel are handled by Castillo Tours which has a small office there. We tried the catamaran snorkel trip. Perhaps because there were only 5 people booked, we were driven to Fajardo, the hopping off point for the trip, and unceremoniously dumped on the boat of a totally different tour operator who operated on the cheap. For example, while we were told that we would receive brand new snorkels we could keep, the snorkels used were old and well worn, held onto the masks by rubber bands and when one woman asked if she could keep hers, she was told a firm 'no'. We were offered no explanation or apology from Castillo Tours. It is rare to encounter this kind of dishonesty but despite the convenience of having the tour operater in the hotel, I would strongly suggest booking elsewhere. The hotel seems to be significantly overpriced. Our room had problems which would have been a concern at any price. Beyond the public areas of the hotel there is little to do in the area. The bars and restaurants in the hotel are wildly overpriced with a mojito for example costing $14. A big improvement would be to offer some form of shuttle service between the airport and the hotel and between the hotel and Old San Juan. But first the hotel must throw out those horrible smelly mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: KKenia
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton in San Juan is a great place to stay. Very clean and conveniently located, friendly staff, excellent service with a smile, excellent spa, good entertaintment at night in the lobby bar. We ate there almost every night. We got a great massage the spa. The food at Ritz is good and made in the kitchen that is very clean. So you know that you will not get sick during your stay. It is not that expensive when you compare with the restaurants in the neighborhood and old San Juan. At least you know you will not get sick. We are vegetarians and they accomodated our request without any problem. The service on the beach is great. One of the waiters Jose Gil, he went out of his way to take care of us while we ate. All in all a great place to stay and relax while you are in San Juan. I will not stay at any other place. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jeffreycowart
Reviews.Content: The grounds and the room were in very good condition. A freindly staff greeted us upon arrival, and checkin went very smooth. Our only real complaint was the overall service. We really expected to get great service and be pampered. That is not what we got. Absolute minimum time to get anything is 30 minutes. When we got there, we went out by the pool and ordered 2 bottled local beers. They are $8 each, and it took 30 minutes to get them. We were 25 feet from the bar, so needless to say the next round we went directly to the bar. Then we tried to order a sandwich from the bar, 45 minutes later our cold sandwich arrived. The next morning at breakfast the trend condinued. I went and ate down the street where the prices were reasonable, but my mother opted to eat a $25 fruit plate. It took 45 minutes, and we had to ask twice where it was, just for a fruit plate. The beach in front of the hotel is in good condition, and they provide chairs, umbrellas, and towels for you to use free of charge. The pool area is also very nice, again towels and lounge chairs are available. The hotel is very close to the airport, so be prepared to listen to them all day long take off. Didnt seem to be an issue at night, luckily we could not hear them in our rooms. Room was in good condition, marble bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. We ate most of our meals off site, because of price and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Fast get away weekend excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blackie162
Reviews.Content: San Juan Ritz has the best customer service I have seen anywhere. My husband and I and another couple spent a long weekend here and we were so impressed with the people ,food ,beach and pool we are going back next Oct. We had an early flight out of JFK and we were on the beach by 10:00 am. We did not have to deal with waiting to go through customs. The cab ride is 7 minutes from the airport. The airport is near the hotel but we never heard much noise from it. Beach Warm beautiful water and a nice beach!! The water is not crystal clear and blue but great!! Food We stayed on club level and Brendan, Rey and the whole staff on that floor were excellent. They tried their best to please you!! The food is very healthy and gourmet style!!!!! The Blt restaurant was ok Metropole across the street was delicious. I highly recommend you go there. The prices are much cheaper then the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Staff is very nice. I arrived there quite early and my room was not ready. The receptionist directed me to the spa where I was able to change and hang out at the pool until my room was done. All receptionists on duty were very polite and the dulce tipicos on the counter are a nice detail. The room was very comfortable and although it did not have the ocean view, it was still very nice. The beach area was very clean and it was a pleasure to run through it in the morning. I would suggest to travelers to go to Pinones, not to far from the hotel for good traditional puertorican food. The pool is fabulous and the hammocks on the beach are also a nice detail.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: CMQR
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice lobby and a great casino. I spend 3 days while Hurricane Omar, and the staff help me with information every other hour. Close to the airport and many local attractions. I would recommend go to the supermarket next street because snacks in the rooms are kind of expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: babygirl722
Reviews.Content: Our stay was just what we expected from the Ritz....First class service at a beautiful resort. The staff here are some of the friendliest and hardest working people I have ever met. They really understand service and go above and beyond to please their guest. The rooms were just OK - we were on the Club Level and felt that the room was a bit small. Bathroom was very nice and overall the room was well maintained but a bit older and nothing special. We had a beach view which was really nice. The Club Level was really worth it for a family of 4 and the staff in the lounge was fantastic! They were constantly offering the kids hot chocolate with whipped cream and always making sure that my husband and I had all that we needed. They really made us feel at home and spoiled us as well. Beach and pool were gorgeous. Casino was just so-so. I like a little more action and felt that the place was not as liveley as the casino at the El San Juan, which is a short walk away. We had dinner at both Il Mulino and BLT Steak. I thought Il Mulino was just OK but BLT Steak was fabulous. Anyway, we went to the Ritz to relax and that is just what we did. We hope to be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Armando_73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the airport and standard is as high as you can expect from Ritz Carlon. I was surprised with their Restaurant BLT. Dinning experience was great (the best we had in Puerto Rico) and service was as good as friendly. Very nice atmosphere to feel confortable and enjoy the menu. Wine selection was excelent and on Friday was 50% off (very rare offer). In general the stay was a nice and relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: travelingcheap
Reviews.Content: Quick Points - Non-Smoking Casino, Great Pool, Nice Beach, Well Appointed. The only downside is the beach area at night - was told by security that it was "very, very dangerous." Just prior to this, the front desk told us that there were no problems. The Ritz-Carlton can't really control the beach and night and since the resort is fully enclosed and the beach access is locked at night....so no worries. Not much in the area, but a nice place to stay. Don't book your tours through the Ritz - way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: captain77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything that you would expect from the Ritz. Beautiful property, with exceptional service. Rafael will take care of your every need. This oceanfront property will cater to your every need. Everything was so great at the hotel, we found it hard to leave and explore San Juan. The casino is somewhat small, but is open 24 hours. There are 3 good, but pricey, restaurants on site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: zebaet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for a weekend visit. The property was lovely and the service was excellent. I selected this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip advisor. The reviews were 100%correct: Service: Stellar Room Quality: Not what I expected. There was an odor in the room and the windows were very dirty. *If I asked to be moved to another room, they probably would have accomodated me. Spa: Very nice Restaurant food Quality: Excellent The Beach was much better than I expected. It seemed like you were on a private beach that was owned by the hotel. Hotel Employees set up umbrella's, tables and chairs on the beach for Hotel Guests and the water was very calm and warm. If I return to Puerto Rico I would stay at the Ritz Carlton again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: MarianneWC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one week stay at this wonderful hotel---two adults and two children, 10 and 16. We booked this trip last minute online, sight unseen. We were thrilled by one of the prettiest hotels on the island with its own white sand beach, well-maintained grounds and a friendly, service -oriented staff team! We were nervous about August weather --- it was warm and lovely. Some clouds at some point each day, but overall typical tropical weather despite the foreboding online weather forecasts predicting rain everyday... did not materialize. We were nervous about this hotel being 5 minutes from the airport---not an issue at all. Never enters your mind once at the hotel. Never heard a plane in the hotel. We could see some take-offs to the right when on the beach. Actually it was convenient for arrival and departure to be so close. We were nervous because there is some renovation at the hotel right now---again, a non-issue. It is secluded and shrouded, presenting no interference whatsoever. The staff of this hotel are outstanding! They are warm and accommodating. The concierge desk (especially Jessica) went out of their way to help us plan excursions (East Wind snorkeling to Icacos, night-time bio-bay kayaking, rainforest tour) as well as dinners in old San Juan (do not miss Baru!). It was like having a best friend on site to take care of you! Also compliments to the Ritz-Kids staff where my 10 year old spent some time (better for her than the rainforest outing)---she loved it! It is very expensive on site, so be prepared. We found a Starbucks down the street at the El San Juan Hotel and brought it back---better than $20/head for breakfast buffet! One dinner at BLT STeak is worth it, followed by a short walk down the street to PIu Bello for an amazing array of tropical ice creams and more! Don't miss this hotel! ~~ Satisfied San Francisco travelers

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: JordanSkye
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous. Just got back from a week at the wonderful Ritz Carlton San Juan. The location is ideal (close to airport) and the entire staff was very attentive, professional and genuinely friendly. The staff went out of their way to make sure my stay was perfect. A great place to relax and enjoy the hospitality of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Ritz experience”
Reviews.Author: Saroo72000
Reviews.Content: We really expected a Ritz experience and it was closer to a Holiday Inn experience (no offense to Holiday Inn). We were given a room next to the air-conditioning unit which was pretty loud at night. The room was very small and nothing special. The pool bar - argh! - We waited and waited for a waiter to show up for at least 20 minutes. Than another 20 minutes for the drinks to be served. When he finally arrived, we already made a decision to leave. He chased us along the pool creating a scene and then ostentatiously put the drinks on the ground and left. We were astounded...and entertained by this peculiar behavior. The checkout was a nightmare. It took 45 minutes! We needed to catch a plane but couldn't leave without an itemized bill. We loved old town and the people there but the staff at the Ritz was unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: migsal
Reviews.Content: My vacation was for a family ruenion as will walk in the employee were great help Neisha (front desk) Isaias (seguridad) Daniel (recreation) WendY (concierge) My 10 yrs old duaghter had a great time she when to the pool to the last day.Old son was out the time we were there everthing was so close he was at the clubs. Casino, drinks and food were great. yes i would go a there again thanks for a great time Sally Hernandez NJ

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, wonderful people (mostly)”
Reviews.Author: jcn2045
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel and stay. We have stayed in Ritz-Carlton properties before and had a similar experience -- the staff is very helpful and polite at a level above other hotels (the only comparison has been the Four Seasons). The room, pool, and grounds were nice. As others mention, there is no airport noise at all. Help for beach chairs/umbrellas was wonderful -- it was a surprise to see 3-4 people whose primary purpose was to hand out towels and place equipment on the beach for guests. Some minor issues -- we arrived in the afternoon and had to wait three hours for our room, which had never happened before at any hotel of the level of the Ritz-Carlton (but they at least took my cell # and called me when a room became available). Second, my wife was using her Mac Air on business, and the in-room internet connection was not able to be used. No adaptors were available and the hotel staff seemed lost when asked for help. At most hotels I would not be bothered, but with the standards of the Ritz-Carlton (and previous experiences at other properties) I was a little (just a little) surprised at the total lack of help.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great...”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve616
Reviews.Content: We stay at Ritz Carltons every time we travel. I agree with other reviewers that this particular property is not on par with other Ritz Hotels, despite the $700 p/night (very small and umimpressively appointed) room. The staff was accomodating enough, but not nearly as consistently cutomer-service oriented as the staff at a typical Ritz (and we're pretty low-maintenacce guests!). Although our stay was enjoyable, we will consider trying another hotel on our next visit to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: shouse333
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the people! We stayed at the club level which I highly recommend. With drinks at $15 a pop at the hotel bar, the club level easily paid for itself. The staff in the club lounge was fantastic at taking special requests and giving information. Our room was beautiful, but housekeeping was sporadic. Definitely take advantage of the water sport equpment rental. The ride on the 13' hobie cat with a captain was amazing...and free. My only conplaint is that the pool allows you to reserve chairs by placing towels on them early in the morning. So there are a lot of chairs sitting empty, but you can't use them because they are reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5-day stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Bizandfuntravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a 5-day stay at the Ritz over the 4th of July weekend. We have stayed at other Ritz properties before, but this was our first time to Puerto Rico. We booked a standard room via the hotel's website and were upgraded to an ocean view room without asking. The rooms and grounds were not quite as nice as other Ritz properties, but were still very nice. Although the hotel is near the airport, we heard absolutely no noise in our room. All staff we encountered (especially the concierges) were extremely nice and accommodating. The pool is beautiful and the grounds are well-manicured. All pool chairs were already taken by the weekend afternoons, but there were plenty available in the mornings and on the weekdays. The beach is public. The sand is not the clean, powdery white sand you see in other parts of the Caribbean. The ocean, however, is much prettier and blue-er than I expected. The Ritz beach service was very nice, as staff quickly set up chairs and a little table for us. As expected, food and drink is expensive. Frozen drinks are $15, Continental breakfast of juice, coffee, and pastries is $17, and the restaurants are overpriced (we ate at Il Mulino). However, it was what you'd expect at a resort. The fitness center was clean and well-equipped. I enjoyed a pilates class. Also included in the resort fee, are free bottled water, all the towels you want for the beach and for off property excursions, internet, and beach toys (floats, kayaks, etc). We left the property to enjoy many activities. We had a great time hiking at El Yunque National Forest, took a beach/snorkeling trip with East Wind Catamaran Company, and toured Old San Juan (it is a $25 cab ride each way). You can walk to other hotels and restaurants in the Isla Verde area from the Ritz. The El San Juan Hotel has a great evening atmosphere with live music and bar in the lobby, good restaurants, lively casino, and a hip pool area. There is very casual, but authentic Puerto Rican and Cuban dining at "Metropol" across the street from the Ritz. There are a few other very casual dining options, but the nice restaurants are all located in the hotels along Isla Verde (the El San Juan, the Intercontinental, and the Water Beach Club). These hotel restaurants are steak and Italian. Nice seafood restaurants are located in Condado, which is a $15 cab ride from the Ritz. There is also a bike shop "Hot Dog Cycling" down the street if you want to join a group ride. ***Please note that there is currently construction at this property, as they are building balconies on the rooms around the pool. They did not work on the weekends, but they resumed construction on Monday and Tuesday. Hammering, banging, and drilling into concrete was audible and visible in the pool area. The construction is disclosed on the property's website and did not affect our enjoyment.***

Reviews.Title: “My Last Trip”
Reviews.Author: bb-starr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ritz Carlton was nice. The rooms were nice and comfortable and the staff was pleasant. Staying at a 5-star resort we expected that it would be expensive especially for mini-bar items ($5 for a Diet Coke, etc.) and the restaurant food ($20++ for continental breakfast). But the one think that we got upset about was the extra charges for bellman ($16) and maid($2/day) gratuities. We have no problem with these charges per se but the reception did not tell us upon checkin of these fees and as a result we paid double (i.e. we also gave them cash unknowingly). This is similar to the airlines now charging for checked bags and snacks. But you feel that a posh resort like this would not have to nickel and dime their guests... some paying $400 or more per day. BTW: there are Wallgreens and Dennys about 300 yards from the hotel. You can get a 12 pack of Diet Coke for $3.99. Also there is another breakfast place called Piu Bello a few yards further where you can get a full breakfast for $7. At least there are reasonable alternatives within easy walking distance from the hotel. But we were not impressed with Puerto Rico in general and probably will not return.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, but far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: dcm58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ritz recently for a work retreat. I think that may have affected a few things that happened while we were there. this review may sound like I am complaining, but I just want everyone to know what to expect. It is a standard ritz property. It is nice, but nothing spectacular. So, if you stay (and I am sure you will enjoy your stay if you choose this hotel), just know what to expect. I arrived very late due to a four hour plane delay, and was given a room on the first floor. I asked for a different room, but was told that every single room was booked. I persisted a bit more, noting that I am a preferred member and stay at the atlanta property several times a year on business. no dice. I would normally be unable to complain too much about this - I mean, I booked a standard room and received a standard room, right? well, that is true except the person behind me then checked in and received a standard room on the 10th floor! umm? When I said something, the receptionist informed me that the person behind me paid a higher rate for his standard room. So I am being punished because my work negotiated a special rate for the 150+ rooms it booked for the entire weekend? not good. Regardless, the room was nice. It was a standard Ritz room. Very nice king bed, nice large flat screen television, nice bathroom. Nothing surprising, it looked like any other ritz. I was a bit surprised - I thought it might have some special resort like touches or amenities? nope. it wasn't even outfitted like a beach hotel - there wasn't even a clothesline to hang wet swimsuits on! we were forced to throw them over the shower curtain (ick). The property is very beautiful. Contrary to other reviews, I always saw beach chairs available by the pool, regardless of the time of day. Additionally, there are chairs available on the beach. My complaint with respect to that is that they only had one beach guy on Saturday (!) and it took twenty minutes to get two beach chairs set up. My husband got frustrated and tried to set them up, but no dice. the chairs are chained together so you can't have self service. The beach was nice and the water was nice and not rocky. We enjoyed it. I wouldn't recommend ordering food and drinks at the beach. we ordered lunch and drinks and they didn't even bring a little side table! we just came back from swimming and our drinks were sitting in the sand! we had room service and beach side service. yes, the food is expensive - this is the ritz. my husband claims the burgers were AWESOME, though and never complained about the price tag. my food was good, too. nothing fabulous, but very good food. the property is far away from anything but a few other beach hotels. it is indeed about 50 USD roundtrip into old san juan. I didn't like this too much. The casino is pretty small. I don't gamble, but plenty in our group did. They all said it was small, but the workers were friendly and they had a good time. there is definitely some miscommunication on the activities among the staff. I called the front desk at 6am to try to book the snorkeling trip I learned some friends were on for that day. I knew it left at 8.30 and wanted to see if there were spots avialable. every time I called, I would be told the activity desk opened a half-hour later. at 6, it opened at 6.30. at 7, it opened at 7.30. at 7.30, it opened at 8! I refused to hang up at 7.30 and demanded that someone help me. finally, fifteen minutes later, I was called by the concierge and informed that I had tickets to snorkeling. he said he had been there since 7am and could have helped me. this kind of miscommuniation is inexcusable at a property like this! Lastly, our plane was due to leave at 4pm the day we checked out. We called to get late check out - even asked to pay for late check out - and were rudely informed that our rate was already super cheap and late checkout wasn't avaialble to us. WHAT? Once again, I complained quite a bit and was able to get late check out (2pm) for an additional 100 USD. With the money my work spent on alcohol alone at this place (!) I think they made enough money off of us to not be so rude.
