It is also an easy cabride into Old San Juan for dinner or sightseeing (20 minutes)...dont miss the forts! The fact that this hotel is so close to the airport is a plus as far as I am concerned. You cannot hear the planes from inside the hotel at all and on the beach once in awhile you hear a plane but not often--there is such a breeze and the waves are so high that it drowns it out. But being able to get to the hotel in 5 minutes and a 13$ cab ride is great! Especially when you are trying to get to the airport the day of departure...you dont have to leave an hour before, you know. My only complaint is with the housekeeping service. Sometimes it was great and sometimes terrible, and I just expect more from a Ritz Carlton. One day they just skipped our room altogether even though we had not been in the room all day--we called and they still didnt come for a long time. The turndown service was also very inconsistent in terms of time and what they would actually do. We had to call another night because they skipped turndown and we needed towels and it still took them a half hour to get towels to us. There is no button on the phone for housekeeping which struck me as strange--you have to go through guest services so I dont know if the chain of communication is very good. Anyway, this is the only area I think they need to work on. So, if you want a peaceful, easy vacation that has an island feel but is easy to get to and you dont need a passport or foreign money...this is a great option!! Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relazing trips yet. . . .”
Reviews.Author: Daisybeee
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a long weekend getaway to the Ritz and I have to say it was one of the most relaxing trips that I have ever been on. . . The staff was more than accomodating and was willing and ready to wait on you hand and foot. The restaurants in the hotel were both above average and bordered on perfection. I am already looking into booking a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyWife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for two nights before going on to St Barts. Our impression of the hotel, generally, is that it is quite nice, and up to the "Ritz" standard. We were left somewhat disappointed with our room. We requested, and received, a room on the club level with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The rate was $1900/nt. The problems were as follows: 1) The size of the room was no larger than a standard room. We knew in advance what the rate was, so there is no complaint there. We just thought that for this rate we should have a more substantial amount of space; 2) Our room was infested with ants. Don't ask me why this is not our number one complaint. Nonetheless, it was frustrating. We contacted the hotel who replied, (not joking) "What would you like us to do?" We asked them to send up an exterminator. They did, however, the ants returned in force; 3) The Ritz charged us a 10% per day resort fee. This meant an additional $190/nt to use the hotel's facilities. This really irked me for some reason. I would rather they simply raised the room rate by an equal amount. Does a family of four staying in a $400/nt room really use 1/5 the facilities that my wife and I used during our two night stay? This just felt like it was unnecessary gouging. I did not complain about this charge, so I do not know what the management's position is on the matter. Now for the really good. Eveybody at this property went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They are truly warm friendly people who took every opportunity to try to please us. We really appreciated their hospitality. The pool area was clean and a great place to fall asleep while my wife was out spending money ( er, sightseeing, I mean). Since we travel through Puerto Rico frequently to get to St Barts, we will be staying here again. We will pay the outrageous 10% resort fee, and we will sleep in a room way too small for $1900/nt. We will even try to beat back the ants - though we wish we didn't have too.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Vacation - Can't wait to go back in February!!”
Reviews.Author: lmom4204
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ritz last year over Mother's Day weekend and had an amazing vacation. I was pregnant at the time and we had our 3 yr. old daughter with us, so needless to say things could have easily gone awry. But, in fact we had an incredible time. The staff went out of their way for us constantly. In particular they were so accomadating and friendly to my daughter that it really enhanced our experience. She still constantly talks about "Gabby", our breakfast waiter in the main restaurant. Which brings me to the subject of food.....we loved all the Restaurants. I have been to Il Mulino in Manhattan several times and I was very impressed by the one at the Ritz. We had the Mother's Day tasting menu; I don't think I've ever eaten so much in my life. The BLT restaurant was also exceptional (the braised shortribs in particular). The rooms were lovely and housekeeping was very attentive. The pool staff was eager to help and the beach was relaxing and very clean. i don't know how people complain about this hotel. We take vacations 2-3 times a year and have been all over the caribbean and this was by far our favorite vacation. My daughter said she loved it even more than Disney World and that certainly speaks volumes. As a matter of fact we just booked a room for this coming February and we're bringing our new baby with us b/c I know I can expect another fantastic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Juan Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: bizperstraveler
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Ritz for 5 nights for a worldwide sales conference and I loved it. The staff was super friendly, the service was amazing and the accomodations were stellar. I did end up with a room that had a great view of a ROOF but other than that everything was great. I would stay there again in a hearbeat and recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: parisbound
Reviews.Content: You can see from the pictures how beautiful the hotel is, so I'll talk about the service. It was OUTSTANDING across the board. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and all staff members courteously spoke to us every time one of them passed us. For example: 1. I cut myself with a razor and my husband called the front desk. They sent someone up with bandaids immediately. 2. Upon arrival in our room, I called and requested foam pillows and they came with them quickly. Then, the front desk called to make sure that we had received them and that they were satisfactory. 3. A staff member saw my husband getting on the elevator and rushed onto the elevator to ask my husband which floor and push the buttons for him. 4. At the pool, we asked a staff member to take a photo of us in the pool. Then when he had, I went to get it back with a slightly wet hand and he said, Oh no, please, let me take it back to your chair. He wrapped in a fresh towel and took it to our chair. Our stay was very romantic and we had a great time. I highly recommend lunch at the cafe by the pool. The waiters were a great time - they made some mean drinks and the food was also great! We ate at Il Mulino for dinner and that was quite an experience too. Again, the service was spectacular. The food was good - not my favorite meal ever, but good.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: VAtravels45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz San Juan, December 12-16th 2007 and would not recommend it to friends and family. My room was very small overlooking the parking lot and there were problems with the ventilation and water pressure in the shower. At times, the staff seemed surly with simple requests. For example, the waitress began yelling when Nutella was requested for croissants at the $17.50 continental breakfast. Also, a beach attendant handed me two towels my first day at the beach but when I saw there were no free chairs available he said, "you didn't ask for a chair." It seemed like odd behavior for a hotel that prides itself on customer service. After my unsuccessful continental breakfast I ate at the Starbucks located within the El San Juan hotel and casino. The staff was super friendly at both the El San Juan and Hotel Intercontinental. If you have the choice, I would seriously consider those two hotels before staying at the Ritz again.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton San Juan Nice hotel some misses with service”
Reviews.Author: dolcevitatravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Spent 1/2 to 1/6 with my wife and 2 kids at the Ritz Carlton San Juan. I'm going to break it down in three sections,Good,Bad and Overall. Good: Very nice hotel, nice rooms (get a balcony not many on property), small but nice casino and great restaurants. Il Mulino (NY) Italian great ate there twice. BLT Steak (NY) great steak and tuna tartare and finally the Thursday night seafood buffet Ritz Carlton Style fantastic. The pool area was very nice,watch out for the 3 huge iguanas that live in the brush near the pool. They don't bother you and they rarley come out plus the kids got a kick out of them. Bad: Housekeeping,left my door open after turn down on the first night. Never cleaned my room on the 2nd night, just forgot to due it. I spoke to the front desk they assured me it wouldn't happen again and asked me when I wanted the room cleaned and turned down they never ever got it right. Not Ritz Carlton Service. Pool service (food and drink) never around yet better on the beach. My son left his new ipod 8gig xmas present on the loung chair one day. we went back down to get it,it was gone. I asked the pool guys they said they hadn't seen it and lost and found had nothing. That was a quick snatch job by someone. Overall: It's the only place to stay in San Juan. It's by far is the best hotel there but lacks that extra Ritz Carlton service.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time, despite the weather”
Reviews.Author: hhenkind
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a one-week stay to the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. We traveled with three children (twins who are 2 and daughter who is 4 1/2). Contrary to some other reviews I read, the beach was VERY nice. Soft sand and clean water. There were one or two days where seaweed washed on the beach. I was surprised the staff didn't clean it up, but it didn't really affect our beach experience. The pool was HUGE, but we only dipped our feet in it because it wasn't heated (or if it was, it was freezing). There were WAY too many pool chairs around so it was almost impossible to get from Point A to Point B. We traveled on a non-vacation week, so maybe there is a need for a lot of chairs during peak travel time, but in off peak, it was too crowded at the pool area with chairs. Unfortunately, it was VERY windy while we were there and in fact, there was a tropical storm one day. One thing I was disappointed with was that there were no shelter areas on the beach or pool. If you were on the beach with your kids and it started to pour (which it did a few times while we were there), you had to grab your kids, your bags and run off the beach, through the ridiculously crowded maze of pool chairs and into the hotel. It's pretty far, especially with kids, to get inside the hotel for shelter. And who wants to stand dripping wet in the fancy hotel lobby? Thus, it would have been nice to have small shelters to stand under during the rainy periods. On the one day it rained, there were NO activities for kids, other than the KIdz Club. But Kidz Club is for kids 5 and up, so I couldn't really bring my twins in there, although I did for a bit just because there was nothing to do with them. I sent them in with my babysitter (who I brought from home) but was still charged for babysitting time. Kind of weird. My daughter loved the kids club, but she was the only one who attended and she sat inside the whole morning doing arts and crafts. That was fine because she loves that kind of stuff, but I was surprised they kept the kids inside so much when it was sunny out. It's possible they stayed inside because that's what my daughter wanted to do. Not sure. Other than the kids club, there are really no activities for kids. No arcades, no water slides, etc... Because the weather wasn't great and the pool was so cold, we actually put the kids in the outdoor hot tub a few times (although probably not the best thing for little kids). The kids actually enjoyed it because it wasn't too hot. The accomodations (rooms) were really very nice. We had adjoining rooms overlooking the pool and ocean. The room was clean and spacious. Large bathrooms. I would have liked a bit more drawer space, though, since I had tons of clothes for the kids. The restaurants were very good too. We loved BLT Steak (went there 3 times!). Il Mulino was a mixed bag. Great appetizers,but I didn't like my entree at all (some chicken dish recommended by the waiter). My kids had no problems finding food to eat. The buffet at breakfast had lots of things they enjoyed and we ate at the same place for dinner most nights. One night we went to the El San Juan (down the street) for hibachi. The biggest problem we had was with the management. Everyone was VERY friendly, but just not at all knowledgeable. When I checked in, I asked about signing up for the kids club. The front desk didn't know anything about the club. She didn't know when it started, how to sign up, the cost etc... No one answered the phone at the kids club either, despite the fact that it was the middle of the day. A package was inadvertently sent to our room and it took two full days for someone to pick it up. We needed milk for the kids before going to bed and they charged $5 per glass. The gym was very nice. They had exercise equipment and different classes. The spa seemed nice, but I had a stone massage for $220 and it was not very good at all. I've had hot stone massages elsewhere and this just didn't compare in the slightest, especially for the hefty price tag. I know some reviewers complained about the airport being so close. That didn't bother us at all (of course, our room didn't overlook the airport!) You could somewhat hear the plane noise on the beach, but the ocean wave sound really drowned out the plane sounds. So that wasn't an issue at all for us. We rented a car from Enterprise in the hotel one day and that worked out really well. The rain kind of put a damper on part of the vacation. The day of the tropical storm, there was NOTHING to do, except go to the casino (which we couldn't do with the kids, obviously). I tried to go to the gym, but had to walk outside to get to it, which was not fun in the torrential rain. All in all, we had a nice time, but I think next time we'd go for a hotel that was a little more kid friendly and that had a heated pool. I think a lot of our disappointment was more with the weather than with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience to date”
Reviews.Author: kimspokane
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ritz five days prior to christmas in a concierge pool view room. Our stay at the Ritz made our subsequent christmas cruise all the more underwhelming. The most impressive part of our stay was the genuine helpful attitude of the staff. Every single staff member that we encountered during our stay made a point of saying good morning and greeting us, often by name. Our two teen daughters were attached to us for the first couple of days. One of the managers, Ramon, took us and our family on a personal tour of areas of the hotel that may be of some interest for our children to hang out. Anticipating the fact that families were traveling together for christmas they set up two large rooms for the kids and teens. One showing christmas movies with bean bag chairs, big screen tv, pop, chips, popcorn machine and an adjoing room set up with play stations, wi games, xbox all with big screen tv's. They had these rooms staffed and the staff gave the kids 1:1 time showing them how to play the games and actually playing with them. LaLa was incredible. She was able to engage our teens and even asked if we wanted her to keep them occupied for a certain amount of time so the adults could have some kid free time. This program was a no cost extra and not part of the kids program. Just one example of how the hotel went to extra lengths to ensure family holiday stays were enjoyable for kids, teens and adults and another example of how the Ritz goes a step beyond. The food was incredible and we are very picky about good food. The food and service in the concierge lounge was a perfect 10. In the afternoons the pool staff delivered complimentary fruit smoothies while we layed in the sun. Food and drinks are expensive but on par with any 4 and five star resort. The grounds are very beautiful. The beach was cleaned daily and there was pleanty of space for chairs, umbrellas, shade or sun. Plane noise was only noticed one afternoon for about 5 min at 2pm on the beach. Must have been a bunch of planes landing or taking off. You can't see them as their path must be away from the Ritz. I walked to the Marriott a ways down the beach one day just to check it out. The plane noise was very noticeable there. The ocean is not the blue blue that you see at the Ritz in St. Thomas or eagle beach in Aruba but it was just right for us and there were pleanty of people swimming. Surf lessons are offered just to the right of the ritz on the beach where the waves have a bigger break. Nightly music was offered in the lobby. Some excellent local music. The spa was not crowded and spa staff very helpful. A couple more examples of service; Our kids wanted to watch a dvd movie in the room. They could not figure out how to get the dvd player to work. My husband called for assistance. I walked into the room and thought there had been some sort of incident. Two uniformed men were in the room to show the kids and my husband how to work the dvd player. The following day one of them called us to see if we were having any further problems or needed any additional help. My daughter was horsing around in the pool and her face met the bottom of the pool causing some scrapes to her nose, forehead and lip. She was embarrassed and immediately wanted to go back to her room. A janitor saw us enter the room with her crying. He was concerned and called for help. Staff responded and two first aid people came up to fix her up and see if I wanted a doctor. Her injuries were to her ego more than face. The staff repeatedly asked me if there was anything they could do to help her feel better, ice cream... and they were genuine. She was embarrassed about being in public and so we ate dinner in the concierge lounge. Wanda went to her mother's house the next day and brought in a large fresh stalk of Aloe Vera plant. She even cut up individual peices and put in a baggie on ice for individual application. This really helped the scrapes heal fast. Even the janitor in the hall asked me how my daughter was doing. My husband usually gets a little stir crazy staying at a resort but he had an excellent relaxing time as well and we did not look forward to leaving for our cruise. The casino offers poker with a $100 buy in no limit bets. He had a lot of fun playing with the locals who were very friendly. We did not leave the resort prior to the cruise. Post cruise we stayed in old san juan which was a lot of fun. We wish we would have seen more of Puerto Rico but now have more exploring to do upon our return. Other guests during our stay were vacationing with family and extended family. It it seemed to me to be a holiday destination vacation for the majority of guests. A good majority of the children were accompanied by a nanny, or more than one attentive nannie and so unruly kids were not running around. The cost of the rooms was much higher due to christmas vacation but I feel that despite the much higher cost, the Ritz was by far the best money and value for our vacation dollar because they delivered exactly the kind of vacation we were looking for. We spent far more on the christmas cruise than we did on the concierge room stay at the Ritz and in retrospect wish we had never left the Ritz. We will definately return to Puerto Rico and stay at the Ritz. When on vacation we typically spend the extra to stay at a four or five star resort. We also typically book a suite. We opted for the concierge level room vs. a suite for this stay. I think the suites ran around 6k per night for holiday stay. Despite the fact that we did not have a balcony or suite we still had the most enjoyable tropical stay that we have had at any resort. This was due to the service. I think when we return we will stay off season when we can afford a suite. The Ritz in St. Thomas and Maui are also great. The service at the San Juan Ritz is what sets this resort apart. My daughter's face and ego have recovered. We returned home last night. We were excited to get home to our own house and beds after 24 hours in flights and airport time. The min. we walked outside the airport to 16 degree temps and snow we all quickly agreed that we wished we were still in Puerto Rico and the Ritz. In fact I'm writing this review in part as task avoidance for the 9 bags of luggage and laundry that is awaiting me in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: spn2200
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan and had a great time. The hotel is well kept and has excellent service. We arrived around 10:00 am and went to check-in to the hotel. The room was not ready but the staff offered to call our cell phone once the room was available. Following the check-in we proceeded to utilize the property amenities until the room was ready. We were able to get into the room around 3:00 pm. To our surprise, we were upgraded to a very nice garden suite, which was valued at $1500 plus the 10% resort fee. The room we booked was an ocean view room for $409 per night plus the resort fee. The garden suite was on the first floor and had a living room, dining room, kitchenette, guest bathroom, master bathroom and master bedroom. In addition there was a private terrace and pool access directly from the room. All this space totaled 1200 square feet. The bed was very comfortable and had frette linens with a goose down mattress cover and blanket. The bathrooms had Bulgari toiletries. I only have one negative comment: the dinning room window was very very dirty and should be cleaned promptly. If I were paying full price for the room, I would be extremely disappointed at that. The pool was very nice and had excellent service. The attendees offered to set up your lounge chair each morning and also provided food and drink service from the Ocean Grill. In addition, there was complimentary water, coffee (in the morning), cold towels and smoothie samples provided throughout the day. I was a little disappointed with the beach, which is mostly due to Mother Nature rather than the hotel. There was seaweed on the shore and the water was not bright blue like some of the other Caribbean islands. Nonetheless, the hotel still offered beachside service, chairs and water sports. The hotel has a number of dining options for dinner: Il Mulinos, BLT Steak and Mares. We only ate at the first two restaurants. Il Mulinos is a nice, expensive Italian restaurant. While the restaurant received high ratings, we found the food to be standard Italian fare at inflated prices. Ravioli was $40 a plate and was nothing special. You should only eat at Il Mulinos if you have exhausted the other options provided by the hotel and IslaVerde/San Juan. BLT Steak, on the other hand, was excellent. I ordered the American Wagyu steak, which was amazing. It was perfectly cooked and was very tender. Prior to the main course, an excellent puffy cheese popover was offered with butter and sea salt. For the dessert, we had a crepe soufflÃ© which I would highly recommend. Overall, I would rate this hotel very highly. The staff went out of their way to make our stay special. This is made possible by the fact that the hotel is very well staffed, allowing them to take care of your requests without taking away from the experience of others.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: Manhattanites
Reviews.Content: Our family had a delightful stay at the Ritz over the Christmas holiday. We traveled with an infant and I would like to say that the amenities for a small child were excellent. We worked with the guest services manager via email prior to our stay to ensure we had a crib in the room, and it was ready for us at arrival and was in perfect condition with bedding and bumpers (although we brought our own). And you can't beat the poolside pack and plays! Great touch. The hotel overall was the perfect choice for us - just five minutes from the airport (huge plus when traveling with a baby) - with an amazing pool and easy access to a well-kept beach. There are babysitting services as well although we didn't use them. Hotel is in walking distance to a Walgreens and other stores if you need snacks, prescriptions, baby supplies or food, sunscreen, etc. The food at the resort is very good, and we are picky picky eaters! Due to the operating hours, we ate at Mares, lobby lounge and the Ocean Bar only; all were great. Room service though was our favorite - loved the seafood pasta and banana trifle so much we ordered it for three nights! Overall, service was outstanding, and we really appreciated the warm smiles and helpful attitudes even on Christmas Day when I'm sure the staff would have preferred not to be working. We have stayed at several Ritz properties over the years and this property certainly lives up to the reputation. My only suggestions (very minor) would be to put in a railing on the stepped entrance to the beach (a little slippery, especially when carrying baby), offering more local spices/coffee/arts&crafts for sale in the gift shop, and expanding the hours of BLT and Il Mulino (starting dinner times of 6 pm were too hard with the baby - would have loved a 5 pm dinner or a more casual lunch option so we could try those places). We would definitely recommend this hotel for a quick stay in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the reputation”
Reviews.Author: travelproEssex
Reviews.Content: Like many hotels in the Caribbean this is aimed at the US market both corporate and personal and although we are from the UK we have travelled extensively in the States, Caribbean, Europe and the Middle East. The booking was made by our good friends who live in Florida and who were travelling with us, having experienced an excellent 7 day cruise with Royal Caribbean on Serenade of the Seas. We wanted to stay for 4 days ashore before flying back to the UK and as the cruise ended in San Juan our pals booked the Ritz Carlton assuring us that we would be mightily impressed with the service and facilities, but that did not quite work out. The room and the room service was fine - we particularly liked the tea and coffee box in the room which allowed us to please ourselves when and how we started and finished a day. The rooms (and even the building) seemed dated although this did not affect the stay and of course there is only so much you can do to modernise a hotel before you have to start again! The pool was fine however unless it was toward the end of the day when most people had left we had to chase waiters to get a poolside drink as they only made very rare trips poolside and usually only if someone (often me) had walked to the pool bar/restaurant to order drinks in the first place. This seemd odd as there were plenty of staff in, around and by the bar chatting and joking while a handful of guests had chosen to eat/drink there. Beach was fine but I don't like the concept of various surfboards/rafts/dinghys etc being included in our 'resort fee' when we did not want to use them. The restaurants were all good although the Steak restaurant by the casino was very confused. We were shown to our table and my wife requested a cushion as she is only 5 ft tall and her seat was too low to be comfortable when eating. The head waiter said that they had none and he was sorry so I suggested one be obtained from the nearby lobby/lounge but I was ignored. So i fetched one myself and explained that it really did not take much and I was surprised that no-one was prepared to do this for me. Shoulders were shrugged and it seemed that I had asked for the impossible. By this time our table had been descended upon by what seemed like a dozen people to bring us water, bread, canapes, menus, wine lists, specials, olive oil & balsamic vinegar and so on. By this time we had to remove the table decorations to get it all on the table - no, seriously! When the food was served the portions were simply immense and one meal could have fed us all. I am used to large portions in the States and her islands but this was ridiculous and I felt embarrased at the waste. The cost was $600 for the 4 of us and we had just a starter and main - no dessert. The wine we ordered was not expensive and by experience we all thought that it was unduly expensive and could have cost much less with reduced portions. The other 2 restaurants were far more sensible and overall we enjoyed the experience very much. In my opinion the hotel could do with another bar where there is more seating and perhaps a pianist as the lobby bar is a little impersonal and usually full of conference delegates. The bill for 4 days was over $3,200 and we ate in Old San Juan one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lovely lovely”
Reviews.Author: heroek
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky traveler and a neat freak. I have also stayed in a few nice hotels so feel I am discriminating. The Ritz in San Juan was just lovely. The service was impeccible, from the moment we stepped onto the property. They offered us ice cold bottles of water at reception and were eager to make us comfortable. The room was very spacious and tidy with flat screen TV. Food excellent all around - we dined at the poolside restaurant and BLT SteakHouse. Of course it wasn't perfect but relatively speaking, the ratio of perfect to not perfect was insignificant (room 432 has tub stopper issues and bed is just slighty lumpy if still comfortable). Yes, the drinks and food are expensive but the quality is outstanding. Go to Denny's down the street if you want it on the cheap. The concierge at the Ritz is happy, happy to recommend other, less pricely restaurants and they have a huge book of menus at the desk for restaurants around the city. But the BLT Steakhouse was phenomental and if you think about what you spend on cab fare it isn't that much (I had a Kobe beef cheeseburger for $22 that included pre-dinner bread and rosemary infused french fries). Our room looked out over the pool and we could hear the Coqui frogs (I say they were piped in, hubbie says it was real). The pool is great and you can walk out straight to the beach. Perfect caribbean exprierience. Given that Embassy Suites, Marriott, Hilton, Intercontinental are charging as much as the Ritz, this is a great deal. If you have any problems at the hotel, the RItz, I am sure would be ready to fix them. Oh, and this is super convienent. FIve minutes from airport (no, I couldn't hear the planes in my room) and cabs are at the ready for a 10 min ride to old San Juan or cruise ship piers. Kodos to the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, personalized service is this hotel's best asset.”
Reviews.Author: suzieboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for four days prior to a cruise, followed by another two days, as part of our honeymoon. Prior to the cruise, we stayed in a club level room. After that, we stayed in a regular room, so we were able to compare those experiences. Check-in. For our first check-in, we were greeted with congratulations and glasses of champagne, a very nice touch (we also came back to a bottle of champagne in the room that night). During both check-ins, we were first greeted by a bellhop who took our luggage, welcomed us warmly, and offered us bottled water. Check-in itself was easy both times. We noticed during each check-in that there were people complaining that they could not check in as early as 12:30 or 1PM. The hotel's official check-in time is 4PM, and they do try to allow early check-in when possible. I was impressed that the front desk staff handled these demanding guests professionally. Rooms: Our club level and regular rooms were identical (you don't get a better room by going with the club level). The size and decor are nothing spectacular, and not unlike those I've seen in some nice 3-star hotels (except for the Frette linens). They were clean. There was a bit of a musty odor, which is not surprising for the humid environment. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and made up nicely. Housekeeping comes twice a day (in the evening this included turn-down, replenishing towels and straightening up the room). The TV is a flat screen. There were, robes, plenty of Bulgari toiletries, and a good hair dryer in the bathroom. Service: The service throughout the hotel was fantastic. The rooms at this hotel aren't all that special, but the service is 5-star. You will often be greeted by name. All of our requests were taken care of. Room service was on time and exactly as ordered. The coffee is great. I like that each "department" in this hotel asks what other kinds of services you need. For example, when you call room service at night for coffee the next day, they ask if you need a wake-up call. If you set up a wake-up call, they ask if you want room service for breakfast. Club Level: Club level cost about $200 extra per night during our trip. Because room service, hotel food, and drinks are quite costly, $200 for us to have access to the club lounge was well worth it. Brandon, the concierge, was absolutely incredible, as were Wanda and the rest of the club level staff. He took great care of us, and the personalized service was really nice. It's good to have a place right on the same floor as your room to get good coffee, read the paper, check email, and, of course, drink and snack at five daily food presentations. We met a lot of great people in the club lounge, too. The Beach and Pool: Well-manicured. The pool was clean. There were enough chairs and umbrellas to go around, and the staff take care of setting you up with chairs and towels. The beach was average--not perfectly white sand and clear water, but nice. They also have hammocks. We took a Hobie Cat ride (included in the resort fee) with their captain, and that was a lot of fun. They have bartenders that come around to get drink orders, plus staff that offer cold towels and small cups of lemon ice when it's hot out. I found the experience of hanging out by the pool and beach very relaxing and stress-free. The Spa: We did not get any treatments, but did use the indoor whirlpool and sauna, which were great. Other reviewers mentioned staff coming in and out of the area. We only saw one staffer come in to make sure we had what we needed and throw water on the coals. The locker-rooms are very clean, well-stocked with towels and toiletries, and the attendant is nice. The Gym: Small, crowded before dinnertime, but fine. The lobby: Fairly small and understated compared with the Vegas-style El San Juan nearby, but hopping on weekends with Latin music and dancing. Attentive bartenders. Drinks are steep--$14-$16 for mojitos. Casino: Typical of San Juan. Fairly small. Plenty of low-stakes machines and tables for gambling wimps like me. BLT Steak: Excellent food and service. The best bartenders anywhere. Check-out: Very easy. A note on the crazy mini-bar lady: A prior reviewer's comment that the mini-bar lady is obnoxious did ring true! She barged in immediately after knocking, and did this to another guest that we met. She did this to me after I told her less than an hour earlier that we did not need her services. Ask for a Do Not Disturb sign upon check-in. The staff will honor this the entire time and no one will knock; this is the best defense! (In case hotel staff read this, we actually met two mini-bar people. Only one was actually intrusive.) Other reviewers have commented that this property does not live up to the Ritz name. In terms of service, staff got it right and went above and beyond to make us happy. I can see how some might not feel the rooms are posh enough, but then the price for standard rooms ($239) was actually very reasonable. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were hoping for”
Reviews.Author: jroman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night getaway at the Ritz San Juan. The entire experience, from the staff to the free-flowing champagne in the Club Lounge made our trip memorable and incredibly relaxing. The entire staff was simply wonderful - accomodating, friendly and very professional. I decided to indulge in a hour long massage (with Freddie) and though it was incredibly expensive, it was worth every penny. I have had many massages over the years...but Freddie really did an outstanding job. If you do decide stay at the Ritz, we suggest staying on the Concierge level. The quality and accessibility of food and beverages is amazing. The experience is perfect if you are looking for an easy (and delicious) vacation. My husband and I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and we think the Ritz really knows how to make an impression. It's all in the friendly service and fine details. Our only suggestion would be to have a few more staff on the beach to take drink/food requests.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, good amenities, but average-quality facility”
Reviews.Author: Pal1
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ritz-Carlton San Juan because it wasn't much more expensive than other nice hotels in the area. I thought I was getting a bargain, but as it turned out, it wasn't the "ritzy" experience that I expected (which probably explains the price). The service was outstanding; however, the room itself was average. There were dirty glasses in the room when we checked in, the door was very difficult to shut (the door trim was misaligned), the bathroom lighting was very dim, the water pressure in the shower was very weak, and the beds were soft and lumpy. Room service was offered 24 hours a day - but the selection was very limited. We stayed for 3 nights, and had housekeeping service on the second day. We had used one of the glasses for coffee, and noticed that they simply rinsed it and put it back in its original place, rather than replacing the glass! The safe was an odd shape - tall but not very deep. It reminded me of a bathroom medicine cabinet without shelves. So, we had to stack things carefully and close the door quickly, before everything toppled out of it. On a more positive note, the complimentary bottled water was a nice touch - very convenient. And the restaurants were pretty good. As a side note, I assumed that there wouldn't be many small children staying at the Ritz, but I was mistaken. Overall, we had a nice stay, but we've stayed in far more luxurious hotels for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “Hoping to return!”
Reviews.Author: laislapr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here for four nights (Nov 28-Dec 2), We must say the service was outstanding. Everyone here always had a smile and were willing to help in everyway, I'm sure Puertorrican hotel staffs are among the friendliest on the hotel industry worldwide. Check in experience was OK (we had to wait a while, and after flying for the whole day and arriving at 11pm, that was a little up setting, the room type we asked for was not available, but we were so tired that did not complain. Our room was nice, impecable, very comfortable and quiet, we never heard our neighboors or people walking around and we know our floor was full. We ordered room service and it was prompt and very good. Food at the restaurants and activities we were, was delicious. We spent our nights at the lobby lounge were there was music and a live show. The beach is beautiful and the pool was nice. The hotel is not close to the Old San Juan, but is a $10 taxi ride, which was reasonable. Safety at this hotel was impressive, there was one morning when my husband left early and accidentaly let the room door a little bit open, then probably five minutes later security personnel knocked on the door and told me it was not completely closed, what a way to take care of guests, Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip of My Life”
Reviews.Author: ashaw
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ritz pre-cruise 10/25-10/28. Please forgive my delay in posting but upon returning home on 11/04, I caught a bad cold. My stay was absolutely fantastic. I wrote the GM 'before' I left to advise it was the best trip of my life - and I travel personally at least 4 times a year. All staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly. They were informative about the hotel, the city and the Island. This trip was a graduation present to myself for 2 MBA's. Staff at the Ritz pampered me - correction - they made me feel like a queen. I felt as if it was my home away from home and I was sad to leave. Never have I been on a vacation and been 'sad' to leave. Kudos to 'all' staff and I do mean 'all'. Of special note are staff I consider my friends - Ramon, Frances, Ivan, Roberto, Rafael, Hosea, Isis and Benjamin. I cannot wait to return. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous and I have posted some (of the 200) pics alone I took inside and outside of the hotel. Note - these pics are dated correctly but the time is off. I was upgraded to Concierge level - if there is anyway you can afford it, I highly recommend this floor and level of service. It has five food presentations a day, drinks, computer with Internet access and a breathtaking view of the pool and ocean as you relax on its balcony. Although I don't drink, one of my newfound friends made me several rum punches without the rum daily. He not only gave me the recipe, but took it one step further and allowed me to watch him make me one so that I'd be sure to know how to do it. You also must eat at BLT. You also must eat at BLT. You also must eat at BLT. Excuse me, have I said you must eat at BLT. Your stay at the Ritz will not be complete unless you eat at BLT. I had the bacon appetizer, ribeye and potatoes augratin. I tasted the crabcakes, braised short ribs and grilled asparagus. Everything was the best and this coming from someone who has eaten at more than half of the top 10 steakhouses of America on both polls. Chicago is known for its steakhouses, we had Magnum's and continue to have Gene & Georgetti's, the Chicago Chop House, etc., Morton's, Lawry's, Ruth Chris, Keefers, etc. Yet I still say, you 'must' eat at BLT. During my stay, I went on tours daily arranged by the Ritz via Castillo Tours. I loved that all three days I had the same driver, Tony. He was absolutely wonderful, 'extremely' informative and has a great sense of humor. By the end of the third day as we said goodbye (he dropped me off at the cruise terminal), I'd found another friend. Tony subs with Castillo so I asked him for his email address because when I do return, I want him as my driver/guide regardless of whether he is still subbing with Castillo. I'll end as I could go on and on. Go to San Juan, stay at the Ritz (concierge level if you can) and eat at BLT!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a genuine smile!”
Reviews.Author: Feliceesq
Reviews.Content: After I booked the hotel, I noticed that they were very responsive to messages posted on this site. It was my fifth anniversary and I wrote them and asked them for ideas to make it special. They wrote back quickly and advised that they would have some surprises for me and asked if I wanted to email a note for my husband. After arrival, they delivered the most lovely assortment of tasty and decorative sweets, chocolate covered strawberries, champagne and my note to my husband that they had handwritten! What a wonderful surprise! This exemplifies the type of service offered by this hotel. We stayed on the club level, and the service was professional, yet warm. We had a wonderful (though not cheap!) meal at Il Molino. We travel a great deal, and eat at fine restaurants, and both thought this place rated highly in both food and service. My sole complaint is that it was a bit noisy since it is next to the casino. The grounds were well groomed and the staff was friendly. Housekeeping did a very good job and I have no complaints at all about the room. It was a really great little anniversary get-a-way and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josiewales
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for an annual appreciation trip provided by one of the vendors we use. The bell staff was friendly and accomodating the whole trip. Never were we ignored or treated rudely. The front desk staff was also friendly and prompt. The concierge likewise. I thought the front lobby was lovely and the lobby bar was a favorite for drinks and relaxtion. It made the trip. The bar staff was great loved Randolf and Orlando. The pool was beautiful and clean. We never had a problem with chairs or floats and the hotel was packed when we were there. The wait staff at the pool was prompt and friendly. I liked our room we had a perfect ocean view (709). But there were a few things that bothered me. Carpet needs changed or cleaned well, a stained duvet was placed on our bed and some things needed to be fixed in bathroom. Bed was so comfortable. Loved the beverage center in the room. One problem; housekeeping was very inconsistent. Never left enough towels and failed to replenish beverage center. I left them a tip every day. The spa service I had was good but the spa itself leaves nothing to be desired. I wish there were more stores on site. Mares restaurant was very good (lemon-glazed halibut), BLT excellent, Il Mulino terrible. I like good food and don't mind paying for it but Il Mulino was a terrible waste of money. People that complain about prices at the Ritz must not travel to large cities much because it is pretty standard compared to Miami, Vegas, New York etc. Drinks and food are expensive if that shocks you stay at the Holiday Inn or Embassy Suites. It's all relative to your standards. Also loved the The Palm restaurant at El San Juan. Overall a good experience (weather was horrible rained every day). If I went back to Puerto Rico I would stay at the Ritz again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatelady
Reviews.Content: As always, our stay at the Ritz-Carlton Isla Verde was just fabulous. From the nicely appointed Club Level room to the ample and continuous food selection at the Club Level dining area to the beautiful ocean views from any floor of the hotel to the courteous staff.....our stay at the Isla Verde Ritz-Carlton was outstanding. We went there to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and to relax from our stressful business life. Relax we did! Our main goal was to spend as much time as possible by the ocean and the ocean did not disappoint us. The water was calm, turquoise blue and warm. The hotel provides complimentary lounge chairs, towels and umbrellas, all you have to do is tip the person who provides them (contrary to other Ritz-Carltons where weâ€™ve had to pay plenty for the lounge chairs and umbrellas). Buying food for three daily meals at all Ritz-Carltons can get quite expensive, we solved this problem by paying a higher rate for a Club level room and this experience was well worth it. We didnâ€™t pay one cent during our 4 day stay for any of our meals which we had at the Club Level dining area. There was a great variety of foods ranging from fruits, cheeses, breads, small sandwiches, cold cuts, pates, salads, deserts, all sorts of soft drinks, teas and coffees, enough to satisfy anyoneâ€™s appetite. Do not expect a hot meal at the Club Level area. The view of the ocean from the Club Level dining area was just mesmerizing. Well aware of the high crime rate in PR we didnâ€™t leave our hotel at all and instead spent 4 blissful, peaceful days and nights at the Ritz. Once our stay was completed, we would rent a car and head inland to other locations but while at the Ritz we decided to stay put and enjoy ourselves. We highly recommend a stay at this property for anyone. We never heard one plane land or depart, no airport noise could be heard from our room.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz is service!”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I must tell you that I had stayed here previously, and thought the service was marginal at best. I am thrilled to say things have changed for the better. I had been following up on other reviews and noticed that the hotels' service manager was taking the time to e-mail back on positive and negative feedback which I found unusually refreshing. I decided to contact him prior to our stay to make sure we basically were on the same page. Ramon Ventura is the real deal. I would contact him again without question. I asked to be upgraded if possible and also explained that it was our wedding anniversary. He got us upgraded to a junior suite which isn't actually listed among their room categories, and upon arrival had a bottle of champagne and anniversary dessert for us. Serivce was impeccable everywhere. We travel twice a year to the caribbean and have a certain standard of travel and this definitely met it. To take it a step further, we had rented a car through an agency established in the hotel. We ended up getting a parking ticket in Old San Juan (be careful there were no signs stating that). We came back to the hotel with our $75 ticket and asked the concierge what to do and how to pay it, she handled it for us without any questions asked, and at the end of our trip we received a small bag of goodies from the gift shop telling us that the staff was very sorry for any inconvenience the parking ticket cost us. That small token of good will means something in times where real service is terribly lacking. You get what you pay for here. This is the Ritz not the Marriott, but it is the best hotel experience in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton San Juan Booooooooo!!!1”
Reviews.Author: cainjax1
Reviews.Content: Let Me start off by stating , my wife and myself frequent the Ritz Carlton Properties as often as we can. We had a horrible experience at the R C San Juan.. This was the second week of our Honeymoon (the first week we stayed at the R C Grand Cayman Islands which I can not brag enough about) and then we were brought to this horrible excuse for a Ritz. Lets start off by our check in that was very nice, we received 2 glasses of champagne as a initial congratulations. We then were brought to our room , which we noticed the Bathroom toilet was leaking and not flushing correctly. I called maintenance around 5 times during the first 2 days there and it was never fixed. Our first dining experience was not so good at the steak restaurant and then we were told â€œnext time you come back we will take care of youâ€�, now why would I come back after this experience? The pool was nice if you could dodge all the dirty cups that were floating around and if you wanted to physically fight with people about the limited rafts.. Oh yes and who could forget the MINI BAR Filler who would walk into our room religiously every morning even when we asked him to wait a minute â€œwere on our Honeymoonâ€�. The lobby bar was a great time we spent a lot of time there and our bartender was great. Oh and who could forget the couples massage we both got, yes thatâ€™s right the masseuses were about as talented as my bulldog with less manners, my masseuse literally sat on the table the whole time and burped not once but twice. My wifeâ€™s masseuse was equally as untalented. This was the most horrific experience we could of ever had unfortunately it had to be on our Honeymoon with a hefty Price Tag. Oh yes don not let me leave out the fact we contacted the conciergeâ€™s as well as the RC San Juan Management and nothing was done about any of these wonderful memories we have of our Honeymoon..

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a vacation”
Reviews.Author: varipaul
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute change and stayed at the Ritz Carlton for our last night in Puerto Rico. We had planned to stay at the Marriott Courtyard, just a short walk down the beach, but when we arrived at the Marriott, the pool was emptied for maintenance. We moved to the Ritz and we were able to get a room overlooking the pool at 10:30am. We thought the room was great -- very clean and comfortable, with a spacious bathroom. We could not hear the airport noise inside the room. We enjoyed the watersports that are included with the rate (we paid $259 + taxes + $25 resort fee). We used the boogie boards and went for a sail on a hobie cat (and we enjoyed talking to our captain who is finishing up his degree in architecture). There really isn't anyplace to snorkel. The pool is beautiful, although my kids were disappointed that it is only 3.5 feet deep. There was a nice hot tub overlooking the ocean. My husband enjoyed the fitness center, and the tennis courts looked like they were in good shape. I can't comment on the restaurants since I was not willing to pay the high prices (most entrees were $35 or more). We had a drink at the pool bar, very top shelf liquor, the drinks were $10 each, $7 for my kids nonalcoholic frozen lemon drink. We found the bartender, as well as all the staff at the pool and beach, to be very friendly and quick to help with whatever you needed. After spending time at Luquillo and Vieques, the beach at Isla Verde was underwhelming, but it is still a nice beach, especially for someone from the midwest. The waves were not very high, but they seemed to kick up a lot of seaweed compared to the much higher waves outside our hotel in Luquillo. But it was nice to have all the blue beach chairs and umbrellas to relax on. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to others, at least for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was great”
Reviews.Author: pnm0909
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed by attentive staff and had a nice pool view room. The pool and beach were very nice. The only concern we had was the amount of seaweed on the beach. The staff said that it was always there this time of year. I would think that a property such as the Ritz would remove this smelly distraction but since the beach is a public beach maybe they feel they dont have to. The property is great. Buffett breakfast is usual fare. The beach resturant is very nice. The two resturants on property have astronomically inflated wine list prices. The price of Opus One ($180 retail in NY) was $265 for room service $385 at Il Mulino ( the better resturant on site) and $450 at BLT(which is over rated). The best bet was the Ruffino Gold label at Il Mulino for a little over $100. I asked the wine steward why there was such a variance in price and he had no answer. Cabs to Old SAn Juan are expensive. We rented a car and it saved us money. Eat in town the resturants are great and 1/3 the price of the hotel resturants

Reviews.Title: “First vacation that we werent ready to come home from....”
Reviews.Author: News2u
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth trip to the island and we decided to throw budget to the wind and book at the Ritz and it was worth every penny spent. We had no agenda. We had done all the sights on previous trips, so our butts hunkered down for six days on the great Carolina beach and the Ritz pool. Staff was five stars all the way! We were pampered and loved every min. of it. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Resort/Tops In Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MDKHarris
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my vacation at The Ritz Carlton in San Juan and it was PHENOMENAL. The hotel room was superb, the customer service was outstanding, the food was tasty and the weather, simply gorgeous. Upon arriving, I received a warm welcome from the check in staff, along with complimentary mimosas and bottled cold water. I was able to check in 2 hrs early into my room without any delay or problem and the hotel looked as beautiful as it did when I last stayed there in 2004. The entire hotel staff [security, front desk, concierge, management] was extremely professional, helpful, curteous and friendly. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Juan, as it is tops!!! You won't be disappointed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RITZ”
Reviews.Author: NCAnnette
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the RITZ was great... We had a lovely room on the 10th floor with a city view....fresh towels twice daily... free bottled water...greeted by name by hotel staff...... Room very clean...nice sheets and pillows... I asked for foam pillows and within minutes they were delivered...Oversized chair for comfort was in the room...a wonderful view of the city of San Juan Room service was fast and great... I ordered a pizza and the cheese was too dark.... they took it back and did not charge me for the pizza... The internet was not working they sent up repair people at once and fixed it... The food at the RITZ is really good and really expensive... we ate there several times for the breakfast buffet at $25.00 per person.. and at one of the restrauants there....good choices daily... The Friday nite seafood buffet is to die for... shrimp, lobster, oysters, crab etc. on the menu as well as red meat and chicken....vegetables...fried rice and plenty of deserts... $68.00 per person...They have a really good selection.. I just don't eat all those things so I don't remember:) We ate at the Outback twice...food great and walked back to the Ritz each nite....drinks are reasonable too We took the A5 local bus into Old San Juan for 75 cents each way then got on the free trolley to see the sights of Old San Juan. Yes... it was near the airport....however we did not hear any planes and yes there was some construction..but it was on the other side of the building...so it did not bother us.. San Juan is humid and hot in September.... The only bad thing about the Ritz is the beach...it has a lot of seaweed ....but that's it... The Ritz was great.,. I would stay there again and again and again... The casino is small compared to the ones in Atlantic City....

Reviews.Title: “4 start-At best”
Reviews.Author: BK_zid_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over labor day. As others have stated, the hotel grounds are beautiful. The pool is great and the beach is fantastic. Its close the the airport, if anybody is surprised by that when they get there then they should have read the reviews more closely; it didnt bother us at all, a few seconds of noise once in a while and thats about it. The rooms were ok, nothing special at all, ours was clean but not usual "ritz carlton" type finishings or quality. The staff was not great. Only once was I recognized by name; this is something that other Ritz Carltons pride themselves on. The staff seemed bothered by any requests that we had( and we really didnt have any at all), not too many smiles and just an all around lack of professionalism. Stay away, i repeat, STAY AWAY, from Il Mulino. Even being used to New York City prices, this restaurant is grossly overpriced and the food is crap. Any positive reviews on the internet about this establishment are from people who obviously never had a good meal before. Im not a food snob at all but this restaurant is bad. Trust me stay away, eat somewhere else and spend the savings at the blackjack table. All and all this hotel is probably one of the nicest in san juan, but take it with a grain of salt. This hotel is equivalent to a nice westin or marriot. NOT ritz carlton or four seasons caliber, not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Stayover - What a Wonderful Surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieS
Reviews.Content: We flew out of Dulles on Sunday 9/2 knowing our flight to Aruba was going to be cancelled due to the Hurricane. We tried to book a night at the Marriott, but they were full. Thank goodness, because it allowed us to try the Ritz. We arrived at 1:00 on the 2nd and were immediately greeted. Bags wisked away while we went to check-in. We did not expect our room to be ready (a garden view - the least expensive) because of the time of our arrival. What was surprising is that they apologized the room was not ready and gave us a free lunch food voucher at the Ocean Bar and Grill. We went to the wrong restaurant and were not directed where to go - but WALKED directly to the restaurant where they immediately seated us at the location of our choice by the beach. We were told to order as much food as we wanted - it was free except for alcohol. We split a shrimp cocktail and a dessert + we each ordered a main course. I had the Grouper Sandwich and my hubby had a cobb salary with lobster. Our total lunch bill was $89 and it was FREE!!! The food and service were wonderful and we would have happily paid the cost of the lunch, but it was very nice that it was free. They called me on my cell phone when the room was ready. We were upgrated to a ocean & pool view with balcony. Room nicely appointed - very comfortable bed and pillows! Since this was a one night stay over due to our cancelled flight, we did not experience much of PR. One thing I did notice that was scary and comforting all at the same time - the number of police on the beach on horse back and ATV's. I wanted to walk the beach in the morning and asked at the front desk if it was safe. I was assured it was. As soon as I hit the beach I noticed an officer on ATV staying close enough away, but at the same time, watching to ensure I remained safe. He rode ahead of me and checked tree's and other wood structures to ensure no issues. I really enjoyed the walk knowing he was close by. It is a shame a tourist cannot walk the beach safely without police, but at the same time - I was very glad he was there. Typical in Ritz style - they remember your name and address you by it. They bring around nice cold snacks at the pool and beach. Someone was always available to help and assist. The service was by far more than we expected at this PR location. I can't close without commenting on our dinning experience at Mares. Exceptional dinner & service. We didn't order alcohol - and our total food bill was $78 - worth every penny!! In fact, we thought it was low compared to mediocre meals we've had at other locations. Hubby had lobster tails and I had the grouper with mango salsa. Off the charts! From the moment we arrived to the time we left - this was a wonderful experience. For the price, in PR, you will find no other resort with this type of service and property. A comment on the Marriott - we went to the Marriott to check it out. It was definitely more crowded and loud. We didn't feel the property was up to the caliber of the Ritz; however, it was a nice property. We enjoyed the visit, but were very glad to get back to the Ritz. I wouldn't chose to vacation in PR, but since we travel through PR for other carribean islands - I would definitely book a night before and after our vacation at the Ritz. In fact, we pondered rescheduling our flight Friday to stay at the Ritz another night. My recommendation would be to spend 2 -3 nights at the Ritz to experience PR and to include this as a stop over on the way to or from another carribean island. One comment about the plane noise. This hotel is very near the airport. You do hear the planes taking off and landing. This noise is the only negative comment I can give to this Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Where am I?”
Reviews.Author: FFCFan
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz I know. How this property remains a Ritz is a mystery. We arrived and dragged all of our bags in to the front desk without a single staff member acknowledging my family's presence. There were plenty of staff but none saw us as important enough to assist or even open the front door. We had to finally interupt the conversation of the three ladies at the Front Desk who obviously had more important things to discuss than greet the "valued" customer. To add insult to injury, the ladies felt comfortable enough to joke, in spanish, about my wifes dress. To assume an American does not understand was quite a miscalculation. What a start to a long awaited break in a luxury hotel. Our room was OK for a Marriott but what is the point of an ocean view if you cannot see through the filthy windows? The room was a dissappointment. Light bulbs out, hole in the wall, toilet wouldn't flush completely and stains on the ceiling. We called and asked for the toilet to be repaired at a minimum which took 4 hours for somebody to show up. The gentleman said they were saving on pay so he was alone!!!! Overall service was painfully slow. I honestly think the staff lack direction from management. I rarely saw any management with the exception of their Italian restaurant and steakhouse. (The only bright spots of the hotel). The location is VERY close to the airport and not great place to walk around but the beach is nice and the pool is beautiful. Our experience could not have been worse and we were not alone. It seemed everyday around the pool the topic of customer conversation was the shocking service and poor condition of the hotel. All of the loyalty I have to Ritz-Carlton as a company was lost by this experience. By the way the toilet was never fixed.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience Of True Puerto Rican Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: DairyDancer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for two days prior to going to St. Croix for an extended stay. Our experience was so fabulous, the staff so accomodating, services superb, that we left St. Croix pronto to return to San Juan to enjoy MORE of the excellence we enjoyed. Five total nights where every request, though minimal, was responded to and acted on and/or resolved to our complete satisfaction. A Ritz is a Ritz for sure, but compared to other mega star rated hotels in Puerto Rico it is by far superior to all! I was traveling with my sister and we like to play cards together, an extra chair was provided immediately upon request ... our dinner reservations made to our exact timetable, and I was addressed by my NAME at the Concierge Desk and at Breakfast each morning and at all other dining options! The price .. . far LESS than all the other hotels I have previously stayed at in San Juan! ~ This for me was a LUXURY BARGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I ever stay in Puertor Rico”
Reviews.Author: mcruzdvm
Reviews.Content: I landed in this hotel by luck, I had a terrible experience in the westin Rio Mar-Not Good. I live in New jersey but travel to Puerto Rico almost every year, I had to say that the Ritz Carlton is the best hotel I ever stayed, the best service, the hotel is great, pool is excellent, the beach is awesome and the water sport are included(not motorized) , the casino is great and the music almost every night is top notch. I highly recommend the hotel, the only place I will stay. I just which the restaurant were slightly cheaper but it is expected it is the ritz carlton, I would not traded it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrintellec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in San Juan from Aug 13 to Aug 17. We had an excellent stay. Wife and teenagers loved it. When we arrived about 4:30 pm, we were told that our room was not yet ready. So we waited in the lounge until the room was available. We ordered cocktails and refreshments while we waited. Since we had to wait about an hour, we received a discounted rate on our room the first night, was given a pool view/partial ocean view room, and our lounge order was comped. We stayed on the club level, which is worth it if you like to drink cocktails and snacks practically all day. Hotel room was nice, beach was nice, and was always able to find a nice spot by the pool. The staff was excellent (typical Ritz fashion), once they knew your name they used it every time they saw us. Had a great time and would definitely go back. As for the airplane noise...didn't bother us a bit, and we were outside most of the time. I can only seriously remembering hearing about 3 to 4 planes while we were there the 5 days. As soon as you hear them there gone. When I heard it, it reminded me of the smooth flight that I had on my way to paradise! There was construction going on from about 9:30 to 4:00, which they did state on their website, but we were always out of our room during those times, so it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz San Juan - A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: DianaNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our 3 grandchildren to the Ritz to begin our Puerto Rican adventure and introduce them to the island. Our stay at the Ritz was heaven. We travel extensively since I run conferences for attorneys & we stay at top luxury hotels.The Ritz San Juan did not disappoint. Beach was beautiful, calm with blue waters. Kids loved the pool, service impecable & friendly, rooms clean and comfortable. I was there there just before Hurricane Dean and did not have the same experience "The Ritz has lost It" had. If you want to visit San Juan, this is the only place to stay. While we did not have club level rooms, we did visit and found it to be one of the most luxurious, it even had its own reading library. Do not be misguided, you will love your stay at the Ritz San Juan. I miss the evening call of the coqui's as we sat poolside and counted the stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: fresq
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for two nights in August 2007. I thought the facilities, staff, and food were all excellent. I recomend the club floor, as it will save money in the long run if you like to drink and eat alot on vacation. The staff is pleasant and helpful. I disagree with the bad reviews, and I would recomend a stay at this property to anyone seeking an upscale vacation. This is not the Four Seasons, but it is an above average/excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling alone to PR and staying at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: DunkinDonuts5
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about the Ritz is " Pure Luxury" ... If you want to stay at a really nice hotel and be treated like gold than you have to stay here. I dont know if they treated me good because I am a cute female traveling alone or because that's how they treat everyone. But I totally loved it there. You know the minute you step into the hotel that you are at a hot spot. The Hotel from the inside and out is "BEAUTIFUL". The hotel staff is the most nicest, polite and helpful people I came across in a long time. I guess most people arent that lucky from some of the reviews that I have read on this site. Anyways traveling alone is always a scary thing... I mean I feel like everyone would be staring at me and nobody would talk to me... WRONG!.... Everybody was wonderful. From dining at El Mulino the service was undescribable. The waiters all male made sure that I was okay and kept on asking how my food was. I didnt mind. I liked the attention. At least two of the waiters struck up a convo with me which i thought was nice since i was eating alone. The conceirge desk was helpful with getting me more info about the tours. The hotel staff outside (the ones getting you cabs) was extremely friendly, everytime I left the hotel and returned they always welcomed me back saying" How was horse back riding"? I was thinking in my head how could they remember that I went? I mentioned it to them briefly before I returned three hours later. Very attentive staff... Maids who arent even assigned to clean your room, say "Hi" and with a smile. You dont see that around alot... One thing i didnt really like was the Spa, mani and pedi was expensive and not really worth it. But I was going to get one even if it was expensive or not. Go there, Trust me you will NOT regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz-Carlton has lost it”
Reviews.Author: onemainstreet
Reviews.Content: The place was over-crowded, pool-side was jam packed with lawnchairs, the pool was filled with floating mats and buoys, could hardly move around the garden. it was absurd. The beach ran out of umbrellas, had only one guy taking drinks orders. It seemed the place was taken over by some major stockbrokers' convention, or a fratboys' reunion. it was terrible. We left after one night. The hotel feels tired and abused. The lobby made a nice enough impression, but then the hallways to the rooms are dank and dingy, and on top of that, being so crowded, made it the worst Ritz-Carlton we had ever stayed at. To be fair, we also left early because Hurricane Dean was heading near Puerto Rico, but really, it was the hotel that made me want to get out of dogde...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: lulu90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month for 4 days. This was my third time and still love it. The best rooms are the ones with garden and/or ocean view. Last time I had a garden view room but the way the hotel is built you have partial ocean view too which it was great. The front desk person told me they are adding balconies to all garden view rooms so when done you will be able to have a better ocean view too. The service, the room, the views are the best. If I needed something their response was inmediate and to my wishes no questions or excuses, it was done to my satisfaction. Great and helpful staff! The rooms are beautiful and have big bathrooms. The food is really good at any of their restaurants. I have to say I have stayed in other hotels there but this is my favorite. Good summer rates for this luxury hotel. This hotel is more quiet, relaxed still you can have a lot of fun. There's music in the lounge/lobby at night, It has a casino, not as big as other hotels but still nice. It's close to the airport,(10 minutes max),and to other sites of interest. If you want loud, party all night, crowded hotel then stay at the nearby El San Juan Hotel, since the Ritz is too classy to be like that. My thing is relax at the Ritz and be treated like a celebrity then if I'm in the mood to party hard take a walk to El San Juan Hotel next door since the people in the lobby are from everywhere and you don't have to stay at that hotel to enjoy their entertainment. The Ritz is really the best!

Reviews.Title: “Fab time at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: nc297
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the nay sayers about this hotel it's beautiful and worth every penny. The airplanes were no bother to us at all. Could not hear them at all in the room and barely noticed them outside. Before we could check in our kids were asking if we could come back next year. We were greated as soon as we walked into the hotel. We arrived at 1:30 and was taken right to our room. The Bellhop brought our bags up as soon as we were opening the drapes to admire our beautiful view. We change and went to the pool where a nice guy set up our towels and umbrella for us. My husband and kids swam every night as the pool is open for 24 hours! The the way the pool is lit up at night just takes your breath away. I sat outside and lounged on the chairs as many folks did each night. Our room was clean twice each day. Guest Services email me before we arrived and asked if we were celebrating any special occasion while staying with them, I told them my husband's birthday. On our second day there while we were out night swimming, we returned to a lovely dessert feast and a happy birthday card from the Ritz. We felt pampered the entire trip. We live in a beautiful home in NJ and only stay in nice hotels and was happy this one lived up to our standards. That was our best vacation ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: gmujake
Reviews.Content: I am sitting on the plane about to leave Puetro Rico. I wanted to get this down while it was fresh in my mind. I just stayed at the â€œRitz Carltonâ€� San Juan for a week. To be fair, there were some good things about the hotel. The noise from airplanes that is often referred to on this site was not an issue. I heard one plane the whole time I was there. The grounds were amazing too. Tree ferns, beautiful fountains and palm trees were all over the place. It looked the part of the tropical get away. Now to the not so great thingsâ€¦ I want to let you all know that this hotel, while nice, should not be listed on the roster of Ritz Carlton properties. I found out during our stay that it is a privately owned Ritz Carlton and is franchised. The Ritz Carlton is supposed to be all about friendly world class service, at least the ones I have stayed at previously. This hotel is service with a scowl at its worst. On arrival, usually the staff at a Ritz Carlton will greet you and offer to take your bags. If the check in line is long, usually they will stow your luggage. No such luck here. We were forced to lug our 6 pieces of luggage into a line that almost stretched out of the door and the front desk person who was (the rudest person I have ever encountered at any hotel front desk, except at a little out of the way Howard Johnson at midnight in a snowstorm) took one look at my group of sweaty tired travelers and promptly told us that our rooms would not be ready for a while and that it was hotel policy to not let guests check in until the room was ready. If you want to know what she was like think the stewardess on Ben Stillerâ€™s plane ride on Meet The Parents. Yes, she is that bad! We asked for the manager and an equally rude individual reiterated her statement and then they started talking about us in Spanish not thinking that the stupid people in front of them could understand. I was very upset by this time and asked what other hotels were in the area because we werenâ€™t sure that we wanted to stay at the Ritz any longer because we didnâ€™t feel welcome. True to his rude demeanor, he started listing other hotels for us to go to and even offered to call a cab for us. I felt that this reaction was another slap in the face. He should have apologized and offered to correct their initial disappointing reception. When we finally got checked in the nightmare continued. As soon as we opened the door, we were hit with a strange smell in our room that was very similar to vomit and several stains on the carpet that were suspicious. The shower curtain was mildewed and there was a large crack in the window of our room looking out to our view. The carpet was soaked too and the internet connection didnâ€™t work. I couldnâ€™t believe that I had paid three thousand dollars for this room. Also, the internet is not wireless in the rooms. It is an Ethernet connection that requires a plug. You have to sit at the desk to use it. Sort of inconvient but once again not up to what the Ritz is usually about. I called the front desk, housekeeping and the management office for help with the smell and room issues. Both hotel managers were on vacation, one until August 6th, over two weeks from when were to leave! I was equally disturbed to discover that the only manager on duty was the rude person mentioned above. What a â€œgreatâ€� start to our long anticipated vacation. I was able to find, after much searching, the guest relations manager who is a lovely woman named Flavia. She is such a sweet person. She listened to my concerns and offered to send an ozone machine up to our room help get rid of the smell. She also offered to move our room if we wanted but we had already unpacked.
