In addition, she gave us a credit to be used towards food at the hotel which was very nice but I didnâ€™t ask for it. I think itâ€™s like someone cutting you and then offering to pay for the stitches. Nice offer but why did it have to happen in the first place? The ozone machine didnâ€™t help much but I was done by this point and didnâ€™t try to persue it any further.. The food at the hotel is not the best and drinks are outrageously expensive. A normal strawberry daiquiri (that pink drink that we all dream about while waiting to go on vacation) is $15 a pop! A Mojito (the islandâ€™s signature drink) is $16. The food at the main restaurant called Mareâ€™s is bland and extremely expensive too. Trust me! Donâ€™t plan to eat or drink there if possible. There was a nice girl named Rosanne at the Mare restaurant that helped us and showed us around the hotel the first day. She was also a bright spot in the otherwise disappointing staff at the hotel and gave us some good tips about where to go for good nightlife. The hotel spa is very small. Get this, there is a staff entrance leading right into the area where the steam room and jacuzzi are located. It is used at least once every 30 seconds by the staff coming and going. When you are trying to relax in the spa, staff members are constantly coming in and out and have no concept of quiet. They are often talking loudly and rolling carts right through the Spa! I could not believe it. Not relaxing at all. The pool is 3ft. 6 inches deep at its deepest point. This makes for tough swimming for adults but good for kids I guess. The beach was nice but there were several homeless people on it begging for food and money which was disturbing. Keep in mind that most of Puetro Rico is very poor and the Ritz is one of three â€œupscaleâ€� hotels in all of San Juan. I do not have any clue how they managed to get their 4 Â½ star rating. I have stayed at 3 star hotels that were better. Overall, I would say if you have low expectations, donâ€™t care about service and like the smell of vomit in your room or just want to get away, the Ritz is a good place to stay. It is a Ritz Carlton in name only. Itâ€™s similar to a good looking Holiday Inn or a nice Best Western. If you want a truly upscale experience with attentive staff, good food and a welcoming atmosphere avoid the place like the plague!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC0929
Reviews.Content: Underwhelming. Pool area was a mess- dirty towels and empty cups were left out all day. Rooms were generic. Proximity to the airport gave the sense that we were at a motor lodge. Seemed like a fake Ritz. we called it the Rit"s". Puerto Rico is a beautiful Island. Pick another hotel- don't stay at the ritz cracker.

Reviews.Title: “Rit's'”
Reviews.Author: jasont830
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Marriotts and Holiday Inns that were more impressive. Dirty towels and empty cups ltitered the pool area- left out all day. The rooms were generic. Didn't seem like a real Ritz... The entire trip we dubbed the place the R-I-T-S... a fake. Puerto Rico is a beautiful Island- try out the Hyatt El Dorado. Much better than the ritz cracker.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous time!”
Reviews.Author: jbg123
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to the Ritz Carlton San Juan. The staff was amazing. We stayed in a club room floor with our two children and they could not have been more attentive. The club room includes, breakfast, light lunch, afternoon tea, appetizers, and dessert and coffee - wine and mixed drinks are also available. We had dinner at the restaurant two nights and the second night (without a reservation) they remembered and welcomed us. The second we walked in they greeted us back and our waiter from the previous evening came over to say hello. The attention to detail was unbelievable. Location was the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation yet”
Reviews.Author: hogfanexplorer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ritz on July 23, 2007 and we were completely captivated. As soon as we walked in we were hooked. The hotel was beautiful. Our room was the basic pool view room, but it was fantastic. The cleaning service was top notch and we had no complaints. The beach is great and the attendants are more than helpful when you need your chairs moved or just a glass of water. They offer cold water and fruit, as well as fresh towels right on the beach. The pool is just as beautiful as the pictures and they have tons of chairs! The only drawback of the Ritz is that they offer no type of gift shop where you can buy a beverge. Of course, they want you to use the mini-bar or pay for it in the lounge. The continental breakfast in the morning was $17.00 and consisted of cereal, small muffins and breads. We found a Starbucks just down the street in the El San Juan hotel. Not far away and pretty cheap on prices. The restaurants at the Ritz are worth the price. Il Mulino is the best Italian food I have ever had, Mares had awesome seafood. The poolside bar is good and reasonable. They do leave complimentary bottled water in the room every day. Overall: Stay here, the service is worth it. Bring your own soda and breakfast items or walk to Starbucks. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service, Beautiful Beach & Pool!!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelNYC1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from 5 nights at the Ritz-Carlton in Isla Verde. Our experience overall was amazing â€“ we will definitely be back!!! HOTEL: Beautiful hotel, service was fantastic. When you walk into the hotel, everything smells like fresh mangos. You walk through to the pool area which is beautiful, comfortable and clean, then through glass doors to the beach, which was gorgeous. The staff here makes it so that you donâ€™t have to lift a finger. They set up your cushioned beach chairs, towels and umbrella wherever you like. The beach was never too crowded, even on the weekend. They even bring around cold wet towels and frozen lemonade samples from time to time â€“ these little luxuries definitely stood out!! LOCATION: The hotel is 10 minutes ($10 taxi ride) from the airport. I was a little concerned about the airplane noise after reading other reviews, but it really didnâ€™t bother us. There is not too much to do in the direct vicinity. We went into Old San Juan a few times, which was a gorgeous old city â€“ nice to just walk around. The only downfall was the high cost of taxis â€“ the 20 minute cab ride was $20 each way, which could get expensive. There is also a bus stop very close to the hotel. For 75 cents, it drops you off right in Old San Juan (the last stop), but does go through some not so nice areas. ROOM: We booked a city view room, ended up having a partial view of the ocean and the building next door. Regardless, it didnâ€™t really matter because we werenâ€™t in our room all that much and there wasnâ€™t a balcony. The room and bathroom were standard (on the smaller side, especially after staying at El Conquistador), the Bvlgari toiletries were nice. Nice, large flat screen TV! SERVICE: From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, to the beach and pool staff, to the restaurant staff â€“ the service at the Ritz-Carlton was 5 stars â€“ we really felt pampered!! FOOD: The food at the hotel is very expensive, but very high quality, so totally worth it. We ate at both BLT Steak and Il Mulino in the hotel â€“ I HIGHLY recommend both places for both delicious food and wonderful atmosphere. Il Mulino is perfect for a romantic dinner. Being from NYC, we were very impressed with both. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was delicious â€“ worth the $25. We ate in the Isla Verde area a couple of times â€“ once at Metropol (Cuban) â€“ popular local place, food was just okay. We also ate at Lupiâ€™s (Mexican) â€“ the only thing good about it was the convenient location. In Old San Juan, we ate at Tantra â€“ they lured us in with the promise of a performance by a belly dancer, who never showed up (total scam!) â€“ unfortunate, because that was the reason we chose that place over a few other cute places in the area â€“ food was just okay and rather expensive. We also ate at El Jibarito, which came highly recommended and had fantastic local Puerto Rican cuisine for a bargain â€“ very casual, a must try. Overall, we found the food in Puerto Rico to be just okay (a lot of fried food)â€¦I donâ€™t think they are known for their cuisine. ACTIVITIES: We went to the larger fort in Old San Juan, which was very cool and had beautiful views â€“ highly recommend. We went Scuba diving and to the bio-bay in Fajardo when staying at El Conquistador (prior to arriving at the Ritz). Both were amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a vacation recently. We went in expecting a luxury hotel -- it is the Ritz, after all. What we got was the worst service we've ever had -- including stays at Best Westerns. Every single day we returned to our room to find that we hadn't gotten new towels, soaps, etc. We had to call and wait for hours to get basic amenities. The facilities in the rest of the hotel weren't great. They didn't regularly clean the bathrooms by the pool. I tried the spa -- I was expecting a lot for a $90 pedicure, but what I got was nail polish all over my toes -- the nail technician didn't get it off for me -- she told me it would come off in the shower. And the concierge desk was completely useless in helping us plan activities. The only good thing about the stay was that the weather was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is Great”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Barman
Reviews.Content: Since we connected through San Juan, we thought we would stay a few days on the way back. We were really glad we did. San Juan is a great city, and the Ritz is an great property. When they found out we were finishing our honeymoon, they brought us champagne as we were checking in. We stayed in a regular room on the club level. The room was nice, a standard ritz-syle hotel room. Not huge, but big and in nice condition. We got rose petal turndown without a request. The pool is huge (but not really deep). The beach is nice, but seemed like most of the scene was a the pool. The restuarants were nice, we did Mares and BLT. Both we great and the staff were friendly and put in the little extras. The casino is nice. Table games and slots. They even give you free soup (which was new to me). Club level was great, we ate lunch and breakfast there each day, not to mention all the cocktails. A great value that I would highly recommend. The staff in the club level are wonderful. Can't wait to go back to PR and the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool, nice beach but..not quite I expected for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Son-of-Poochmas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 7/18-7/20. Paid $250 + heavy taxes/night. This is a smaller Ritz than others I have been to. Overall a very good hotel, but the price is too much. Pros: 1. Beautiful pool grounds ! 2. Direct exit to the beach - many chaise lounges 3. Friendly beach service; you can use kayaks etc 4. Mares restaurant is not bad - breakfust buffet includes champagne and a good assortment of cheeses 5. Beautiful large plasma-screen TV Cons: 1. Maid opened up the door whithout knocking 2. Bathroom needed 2 flushes - an observation seen in another five star hotel 3. Hallways not very nicely decorated, room very clean but with ok furnishings 4. Window not that big, no balcony in my room overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: hotelsRfun
Reviews.Content: I have been to Puerto Rico five times, and I have stayed at several different hotels, the Hilton, Mariott, Westin, and the El conquistador, and I am convinced that the Ritz Carlton is truly the most magnificent. The staff will go out of there way to make the trip enjoyable for you. And even will remeber your name. I think the service alone exemplifies the level of elegance of this property. The lobby is fantastic, simply beautiful, and features a very uspcale casino. Concierge was very helpful, it is my suggestion that you make reservations with them for Pelican Dumas. The guestrooms are a normal size, but have a special Ritz touch to them. The bed was very comfy. On the grounds there is a magnificent pool, two tennis courts, and a full spa. And best of all the beach is probably the best in puerto Rico and only steps away. At night the Ritz is a little dull, however, its location affords its guest to be able to walk to nearby hotels that are much more lively. But if you want to have a quiet relaxing night the lobby bar is great, and the casino is also fun. Overall, this place caters to all of its guests, it welcomes business/leisure travelers, is great for families or couples. What separates this property from all others in Puerto Rico are staff who really pamper their guests, and luxurious accomadations brought to a whole new level.

Reviews.Title: “NOT UP TO ANY LUXURY HOTEL STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: paolp88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 20th Anniversary and we wanted a special hotel. This was not the place. The rooms were okay. The food at the specialty restaurants in the hotel were good, but very overpriced. The Casino was dirty and had antique machines. Beach and Pool staff were awful, we had our towels laid out for us once on a week vacation. Also, the waiters at the pool only asked us twice if we needed a drink. I was expecting luxury but received a moderate quality hotel with poor customer service. I had to call the front desk about a question when we arrived and called 4 times and no one answered. We paid for a luxury hotel. But, the RITZ did not meet our expectations. I think there are much better hotels to be found in Puerto Rico. This one is close to the airport and is very loud, we heard the planes all day and night. Especially annoying while trying to relax on the beach, Our room was very small and there are no balconies on most of the rooms. I will never stay at a Ritz hotel again. Every Marriott I have ever stayed at puts this place to shame. Just to bad that we put our special occasion in their hands and they could not live up to their reputation of luxury and excellence

Reviews.Title: “Great Club Level..but watch your hotel statement!!”
Reviews.Author: happytrav07
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5 night vacation here back in the Spring. We booked through my travel agent who went through Apple Vacations. We decided to upgrade to the Club Level that we had heard so many wonderful things about. So, ALL was prepaid before we even left on July 9th arrival..checkout on July 14. Upon arrival we were greeted very nicely..good start! So, now we are checking in and there was a problem. Somehow, there were two rooms booked...one for me and another for my daughter. Nope..we only booked one room. So this gliche took about 15 minutes to resolve..I gave them the vouchers that stated the room was PAID in full..one room!! Then, they asked for my credit card for "incidental charges". Thoughtout the 5 night stay we only charged 2 lunches and one sightseeing tour that amounted to a $175.00 charge to my credit card. Imagine my surprise when on the morning of checkout there is a bill for over $3000.00!!! I immediately went to the front desk asking for an explanation! Thank goodness I had brought the duplicate set of vouchers (receipts). They had to make copies of the duplicates Uh..where were the originals they took from me when we checked in? I was then told nothing could be done until 10am when the "billing office" opened. Three and a half hours later...the club lounge manager, Brandon, checked on this and said it was remedied. I checked out with a receipt for ONLY the $175.00 correct charge to the credit card. Imagine my surprise when I got home and was checking my credit card statement....uh huh...the Ritz Carlton had CHARGED my credit card for 5 full nights on the day of my check-in for the over $3000.00 charge. Even though the "charges were pending" I was outraged that my card had been charged for 5 nights AND it was a prepaid trip. This morning I called the RC and spoke to the finance department who was going to call my bank to have the charges reversed. As of my writing this...I am waiting for her phone call. A lovely hotel, wonderful club level..kudos to Brandon, Rey, Venus, Roberto. Good restaurants..expensive but service is excellent. A terrific trip except for the above problem. Hopefully will be resolved...will let all of you know as soon as the call is returned.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Ritz Standards”
Reviews.Author: Extremegolfer15
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went here on Memorial Day. I have to say it was not what I expected at all. The Location was good because it 10 minutes from the airport but everything else was not impressive. We have stayed at about 7 different Ritz Locations now this one being the worst. The chairs at the pool are on top of each other. They did not have enough servers to handle all the drink orders. If you didnt get down to the pool by 9 am then you didnt get a chair. The property itself is very small so it is not a typical sprawing ritz resort. The room was tiny and basic. The only thing that didnt make this a marriott room was a flat screen TV. The one redeeming quality about the hotel was the restaurant. The formal restaurant was amazing. The service, food and wine were really the only thing that reminded you that this was a Ritz. If you are looking for a quick flight from the east coast to the carribean I highly recommend the St. THomas Ritz. You will not be disappointed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JenM72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights toward the end of June. Was there for work,but was lucky enough to be able to spend a weekend there aswell. Hotel was fantastic and really enjoyed my time there. Hotel is about a 20 min ride to Old San juan, but located right on the beach front and minutes from the hotel. You can also get to 2 large malls within 15 minutes and the Belz outlet in about 30 mins (all dependant on traffic) I had a very good rate, though my company, which for the price I paid made the hotel very good value. I stayed in the normal room, facing the car park area. For about $40 a night I could have upgraded to a pool view, and if I had been on holidays there, I might have done it. Positives - Most friendly and helpful staff I have ever come across. Everyone from security, cleaners, front desk, restaurant staff are all friendly. Actually this seemed to be the trend in San Juan - Room had a nice large flat screen TV - Room was large, clean etc - Room ammenities were from Bvlgari and included everything you could want from shampoo, conditioner, sewing kit etc - great restaurants, especially BLT. Fantastic steak (but you pay for it!) - pool was really nice, easy to get a deck chair. - Right at the beach front Negatives - not really many. the only one (minor at that) was on weekend afternoons by the pool it is quite crowded. So not a lot of free space in the pool and a lot of noise depending on the crowd. I have read complaints about others about the airport, but this is not that distracting, you get use to it. I did hear the planes from my room, but they are not going when most people would want to sleep e.g. the last one was always around 10:30pm or so. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, great food, pool, tennis court, gym, beach, and a casino for those interested

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - absolutely useless concierge”
Reviews.Author: Hoboken Traveller
Reviews.Content: As so many of the reviews say, this really is a fantastic hotel. It is well thought out, the service is great - it is definitely on Island time but then you should be too while you are here so relax. The only thing I would complain about is the concierge service. I travel a lot and am used to being able to go to the concierge and asking my question - usually I get a wealth of informaiton including timelines, recommendations, directions etc. The concierge at the Ritz (all of them) are rather ditzy individuals from whom extracting any meaningful data is rather like pulling teeth. Then when you do get some informatoin you feel so happy that you don't realize they neglected to mention the most critical item that later comes back to screw you. In short, don't use them! Can't recommend BLT Steak highly enough - what a fantastic experience. Also liked Il Mulino though the Italian food is just a little too heavy for me and the wine list is quite a bit more expensive than the BLT menu. We did the rum tasting in the lobby lounge and the gentleman who helped us there was lovely - highly receommended if you want to learn more about rum and taste some great ones too. From what we saw, the beach at the hotel is the best you will find on teh island, so almost don't bother going anywhere else. This is given every guide book tells you Luquillo beach is one of the nicest on the island and we visited there. Finally, DO the bioluminscent tour at Fajardo - it was EXCELLENT - especially watching those who normally don't leave their armchairs trying to canoe upsream - hilarious!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jemr77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for 8 nights over memorial day weekend. We were not impressed by the service at the Ritz. It took over 2 hours for the bell hop to bring our luggage after we had checked in, the hotel has hardly no rooms with balcony's or you have to upgrade. The service by the pool was awful, you had to practically flag someone down to get you anything. The hotel also was not very good about policing who was using the pool facilities. It was quite obvious that a lot of people at the pool were not guest of the hotel. On a positive note the concergie was helpful and the spa was pretty good. Overall I expected a lot more out the Ritz and probably won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: desertguy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a great time overall at the Ritz. When we arrived, we were able to check in and got a room facing the pool on the 2nd floor. We were quite happy the first night. On the second night of our four night visit, we had some REALLY noisy neighbors in the room next to us. There was LOUD music from 6 PM to 6AM. We complained three times and the loud music would stop for a while and then start up again. In the end, on our second night we literally got no sleep. After explaining this situation to management the next day, they were very apologetic and we were moved to a very nice ocean view room on the 10th floor. Our bill was also adjusted accordingly and I asked for a meal credit which was given to us and was used at Mares. The food and service at Mares was very good. In fact, they have the best guava flan I have ever tasted. It was so good that I requested a copy of the recipe, which was emailed to me, when we checked out. We also used the gym (which is part of the resort fee) which was nicely equipped with treadmills, etc. We also had continental breakfast in the lobby bar which at $18 a pop was not cheep but nevertheless was good with great coffee. On our last night we ate at Il Molino which was expensive but the service and food were excellent. The beach just outside of the hotel was very nice. They obviously comb the beach to get rid of the trash, rocks, etc. They also provide great lounge chairs with umbrellas. Regarding the noise, yes this hotel is right next to the airport runways and this is a known fact. If airplane noise bothers you, then go somewhere else, however, you will not hear the noise when in your room and it is not like LAX, JFK or ORD where there is one plane taking off every 20 seconds! Based on our experience, we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: mgou4
Reviews.Content: We , Hubby and I, our 2 son's (21 & 17) had a wonderful vacation. We connected as a family, once again. The Ritz was wonderful!! The staff were beyond our expectaions. We stayed on the Club Level which I am convinced is what made our vacation special...if you can afford the extra dollar, do it. I promise, you WILL feel special, and you connect with new friends from around the world staying there. Yes, you hear the airplanes at the airport taking off, however NOT in your room, we could hear them loud and clear on the beach. It was no bother really , we became immuned to the sound, except when a really large plane would take off , that is when we really became aware to how close we were to the airport. Snorkeling was great out front on the beach, we saw lots of sea critters; starfish, sea turtles and even Nemo. We went deep fishing 1 day, my sweet Hubby and I got seasick because the seas were 4 to 5 feet swells, ( I can't type anymore about it or I feel queasy again :( ) The captain took my husband and I along with our 17 year old back to the marina. Then he, the captain took our 21 year old back out to the rockin' an a rollin sea..UGH..brave fellow!! They got 1 strike in 5 hours, but no fish. We mostly stayed on the property at all times, we visited El San Juan Hotel a couple of times which by the way was FUN!!! An absolutely must see!!! The Ritz casino SUCKED our money out of our pockets, but we had a great time trying to get it back, it is NOTHING like Vegas if that is what you are looking for, very small. We have traveled to many places , you will never meet any nicer people than at the Ritz Carlton and Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz ~ A++++ ~ 2 days stay after cruise”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: Hi ~ We just returned from a 2 day stay at the Ritz following a cruise from San Juan. We had a GREAT experience with this resort. We have stayed at several Ritz's and found this to be one of our favorites. PROS: 1) Location - very close $10 trip to and from the airport. The don't have a shuttle, but taxi's are always waiting 2) Pool - Gorgeous as always - chairs so comfy - never a wait for the perfect spot. Pool staff always removed left towels, so finding the perfect spot was always easy. Tons of comfy water floats. Shorbet poolside, cool towels ~ all the great little Ritz perks. We booked Club Level. Our 1st time A++++++++++ - highly recommend - don't let the $100 per night run you off. You WILL get your $$ worth. Drinks, bottled water, wine, champagne - tons of food selections all throughout the day and night. Again, HIGHLY recommend. Free Internet. Great water activitites - also free (or should I say included in daily resort fee). Bottled waters waiting for you at the door when you arrive. Great casino. Cute little boutique shops right on site. Hotel laid out soooooooo conveniently, hardly any walking involved to navigate around. CONS: 1) Location - yes, this was also a PRO, however while you are in the pool you can't help but pay attention to the loud plane taking off. In the room YOU NEVER hear them and I am a very light sleeper. 2) Restaurant prices - again, typical for Ritz, but that is why we loved Club Level. 3) Bellman - not the most pleasant as we have found in the other resorts 4) check-in - took over 30 minutes from those waiting in the same line with problems w/ their bills checking out at the same time ............. Again, we had a super great time. You can't go wrong at this hotel. The small little cons, were just minor things. Ritz top class alllllllll the way!! .......... I can't get enough of "my pleasure" :)

Reviews.Title: “Ritz: Cancelled our Wedding Plans”
Reviews.Author: Indot081
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Ritz..we were headed there to plan our wedding taking place in June 08...after our 3rd day there we had a change of heart! Overall: The grounds were well kept and beautiful including the lobby and restuarants..the people were extremely nice...however the rooms leave little to be desired...we got a great deal $175 a nite through our travel agent but ended up facing the "city" aka the airport...we were willing to accept this because of the low price we paid, however when we explained we were planning to have our wedding there they didnt even bother to help give us an upgrade.. Noise: Far as previous reviews posted about the airplanes...we werent too upset with this..indoors you couldnt really hear them but outside by the pool was a bit too noisy for me especially in the morning when your just trying to relax Food: The restuarants were fare, I think what made them worse was the fact that the prices were out of sight! Now just to be clear we live in the heart of NYC and are used to paying high prices at restuarants but we usually get what we pay for here...at the Ritz it felt like we were being taken advantage of...$58 per person for the sunday buffet at the restaurant Mares!! Im sorry but no breakfast is worth $58 per person Needless to say we will not be coming back here and have called off the plans to have our wedding here next year...starting our plans back at ground 0 But if you do plan to visit san juan after exploring other hotels nearby the Ritz is your best bet

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more...”
Reviews.Author: xglitterchickx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz from May 28-June 2, 2007 for our honeymoon. I had been reading every review written here on trip advisor for the past 6 months. I figured most of the bad reviews were overexaggerated because it sounded like a wonderful place. I was expecting all the great things that all the other reviewers were raving about...but got none. Let me preface this review with the fact that I am in no way frugal about spending money. I do not cut corners and try to save a buck. I knew that this place was spendy and we were prepared. BUT... when you have the option to spend large amounts of money on something advertised as this I would expect this "exceptional" service and "5 star treatment" that was promised. We got to the hotel about 7pm with not even an offer to load our bags for us. Checked in and was given a room on the 7th floor. By the sound of the other reviewers, it seemed like the Ritz likes to accomodate celebrations with free upgrades or special perks upon arrival. Since nothing was offered, I just figured I'd ask if there were any upgrades available, and that we we're just married on saturday. (It was 7pm, how many $450.00++ /night rooms were gonna be sold after 7pm?) She told us that we could upgrade from our parking lot view to an ocean view for $100.00 more a night...or to the club level had many rooms available for an extra $250.00 a night. We said no thanks and carted our bags upstairs on our own. The room was nice and clean. Very nice room. Big plasma screen tv, computer desk and a loveseat. Large and very comfortable bed. Marble bathroom with bulvgari shampoos, soaps and shower gels. Two waffle robes in the closet. Room also had a mini bar, $3.50 for cans of pop, m&ms, $5.50 for mini liquor, $27 mini bottle of chardonnay ect. In room safe, coffee maker, ect. Was impressed by the room and the housekeeping staff. Only thing I was not happy with housekeeping about was that they came at 7am and knocked twice and on the 3rd they just used their key to come in. I am sleeping in on my vacation, so when it says 'privacy please' on my door I do not appreciate you barging in. Especially when the past few days we had gone over this already! However, they did a very nice job and always came back and cleaned while we were gone. Skip the room service if you can. We used it twice and I dont think it was anything special. (Stay away from the seafood linguini alfredo. Trust me!) There were 2 steakhouses, II Mulino and BLT. Didn't eat there, but they looked and smelled nice. I read other reviews on the exceptional guest service and how the staff was all 'my pleasures' and knew your names. The only people who remembered our names and used them while we were there were the parking attendants. Did not see any of these personal notes and little gifts that are talked about. I was lucky if they remembered to leave bottled water. Also, there are some extra fees... the hotel charges you a 10% a day resort fee. Then you also have to pay either $17 (self) or $25-$28 (valet) a day for parking. When you order room service there is a $2.50/person fee plus the 17% gratuity added on. Like mentioned in the other reviews, there is noticeable plane noise. It was not constant, and not extremely disturbing, but you can hear it and it could be distracting, I guess, but it did not bother us. The pool was beauiful and so was the beach. No problem finding chairs anywhere. There were no kids overtaking the pool durning my stay... but I did see the $18 kid's pail and shovel that another reviewer was talking about. (LoL) I didnt hear or see planes taking off while lounging on the beach. The casino was exceptionally clean and accomodating. There was no smoke (I think there is no smoking in PR anymore) and the servers were quick to refill you if you tipped enough the first time. At night it got a little busy and sometimes the locals weren't too happy to share a table with you. Most of the dealers didnt bother to speak with you or really interact with you unless you spoke spanish. I can honestly say that these employees were really interested in doing anything other than dealing cards. They spent alot of time looking around and talking to each other from table to table durning the game. My best advice to you is to buy the insurance on the rental car if you get one. There is apparently no rules or regulations on the roads. (I only got stopped because I was driving unbeknownst in the bus lane LoL) but the officer barely spoke english so he just told me to do a U-turn in the middle of the road (which is common) and continue on my way. AND... beware if you drive into old san juan. Very tight squeezes and alot of odd one ways... All and all if I was ever to return to PR, I would stay here...only beacause everywhere else looked like the ghetto. No kidding.

Reviews.Title: “Always first class...”
Reviews.Author: kzdallas
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stopover in PR at the Ritz. Always first class in every way. Had a seventh floor room with a beautiful view, good food, friendly service, no hassles. The beach is very nice for an urban beach and the grounds and pool area are spotless and lovely. Most of the rooms, however, do not have balconies, so you might get an ocean view room (which has a pretty view) without a balcony. The casino is fun and the hotel is in walking distance to other hotels along the Isla Verde strip and to other places to eat such as Metopol across the street. Good food, good prices. If you've stayed at the Ritz elsewhere -- NYC, DC, etc. -- you might have expectations that are a bit too high for an island resort. In the islands even luxury resorts work a bit different. The pace is slower, there's heat and humidity to deal with, and it is sometimes difficult to keep everything in top order. And this is true no matter which island you visit or what hotel you stay in. But the Ritz does an excellent job trying to please. And we were very pleased with our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JJQuick
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Hotel in beautiful Puerto Rico was beautiful, beautifully furnished in a nice sized room. I thought the bathroom was a little small. In my opinion there were not enough towel hooks to hang our swim suits to dry. But bathroom was nice. Hotel Staff - staff was accommodating. Concierge always gave nice recommendations on where to go visit in town and where to go and eat. Location-this hotel is literally on the beach. If you want something beach side then this is the place. You can hang out by their large pool and then walk a few steps to access the beach. It's easy to hang by the pool for a couple of hours and then walk to the beach for a while then go back to pool. My husband and I managed to do this for a couple of days. It does not get old. We were there for "R&R" and thats what we got ! This hotel is not near Old San Juan. You can catch a cab to Old SJ for $20 each way. Hotel Food - the food was good but --be ready for the price. It is expensive. First we ate at an outdoor cafe/bar. It's near the pool and beach. Our lunch consisted of 2 sodas, a chicken wrap and a hamburger with fries. This totaled about $40 not including tip. We had to remind ourselves this is the Ritz. It was good food though. We also tried room service. This was great. I ordered a pizza for myself (It is enough for 2 people) and it tasted great. Casino- This was always crowded. It had tons of games to play. cha-ching! Spa - We had to try this. My husband and I both had a swedish massage at the spa. This was great. We didn't know it at the time but you can request a couple's massage. Cost $150 PP + tip. Overall-We had a great time at the Ritz. It is pricey but you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mmnyc91
Reviews.Content: Beware - this is not a place to travel with children unless your fine with spending $18 to buy a plastic pail to take to the beach. The food was absolutely terrible and there is no place to walk outside the hotel with children, unless you'd like to teach them a lesson in abject poverty. Worst of all the windows do not open in the guest rooms, so if you like fresh air, forget it. Also the beds are extremely hard, and you can hear the elevator beeping all night long along with the sounds of the casino - this is from the fifth floor. Further, the beach was beautiful and the staff was very friendly but you can hear planes taking off every few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: malayalee
Reviews.Content: Fabulous, beautiful resort. Fantastic pool and beach area. Water sports available - some are free with the room i.e. catamaran ride, kayaks, and some for extra charge i.e. jet ski, parasailing. Very friendly staff. Located right next to the airport but we were not bothered by the occasional jet engine noise while poolside, and can't hear anything once inside the hotel. The casino is good as well...all your standard games (blackjack, craps, roulette...) but the poker tables hardly ever had a quorum of people to get going. Be prepared to spend a pretty penny while you are there...even if you get a good room rate, food and drinks in the resort are expensive. We took taxis to Old San Juan for dinner several times ($20 each way) - many excellent restaurants there....Parrot Club, Dragonfly, Baru. Overall I highly recommend it if you have the money to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive..”
Reviews.Author: UsaS.
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Puerto Rico with our 2 and 4 year old. We had an excellent time. The room was clean and the pool and beach areas were beautiful. But what truly made the difference, was how professional, friendly, and helpful the staff was, from the time we checked in, to the time we left. Yes, the airport is close, and yes you can hear some planes taking off, but definitely not a problem as described by other readers. If anything, the proximity is great when you are traveling with children. The casino has a private entrance. Old San juan is a must see and is about 15 minutes away. We took a club room with access to a private lounge. This was probably the smartest decision we made on that trip. The staff was incredible (Thanks Brandon!) and so accomodating. Yes it is pricey, but in this case, you get what you pay for. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Reproach”
Reviews.Author: THECC
Reviews.Content: One expects high standards from Ritz and San Juan delivers. What I liked most about this incredible resort was informal elegance. As a beach resort and with today's more casual market this property excels. Front office, housekeeping and food service people were all pro's. The mantra of "Ladies and Gentleman serving Ladies and Gentleman" is alive and well here. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Taylor
Reviews.Content: I JUST returned from a 4 night stay at this Ritz. This is my first review I am ever writing, that's how good it was to stay there. On our arrival at 10:30 in the morning they had our room ready for us which was amazing in itself! We could then freshen up before heading out again. When we walked down our hall they were painting it and there wa an oder of paint in the hall (note that later in the afternoon prior to regular check in time they were done painting and the smell was gone). We thought we would see if we could get another room away from the painting although there was NO paint smell in our room. They hotel immediately found us another and two people escorted us there to see it first. We decided to keep our original and told them we thought it would be fine later and we were right. It totally was fine a couple hours later. We left the room at that time to go down to the beach and pool. It was a little rainy that day so we had some lunch at the bar at the pool. While there I asked a server where the closest restroom was. She pointed in the direction but said, "may I escort you there?" . I was a little taken aback by a waitress stopping what she was doing to WALK ME TO THE RESTROOM but I thought it was also extremely polite. Later that day we returned to our room to see that the manager of housekeeping had left us a Oil Fragrance Diffuser in our room as a present because of our concern for the smell. We actually did not have an odor in our room but for the our entire stay when we walked into our room it was fantastic to have that new smell waiting for us and was a reminder of the thoughtful gift (see photo) On the beach they not only give you towels ( regular thing) but set up your chair exactly as you want it. We watched as they "made our chair" and dug holes in the sand to put umbrellas. We were holding coffees so he ran off and got us a table to set them on. One morning we asked a hostess where we could get a cup of coffee and instead of sending us away she went and got it herself, free of charge. While at the pool we were offered iced towels and Evian mist to cool us off. Every thing at the Ritz was "my pleasure". So much so it became a huge joke between my friend and I. Our rooms were extremely clean and orchids and chocolates were left for us at night. Also- about breakfast in the hotel- HERE IS A HINT: If you go to the main bar which is a coffee bar in the morning (great iced mochaccino's) you can also order individual breakfast item's for $3.50. On the day we were going to the rain forest we could just grab a bagel and coffee in a to-go container. They packaged it beautifully for us to take. If you get the continental buffet it is $17.50. My guess is that not many realize you can purchase individual items if you just ask. I mean how much can a person really eat for breakfast! The location was ok but we had absolutely no problem taking a taxi to Old San juan. This did seem like more of a family/married couples hotel but also as two single 30 year old women there is the El San juan Hotel two doors down that has fantastic night life! Some of this stuff may just be what a hotel should do any way but it was a constant pleasure to be here. And in today's world the service we received is NOT the norm. It was an unexpected and welcome surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A first class experience”
Reviews.Author: georgeandsheryl
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 kids, 12 and 15) recently returned from a long weekend at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. We arrived at 2PM and were told our room was not ready yet but was invited to have a complimentary lunch at their restaurant by the pool while we waited. The food was delicious and the service warm and friendly. After lunch we checked in to our standard room (two double beds with a view of the pool and partial view of the beach). The wall mounted flat screen tv was great, as were the Bulgari toiletries in the bathroom. Over the next couple of days we sampled the continental and buffet breakfasts (the buffet is easily the better value, though both are expensive, as expected). One day they set up a barbecue grill poolside and prepared hotdogs, hamburgers and chicken sandwiches to order. For a break on the wallet we breakfasted at Denny's just outside the property. We jetskied, parasailed and hobi catted on the water, all of which was terrific. The beach is really nice, water is beautiful and warm and the staff sets up chairs/umbrellas for you. Uniformly the staff is pleasant, friendly, knowledgable and are well trained. There is a high ratio of staff to guests so you are never in want for long and sometimes they seem to anticipate your needs before you do. In short, I highly recommend the resort and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, if only they could manage to clean my room”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful -- the beach, the pool, and we really enjoyed the spa. The most significant problem we had was getting housecleaning to make it to our room. We stayed for four nights and had no problems the first morning, but a dismal experience in the following days. The highlight was definitely the spa and fitness center. The facilities were excellent and the wide array of fitness classes were a strong feature. The food -- we ate at both Mare and the new Mulinas -- was excellent. Major problem: getting the room cleaned by a reasonable time (and one day they never came 'til the turndown). I came back to my room at 4:50 pm the second day to find still no one had come to clean. When I called, I was told that they worked from 9 to 5:30 pm, so they would probably be along soon. :( I was very disappointed by this standard and told him that it was not appropriate for any hotel, let alone a Ritz Carlton; but the gentlemen told me that they had a lot of rooms, so this was how they did it. He was willing, he said, to put me down to get service earlier for the next day, although he said this would just mean some other room got serviced later. I asked that cleaning be completed by 1pm (that's my standard, even if it isn't theirs). The next day, my husband returned at 1:45 to find no cleaning had been done and went to the front desk to get "I'm so sorry. I will call them, it will get done right away." By 3, still no cleaning. As a breastfeeding mom away from her baby, I NEED to be able to relax and pump on time, not waiting and calling and waiting and calling to get know I can relax and pump uninterrupted. The manager was apologetic, but was not able to actually get things done right.

Reviews.Title: “OH! How the mighty have fallen, North Caldwell, N.J.”
Reviews.Author: ParrotCay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel appx. 10 times over the past 5 years. We have loved it so much for short getaways that we decided to go for our 2nd anniversary. We arrived 3/28 and were given the wrong room. After few calls we were moved to the proper room. I don't know how they could let anyone stay in that 1st room it was dirty. Spent 1 1/2 hours Calling guest relations to have roses brought following day, anniversary, to our room. Finally got through. Roses never came. Called guest services and I was told guest relations gone for day but will give rose petal turn down that nt--never came either. Dinner at BLT was very good and waiter Wilson was awesome. Went back again had different waiter rude and obnoxious and hurried. Il Mulino--NY it is not--my wife's pasta wasn't Al Dente it was as hard as the table. I had risotto which had no taste and the shrimp tasted like BLEACH. The restaurant is at the Casino entrance and some of the tables are outside literally at the casino steps. I had a view of the back of a casino plasma tv. The place was full of kids. I have kids of my own but this was a first on any of my visits here.It was like Disney South. I guess the no passport requirement to PR might have had something to do with it. Some of the kids were well mannered and polite others were just reckless and brazen-and the parents could care less. Kids would pile 6-7-or 8 floats on top of each other and others couldn't use them parents said or did nothing 1 child was hurt when he tried to stand on his creation. The staff now consists of locals who really could care less and you can tell they are there just to collect a check. They used to import staff and train them well. Two exceptions--Wilson as noted--and Blaine who sold me a watch at Little Switzerland in lobby--really pleasant and attentive. The hotel is weathered as noted by the landscaping which was not kept as it has been in the past. Spa--my wife loved her massage with Evelyn--I on the other hand received a 50 min. massage in 30 mins since they were running late and it was interuppted when masseuse had to leave the room for some inexplicable reason. We are sad to have written this review but did so in the hope that someone from Ritz would read it and try to bring this previous diamond in the carribean back to its former luster.

Reviews.Title: “CAN"T WAIT TO GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: justhte4ofus
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan, Puerto Rico and all I can say is that it was one of the most fabulous trips we have ever gone on. We went during the school break. My husband, myself and our 15 year old daughter and 10 year old son.. When we arrived there was some confusion with the room. Let me tell you that we were upset at first but then one of the managers, Carlos came over to us and was genuinely concerned and only wanted to make us happy. Eventually the problem was rectified and I have to say that he handled it incredibly professionally and made us feel like he actually cared. Next, we stayed on the club level. I don't think I can even begin to describe how incredible the cub level was. The staff on the club level just couldnt do enough to make us happy. Everything was "my pleasure" and the funny thing was I really felt like they meant it. Rita, Venus, Rey, Robert and Brandon, the manager would have gone to any length to please us and all the other guests on the club level. I seriously felt like royalty as did the other people who we met who were also staying on the club level. They were just unbelievably incredible and I must say it made the vacation even more enjoyable. When I booked this I noticed many people commenting or asking about the club level and for those who are curious I will elaborate a little bit on the club level. They had 4 food presentations per day. Breakfast, lunch, hors d'oueveres and deserts and after dinner drinks. The food was so delicious and presented so beautifully, the staff was so nice and the room was so nice with the outdoor balcony overlooking the pool and the beach that you could stay there for every meal if you wanted to. We had made dinner reservations before we left New York and everything changed when we got there. I can't even tell you how helpful the club lounge staff was. Every time I changed my mind they changed the reservation. It was unbelievable. And, every single request I made (and I made many) their response was always "My Pleasure". I can't even begin to say how wonderful they were. The beach was absolutely beautiful. Never ever had an issue with getting a chair (or four) wherever we wanted them on the beach. The pool was a little bit harder but just harder to get a chair where you wanted it if you didnt come early in the morning but I NEVER had a problem getting chairs at the pool in fact one day I really wanted to be in the first row around the pool and the pool person actually moved chirs closer to eachother to make room for 3 chairs for me in the first row around the pool. Also, we never, ever had a problem getting anything at the pool or on the beach. There were always waiters and waitresses coming over to us. that was never an isue. Also, by the pool for the kids they made snow cones for no charge and always had cold bottles of water at the pool and at the beach and they weere free. Also, they would come around the beach and the pool and give you cold washcloths which I thought was very nice. The rooms were beautiful. The resort was beautiful immaculately maintained. The water sports on the beach were great, totally accessible and most of them were free. I could go on and on. It was a fabulous vacation, a fabulous, beautiful resort and the staff really set the Ritz Carlton apart from other resorts. If you go make sure to look for Carlos at the front desk, and Brandon, Rita, Rey, Venus, Robert and Brandon and the others (I just can't remember all their names) in the club room. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “From a child-friendly perspective, they should take a cue from the 4seasons”
Reviews.Author: bams4446
Reviews.Content: This resort touts itself as "child friendly" and does have some amenities for children. However they do not go the extra step like the Four Seasons. For example, the Four Seasons provides diapers, swim diapers, baby floats, toys, and most important, strollers. This makes travelling extremely easy -- you need a car seat stroller to fly, so it's so nice to be able to avoid bringing a second one for the beach/pool. Of course, the Four Seasons charges a resort fee too -- but it's the convenience of having those items that make it worth it. I had been corresponding with the Ritz about these items for weeks in advance of my trip and did not get a straight answer as to what they can provide or not. Responses are very vague, which makes it quite difficult to pack. If I were them, I would take a cue from the 4S, spend a few hundred dollars on a handful of strollers and baby amenities and advertise it as a convenience. As of now, I will go back to the 4S where it's quite clear what they provide and it is very easy to travel with children.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, but too near airport...”
Reviews.Author: Mandirae
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a two night stay at The Ritz. I had read other reviews about the close proximity to the airport, but kept hearing it was NOT an airport hotel. The rooms are lovely, but small. The beds looked more comfortable than they were. No balconies. The pool area was very crowded as it was holiday week and they had a large group in attendance. Somewhat annoying when trying to secure lounge chairs. We unfortunately found the sounds of airplanes taking off annoying. Could not see them from the pool, but the sound was loud and you could smell the fumes! The casino was very nice. The restaurants in hotel were good, but as expected expensive. They could use a Starbucks- or similar for take out late night coffee or light breakfast fare. Limited options for breakfast-other than full buffet-$25.00 /or cold buffet $19.00. Could order a la cart-which is best option if prefer lower cost and lighter fare. We saw many go off property to eat dinner-which is an option due to close proximity to Old San Juan. We were there only two nights, so we opted to stay on property. Stayed at The Westin Rio Mar for 5 nights prior to The Ritz(can see my review there) and enjoyed the pool/beach seen better there. Was more relaxed. Lovely hotel, but prefer a more relaxed setting that still retains an air of luxury. Ate lunch at Barrachina's in Old San Juan-known for Puerto Rican fare. This was recommended to us in town. The food was good, but waited 45mins from order time -for food to appear. They have great Pina Coladas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun!”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle33
Reviews.Content: Hello. Stayed at the Ritz for 5 days in May 2006. It was such a treat to arrive at the hotel. The hotel itself is very very nice. Specifically: 1. Wonderful grand lobby. 2. Friendly staff. 3. Cool casino in hotel. 4. Very nice hotel room and bathroom with clean linens, towels, etc. 5. Spacious pool area. Never had a problem obtaining a chair. 6. Beautiful ocean waters - crystal clear water. 7. Hotel not too croweded. 8. Great beachside eatery. Cons about the hotel: 1. Smokey, smokey, smokey....although you can't smoke in the lobby of the hotel, the smokey smell of the casino lingers throughout the lobby area. Went into downtown Puerto Rico but was pretty disappointed and wouldn't recommend it. Expensive cab ride and not too much to see down there. Also, didn't really enjoy the areas surrounding the hotel. We did walk to a neighboring hotel to have dinner one night but if you come you def. don't want to leave the Ritz resort....by far the nicest on the stretch. Overall I had a great time at the hotel and would def. come back again. See pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay... but we'll stick with 4S”
Reviews.Author: Scout007
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience staying at a Ritz, and we enjoyed it. We were at the hotel by 12 since our room wasn't ready we stored our luggage. When we did go up to our room, the room was nice, it over looked the pool and fountainâ€¦. However, I guess I was expecting more. Last year for our HM we stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui so I guess I was expecting a room comparableâ€¦ the bathroom was half the size of the one at the 4S and there was no balcony. We had a window which didn't open. We had lunch at Mares one day. I had a Ritz burger, which someone said I had to try but it was a burger, nothing fantastic. Supposedly they use some amazing sauce but there wasnâ€™t any on mine. My husband enjoyed his lobster roll very much, and both we ordered with Yucca friesâ€¦ I love those! We dined outside and there was a giant iguana walking aroundâ€¦ Iâ€™ve had relatives that had them as pets but I have never seen them out in the â€œwild.â€� Service was slow and of course it was pricey. We did breakfast in our room both mornings and wasn't impressed. The food was blah, and our potatoes terrible. We dined the first night at Marmalade. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. It was amazing! My husband said it was easily the best meal heâ€™s ever had, and since he works at a restaurant he knows what he's talking about. We had the 10 course tasting menu for $100 a person. This included the wine pairings, so we thought this was a great deal. The wines the courses weren't cheap wines so it was a bargain considering the amount you'd be eating and drinking. They had the most amazing pasta with truffles I have ever had. I wish we had more time we would have gone back there for another meal. The following day we spent at the beach. The pool was very crowded and we didn't want to wasted time trying to find good chairs so we went to the beach... no shortage of chairs there. We did take a dip in the pool later, but the pool itself is pretty chilly, considering how warm it was outside. I went jetskiing for the first time ever, believe it or not. It was interesting to say the least. You can sign up at a shack right on the beach at the Ritz, but they pick you up on a jet ski and take you over to where the esj towers are. It was something like $60 for a half hour. We went to Metropol that night for a quick meal before our scheduled biobay tour. I guess any restaurant would have had a hard time living up to our experience at Marmalade the night beforeâ€¦ but even if I had dined someplace else the night prior, I donâ€™t think I would go back to Metropol. There is this amazing Cuban restaurant in our hometown so I thought the food would be as good as that. Not the case. I was very disappointed in my shrimp cocktail (I wanted something light as an appetizer). The shrimp was rubbery and the cocktail sauce came out of a heinz bottle. When I make my own shrimp at home I donâ€™t use bottled sauce so I wouldnâ€™t expect to have that while dining out. My husband enjoyed his cerviche very much though. For a main course I ordered the â€œCuban styleâ€� peppersteak. It was basically just peppersteak you could eat anywhere with rice, beans and plantains. I donâ€™t remember what he had but he enjoyed it. We then went on our biobay tour. We had booked our trip well in advance with Castillo tours, the company that has a desk located right at the Ritz. We received a phone call at 4:00 PM as we were getting ready for dinner that our tour was cancelled as the other two couples booked cancelled and they needed a minimum of 6 to go. I donâ€™t know if this really happened as earlier when I was confirming our tour I had heard that one of their desk agents accidentally told people the tour was at 4:45 instead of 6:45 and then they tried to get me to switch to the newly created timeslot. So when they called at 4 saying that the tour was cancelled, my options were to go at 4:45 (45 minutes from that moment) or go tomorrow. We had planned our trip in advance and had plans the following night so that wouldnâ€™t work. I suspected that they really got those other people to switch to the earlier time to please the large group in house that had accidentally been told the wrong time, so I was not happy. Luckily, they called another company who was able to accommodate us that evening, so we did the tour through E & B tours. I donâ€™t think I would recommend dealing with Castillo Tours as any time I was near the concierge and observed their desk, they seems to be overwhelmed and disorganized. So the biobay tour itself was an interesting experience. It was a long drive to Los Croabas, where the actual trip itself started. After a quick kyack 101 lesson, we were off. Since the point is to see the dynoflates, you kyack 25 minutes through an extremely narrow canalâ€¦ IN THE DARK. The only light you see is the glow stick circle of the kyack in font of you. The bay itself is quite amazing to see. My husband took advantage when they said it was ok to take a swim, but I had read that it only caused harm to the ecological setting of the bay so I decided against it and waiting in the kyack for his return. We were so exhausted we could not wait to get home. We finally mad it back to the hotel and were ready for bed. That evening my husband was well enough to grab a quick dinner so we were able to make our dinner reservations at Baru. This restaurant is considered â€œcreative Caribbeanâ€� and is very good. Definitely better than Metropol, but not as good as Marmalade. Service was great and like Marmalade, this can be found in Old San Juan. The Casino is extremely smoky. I live in NY, a state that has abolished smoking in public places, so I'm not used to being around that much smoke anymore.... it got to me pretty quickly so I left while my husband played. Service at the Ritz is great of course, just not as good as a Four Seasons property. And seriously, I absolutely hate resorts that charge a "resort fee" and if my husband wasn't so insistent on staying at the Ritz I would have looked elsewhere just because of this. I absolutely agree that she should take a cue from the Four Seasons and not charge this. Why should I pay for all the services that I may not want to use. I didn't do any of the "water sports" and the one I did, the jetskiing, wasn't included. On the beach, not once did someone offer to get me a drink, even though everyone around me was getting served. It took me a while to flag someone down when I wanted to have lunch sent over. You can order off a very minimal menu and they will bring you lunch on the beach. Food overall of course is overpriced. Overall for the price you pay and what you get, I will stick to visiting places that have Four Seasons properties. I just felt like we got more for our money there. However, it was still a lovely stay and we did enjoy ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz PR last November, and it was wonderful!!! The highlights: Beach: well attended, and plenty of chairs, umbrellas, etc. They also have a few hammocks about which I fell in love with. Nothing beats sitting in one, listening to the ocean with the tropical breeze blowing over you. LOVE IT! Pool - open 24hrs! The water can get a bit cool at night, but there's always the Jacuzzi to warm you up. Also, you can get a drink at the bar at Mares and they'll let you take it to the pool (in a plastic cup, of course). Food: Speaking of Mares, they have a great seafood buffet on Friday's. Well worth the price. Besides that, we didnt really do a whole lot of eating on the property. We opted for trying local tastes of the island. If you want great local food, hope across the street to Metropol. VERY good. Rooms: all you would expect the Ritz to be. I feel obligated to make a comment about the noise, since so many reviwers mention it. We had a room facing out to the airport, and I gotta tell you the noise was not an issue. The only time you really noticed was maybe once an hour or so when a big 747 would take off. Honestly, I noticed the noise from the A/C more than the planes! Funny, the place I actually noticed it was on the beach...it's *really* loud there. Service: The housecleaning staff were very attentive. They leave you a couple bottles of water in the room each day, but I get so thirsty in the humidity so each day I would write a note for the maid to leave a couple extra, and she would leave like five more. Every morning when we left our room, if she was in the hall she would greet us by name. Room Service was also wonderful. What can I say...this property lived up to the Ritz reputation. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: joeinnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for four nights in March. Rooms: The rooms were very nice. Housekeeping did an excellent job. We had a pool view which in reality could have been a partial ocean view. No complaints, other than that none of the windows open. (Digressing for a moment, this seemed to be a common theme in Puerto Rico. Beautiful weather, beautiful scenery, but most of the restaurants, etc were all indoors, with the A/C cranked up to the mid 60's.) Gym: The gym was nice for a hotel gym. Great treadmills and other cardio equipment with individual TV's. Spa Facilities: I didn't get a spa treatment, but did use the locker room. The steam room was nice, the sauna was very spacious (but co-ed, which I thought was odd to be sweating buckets in front of the opposite sex). Food: The breakfast buffet was so-so. They could have used more varieties of fresh fruit and another guy working the omelet station. Service was spotty and was downright horrible one of the mornings. The lobby bar was good because they had live entertainment at night which was nice to come home to. There was a seafood buffet on Friday night that wasn't very good. They had raw oysters, a rarity for a buffet, and I quickly figured out why after I spit the first one I tasted out. I hope that they had been frozen first, and they were horrible. There was an Il Mulino in the casino and a BLT Steak. I highly suggest that you avoid them both and come to NYC if you would like to try either. San Juan isn't Las Vegas, and the restaurants were very overpriced and were hollow shells of what they should have been. It's sad that Tourondel has attached his name to BLT Steak in PR and I plan on writing a letter to let him know how bad it was. It was foreshadowing when I sat at the bar for a cocktail and asked what kind of bourbon they had and was told "Jack Daniels or Canadian Club" (neither a bourbon) and then was mocked when I asked that a glass of red wine be poured in a wine glass meant for red wine (they had given me a narrow white glass). They apparently thought I wanted a bigger pour (it was a bigger glass). Someone at a dive bar should expect better, much less a Ritz where their motto should be to serve it to me in my shoe if I request. Pool area: Crowded, but you could always find chairs. The pool service was horrible. Final thoughts: I'll try not to rant, but I really wish resorts like the Ritz Carlton would take a cue from the Four Seasons and STOP CHARGING RESORT FEES. Please, just increase the price of the room. It's not fair to business travelers, who may not use the pool, and not fair to people who expect some decent service out of their 10% ($60+). The pool staff could not be bothered to set up a chair, no one came around to give water much less drinks, etc, etc. Please, just charge it as part of the cost of the room, and then make your workers actually work for the possibility that they might get tips for doing what should be their jobs. Everyone just feels ripped off, and no one wins. The service at the Ritz could have been much better. It wasn't bad, except at the restaurants, but it wasn't 4/5 star either. They need to get better food and/or get the backers of their 'name' restaurants to give their brands a little bit of attention. In the end, itâ€™s still a Ritz Carlton and a good hotel. But I wouldnâ€™t recommend that anyone not already going to San Juan go there and I would advise those thinking of it to consider alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “"My Pleasure" that's the theme of The Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: marshg1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 2 year wedding anniversary. We stayed from May 5 to May 12th. We This was our second time to Puerto Rico, the 1st time we stayed at the "Westin Rio Mar". When we arrived at the airport, we took a taxi to The Ritz. The hotel is about a 5 minute drive from the airport. Upon pulling up, someone greated us with a "welcome" and picked up our luggage. We then went straight to the front desk to check-in. I was not impressed with check in, we were told our room would not be ready for another few hours. We had no choice but to wait which, was fine. After all, this was my vacation and I wouldn't let one minor thing upset me. After waiting about 1 hour, we had a room, no big deal. Now, one to the whole review. This will be broken down into sections: ROOM :Our room was a Pool View, located on the fifth floor. The room rate was roughly $285 a night through our local travel agent. After a few days, we quickly learned that just about everyone else staying were paying $400 and above. The room was excellent. A good view of the pool, and grounds of the resort. The bed was nice, the bathroom was very clean. Our room had a Plasma tv and free internet. I can't think of one bad thing about to say about the room. FOOD: The food was great. We had at least one meal at the resort every day. However, the food was expensive. A hamburger was $15. Now, don't get me wrong, it was the best $15 burger I've ever had. Not to mention, you are staying at a Ritz. So, the prices weren't going to upset me. The Prime 787 was OUTSTANDING! I can not say enough about the level of service I received from our server. Our first time eating there, we received a card from our server when we got back to the room thannking us for celebrating our anniversary with them. Needless to say, I called the server back when we arrived to our room requesting him again for the following night. We also ate at The Palm next door (El San Juan). We had a good dinner there and for some reason, were given a $60 credit to our bill. The manager asked my wife and I if this was the first time eating at The Palm. After we told him "Yes", he gave us a $60 credit saying, order anything you woud like. The pool bar had typical bar food (burgers, pizza, salads). The service at the pool bar was good. Everyone was very friendly and the Madelia (local beer) was a lot of fun every weekday. About a block down from The Ritz (if you walk out of the lobby and turn right, walk down one or two blocks and this place will be on your right hand side). there is a little cafe, ice cream shop. We ate breakfast there as well. It's nothing special but good breakfast food for an inexpensive cost. SERVICE: "Our Pleasure" was the theme for our stay. No matter what I asked, that was what I heard in return. The customer service was the highest I've ever received. Now, this was the first time that I have stayed at a Ritz but, I have stayed in hotel rooms which cost $3,000 a night. I didn't receive that level of service at any time at those hotels. BEACH: The beach at The Ritz is amazing. It is probably one of the nicest beached in Puerto Rico. The water isn't crystal clear blue but, it is nice. The sand is nice as well. They have hammicks, beach chairs, and such. Bar and food service are provided at the beach. Other reviews have mentioned that the service is somewhat slow. I didn't time how long it would take for me to get a drink at the beach. I didn't feel the service was slow. SAFETY: I've read reviews where people said SAN JUAN is not safe. At no point did I feel unsafe. We walked around the surrounding area, talked to locals, walked around Old San Juan. It's all what you make of it. Life in San Juan is the same as anywhere else. They have good parts, and bad parts. Don't go to the bad parts. POOL: The pool was a lot of fun. They had raffs and tubes to lay on and relax. Not to mention the service of the cool wash cloth to cool down! SHOPPING: A few shops are located inside the hotel. For the ladys, yes, they do have a Tiffany's inside the hotel. The other store was ok but, I don't remember the name of it. My personal opinion is the shops at the El San Juan are a little nicer. Airplane Noise: Yes, if you are laying on the beach, you will see airplanes taking off. Yes, you can hear it. Now, I think EVERYONE complaining about that is nuts. At no time did it bother me or upset me. Look, if you want to be in the middle of nowhere, then go to the middle of nowhere. It is fine, the noise is barley hearable. All in all, this was an excellent hotel. The customer service was top notch at all times. Like the name of this review, everything was "My pleasure". I had made some high demands (rose peddles in the room for my wife) and it was taken care of. Nothing was to big for them. All of the staff at the bar was friendly. Again, I can not praise the staff enough. My wife enjoyed the trip so much last year, we just booked another trip this coming May.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: An_Honest_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 16 month old son and I had to travel to Puerto Rico for a family emergency. We ended up booking Friday night and Saturday night at the Ritz Carlton. First the good: The grounds are beautiful and the staff is great. Everyone greeted us, and were very friendly to my infant son. The food was exceptional and the service, as usual for the Ritz, was great. Also, I believe the beach was private which is unusual for Puerto Rico. Most hotel chains share the beach with the general public. Our room was a standard entry level room with partial view of the ocean. The room was somewhat small as we couldn't fit the crib in there comfortably so our son slept in our bed for the two nights. The bed was a California King and had plenty of room so it wasn't a big deal. Overall, I feel that it was above average. Now for the bad (which really isn't too bad), I didn't feel like the Ritz catered to families. There was no kiddie pool and the one and only pool was 3 feet deep all around. Unless you have an inflatable toy for your kids, you will be holding them the entire time. I also don't think the pool was heated. I know it's 90 degrees, but it felt cold when you first got in. My son did not enjoy it at all and we had to spend the morning by the pool while my husband visited with family. We paid almost $600 per night, at that price, I would have liked to have a heated pool. There were no playgrounds for the kids to play or an area where you can let them go wild. There was one saving grace and that is at Mares - their casual restaurant. It turns out they lend hotel guest a DVD player with Disney movies so the kids can be entertained while the adults eat. It was the first time I can remember having a hot meal in ages. Overall it was a good stay. We had to check out of the Ritz and check into El San Juan as they were booked and that really made me appreciate the Ritz so much more. I'll write a review about El San Juan as well in case you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Rocks”
Reviews.Author: kebdc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing three-night stay at the Ritz San Juan (March 1-4). Upon check-in we were offered a choice of the standard room we had originally booked - with two doubles and a view, or a club-level room with no view (well of the very nearby airport and mountains) and a king-size bed - at the same rate. We chose the club-level room and we were glad we did! The "club" was just down the hall from our room and seemed to always be open for a different meal or cocktail or snack. Each day there were four services: a continental breakfast, lunch, cocktails and hors d'oeuvres, and desserts and cordials. The meals were buffet style and were light, healthy and delicious. It doesn't get much better than your boyfriend handing you a glass of champagne during your shower because there were two chilled uncorked bottles at all times in the club room down the hall. The club staff members were very friendly and helpful. The club room had a beautiful view of the pool and ocean and there is a balcony with seating if you want to have your meal outside (this more than made up for the airport view). There are also books, iPods, and a computer for your use. Considering the price of the meals in the hotel - according to other reviewers -(we wouldn't know because we never had to pay for any of them) and the price of drinks - Club Level is the way to go if it's an option for you. We checked-in late - around midnight - so maybe that had something to do with our luck. Our room was beautiful and roomy and room service was impeccable. A fresh orchid along with chocolates and fresh bottles of water were bedside each day. Plenty of fresh new towels in the bathroom - along with robes and slippers. Other reviewers complained about the water pressure but I thought it was fine. If you want lots of water pressure go stand under one of the lion spouts in the pool! The hotel is lively - yet quiet and elegant at the same time. One night there was a live bongo performance in the lobby that was fun to see - but for the most part it was quiet. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather each day - around 85 and sunny and breezy. The ocean water was very warm and the sand was soft and clean. We never had to wait for chairs or towels at the beach - although chairs by the pool were a little difficult to negotiate. If you know how to sail, then definitely take adavantage of the catamarans available - and included in the resort fee. Fortunately my bf is an expert sailor and handled our boat effortlessly - however we saw a couple of peeps have difficulty turning their boat around and coming dangerously close to drifting upon the sharp coral that is just below the water surface in some areas. Ouch! As far as other activities at the hotel - the spinning classes run by Francisco were challenging (I'm told) - although I would pass on the beginning yoga class (Jackie) - unless you have never taken a yoga class before. It was basically 45 minutes divided into 10 minutes of light stretching, 20 minutes of ab work, then 15 minutes of lying on your mat (I guess that was supposed to be shivasina). I heard Francisco has a fantastic hatha class, but I opted to sleep-in instead. I highly recommend Evelyn if you are going to have a massage treatment at the spa. I chose the 50 minute deep tissue and she was excellent. It was a perfect massage experience. The padding on the table is heated and feels amazing. They also use heated and scented towels and pillows on your eyes, legs, and under knees - usually considered "signature" treatment at other spas.
