The casino is super-fun, although a little more low-key than the one at the Hotel El San Juan which was absolutely packed. At least at the Ritz you never had to wait for a spot at the table and you didn't feel like a loser for making $2 bets on roulette! The other casino was a little more intimidating in my opinion. At the Ritz If you get a players card, then make sure the dealers know you have it and give you credit accurately for your time and average bets.The dealers were very friendly - although it took a little while to get a cocktail. The pool area at night is beautiful. The lights, palm trees, pool, fountains, flowers and warm breezes are amazing. You can hear the coqui "frogs" - although I'm told they are not really frogs - throughout the grounds. They sound like chirping birds. I was also told their little chirp means "I love you," but maybe they just say that to woo tourists. Old San Juan is beautiful both day and night. During the day check out the grounds of the Fort El Morro and Fort San Cristobal. In town there are many shops, restaurants, and art galleries. Also - outlet shopping including Coach, Polo, Dooney and Burke - and a few others I can't remember. For our one night in Old San Juan we had dinner at Barrachina. It seemed a little touristy but we decided to stay for dinner for the hour-long flamenco show. The food was ok, but the show was fabulous. Not only was there a spanish guitarist, but also a singer - in addition to the three flamenco dancers. Service was a little on the slow side but the drinks were stiff. If you go there make sure you keep your receipt. We were half-way across Old San Juan after dinner in an alley on our way to the New Yorican, when one of the waiters from Barrachina tracked us down saying we didn't pay! After producing our receipt the thankful waiter returned to the restaurant - but it could have been a not so pleasant situation. After dinner we went to Marmalade for a digestif. Marmalade is a jolt of contemporary and chic compared with the more romantic Spanish atmosphere of Barrachina that included candles, wrought iron and other Spanish decor. If you are in Old San Juan and need taxi service back to the Ritz, then call Ana Figueroa with Island Taxi Service (787-450-3242). She is a taxi driver/ tour guide and is super -fun and hilarious (and informative). We laughed with her the entire cab ride back to the hotel. We spent one night hanging out at the Hotel El San Juan. I mentioned their casino above...They also have a few restaurants - including The Palm - where we had dinner - and a nightclub and an additional live music lounge with dancing if you are in the mood. I had probably the best mojito I have ever tasted at the bar along the wall next to the tobacco shop. It was a fabulous trip. The Ritz was amazing. I would go back in a heartbeat! One last tip though would be to carry-on your luggage if possible. The SJ airport was nuts on the way out and United still doesn't know where my suitcase is. But the direct flight home cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, with a glitch or two!!”
Reviews.Author: caryaf
Reviews.Content: This was our first "real" trip to Puerto Rico, and the Ritz Carlton was our choice based on prior excellent experiences at other Ritz Carlton's! Unfortunatley, rain for three days and cloudy weather on the fourth "dampened" our experience, but the one and a half glorious sunny days, of our five, were spectacular. Quite simply, the Ritz in San Juan is an "elegant" hotel with all the good things that implies! The grounds are spectacular -- like visiting a botanical garden. The pool is elegant, the beach is superbly maintained and spotless. There's a sense of graciousness and quiet throughout the hotel. The lobbies are superbly maintained, and all the staff is quick with a "good morning!" which quickly extends to the guests making things so very pleasant here! At the pool and beach areas there are more than a sufficient number of people to help you with chairs, towels, drinks, and so on. Each is friendly and eager to help. But this IS an expensive hotel! Our ocean view, balcony room was large and most comfortable. The bathroom almost larger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in. Beds are comfy and cozy, and there's a huge flat screen TV. All this was for a room rate over $750 per nite, with a 10% charge added on for "accessories" like beach towels, use of the gym, etc. It's pretty much impossible to eat for less than $25 per person for breakfast, and a simple lunch is in the $35 per person range. Dinner is even more. All this is without liquor. BUT: the food is superb, the service excellent and the prices are what you would pay in any similar restaurant outside the hotel. Some other small annoyances: Room service was slow, and breakfast took over an hour, althought they promised 20 minutes. The food arrived cold. We were scheduled to go off for a day of touring, so this was quite inconveninet. In response to our dissatisfaction, though, the $55 breakfast for two charge was "removed" from our account. While the "people" in the hotel are incredibly friendly and helpful, many of the "systems" in the hotel, such as the one designed for check in, failed them. We waited all afternoon to get our room, which was a disappointment as we had paid extra on our air fare to get to Puerto Rico early. A promised upgrade, for which we were paying an additional $150/nite (club level), never materialized. A few mechanical problems also cropped up, such as the door handles falling off the balcony door, and the airconditioning thermostat failing on the first day. BUT: Puerto Rico is WONDERFUL! A GREAT VACATION SPOT! The food was fabulous everywhere we went, and the people bend over backwards to help. It's a very friendly place! Old San Juan is fabulous to walk around in, and there's just so much of interest in other neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ljepotica
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent the long weekend of Feb. 16th at the Ritz and had a remarkable time! I've read many of the reviews before I left and honestly cannot believe some of the people that have negative comments. Either theyre too old to be traveling and should stay home or they must be very demanding (obnoxoius) people! The hotel is second to none. We unfortunately were very delayed due to the snow storm in NY and arrived at 6am. We had to wait for our room to be ready but we were compted a free breakfast ($60) and were upgraded to an ocean view suite. The pool was beautiful but we opted for the beach since there was more of a breeze from the ocean. There were a large amount of children there but I think most of them were in a day camp and even the ones that werent..were no bother. If you like to workout..they offer some good classes which are all included in your resort fee. I ran on the beach one morning which was kinda hard since the sand was so soft but nice nonetheless. We ate breakfast at the restaurant every morning but if you do not want to spend the $ or do not want the continental breakfast they offer..there is a dennys right outside the hotel. We decided to eat at more authentic restaurants so we tried Baru in Old San Juan and it was delicious. We also ate at this small restaurant called UVVA. Its located at a hotel in Ocean Park (about 5 min away) called Numero Uno. It is just like Pamelas but less known and you can eat directly on the beach. Food was great and it was very romantic. All in all the Ritz was great and coming from NY..it was the perfect getaway weekend trip. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in noisy crowded worn out hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: aledo99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Juan. We enjoyed the trip but were disappointed in the atmosphere and condition of the hotel. Worst Ritz Carlton we have ever seen! The new Courtyard Marriott next door is much less crowded, new, and much less expensive! (Usually could not compare a Ritz Carlton to a Courtyard Marriott!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location, service needs a little help.”
Reviews.Author: BigAppleWriter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz in San Juan for 4 nights in January. We took the advice of others here and booked a room on the club level, which was worth the extra $$$. We had a partial view of the ocean, and despite our room facing towards the airport, it was very quiet. (The complaints about the airport, being someone from NYC - are not warranted. You hear a plane every so often but it doesn't take away from the experience). The great - room is beautiful, huge bathroom, housekeeping did a nice job. Gym was nice amenity to have. Pool is gorgeous and grounds are well-kept. Il Mulino and BLT Steak (both on the property) were wonderful dining experiences, and we have both of those restaurants in NYC. They were better in San Juan! Casino was a delight to have nearby, and the dealers were all nice, friendly, and clientele was nice as well. Very easy to get to the hotel from the airport. The club level lounge was perfect. Had breakfast and lunch there every day, and appetizers as well. Breakfast at the regular hotel restaurant is $50 per person for their buffet, so that difference alone is worth the club level! The needs improvement : 1) the spa. Their upstairs quiet waiting area is directly over the lobby where you enter for the gym as well, and it's noisy. The sauna and jacuzzi are co-ed, something I am not comfortable with nor did I expect for a hotel that's a minimum of around $400 a night. I had a swedish massage and it was as if the therapist was giving me tickles and not massages. I asked for a little more pressure but it wasn't great. 2) The pool staff. Before 11:30AM, not a single person came around to take drink/food orders (we wanted fruit and/or bottled water). You had to go to the little tiki bar behind the pool to help yourself. I went around 11AM and waited a full 15 minutes at the bar for someone to help me b/c he made himself look too busy with others and by going in the back. As a side note to the pool staff - there were many of them standing around where you pick up towels, not helping anyone. When you DID get someone to help, you had to flag them down and yell to be sure they wouldn't just rush past you. I've been at other Ritz and other 4-5 star hotels, and they stop in every so often to check on you. Here they did not. Since you are paying a 10% resort fee (around $40-$70 a day) I'd expect more. 3) Mares - Ritz's restaurant with a Friday night seafood buffet. Who serves stone crab claws with NO small seafood forks? Not a single one on the property. Seafood was not well prepared (a buffet with a station to get pasta/seafood to order) and it was an apprentice chef cooking our food. He cranked out 1 dish in the time the chef next to him did 4. ALSO - at Mares, our waiter literally disappeared (we watched him leave the restaurant) after we ate dessert, and waited 20 minutes before getting up and asking another server for our bill. Lastly, that same night -- a hostess from the restaurant staff tracked us down (wrongly) because she said we signed the wrong restaurant bill. it turns out they gave our wrong bill to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Love the Pool & Beach”
Reviews.Author: seew0rld
Reviews.Content: I went down for a weekend for a wedding. The hotel & food is excellent. The area is close to downtown which is near by to everything. The hotel is a bit pricy but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: amirgold
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Ritz and each year they impress me more. This time we went with our now 2 1/2 year old and our 8 month old. Here is a breakdown (I like to write, sorry): Room - We stayed in a Standard room which we were a bit worried about, but got an excellent corporate rate (I would ask for one when you book) for the room. The room was very nice with plenty of towels, flat screen tv, plenty of towels and drawer space. It was a bit smaller than I am used to but that becuase e got 2 double beds, one for us and one for our daughter plus a crib. We found out later that a King room has a pull out twin sofa and more room. They supplied us with a nice Crib at no charge. This really impressed me, the maid came in a knew we had a toddler, next thing I know we had bed gaurds set up. They store your empty luggage too. Pool - Nice pool and only 3 ft deep. I guess this is the only non kid friendly part since there is not shallow 1 ft area for kids, but it was fine since we broght a floatee. Staff always there to set up chairs. Get this, they have pack-n-plays that they will set up for you. Tons of rafts to lie on in the pool. Only other drawback, its a bit chilly when you get in but gets to be refreshing afterwards. Ocean - Probably the best part of the hotel. Clean, great sand, very warm. I didnt expect such a nice beach on the atlantic but it was great. I dont care what anyone says, Ritz has the best beach location in Isla Verde. Plus once again staff there to set up chairs with umbrellas, set you up with pack-n-plays, buckets and shovels, fruit. Plenty of boogie boards, sail boats too. Food - Food was eh. Breakfast buffet got a bit boring after a while, expecially for $25 a pop. Coffee was very weak (I like my Coffee) We ate a few nights at Masa which was also overpriced for the quality. Sushi was good though. Didnt try to gourmet places so cant comment. Casino - Was nice. Fri and Sat nights they have poker which was a good way to spend time. Get a comp. card if you go, I got $50 added to my bill when I left and trust me, i didnt spend that much money or time there. Staff/Service - Excellent! Everything was "My pleasure". Had an issue with a food delivery, got $100 knocked off my bill. Went to breakfast and dinner with my daughter, had portable DVD players brought to us each time with Dora the Explorer, toy balloons..one night they brought her ice cream on the house. I asked for a to go box for breakfast and some water to go, I got a big bottle of Figi water and 2 containers to fill up for the day (one way to save money). They definetly made you and your children feel welcome and pampered. I expecially likle to nightly turn down service with chocolates and more free water. Resort - The nice part of it is that everything is right next to each other, within 2 minute walk you can get from your room to the pool then to the beach. Everything was very clean (I saw them cleaning at 4AM when my daughter woke and I had to roll her back to sleep). Hallways and lobby were always clean. BTW, all of the above amenities were free of charge although you pay a 10% resort fee for it but its nice not to have think about that :) Overall great experience, keep up the good work Ritz! I hope to be back for a 3rd next January.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience; OK for a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Travel2001
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay at the Ritz Carlton. The hotel property was beautiful in true Ritz style. The entry way was grand and the gardens surrounding the pool area were stunning. The pool itself was a nice size and the temperature of the water hovered around the "chilly" mark. The beach was nice with plenty of chairs, umbrellas and hammocks. The workers for the pool and beach area were always very helpful with the exception of the waiter staff for serving up drinks. They were in short supply and we frequently went to the outdoor bar ourselves for our drinks. The spa and fitness center were very nice with full days of scheduled workout classes by the hour starting at 7:00am. The biggest disappointment was that several of the rooms on the property did not have balconies. We were told it was due to the close proximity to the airport and the extreme noise from the planes. We heard only muffled sounds from the airport in our room. However, we heard our neighbors kids and conversations quite clearly in the connecting room. The hotel was very accomodating and moved us right away into a new room. At the Ritz, we dined at Il Mulino which we would highly recommend. The food was good and the service was exceptional. We also dined at Mares which was ok but expensive. The service was not very good. We also dined at the 3rd restaurant, a NY Steakhouse, BLT.The food was good, the price was high, and the setting was not nearly as intimate as Il Mulino. We would recommend the restaurants, Pamela in Condado and Tangerine in Isla Verde for dinner. Also, the bar in the San Juan Beach and Sand Hotel called Liquid was a nice roof top venue which overlooked the ocean and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: LillianLM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Ritz Carlton. We were extremely pleased with this hotel. I let the hotel know when I booked it that it was a special occasion (my husband's 50th birthday) and, on our first evening there, they set up a complimentary bottle of wine and a delicious dessert. The staff really goes out of its way to be friendly and accomodating. We had a few lunches at the beach/pool restaurant and ate dinner at the Mare, the Ritz Carlton's seafood restaurant and these were very good experiences. (There is a good casual restaurant across the street called Metropol, as well as one a few blocks down in a strip shopping center.) At the Ritz-Carlton, there are plenty of available beach chairs, both poolside and on the beach. We booked an off-site catamaran trip through the hotel, which sailed (with about 35 other people) to a small island to snorkel. That trip was well worth the $83 price (about 6 hours on the boat) and included unlimited food and drinks (with rum, if desired). The R-C offers a full day of varied exercise classes, if that's your thing. Francisco's abs and gluts class was a really challaging workout. My only complaint was with the concierge, who only called our room at 7:10 p.m. to let us know that our requested 8:00 pm reservation at the Palm Restaurant at another hotel was unavailable. I made the request at 10:00 a.m. that morning; there was no excuse for hearing back so late of the unavailability of the requested reservation. Also, while it's true that the hotel is right across the street from the airport, I was not bothered by the airport noise, which I thought was minimal. We never ate breakfast at the hotel but walked to Denny's (out the door, to the right, about 1 block down) or to Starbucks (inside the El San Juan Hotel - out the door of the Ritz,, to the right, about three blocks down, but in the hotel.) All in all, we found the Ritz Carlton in San Juan to be a fabulous hotel, which lives up to the Ritz's fine reputation.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Donnercruz
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely nice hotel. The staff go out of their way to take care of you. The prices are extremely high, but you get most of what you pay for. It would be nice if they had more of their food choice from local favorites rather than just American food! We had so many great flavor choices on the island and none of them were here. Room service was excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...bad restaurant....”
Reviews.Author: erinems
Reviews.Content: Definetly a good hotel, but I will not recommend BLT steak. If you will like to eat in a steak house go to next door at The Palm or Morton's at the Caribbe Hilton.(we went there for one of our nights and we loved it!) The Concierge was fabulos!!!! They send us to the best restaurants....of course they are the one that told us to go to Morton's. Just remember if you stay at this property you will love it...but ask the Concierge for their favorites restaurants, if you like the best. Rooms they were Ok, but a little pricy for the space and no balcony. Il Mulino was great! Italian restaurant also inside the hotel. Old San Juan is just 15 to 20 minutes in a taxi $20.00 one way. And the staff at the hotel is great exept for the staff at BLT, because they are a restaurant from NY I'm thinking that the staff and especially the managment is not part of the hotel. I've been to the one in NY but believe me is totally diffrent.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but definately not worth the price they charge”
Reviews.Author: M_Boyd
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Puerto Rico is really nice and the service is amazing, but I would never stay there again if I went back. First of all I wouldn't recommend staying in this area, you're a stones throw away from the airport so while relaxing on the beach you hear the jets taking off and landing. It was a late honeymoon for us and we'd just found out we were expecting and our rate was 710.00 a night and we had read some posts about the hotel being so good at upgrading on special occasions but nothing - we had a view of the airport and the parking lot. The service at the hotel was definately excellent and if you have money to throw away I guess you'd think it was worth it, but for 700.00 a night plus a 10% resort fee you'd think you'd just get something worthwhile there. The continental breakfast in the mornings is 17.00 which is crazy for some fruit and pastries. I personally think the other hotels in that same strip are just as nice and not nearly as pricey. I don't think the Ritz is at all worth the cost unless you can get it online for a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: acctgdweeb001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a one week vacation in Puerto Rico and we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. This hotel is fantastic. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the grounds are immaculate. There are a number of wonderful restaurants in the hotel and there is a great gym which offers a number of exercise classes that my wife enjoyed. While staying there we dined at Il Molino the Italian offering and it was fantastic. There is also a casino on the premises if you enjoy that sort of thing. We did hear a number of guests complain that the slots did not seem to pay very well. There are also a number of other little restaurants within walking distance of the hotel which are a nice break from the $50 breakfasts at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: hate2go
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Ritz in St Thomas twice I was looking forward to my visit to San Juan. This was a step up in my opinion. The staff at this Ritz is wonderful. We stayed in a club level room and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room size is average at this price point, however itâ€™s tastefully decorated and well appointed. The food is very good and the staff repeatedly extended themselves for us. The hotel itself is beautifully maintained and well staffed. We had dinner at the newly opened BLT restaurant. It was very good, however I have been to better steak houses here in Chicago for around the same price. It was packed and appeared to be the new place in town to visit. My husband thought that the hotel property itself was a little narrow. Itâ€™s not as large as other beach resorts in the Caribbean, however I imagine that property is at a prime here. I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning. If you can visit El Yunque National Park itâ€™s beautiful and worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Ritz San Juan”
Reviews.Author: aristophanesny
Reviews.Content: We (group of couples) have been going down to the RC at San Juan and consistently find it outstanding. The rooms were big and clean and feature flat screen tvs and all the amenities you would need. Bathrooms are big. Housekeeping was very good. The grounds are very well taken care of. Beautiful resort. Pool is very nice and large (Never seen it crowded) and the beach is also very nice. One really nice thing about this hotel is it is very "cozy". Everything is very close, the pool, the beach, the gym, etc and yet it does not feel cramped at all. The gym / spa are excellent. Massages are top notch and the facility is very clean. My wife took many classes at the gym while we were there. I took a tennis clinic with Miguel and really enjoyed it. It was hard to book time with him for lessons so do in advance. We ate at BLT and it was awesome. Food and service were great. Skipped Mulino's. Interesting where they put Mulino's. It is located in the casino where the big screen tv / bar used to be. Kind of a bummer that the bar is no longer there. It was nice when you wanted to take a break from the tables, plus on Sunday's you could watch the football games there. They made a lounge upstairs, but its out of the way and I never saw anybody in it my whole stay (I think they should have put Mulino's upstairs). Did I mention the casino ? In all would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jaxlax90
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Ritz Carlton PR. We stayed on the Club Floor, if you can please upgrade and stay on the club floor. The food and service from the staff are well worth the extra price. Overall great 5 Star hotel, the only negative was the slow service by the pool. Thanks again to everyone who worked in the club floor lounge. Definitely the nicest hotel in PR!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Relaxing Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Intro: My family always travels to Puerto Rico for thanksgiving weekend. We used to go to the El San Juan, but that place is falling apart, so we decided to try the Ritz, and we had one of the best vacations of all time. Everything was absolutely perfect. They have thought of everything you could possibly want and did that and more. The staff will cater to your every need and give you a smile every which way you turn. We got lost when we first arrived finding the elevator, so instead of being given directions, we were escorted to it. The staff truly sets a Ritz-Carlton apart. Rooms/Housekeeping: We had a junior suite and double room. Both were spotless and had the most comfortable bedset I have ever felt at a hotel, and I travel often. They were both ocean view, so the view out into the Atlantic was fascinating and serene. The rooms come with a huge flat screen TV and include little amenities like slippers and bathrobes. The bathroom is amazing; they are huge and again have really comfortable towels. The lotions are all European, and the showerhead is also like a massage. Housekeeping is done twice daily, and whenever you need them you can call. The turndown service is great before you come back to your room. I accidentally broke a glass one night at 1am, and I called for them to clean it up, they were in my room 10 minutes later sweeping. Pool/Beach The pool is a freeform pool with spitting lions and it is huge. They provide rafts for their guests in the pool. The only problem during the stay however was getting chairs poolside; you had to be down by 7:30am to get chairs together, which was annoying. However, the resort was full. When you do get a chair however, they are really comfy. Again little touches make the difference here, they bring around cold towels and provide iced water with oranges for your convince. The pool boys also bring around dry towels in the afternoon. The ocean was super clean and really warm water. Dining Like most nice resorts, food is really expensive here but you expect it. I ate at all three of the restaurants in the hotel, the Caribbean Grill, Il Mulino and BLT Steak. Caribbean Grill is mostly seafood, I had the ravioli and the portion was really small but really good. Il Mulino is some of the best Italian food that can be ordered and the staff there is extremely helpful and friendly. BLT Steak is opening November 28, but we were of a selected test crowd for a soft opening, the food was again out of this world, and the atmosphere is great. Casino The Caribbean is great as the gambling age is 18. Casino here is again really nice. Lots of table games, ranging from high limit to some low limit. However, be forewarned the slots pay AWFUL here (as they do in most of the Caribbean.) Free drinks, grilled cheese, chicken sandwiches and soups in the casinos for players. Conclusion: An absolutely amazing resort that provided a relaxing weekend. I cannot wait to return to next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 9brady
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our honeymoon here recently. The Ritz is in a great location on the beach and in walking distance to other great hotels and restaurants. As always, we found the service to be top-notch, especially on the club level. Staff members remembered our names throughout our stay. The beach and pool areas are beautiful. We found little reason to leave the hotel more than a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel OK location”
Reviews.Author: bullwrinkles
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Ritz. The hotel is very clean and the pool area is beautiful. The beach is small but nice enough. The people who work here are very friendly and try to do their best. Yes they could use a couple more waiters on the beach. You almost feel sorry for the two that are running around to accomodate everyone. Just dont go to the beach thirsty. Stop by the lobby entrance everyday they provide a super tastey fruit juice. We had dinner at Il Mulino and it was pretty much exactly like the Il Mulino in Chicago, New york etc. I made a reservation through the hotel but upon arriving they didn't have it? Not surprised by this because truthfully the hotel seemed alittle mismanaged. Asked the concierge 4 diffrent time to help me set up a trip to Culebra and each time they told me they would call me and never did. I finally set it up for myself. By the way for 60bucks a person on a short flight (Isla nena fajardo airport) it was worth it. beautiful beach soft white sand clear blue water. Just be sure to bring off the mosquitos are crazy there! For a nite out go to Old San Juan theres a lot more happening there. The Ritz dies down pretty early at nite. For premium shopping hit Condado this is a beautiful area with alot of construction going on but it is nice for daytime walking around. Cafe De Angel is a great spot for lunch with super food at reasonable prices. The Ritz is great. San Juan is ok. Not to muchto do in San Juan but gamble. You will have to leave that area to really enjoy Puerto Rico. One final warning do not go to Lupi's (down the street from the Ritz) it is gross. The worst Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. Never got past the fake guacamole(they say is fresh) to order anymore.

Reviews.Title: “the ritz san juan - the real deal”
Reviews.Author: pagination
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the ritz in san juan. We selected the ritz in san juan because we wanted to relax at close beach location. Overall i thought the rooms were nice however we could hear our neighbors every night. the service was good but not the best i've experienced. the grounds were a let down. the beach was just ok. i think i selected the wrong beach destination. the food at the hotel was good but limited. like any hotel you will want to leave the grounds to get a great meal at a proper price. o/a not a bad experience. would i stay here again for a vacation? probably not. if you're in san juan for business then i would say this is ideal for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough Discounted.”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINGLIFE
Reviews.Content: Next review (see Carimar, Holland House, Grand Case) Well, Ritz-Carlton ummm it has a beautiful lobby with a lot of good property amenities best of all it has a GYM AND SPA and thank goodness we didn't have to pay extra for the gym but at $400/night I guess a gym pass is expected. The beach was okay but everyone seems to enjoy the pool a great deal. This hotel is fabulous at a discounted price it is worth exactly half the price I would only go back at $200/night and if they assured me that my do not disturbed sign would be respected. I DISLIKED EL CONQUISTADOR and Ritz might be the best accommodations in San Juan and there lies the trap. The atmosphere did scream vacation with (CoquÃ­ - little frog) singing to you at the front of the hotel (I believe it is a recording) but nice. A few restaurants, concierge, high tea, and the spa helps to make your stay enjoyable. The room was spacious but best of all THE BATHROOM WAS LOVELY. I like certain basic amenities and usually won't stay at a hotel if they don't have them and the Ritz did: 1. Pull out wall mirror in bathroom 2. Big spacious marble counter tops for all my jewelry, perfumes, jels, lotions and potions (smile) makeup etc..... 3. Shelf space in the shower and a shower line to hang towels and undies to dry. 4. Spacious bathroom with beautiful tiles. 5. Toilet separate (with a phone) 7. BATHROOM SCALE 8. Toiletries (I bring my own but Ritz was one of the two I actually would recommend for use). (Hilton's Resource spa) One BIG PEEV: Cleaning crew kept coming into my room even though I had a do not disturb sign. I usually have my things laid out just right and I don't like folks messing with that but some how my sign would disappear and in they would come, luckily I was in the room every time and sent them packing (smile). Spoke with security 5 different times (head of security even came to my room) and they would assure me but house keeping would still come in. They tried to say there might be some kids playfully removing the sign but I never saw or heard any children. They never offered any gift of apology for all the times it happened. I am glad I was there each time (at least that I was aware of) and none of my jewelry came up missing.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could be a mystery shopper”
Reviews.Author: bartleby2006
Reviews.Content: Some background - My girlfriend and I booked a 3 night trip on Expedia after changing our original destination, so we were offered a special room rate that included a pool view and breakfast buffet for $313. This is the off-season. Off-season runs from September to November. It's only natural to list the complaints. At the end, I'll list the positives. 1. The initial check-in offered some confusion as the front staff did not recognize the free breakfast buffet. To correct this, it required a call to Expedia and then a return to the front staff. 2. There was some initial confusion checking in. Bell boys would just rush up to you and ask if you were checking in. There wasn't really any attentiveness; it just seemed more like aggression. For example, I stepped out for a second to answer an important cell phone call and the same bellboy that took my baggage initially rushed up to me again without any awareness that I was on the phone and asked if I needed any help. And then while I was talking on the phone off to the side, I was aggressively approached by another bell boy and again asked if I needed any help. And then when I walked back inside, I was rushed at once again by a third worker and asked if I was checking in. It was all strange behavior. There was also some confusion about my luggage. I was told that it was in storage because we had arrived early but when I went to answer my cell outside I noticed that it was left outside on the side where it could easily have been stolen. 3. There was a large stain in the carpet outside our room door. It was there when we arrived. It was never cleaned up. 4. The mattress in the room had a bed that sagged very badly, especially on the right side. You could see the bed sagging severely. This bad mattress hurt our backs (we tried switching places). 5. The casino is a bit on the cheap side. We had to wait two hours so that we could get refunded on a $27 ticket from the auto-cash machine. Apparently, they just installed new auto-cash machines that will refund your money for tickets but they were having problems with the software. One machine wouldn't take my tickets because I had folded them. The machine in question did not give me $27 -- and just flashed over and over that it was out of order and that I would have to wait for the operator. We ended up waiting 2 hours for the manager to refund us (You can't just leave the auto-cash machine, you have to stay near it.) The manager said that they had many complaints about the machine not working but they only put up an out of order sign 2 days after the incident. No compensation was given to us for having to wait, except for a sweet sandwich. The manager said that the only person allowed to offer compensation was the CFO of the hotel; so good luck to anyone that has any issues in the casino. Don't just ask for the manager, ask for the CFO! 6. This is the off-season, but there does seem to be some cheating going on by the taxi drivers who service the Ritz. For example, we were given a ticket by the taxi dispatcher at the airport that said the trip from the airport to the hotel would cost $10.50. However, when we got to the hotel, the taxi driver tried to ask for $15.00. Even after we showed the driver the ticket, she attempted to argue that we still owed her $15.00. She tried to say that she did not speak or read English. We only had 1 piece of luggage with us. I know this sounds strange but I wouldn't have mentioned it unless there were two other instances of overcharging. We had asked the concierge how much it would cost to take a taxi from the hotel to the Bicardi Rum Factory and the concierge told us $20 to 25. However, when we took the taxi, the driver asked us for $35 when arrived at the factory. And when we took the taxi back, the only available drivers asked for $40. We didn't have much of a choice, so we paid the fare. We reported all the above incidents to the Puerto Rico transportation department. I have a feeling that the overcharges were due to us staying at the Ritz so be careful. We've stayed in Puerto Rico before (4 times) but never at the Ritz and have never been overcharged on taxi rides before. 7. The Ritz-Carlton accidentally revealed the industry rate that the charge Expedia when they charged us $244 in our folio. You can check your account through the tv -- I would strongly advise anyone to do this staying at any hotel. We disputed the fees as soon as we found out, rather than waiting until we checked out. Remember, we had originally booked this vacation via Expedia, so Expedia charges us, not them. The front staff took the charge off but they also revealed what they charge Expedia ($244) and the difference that Expedia profits in the markup ($69). This didn't help us out in getting any type of discount (we were on the phone with Expedia for at least an hour) but it does reveal that there's a lot of cannabilizing of hotel rates going on -- not only for the customers who pay the full $500 rate directly throught he Ritz but even for the Expedia customers who think they are getting a good deal. One Expedia rep told us that 50% of the 500 rooms at the Ritz went through Expedia. The same rep also acknowledged that the Ritz in San Juan was under close watch by Expedia due to "billing irregularities." 8. The food is average and overpriced. But that wouldn't be so bad if they offered some healthier choices -- including low-fat, low-cholesterol, or diabetic-friendly foods. Diabetes in particular is a national epidemic; especially among Latinos. So it's strange that the Ritz isn't health-conscious in this regard. Positives: 1. Rooms are nice. We got a nice room for a great rate (or a better rate than initially expected). Nice flat screen thin panel lcd televisions. A little discrepency in that there are more channels offered on the tvs in the gym than in the hotel rooms. Housekeeping is great. Nice front staff, nice casino staff, nice food staff. Everyone tries really hard. There are a lot of good bell boys to make up for the other ones that are mindless. 2. Food is overpriced but not that overpriced. You can get a Caeser salad for $11; a burger with fries for $15. We're from NYC so those prices seem within line. 3. Casino is bright and clean and slot machines seem new. 4. A lot of really great shells can be found on the beach. One of the best beaches for shell collectors anywhere in the world. 5. The entire hotel is very romantic and beautiful at night. It really shines then... the pools, the beach, etc. 6. Gym staff is alert and attentive and friendly. You can get free complimentary bottles of water, menthol-infused towels, and headphones. Gym equipment was great. And like I said earlier, you can get more tv channels in the gym than you can in your hotel room. 7. Business center with Internet connected computers is free.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: texashookum
Reviews.Content: Well reading the reviews about the Atlantis in the bahamas made me look for a alternative vacation, so I thought why not puerto rico its non-stop from chicago no change of planes no hassles thru customs but I have never been. I read the reviews of the Ritz and said why not well my wife said it was her best vacation yet and we go to Hawaii every year. We spent three nights and all were fun and relaxing, took in the spa and the pool not very crowded, to in the weight room and trainer services, part of resort fee but paid that thru expedia. If you are looking for first class treatment take a few days and go to the Ritz in Puerto Rico you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A memorabe experience”
Reviews.Author: amazingrace214
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this was our 1st time staying at a Ritz property. It was beautiful. There is staff EVERYWHERE, willing to help and open doors, and let you off the elevator first, and get you whatever you need and call you by your name. We came over after staying at Embassy Suites, which was a great great great hotel as well. I believe that the atmosphere here is a bit stuffy, with a lot of roaming business people who tend to make the ambiance pretty tense. When walking into the $22 p/person breakfast buffet (which was pretty good), we were sort of looked down upon. The stares we got by other guests were not at all friendly. Being from New York, it was very easy for us to laugh it off though. But it was still a very uncomfortable feeling for both my boyfriend and I. Anyway, the pool is absolutely breathtaking. Those chairs will put you right to sleep. Fresh citrus water and fruits were always available to keep you cool. The Ritz's private beach is a few steps from the pool and is just as beautiful. Since its a private beach, it is one the best places to relax. Go Kayaking or sailing. It is included with your stay and since you're on vacation, make the most of it. Don't forget to relax on the hammoks too. Although food is expensive, you have to expect it when you stay here. We ate at the hotel only once for the breakfast. We also ate at Denny's 1 day which was just around the corner. Plaza las Americas was a 15min. ride and perfect if it happens to rain. Some of the staff is friendly, while some offer their services with a fake smile...we tried to joke around to relax some of them, but I guess they are just not used to it. All in all, I think I would stay here again but only for an anniversary or special occasion. Despite the weird stares and tense atmosphere, it is a beautiful hotel, and the rooms definintly make you feel like royalty. I agree with 1 review, the water pressure wasn't all that high. But the robe and marble counters and floors made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know what 5-star means!!”
Reviews.Author: NJ2Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan from Friday, 9/29 until Monday, 10/2. The service was head and shoulders above any other hotel we have stayed at. The location is very near the airport but that enabled us to enjoy more time there during our short weekend stay. We heard the airplanes but, even though our room faced the airport, they never woke us up or bothered us. The casino was fun and very laid back if you are used to Vegas or Atlantic City -- slow dealers, free drinks and food! One MINOR complaint; the water pressure in our room was terrible. Others we traveled with said the same thing. If you want better (but still not great) shower pressure, use the shower in the spa/fitness center. Yes, drinks and food are expensive. For me, a $15 ocean-front hamburger was part of the experience and we had budgeted for it. There are plenty of options within walking distance (we enjoyed Edith's, between the Ritz and the El San Juan).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip - Unforgettable Time”
Reviews.Author: nonnarosie
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton-SanJuan Puerto Rico - July 31st to August 5th. Absolutely marvelous. Where do I start. The minute we walked in the door we knew we were in for the time of our life. From the beginning to the end it was a vacation of a lifetime. The room, the pool, the dining rooms were absolutely mangificient. We were treated like royalty by each and every staff member we encountered. The "gentlemen" at the pool bringing over towels and/or drinks if needed were so polite. The waitresses/waiters in the restaurants or at the pool area again could not do enough for you. Each and every time you needed something there was always a person taking care of you with a smile on their face. The spa was so great - just relaxing to lay in the whirlpool after a day at the pool. We went to dinner at the hotel which was unforgettable, but we mostly stayed right in the pool area and only went to the rainforest, Casa Baccardi and Old SanJuan. That took us two days and the rest of the days we stayed right at the hotel, never wanting to leave. The hotel staff made if very comfortable and exciting to be there. The hotel itself was very condusive to relaxation. Why would you want to leave paradise to go anywhere else. The staff on the concerige floor could not be more helpful. Anything we needed or wanted was at our fingertips. They even helped us in making reservations for dinner out of the hotel and they printed our boarding passes for us. What else could anyone ask for. Would we go back - you can believe that if in San Juan this is the only place we would be staying. There was not one thing that did not make us happy - this was absolutely the best vacation ever and if anyone would like us to tell about it we would be happy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Elle08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton San Juan for two night during Labor Day Weekend. The hotel and service was fantastic. We loved it. The property is beautiful. We had an oceanview room and didn't hear any airport noise. The view was beautiful and it didn't even seem like we were near the airport. There was live music in the bar which was a nice touch as well. I also enjoyed the spa which was outstanding. They gave us a glass of wine with the pedicure service which was pretty nice. I had one of their signature body treatments the Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage and it was outstanding. The spa service is top notch. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. I've stayed at other hotels in the surrounding area and they don't hold a candle to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for airplane noise and slow service”
Reviews.Author: novatravelreview
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say that I've stayed in over a dozen Ritz Carltons worldwide as a result of my frequent business travel. I've also stayed at several other fine hotels including the Four Seasons, St. Regis, etc. If you are used to staying in these type of hotels then please read this review VERY carefully. 1) The hotel is located smack under the main airport. This means 2 things - noisy airplanes taking off over the beach while you relax and dumping jet fumes all over you it also means that "city view" rooms are "runway view". Even the double pane glass does not drown out the noise completely. 2) While the staff is incredibly friendly, they also act as if they are on vacation. Don't expect to be asked for a drink more than once per hour at the beach and dont expect any sort of real service at the lobby lounge bar. The table next to use had to go flag a waitress after waiting 20 minutes. She said she would be right there. 10 minutes later she still was not there and the couple go up and left. The best service is at the beach side grill, but don't expect too much. 3) While you expect to pay a premium for food and ammenities at the Ritz Carlton, this Ritz has taken it to another level. $18 for a "Ritz Burger" which tasted like a frozen beef patty. $7 for 2 pieces of sushi at the sushi bar. While the sushi was fresh they cut very small pieces that barely covered the rice...COME ON, for $3.50 per piece you could cut some fish!! 4) The concierge is not knowlegeable. We asked to book a trip to a neighboring island. It took about 45 minutes for the lady to find out that there were no travel tours because it was "off season". We also asked which restaurant would have a sunday brunch. The concierge pointed us to the Ritz Carribean Grill which of course did not have a brunch when we got there. 5) We returned to our room the second night and our entire floor including the room smelled like a bathroom. Very gross. Also, the room next to ours had a party going on at midnight which was very loud and the smell of marijuana poured through the door between our room and theirs. When we brought our issues to the attention of the staff they changed our room from a pool/beach view to a runway/city view. I asked if this was their normal way of doing business - to downgrade their disatissfied customers. I was simply told that they were sold out, which I did not believe judging by the number of hotel room lights that were on at night. 6) The casino is very stingy. Our friend was playing $25 chips on blackjack for almost 2 hours and she never got offered a drink once. When I tried to flag down a waitress she pretended not to see. 7) One day there was a parade outside the Ritz (a city organized event). About 2/3 of the hotel staff decided they were going to go watch.....I'm not sure who was on vacation, the guests or the staff? Conclusions - if you are used to staying at 5 star hotels then stay away from the Ritz. If you are not but want a true 5 star hotel experience then also stay away from the Ritz. All the marble and friendly staff in the world cannot make up for their disorganized and poorly run hotel My recommendations - If you want to be near the airport, we looked at the Hotel San Juan, this hotel was much nicer and much more classy. The pool was very impressive and the beach does not face the runway. If you want to stay somewhere nice for vacation in puerto rico, and don't care about the airport being near you - stick with the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Love going there”
Reviews.Author: My_Visit
Reviews.Content: We've gone twice in the past year for 3 and 4-day weekends and loved it. The service is just exceptional and worth the money. It's perfect for us when we want to get away for a few days and just relax on the beach or by the pool. The rates include activities on the beach, which is great since you don't have to deal with payments for everything you do. Spa, pool side, and beach services were fantastic. Definitely helped to call in advance to make spa appointments. One of the weekends we went was easter weekend, and it was packed with children. It was cute for a few minutes, but it too loud and busy to relax by the pool. Since we're looking for quiet, now we know to stay away on US holidays. But it was good to know that the resort had a kid-friendly space and activities for them.

Reviews.Title: “Just as we expected from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jemill00
Reviews.Content: Physically, we have just returned from the beautiful Ritz-Carlton in San Juan, mentally, we're still there. It's a beautiful property in an area that could use some upgrading. We arrived for a long overdue anniversary trip and were greeted at the front desk with complimentary champagne and best wishes from the helpful staff. The room actually consisted of two rooms separated by French doors. One was a living room with a flat panel TV on the wall across from a sofa bed, a desk which became a computer desk with high speed internet and half bath. The bedroom also had a flat panel TV, dressing area, double sink, private toilet and a separate tub and oversized shower. Our next interaction with the staff was the night turn-down maid. She called me by name even though we checked in only an hour before. She got ice and took a can of pineapple juice we bought on the way from the airport to open it so we could drink our Bacardi Coco. The second night when we came back to the room, the bed was turned down and rose petals were left on the bed in the shape of a heart. What a touch! Needless to say, service was impeccable. The grounds were amazing. The grass was perfectly manicured though I never saw groundskeepers. The pool area was great as was the beach. It was clean; chairs were available, as were hammocks. The only negative, though totally expected, was the prices. The fifty minute couplesâ€™ massage was $310, including tip. The one lunch we had on the property was $75 for an appetizer, wrap, small pizza, beer and mojito. The mojito was $14. One related positive note that caught us by surprise was we had an included amount for breakfast. We didnâ€™t realize this until our fourth day. Ahhhâ€¦a lost opportunity. The breakfast was teriffic. The bottom line is I would return and I would recommend this property to anyone that is willing to spend a few extra dollars for the many extras. Donâ€™t forget, the resort fee is 10% of your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sevice Joe clifton, NJ”
Reviews.Author: jovis10
Reviews.Content: While very impressed with the overall service of the hotel and would definitly return, not all was as planned. Upon our arrivall our room was not as we had ordered (king, balcony, ocean veiw) we had received a double, pool view, no balcony, ok. We spoke with management and decided on waiting until the next day for our room. Once in our new room it was heaven. Food as you read and I did as well was expensive in the hotel, and dont fall into the continental breakfast pitfall, as i was under the impression it was included with my room through my booking with Amex it want and let me tall you it wasnt cheap I had taost and some fruit that was $40.00. I ordered the morning before a full out breakfast with pancakes bacon eggs and it only cost me 32.00 so choice wisely. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: bobnmolly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at The Ritz Carlton in San Juan. Let me tell you what a beautifully maintained property it is. We were amazed at how clean everything is and how many people are working constantly around you!!! We took our two children, aged 6 and 9. They loved the Ritz Kids Club. It is pricey, but they went two afternoons and one evening. They went to the pool, went to the beach, played games, did arts and crafts... They loved the staff and had to be pulled away each time. We had a pool view room on the club level. What an amazing view. We were upgraded from city view (which is actually airport view) I called the hotel three days before check in and had a nice friendly conversation with a front desk clerk and requested it. Upon arrival, they told us that we would receive the upgrade, but that the room would not be ready as they could not evict the previous occupants!!! They were very gracious and gave us an interim room on the club level and paid for our lunch at the poolside restaurant. When our room was ready, they called us and gave us our keys and we were set. Great service!!!! The room had luxurious bath towels, and Bulgari shampoos and a soft bathrobe. The club level was well worth it. We ate breakfast and lunch there everyday. We only ate dinner out and saved tons of money!!! The breakfasts had juices, fresh fruit, danishes, toast, bagels, hard boiled eggs, meats and cereals. Plenty!!!! The lunches were soups, salads and different sandwhiches. They had huge freshly baked cookies that we ate daily! After dinner we would go to the club for coffee and desert. The club staff looked after us so well and went out of their way to help us with everything. We went to see the Caribe Hilton, the Marriott and the InterContinental. None of the grounds or beaches compared to the Ritz. The lobbies were also not as luxurious as the Ritz'. The service at the hotel was impeccable. We met the friendliest and kindest staff that went out of their way everyday to say hello to us and help make our stay pleasant. We loved the frest fruit and complimentary bottled water by the beach and pool. We had a wonderful time and are counting the days till we can go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Margaret100
Reviews.Content: What a lovely vacation spot, we truly enjoyed our time at this hotel!! The staff were approachable, attentive and ensured we were well taken care of. The hotel is right on the beach so our biggest decision each day was wether to go to the beach or the pool!! Great stay, we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz was fabulous, especially....”
Reviews.Author: flojos
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door we were in Heaven!!! The staff catered to our every whim. The only disappointment was the size of the casino, it was pretty limited. Also, we booked a daytour with a local American named Mike [---------------] who provided us with a private tour in his new car. We enjoyed an intimate, yet entertaining tour to many of the important sites in Puerto Rico. Another good point was the proximity to nice restaurants, shops, and casinos. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, clean beach”
Reviews.Author: littlemama_n_va
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 26 through the 31st and this was the best hotel I have stayed at in Puerto Rico right under the Conquistador. What would make me choose this hotel over the El Conquistador is the location and the beach. Also, the pool was magnificent! The beach is super clean, except for a little seasonal seaweed in some spots. The only issue we had with our room, which overlooked the pool and the ocean, was that one of our beds was not that clean. But we brought this to the attention of the staff and they very quickly took care of it. The bathroom is not that big but very modern and clean with large mirrors and marble countertops. We enjoyed the high speed internet in our room, I brought my laptop. and the flat screen was a plus. This hotel is so quiet, the rooms are pretty much sound proof. Great for that kind of vacationer, if you want to party you will need to walk to some of the nearby lounges and night spots.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler109
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this wonderful hotel/resort. We were amazed when we checked in a walked into our 10 floor ocean view room. The view and the room were great! The beach service - chair set up, etc was terrific. While I will agree that the drinks are a little pricey, part of the fun is sitting on the beach and having it delivered to you. We did enjoy heading to the El San Juan for evening entertainment, as the Ritz was a little more subdued - however it was great to return to the quiet after a LOUD evening of live music someplace else! I would highly recommend staying at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilsanti
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at The Ritz Hotel and in my book its a five star hotel. I reside in Puerto Rico and stayed in various hotels in the island as well as in the states and this hotel tops them all. The service here is excellent with attentive and friendly staff always looking to please the guests. The rooms are spacious with king or queen size beds with a large plasma TV and spacious bathroom with enough towels along with shampoo, soap, conditioner a scale and hair blower. There is also a business desk with phone and Internet connection along with an extra chair at desk. I was even delivered the local newspaper in English. The pool is fabulous, very spacious with enough cushioned chairs, towels and umbrellas. There was cold water for drinking and fruits for snacking. The staff always-attentive taking orders for restaurant. Beach is accessible from pool with chairs and umbrellas although beach water is not clear with some seaweed. Hotel is close to airport so expect noise from planes landing and taking off. The restaurants are expensive but there are fast food restaurants walking distance away. Enjoyed my stay here along with my wife and daughter of fourteen who told me she wants to stay here again. I most certainly will! HS

Reviews.Title: “gold standard”
Reviews.Author: jhh
Reviews.Content: 9th stay at this hotel, have stayed at many Ritz Carlton Hotels, this one is like staying with family, great casino, perfect beach and fantastic culture, have booked again for this November

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz was Great !!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrismigs65
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids, (12 and 9), and I stayed at the Ritz from July 15-22. In short, if this isn't a 5 star hotel, I don't know what is. Let me get the negatives out of the way first, so I can focus on all the positives: -Location: It's near the airport, you will hear planes while outside and probably if you have a room not facing the pool or beach -Beach: The water isn't as blue as Cancun or Aruba, but you can't blame the Ritz for that, it's combed every day, but there's some seaweed in the water -Price: Food and drink is priced at a resort rate...expensive. Breakfast buffet $17 per person, lunch by the pool consistently cost $75 for 4, a Vodka tonic $9...this added up over a 7 day stay. Now the positives: -The Staff: In short, they are the nicest bunch of people, always trying to help make your stay a nice one, always doing extra to assist you -The room: House cleaning 2x a day, thorough, willing to leave extra waters and chocolates at turndown service -The concierge: Efficient, never steered us wrong, understood how to direct a family to the best possible dining and attractions -The pool: Clean, not crowded (even on a weekend with the hotel full) All the little details were great. Complimentary fresh squeezed orange juice in the lobby, water and fruit by the pool, refrigerated washcloths in the workout facility. This is a first class hotel. I walked thru the Intercontinental Hotel and cannot believe the Ritz is not rated higher than that place. A few other notes: -I was not charged a resort fee even though AAVacations said I was subject to one...this saved me at least $200 -We ate every breakfast at a place called Piu Bello...it was a 5 minute walk from the hotel, excellent food, and very reasonably priced. They also served lunch (very good) and had GREAT Gellato. In short, I would go back to the Ritz, but probably for a long weekend or without the kids. As nice as the hotel was, it's really not geared to kids over the age of 5...but if you want to impress the wife with a long weekend away, this is the place in San Juan for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is the best hotel in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: LBashir
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 1 week stay in Puerto Rico and the Ritz was fabulous! I can clearly say its by far the best hotel on the whole island. The service is excellent, you are treated like royalty from the second you walk in. The spa was great, and the concierge very helpful (they helped make great suggestions, try Aguaviva in Old san juan!) The restaurants at the hotel are wonderful as well. We ate at Prime 787 which was very comaprable if not better than the best steak houses back home with impecibale service (they even wrote us a thank you note!) We also had the famed seafood buffet which was spectacular. Granted, the location is a bit weird, literally right next to the airport, but honestly who cares when the hotel is so nice. If you are going to Puerto Rico, stay here, trust me you can't go wrong with the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “How is this not a 5 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mmislove
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review ever since we got back from San Juan near the end of May. We almost didn't go to this jewel of a hotel because of a few negative reviews we had read on this site, which I'd always found quite helpful in the past (There were many wonderful reviews which thankfully we used to finally make the booking). So, after having spent nothing less than a glorious week there, I can only assume these reviews I read were written by either some local competition, out of some act of desperation, or by some very spoiled people who don't know how to enjoy themselves. We can't think of one moment, or one employee, or one venue which wasn't "world class". The restaurants, our room, the casino, the pool and spa....all terrific. And the staff, from front desk to room service, were nothing short of fantastic. And, it's not as if my wife and I haven't travelled a lot, because we have. And this hotel is world class, all the way from arrival to departure. We couldn't reccomend it more highly. Okay, it's not cheap, but boy is it worth the money. PS: Spend a little more and stay on the "club floor". You won't regret it for a moment. We're counting the days until we can return. Michael NYC

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: prczar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a great escape for our Anniversary and the Ritz Carlton was just the place! We stayed on the Club Level and the employees could not do enough to please. They were amazing, as was the hotel. We never had a problem with a too crowded beach or pool. Everyone was so accomodating and friendly. Visit El Morro and tour the fort in Old San Juan..beautiful views. We can recommend these places to eat: Tantra in Old San Juan..a belly dancer while you dine, lots of fun! Also, go to the Rainforest, El Yunque and hike to the waterfalls..lovely. Eat at Bebo's Cafe for tru ePuerto Rican fare and at Pamela's for a romantic restaurant on the beach, not far from the Ritz. Enjoy!!! If you can, stay on the Club Level, it was top of the line amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Ritzy”
Reviews.Author: Bilteach
Reviews.Content: We took our family of 8 (three in their 20's) to P.R. for a 4 nite stay at the Ritz. Everyone had a great time!!!! The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. We rented a mini van and hotel parking was tight but very convenient. We did not have the noise factor that someone else complained about and there were lots of restaurants within walking distance. We recommend "Platos" for true authentic Puerto Rican food - large portions at good prices! The "LemonGrass" restaurant was pricy but the food was excellent and not too far from the hotel. Wished the stay was longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: acptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz June 23rd-28th, 2006. Don't listen to the reviews telling you not to stay at the Ritz. It is an excellent hotel with top-notch service, especially in comparison with the other hotels San Juan has to offer. We arrived in San Juan and checked in at the El San Juan (hotel next to Ritz) - at 3 am, with music still blaring from the pool deck keeping my husband and I awake, I called the Ritz and booked the rest of our vacation with them. We got to the hotel at 10:30am, and we're treated like royalty from the first minute we stepped out of the taxi. They took our baggage, insisted we eat a delicious breakfast, and had us in our room when we arrived! You are in Puerto Rico and if you have any cultural experience, you should know what to expect. It's not Hawaii, but that's not why you should go there. I've stayed in nicer Ritz's, but I've also paid A LOT more. You won't find a better hotel in Puerto Rico, and it's still a wonderful resort. Food was great at all restaurants - especially Prime 787. If we return to San Juan, we'll be staying here, hands down, there is no contest.

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Rainy Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned back from a 5 day / 4 night stay at the Ritz Carlton San Juan. I enjoyed the Ritz Carlton, as it was clean, the staff was friendly, the location was convenient to the airport (7 minutes), and convenient to Old San Juan (a must see!). The hotel grounds were beautiful! I was prepared for the food to be expensive (from reading other reviews), and yes it was! Unfortunately, it was only average tasting food. The cost.......$45.00-$55.00 for lunch for 2-3 people. I went across the street to THE METROPOL restaurant (a recommendation from reading other reviews) and ate there our last night in San Juan. Better value for your money, and the Pina Colada's are just as good, and cheaper. The cost of a Pina Colada at THE METROPOL $7.00 The cost at The Ritz $14.00 Because it was close to the Airport, we could definitely hear the noise from the planes taking off. I did not like that. The Beach - It was very clean. The water was nice. It was a little cloudy, and somewhat clear, but not crystal clear like Cancun, or Jamaica, or the Bahamas We went in to Old San Juan. That was probably the highlight of the trip (due to the weather) It was fun walking up and down the cobblestone streets, and shopping. (Girls.....if you like Coach and Dooney & Burke...there are outlet stores there, with good prices.) We also toured El Morro Fort which was nice. The view of the bay is great from there. The Weather - It rained way too much for me, considering it was the middle of June. That definitely put a damper on the activities. It was gloomy for 1 entire day of my stay. The Spa - I had a good massage there. The prices are about average (I am from LA). They include the gratuity in the cost of the massage. Overall, nice getaway. Would I stay at the Ritz again? Only if I wanted to stay in San Juan again. If, and when I ever go back to Puerto Rico, I would stay further East, towards Luquillo, or Farjado.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ATR25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan in January 2005 for a long birthday weekend. I had been to Puerto Rico numerous times prior and had yet to stay in San Juan. We stayed for four nights/five days and overall the stay was just OK. The lobby was nice, yet small, compared to the other hotels I've stayed at in Puerto Rico. The pool was lovely as was the beach. The proximity of the rooms to the beach was convenient. The rooms were rather boring, nothing special. First we had to switch out of our first room because it smelled terrible. We later learned you could hear nearly EVERYTHING going on in the rooms next to us. This was problematic. There wasn't even a balcony which I've had everywhere else while visiting Puerto Rico. This was disappointing given the lack of seating in the lobby. There really wasn't anywhere just to go and read a book if all of the pool and beach chairs were taken if you had an hour to kill. Given that we visited mid-January there were typical mid-day rain showers every day. It would pour for about 30-40 minutes and then the sun would return. We were irritated because maid service would be cleaning our room during this time and they were doing construction around the few chairs in the lobby so we weren't allowed to sit there. There was literally no where to go during these brief showers. Unlike other hotels who have tons of indoor space and seating just to relax and possibly go if it is raining the Ritz Carlton doesn't have a back up plan for their guests in case of rain. The food was pretty good yet overpriced as one could imagine. The night of my birthday they delivered a special birthday platter to my room containing birthday cake, chocolate covered strawberries, and sodas. Several nights we walked to neighboring hotels which seemed to be more happening at night. Granted there was live music at the Ritz casino but it didn't seem to attract the locals like the Westin did. We had so much fun watching the locals dance to the live band at the Westin. Overall I would stay here again but only for a short amount of time. If you are visiting for a week or more I would recommend one of the large resorts elsewhere in Puerto Rico. You'll never grow bored and you'll still have plenty to do in case it rains.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there for a long vacation, two weeks, and it was just beautiful. I'd wake up, go down to the outdoor pool, have an attendant lay out a towel on a lounge chair in the shade, help myself to the lemon/orange water at the front and just relax. Some days I'd go to the beach, have a different attendant set up a chair and umbrella for me, and relax while the waves crashed onto the shore. Its so peaceful and quiet. At night I checked out the gym, and its amazing. Five of the ten eliptical trainers and treadmills have personal TVs on the front, and several weight training machines as well. The cleaning staff comes by your room twice, once in the morning to clean, and then again to give you any extra shampoo, water bottles, towels, and chocolates you might find a neccesity. At any given time, walking down the hallway is interrupted by "Good Morning" or "Do you need anything?" you call the front desk and you hear: "Hello Mr./Mrs./Ms. ______, how can i make your stay more enjoyable tonight?" Its within walking distance of a car rental place, so you can drive down to Old San Juan or the rainforest if you'd like, the stay as a whole was beautiful and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Is this value for money?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My company does business with the Ritz-Carlton, and so I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. I was prepared to be impressed, but, I told my boss "my people are Motel Six people, I don't know how to handle this kind of royalty treatment".... All I could think of the whole time was "this is too pricey..." The people were friendly. (But they're friendly at budget motels too) The lobby was very pretty and so were the grounds. I'll grant that. The breakfast buffet was pretty but I didn't eat it because it was so pricey (no sense in having my employer pick up the check $20+ when my diet says I should eat toast and coffee...) Never ate at the pricey restaurants OR ordered room service. (too pricey) Never did any of the "resort things" (surfing, snorkelling, etc). [I was too tired from doing business all day] Never partook of the mini-bar (Four bucks for a candy bar, you've got to be kidding???) But here's the kicker: My co-worker travelling companion had her company business credit card declined as we were paying the check at a nearby restaurant. Upon internet research we came to find out that the Ritz charges $150 per day (!!!!) to your credit card UPON CHECKIN to protect themselves from unscrupulous users (and doesn't share this little tidbit with you). The charge does get reversed when you check out but.... YIKES. We complained to both our employer and the Ritz about this process. This is not the way to treat business travellers. Plus you get $17.90 extra charged to your bill each day as a "resort fee" (which is pretty standard, but it still shocked the heck out of me). I think I'll stay at non-resort hotels. . .until I win the lottery (or I get mad enough at my employer that I will want to gouge the company....)

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back with kids in October!”
Reviews.Author: thebets
Reviews.Content: WOW. What a place. But more importantly, what staff! "It's my pleasure" is a phrase you will hear quite often from the staff. And, by golly, you believe it! Beach is wonderful- great people set up your chair for you and even bring you a cold towel to wipe your face. Pool was very nice as well. Food was incredibly expensive. Servings are pretty large for hamburger/french fries- split with a friend! Go to the El San Juan & Intercontinental for night life, as well as some great restaurants in Old San Juan: Tantra (has belly dancers!), Dragonfly, the parrot club. MUST go to the Water Club and see the view from the top of this tres chic boutique hotel. Don't believe all the warnings about how dangerous it is- if you have ever been to a city before- you practice the same caution. Very easy cab ride to and from airport. I 'm already looking into going back in October with my children! If someone asked me if I loved PR, i'd say, I sure love the Ritz in PR!!!! Check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: BrownSugar622
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just got back from a long weekend at the Ritz Carlton San Juan. The hotel was lovely and the staff was very polite and helpful. The pool area is fantastic and the restaurant by the beach is not to be missed! The rooms were nice (we loved the bathroom) and the flat screen tv was even better... For authentic Puerto Rican food, try Metropol across the street from the hotel and in Old San Juan, Aquaviva is the best!! For the twenty-something year old crowd who wants to party, make sure you go to the El San Juan Hotel (down the block from the Ritz) and The Waterclub (wonderful rooftop lounge/bar).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my mother there for a motherâ€™s day weekend getaway. We were very excited when we arrived. The Hotel was beautiful. Then I went to confirm some surfing lessons for my son. It turns out they were never arranged but I have the email to prove they were. Then they recommended a restaurant to us that was awful everything they served us was burned. When we got back to the Hotel and went to our room we noticed many holes in the sheets. I told the front desk and all they said was oh we are sorry. No one ever change them. When we tried to make reservations for the brunch I was told they didnâ€™t have availability. Before I went to the hotel I had called and they told me to make the reservation when I arrived that it wouldnâ€™t be a problem. When I ordered room service 4 times I was told they did not have half the things on the menu. My son took the gummy bears out of the mini bar and only had 3 of them we left the room and when we came back they had been thrown away. He is 6 so he was devastated and he never got his surfing lessons. Not only that but it has already been a week since I left and they charged the full amount an my credit card and still have a hold on it for the same amount that they charged.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the negative reviews and go!”
Reviews.Author: usckim01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend at the Ritz and I'm not sure whether the people who write the negative reviews are just snobby or if they just love to complain, but our stay was fantastic. Service at the front desk, lobby lounge, restaurant, poolside, etc. were excellent. My husband and I have stayed at similar 5* hotels and at some, we felt looked down upon because we don't "look" wealthy...we're not flashy at all...just grounded wall street bankers in our mid-20s that happen to like nice hotels. At the RCSJ, though, we were always made to feel welcomed and didn't get a pretentious look from anyone. We were given a well-appointed, clean room overlooking the pool (w/ a big flat panel TV). I was afraid of the airplane noise, but I never heard any. The pool/beach area were spacious and comfortable. The only thing that we would have liked to see was more dining variety. We ate at the Caribe Hilton at Lemongrass and it was innovative delicious pan-asian food, plus they had lots of other dining options.
